loans.name: Yuri Janeth

texts.es:
Yuri inicio el negocio para apoyar a su esposo, y así tener mas ingresos para ofrecerles mejor calidad de vida a sus 2 pequeños hijos de 4 y 2 años. la idea de trabajar en su propio negocio siempre la ha entusiasmado es por eso que decidió elaborar y vender tacos en su casa, y actualmente goza de buena clientela.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $325 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar materia prima y así poder ofrecer su servicio hasta mas tare, ya que en ocasiones se le acaba y tiene que cerrar el negocio.
texts.en:
Yuri began her business to support her husband and increase their income so that they may offer a better quality of life to their two little children, who are two and four years old. The idea of working in her own business always excited her and it's for this reason that she decided to make and sell tacos in her home, and presently she enjoys a good clientele. She needs a loan of $325, which she will pay back in three months, in order to buy more raw materials to be able to offer her service later in the day, since there are times when she runs out of ingredients and has to close the business.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy ingredients

loans.name: Verica

texts.en: Verica Ć. is 35 years old and comes from the town of Derventa. She is a widow and raises her children alone. Both her children are school-aged. Verica is employed in a local shoe factory but this job does not pay enough to support her family, so she also works at home. She designs and prints price lists, diplomas, promotional materials, etc. She started by making cards for her children and they were good, so she decided to offer her services to other people. Her little business runs well but she thinks that it can be better. So, Verica requests a loan of 1000 KM ($675 US) to buy additional supplies for her computer, a new scanner, and a printer. In this way she will provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: To buy printing supplies for her computer

loans.name: Safy

texts.fr: Agée de 31ans Safy est une femme mariée et mere de famille.Pour sirvenir à ses besoins ,elle vend des légumes au coin du quartier .Chaque  jour depuis 2 ans les femmes du quartier qui ne peuvent pas aller au marché achettent les legumes chez safy .Les recettes tirées de la vente des légumes lui permettent de contribuer aux charges du menage.Avec le pretsollicité, elle compte renforcer son commerce.
texts.en:
Safy is a 31-year-old married mother with a family. To meet her needs, she sells vegetables on a corner in the neighborhood. Each day for two years, the neighborhood women unable to go to the market buy vegetables at Safy's place. The receipts derived from selling vegetables enable her to cover household expenses. With this loan being requested, she intends to boost her commerce.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Angèle

texts.fr:
Mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants, Madame A. Angèle est spécialisée dans le commerce des denrées alimentaires il y a 13 ans. Dotée d’une bonne moralité et très douée dans la gestion, cette activité l’aide beaucoup dans les charges de sa famille. Malgré que son mari soit sans emploi, elle ne le sent pas beaucoup, car son activité lui rapporte beaucoup. 
Pour mieux faire, elle voudrait augmenter son chiffre d’affaires par ce financement en approvisionnant suffisamment sa boutique en marchandises. Une fois cet objectif atteint, elle assurera le plein épanouissement de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ms. Angèle A. is married and the mother of four. She has been a specialist in the commerce of grocery items for thirteen years. Of good character and very talented in management, she helps her family a lot to cover expenses through her work. Despite her husband being unemployed, she isn’t impacted very much because her work brings in a great deal. To do better, she would like to increase her sales figures through this financing by getting sufficient supplies of goods for her shop. Once this is achieved, she will ensure that her children will thrive fully.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply her shop with merchandise

loans.name: Georgette

texts.fr: Agée de 37 ans, Mme F. Georgette est mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants. Actuellement divorcée, son ex mari ne participe pas aux charges de ses enfants, et tout le poids de la famille se repose sur elle seule. Pour surmonter ses difficultés, elle a bénéficié un petit crédit qui lui a permis d’ouvrir un petit restaurant dans son village. Actuellement, elle sollicite un crédit pour réaménager son petit restaurant et s’approvisionner en denrées alimentaires. Ceci lui permettra de mieux satisfaire ses clients et de dégager une marge bénéficiaire élevée susceptibles d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Georgette F. is 37 years old, was married, and has three children. Now divorced, her ex-husband does not support his children: she alone is responsible for the family. To overcome her difficulties, she borrowed a small amount with which she opened a little restaurant in her village. She is now asking for a loan to reorganize her little restaurant and to buy food supplies. She will then be able to better satisfy her customers and make a greater profit, thus improving her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To organize her restaurant and buy food supplies.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
A woman with a positive mind who always believes that in her every breath she must have the guts to go on and continue living no matter how hard and challenging life--this describes Analiza A., who is a 37-year-old mother of two. She is married to Banjo, who is one of the Barangay Councilors in their village. He also operates the family's passenger tricycle. Their children are John Siahm, who is 10 years old and a grade III student, and Atasha, who is 5 years old and a day care student.

According to Analiza, the village where the family lives is progressive because of the different government projects being implemented there, such as a farm-to-market road, an irrigation system, a potable water system, and a post-harvest facility.

Analiza’s family does not own a farm to cultivate, so she wants to make their current source of income more stable and also develop an alternative source of income. In order to do this, she is requesting a loan of $100, which will be used in the maintenance of the passenger motorcycle and for the establishment of a hog and poultry raising business.

Analiza wants to start these projects as soon as possible because she really wants to help her husband in earning money for the education of their children and for the basic needs of their family.

loans.use: Maintenance of passenger motorcycle and starting capital for a hog and poultry raising business

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru: Дилором 34 летняя женщина , мать двоих детей.Работает техничкой в школе Табошара. Её муж занимается откормом и продажей скота.она ему помогает за уходом.У них 20 баранов.Дилором из шерсти баранов вяжет носки и продаёт в зимний период.Пока скот дешёвый Дилором со своим мужем хочет закупить ещё несколько голов.Муж её дополнительно подрабатывает разнорабочим,и погашения вполне смогут погасить без проблем.
texts.en:
Dilorom is a 34-year old mother of two. She works as a cleaning lady at a Taboshar school and helps her husband to raise and sell livestock. Dilorom and her husband own 20 sheep. She uses their wool for knitting and selling socks in the winter season. Dilorom and her husband would like to buy more livestock because it is cheap now. Since her husband also works day jobs, they think they would not have any problems with loan repayment.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: livestock

loans.name: Khushnudbek

texts.en:
S. Khushnudbek is 20 years old. In spite of his young age he is working and supporting his parents. He is an expert in computer services. He provides computer services such as printing, scanning, lamination and audio editing of video tapes and discs of clients' family events. He has been in this business for two years already.

Khushnudbek tries to use modern, up-to-date technologies in his work to satisfy the demands and requirements of the customers. For instance, now he is planning to purchase a new computer in order to improve the quality of his work and to expand the business. For this purpose, Khushnudbek requests $1,200 for the term of 12 months. This is Khushnudbek's first loan and he thanks everyone for the support. He promises not to let anyone down and to pay the loan on time.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing a new computer to improve the quality of his work

loans.name: Luz Y Esperanza 2 Group

texts.en:
“Luz y Esperanza”, or Light and Hope, is a group of five entrepreneurs seeking their second loan from Esperanza International. The group’s past loan has been successfully repaid, and the group hopes to utilize a second loan for further business expansion. Yanira is one of the coordinators of the group in Santiago.

Yanira, mother of three (ages: 17, 14 and 9), operates from her home and sells men’s, women’s, and children’s clothing, shoes and accessories. Yanira’s past loan was used to increase product capacity and allowed for a greater return on sales due to increased product offerings to her customers. Yanira plans to use her second loan in a similar manner, to increase her current inventory levels.

Yanira is dedicated to the completion of her loan as she dreams of one day owning her own store to sell her products from.

Other members of Yanira’s microfinance bank run similar entrepreneurial operations including Dominican-style fast food sales, fried food, clothing and jewelry sales.

On behalf of Esperanza and this group of business entrepreneurs, we would like to thank you for your support!

loans.use: To increase her current inventory levels

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
La señora Josefa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen D. la Inmaculada”, vive en el Jr. Augusto B. Legui Nº 763, Distrito Tarapoto, Provincia D. San Martín, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 64 años, 03 hijos, todos ellos ya independientes.

El espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas D. salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio D. venta D. anticuchos  a fuera D. su casa donD. poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo D. actividad. 
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio donD. venD. diariamente  por las noches. Tiene años trabajando en este negocio y se siente muy contenta con lo que hace.
 
Con el préstamo D. S/ 2,500.00, desea invertirlo comprando planchas D. calaminas, para cambiar el techo del ambiente donD. desarrolla  su negocio y así dar una mejor comonidad y seguridad a sus clientes, con parte del dinero también comprará insumos como arroz en sacos, huevos, gallinas criollas para sus juanes y pollos desviscerados para sus anticuchos, asimismo utensilios D. cocina para brindar un servicio D. calidad.  

Josefa,  se siente tranquila y contenta con lo que hace  y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento D. sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Josefa belongs to the community bank, “Virgen D. la Inmaculada.” She lives on Jr. Augusto B. Legui Nº 763, Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She’s married, 64 years old, and has 3 kids, all of them independent.

The fighting spirit that has always characterized her and the desire to move ahead by her own means inspired her to start her own business in the sales of kebabs out of her home. Little by little, she has become well-known amongst her customers, and now she tells us that her business is doing very well.

Today she continues with the same business which is open for business nightly. She has worked in this business for many years, and she is very happy with what she does.

With this loan of S/2,500.00 ($825 USD) , she wants to purchase corrugated steel to renovate the roof of her business and give comfort and security to her customers. With part of the money, she will also buy supplies such as bags of rice, eggs, chicken for her kebabs and cooking utensils to improve her quality of service.

Josefa feels unworried and content with what she does and thanks Manuela Ramos for contributing to the realization of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and improve infrastructure of her business

loans.name: Amigas Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
La Fundación Paraguaya briD. a este grupo de señoras la oportunidad de cambio con un apoyo crediticio, ellas cuentan con trabajos propios, son luchadoras para ganar un poco de dinero para mantener a la familia.  Las mujeres tienen el deseo de invertir el crédito en su trabajo porque esto les facilitará con una herramienta para mejorar sus negocios.

Este grupo se formo con señoras con un gran espíritu emprendedor.  Ellas se unierón con el deseo de mejorar su calidad de viD. atravez de la formación de un  grupo solidario.  Las mismas poseen caD. una un trabajo en donde invertir su  crédito y lo asumen de manera conjunta,  una responsabilidad de apoyarse y demostrar que desean progresar en lo laboral.  Ellas son personas sencillas y muy trabajadoras.  Poseen el espíritu emprendedor y las ganas de progresar conjuntamente.  Algunas señoras llevan un monto de 800.000gs. Otras un monto de 500.000 gs y 300.000gs.

Las integrantes y sus actividades son: 

SunilD. Elizabenh G. - 	Compra y Venta de Carne de Cerdo
María Isabel O. - 	Macatera vta de Ropas 
AgueD. M. - 	Venta de Frutas y Verduras en el M. municipal
Felicia F. - 	Macatera vta de Ropas 
Rosanna D. S. - 	Macatera vta de Ropas 
Margarita F. -	Vendedora Ambulante de Frutas y Verduras
Fermina F.  - 	Macatera vta de Ropas 
Angelina Gavilán - 	Venta de Frutas y Verduras
NilD. M.	  -  Venta de Frutas y Verduras en el M. municipal
Felicia A.	  -   Carbonería
Teodora R.  - 	Almacén
María Concepción A.  - 	Vendedora Ambulante de Mandioca y Verduras
Sara A.  -  	Almacén
Lucia G.	-  Macatera Venta de Ropas Nuevas
Ciriaca T.  -  	Almacén
Isabel M.	-  Venta de Ropas
Rosalia G.  -  	Almacén
Zulma G.	-  Venta de Joyas de plata
texts.en:
Fundación Paraguaya brings this group of women the opportunity for change with the help of credit. They each have their own jobs, and fight to earn money to support their families. The women wish to invest the credit in their jobs as a tool to improve their businesses. This group is comprised of women with a great entrepreneurial spirit. They came together with the desire to improve their quality of life through the formation of a solidarity group. They each have a job in which to invest credit, and they take on jointly the responsibility to help one another and demonstrate their desire to progress in their work. They are simple, hardworking people. They have an entrepreneurial spirit and the will to move forward together. Some of the women are seeking loans of 800,000 PYG; others, 500,000 PYG or 300,000 PYG. The members and their activities are: SunilD. Elizabenh G. - Purchase and sale of pork María Isabel O. - Clothing sales AgueD. M. - Fruit and vegetable sales in municipal market Felicia F. - Clothing sales Rosanna D. S. - Clothing sales Margarita F. - Door-to-door sales of fruits and vegetables Fermina F. - Clothing sales Angelina Gavilán - Fruit and vegetable sales NilD. M. - Fruit and vegetable sales in municipal market Felicia A. - Fuel sales Teodora R. - Grocery store María Concepción A. - Door-to-door sales of cassava and vegetables Sara A. - Grocery store Lucia G. - Clothing sales Ciriaca T. - Grocery store Isabel M. - Clothing sales Rosalia G. - Grocery store Zulma G. - Silver jewelry sales

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Door-to-door vendors: more products to sell--fruits, vegetables, merchandise, etc.; Dressmakers: purchase fabrics, thread, etc.

loans.name: Plan  For Real Group

texts.en:
This is Daniel K., Santigie C., Aminata S. and Salamatu S.. They named their group Plan for Real. These members of Plan for Real group are local entrepreneurs based in the small-town of Waterloo, twenty miles from the city of Freetown.

They are requesting a loan of Le 500,000 each for the first time from SMT, a Partner of Shine on Sierra Leone. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, make better sales, and consequently improve on their standards of living.

Daniel K. (left) is the leader of Plan for Real group. Daniel is now age thirty-two and is married with one child in nursery school. Daniel was born in Binkolo village, in northern Sierra Leone. Daniel sells ice and has been in this business for two years now. With this loan, he will be able to sell more ice in order to meet the growing need of his customers.

loans.use: To invest in his business

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa María R. Pérez tiene la edad de 59 años. Es una mujer viuda. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Su actividad económica es lun cafetin. Hace más de 30 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que dio inicio a esta actividad desde muy joven ya que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y seguir adelante, por lo que al inicio no tenía un lugar estable donde ofrecer su comida, y se ubicaba en las orillas del parque, mas tarde decide seguir con este negocio y mantenerlo. Por lo que ahora el financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de gaseosas, jugos, granos básicos entre otras cosas. El sueño de Rosa es proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosa María R. Pérez is 59 years old and a widow. She has 2 children. She runs a cafe. She has been working in this business for 30 years. She started this business when she was very young, as she has always liked to work and get ahead. Initially she did not have a stable place where she could offer her food, and she would work around the park. Later, she decided to continue with and better equip her business. The financing she seeks now will be capital for the purchase of sodas, juices, grains and similar items. Rosa's dream is to make improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.pt:
ROSALINA Francisco M. nasceu no distrito de Manhica (a 70 km da cidade de Maputo), de 45 anos de idade, casada e mãe de seis filhos sendo três freqüentando escola e os restantes maiores de idade e com vida particular.

Rosalina tem 7 classe parou de estudar na altura da guerra. Sustenta também uma enteada com três filhos, que vive com ela na mesma casa, própria.
Rosalina transferiu se de manhica para vila de namaacha com a família (marido e os filhos) em missão de serviços do esposo no ano de 1988 que exerce a tarefa de docente.
  
Rosalina é Modista ( faz roupas para ambos sexos) a mais de 30 anos e trabalha sem empregado. Aprendeu a fazer esta actividade em casa com a sua mãe e mais tarde foi se formar numa escola de corte e costura a mais de 20 anos.
Com esta actividade consegue um rendimento mensal de 3.000,00MT que dedica para o pagamento da divida e alguma vez poupa num esquema tradicional.

Ouviu falar da Hluvuku-Adsema através de amigos e nunca tinha tido empréstimos com outros bancos. Este é o seu segundo credito no valor de 18.000,00MT para compra de material de construção. O primeiro empréstimo também foi para compra de material de construção no valor de 16.000,00MT.
Propõe se a pagar o credito sem problemas para no futuro aceder a mais empréstimos e terminar a sua obra.
texts.en:
Rosalina Francisco M. was born in the district of Manhica (70km from Maputo), she is 45 years old, she is married and has 6 children, three of them go to school, and the other 3 are adults now with their own lives. Rosalina stopped studying when she was on 7th grade because of war in her country. She also supports a stepdaughter with 3 kids, who live in the same house. Rosalina moved from Manhica with her family (husband and children) because of her husband's mission working as a teacher back on 1988. Rosalina is a dressmaker (creates clothes for females and males) for the last 30 years and works without any employee. She learned this activity with her mother and later on she went to sawing and cutting school 20 years ago. With this activity she gets a monthly income of 3.000MT that she uses to pay her debt and sometimes is able to save too. She learned about Hluvuky-Adsema from friends and she never had loans with other banks before. This is her second loan for 18.000MT to buy construction material. Her first loan for 16.000MT was to buy construction material too. She expects to pay the loan without any problem to access more loans in the future to finish her construction.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a lamination machine and a perforating machine

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia P. is from the village of Upper Centro, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old and is widowed. Virginia owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling gasoline in the local community. Virginia is just starting this business. In 2005, Virginia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann is a married mother of two children who are both in school. She has been selling her wares for the last two years in Naivasha town. Ann was introduced to KADET by a friend. This will be her second loan, which she plans to use to buy more basins and boost her stock. In the future, Ann wants to own her own store from which she can operate her business of selling general wares.

loans.use: To buy more basins to sell

loans.name: María Alicia

texts.es: María Alicia P. M. de 45 años de edad, reside en Tonacatepeque junto a su hija, sus nietos y su yerno. Ella desde hace 14 años que posee un negocio en el cual vende medicina natural y cosméticos. Es así como María ha logrado superarse y obtener todo lo necesario durante todo este tiempo. María solicita un préstamo ya que desea ver prosperado su negocio y así lograr más ventas, es así como por medio de dicho préstamo ella espera comprar más medicinas y cosméticos. María espera mejorar sus ventas, ya que es por medio de este negocio por el cual ella obtiene los ingresos necesarios para vivir de una manera aceptable.
texts.en:
María Alicia P. M. is 45. She lives in Tonacatepeque with her daughter, grandchildren, and son-in-law. For 14 years she has had a business selling natural medicine and cosmetics. That is how María has been successful and gotten what she needed during all of this time. María is asking for a loan because she wants to see her business prosper and get more sales. Through this loan she hopes to buy more medicines and cosmetics. María hopes to improve her sales. It is through the business that she gets the necessary income to live in an acceptable manner.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy medicine and cosmetics

loans.name: Loryn

texts.en:
Loryn B., 26 years old, is one of the youngest CCT entrepreneurs in Dasmarinas, Cavite. She lives with her 25 year old husband Marvin, a factory worker, and their lone child, who is now in grade school.

Loryn sells electronic load credits for mobile phones. She employs two neighbors as store assistants. Loryn now earns P 13,600.00 a month. She sets aside large sums of her profits for her family's future. From her earnings, for instance, she was already able to purchase a motorized tricycle.  

She has just finished paying off her latest loan from the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative, of which she became a member only last year. She is now applying for a new loan in the amount of P 10,000.00 so that she can have enough funds to restock on grocery items she also sells at her store.

Loryn wishes to have other store outlets in other parts of the town.

About CCT:

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is a Christian organization dedicated to fighting poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical missions in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves both urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: restocking grocery items to sell at her store

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en: Beauty O. is married and has six dependants. She has not received any formal education. Beauty has been selling maize in Abotoase for the past 6 years. Her husband is a carpenter with very little capital to care for the entire family. Beauty uses her income to feed her children and help her husband pay the housekeeping expenses. Beauty will use the loan to purchase other assorted grains for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Beauty plans to save.

loans.use: To purchase other assorted grains for sale.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites S. is from the village of Katipunan, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Marites owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production) products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Marites joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Marites is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: EL SEÑOR FRANCISCO SE DEDICA LA PINTURA, COMO CONTRATISTA, SON MAS DE 8 AÑOS QUE TIENE DE EXPERIENCIA EN EL TRABAJO DE LA PINTURA, VIVE EN CASA PROPIA CON SU ESPOSA Y SUS 3 HIJOS, EL SEÑOR AHORA TRABAJA EN LOS CONDOMINIOS COBOCE, FIRMO UN TRABAJO BASTANTE GRANDE, EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO ES PARA PODER COMPRAR MAS MATERIAL DE PINTURA , BROCHAS, ESCALERA , Y OTROS. EL YA ES CLIENTE ANTIGUO DE EMPRENDER EL CUAL ACCEDIO AL CREDITO POR SER UN BUEN CLIENTE.
texts.en:
Señor Francisco works as a painter by contract. He has more than 8 years of experience with this work. He lives in his own home with his wife and 3 children. Right now he is working at hte Coboce Condominiums. He signed a rather large project. He will use this credit to be able to buy more painting materials like paint, brushes, a ladder, etc. Since he is an old client of Empreder, he was able to access this credit because he is a good client.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is married and a mother of three children. She lives with her family in Likoni Mombasa. Her business is poultry farming. She says the loan of Khs 30,000 will help her  improve her business structure, buy 250 chicks and chicken feed. She says this will increase her clientele and indirectly improve her living standards. Her future dream is to venture into the tailoring materials business.

loans.use: to buy 250 chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno y  la producción de leche que comercializa  a Pil Andina, planta Industrializadora de leche.
 
Vive. en la comunidad de Ticuyo  sector Laja de Provincia Los Andes del departamento de La Paz ubicado  a cuatro horas de la ciudad de La Paz.

Vive junto a sus padres y hermanos menores a quien colabora económicamente para sus estudios.
 
El crédito lo destinará para la compra de ganado y así incrementar  la producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Juana raises cows and produces milk that she sells to Pil Andina, an industrial milk plant. She lives in the community of Ticuyo in the Laja sector of Los Andes province in the department of La Paz, located 4 hours from the city of La Paz. She lives with her parents and her younger brothers, and she helps out with their educational expenses. The loan will be used to buy a milk cow and in this way increase her production of milk as well as her income. This is her second loan with IMPRO, and their evaluation qualified her to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a milk cow to increase her production of milk

loans.name: Gemima

texts.es: Gemima, es una mujer muy puntual, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región Ucayali, tiene 28 años, es madre de un hijo, menor de edad, ella se dedica a administrar su bodega, esta actividad la realiza en su casa, es madre soltera. Gemima forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Flores”, desde hace dos años y cuatro meses, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en productos para su bodega, ahora ella necesita 2000 soles, dinero que utilizará para implementar su bodega con productos comestibles. Ella agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por darle la facilidad de obtener un crédito y poder hacer crecer su bodega. La meta de Gemima es tener un minimarket bien surtido.
texts.en:
Gemima is a very punctual woman that lives in Yarina Cocha District, Ucayali region. She is 28 years old and the single mother of a minor. She is dedicated to run her small grocery shop at home.

Gemima has been a member of the Community Bank "Las Flores", for two years and four months. The first loan she received was for 300 soles, which was invested in the purchase of products for her grocery shop. She needs a loan of $700 that will invest in the purchase of food products to restock her shop. She thanks the Manuela Ramos Group for the loan that allowed her to grow her business. Her goal is to have a very well stocked mini market

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim has owned a beauty salon since 2007 although he has been involved in this occupation for the past fifteen years. He started working when he was very young after the death of his father. Today, he's married with one baby and he's able to take care of his family.

Ibrahim caters to a wide range of clientele in his village and its neighborhood. Today, he wishes to improve the decor of his salon and buy new equipment so as to be always up-to-date with the new haircuts and designs. In order to do so, he is requesting $1,000.

loans.use: To improve the decor of his salon and to buy new equipment

loans.name: Honorine

texts.fr: Née en 1980 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, H. Honorine est mariée à CHEMADIN Emmanuel, un chauffeur. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille vit depuis 11 ans, à Davatin dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Honorine vient en aide à son mari et supporte avec lui les charges familiales. Honorine n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Il y a 5 ans environs que Honorine mène comme activité, la vente de mêches de façon ambulante. Honorine vend également des sachets, de faon secondaire. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Honorine s'approvisionne. Honorine a déjà obtenu deux prêts à ALIDé, et les a tous bien remboursés. Honorine envisage développer davantage son activité et augmenter le stock de ses produits, afin de mieux faire face à la demande de sa clientèle. C'est la raison pour laquelle Honorine sollicite un troisème crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1980 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Honorine H. is married to Emmanuel CHEMADIN, a driver. The couple has three children, all attending school. Honorine has not attended school herself. For the past 11 years the family has been living in Davatin, in the Sèmè-Podji area. Honorine helps her husband and shares household expenses. Five years ago Honorine started selling hair extensions, as an itinerant vendor. She also sells plastic bags as a second line of business. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. Honorine has already been granted two loans from ALIDé, and has repaid them in full. She wants to expand her business, increase her stock supply, and in turn give better response to customer demands. This is why she is now requesting a third laon from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy packages of hair extensions and plastic bags

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La señora Luz Marina G. R.  se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, negocio esta ubicado del centro de salud primero de mayo 1c. Al norte,  trabaja cada día de la  7 am a exhibir su mercadería al público y finaliza a las 6 pm.
 
 Este crédito lo solicito para  compra de dos pacas de ropa usada de mejor calidad y así obtener mayor ganancia para el sustento de su hijo.
 
Cabe mencionar que la Señora G. R.  esta agradecida por que sus créditos con ceprodel le ha ayudado a crecer su negocio con ropa de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Luz Marina G. R. sells used clothing. Her business is located near the "primero de mayo" health center 1c north. She works every day from 7 a.m. to display her merchandise to the public and she finishes at 6 p.m.

She seeks this loan to purchase two bales of used clothes at a higher quality, and obtain better earnings to support her son.

It's important to mention that she is very grateful for the loans with Ceprodel that have helped her grow her business with higher-quality clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of two bales of used clothes

loans.name: Biguri Group, Rukungiri

texts.en:
N. Charles appears in the small photo and also appears in the big group photo. He is the leader of his lending group and is married with ten children, six of them still in school. He also takes care of other orphans.

Charles has a business selling cows from Biguri and although the cows are very expensive to buy, he is able to make 200,000/= as profits. For over fifteen years, he has bought cows, kept them for some time and then sold the healthy ones.

Charles’ dream is to be able to buy more cows and start selling to Kampala as well as to have a good looking house. He needs a loan to be able to buy more cows for increased sales. He is such a hardworking man.

loans.use: To buy more cows to sell

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha D. is very happy to have been a member of ASHI in 2009. With the opportunity to receive loan, she has been able to perform her productive role and has become a businesswoman. She has a small backyard poultry business and sells fish her husband catches from the ocean near their house.

Though her business may not be as big as she expects, nevertheless she and her family enjoy its profits being spent for their primary needs. Editha is also excited to support growing her husband’s fishing business using the loan she requests through ASHI. Before, she had almost lost hope because her family revenue is just enough to support the education of her two children in college.

Now that her youngest 24-year-old daughter has been employed as a teacher, the loan she is requesting will surely be used for her business alone, because her daughter and her daughter's husband earn enough to support their other needs at home. Despite Editha’s child supporting her financially, Editha wants to have her own stable source of income so her daughter can enjoy her own life spending her own income.

loans.use: To purchase fishing gear

loans.name: Yatt's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Yatt B., 52, is the village bank president selected by the 15 group members located in Spean Dek village in Kandal province. Each member of this village loan will use the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Yatt B. is a fish seller who can earn a small income to support her family living. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it; thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fish to enlarge her business. Her husband, Mr. Bunthoeun Sory, is a Khmer trailer taxi driver. This couple has five children: one is a teacher and one is a seamstress in a garment factory while the last one is fish seller who supports the mother's business.

loans.use: To buy more fish

loans.name: God Bless You Group

texts.en:
Martha D. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God Bless You. She is 63 years old and a widow with five children who range from 15 to 21 years old. She also cares for two nephews. Martha did not have the opportunity to go to school due to poverty.

For 20 years, she has been selling slippers at the Rally Town market in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. Martha started by selling petty goods and fish but has been facing problems with low funds to do business and she lacks a sponsor. She places her goods in an orderly manner in order to keep customers returning.

Martha plans to use her 20,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 80,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to purchase more slippers to improve her business. Her goals and dreams are to improve her business by building a shop and to build a house for her children.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Martha is holding the sign.

loans.use: To purchase more slippers to improve her business

loans.name: Akabare Tukwatanise Group, Ibanda

texts.en:
Having ventured into the business of cattle keeping, M. Josephine has no regrets. It being part of her culture, commonly carried out in western Uganda where people own large heads of cattle, 60-year-old Josephine has benefited a lot from her farming business. She sells milk, ghee (clarified butter) and also some cows for beef as they are some of the products she gets from her farming business.

Josephine’s motive to acquire this loan is to help her buy sprays for her cattle to kill ticks and also to buy de-worming medicine to treat against diseases that affect her cattle. This will help her increase production as well as increase revenue.

loans.use: To purchase sprays and de-worming medicine for her cattle

loans.name: Andrei

texts.en:
Andrei is a businessman from Novaya Kahovka. He owns a small business selling office appliances, related components and expendable materials in one of the local malls called “Central”. He launched this business about twelve years ago. Currently, his business has grown up to 20,000 UAH in monthly turnover. His monthly net profit is about 5,000 UAH.

Andrei is requesting a loan of 10,000 UAH to purchase parts, expendables and other inventory items. His goal is to develop his business further. A portion of profits generated will be invested in his business while some of it will be used to meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: To purchase parts, expendables and other inventory

loans.name: Alberto Luis

texts.es:
Alberto Luis E., es un hombre que vive en Baranoa, un pueblo  muy cerca a Barranquilla, caracterizado por sus manifestaciones de arte y folclor y por las frituras especialmente las famosas chuletas de cerdo  en el departamento del Atlántico. En Baranoa los fines de semana y festivos, habitantes ubicados en poblaciones muy  cercanas, se deleitan con los exquisitez de los alimentos preparados que allí venden y están posicionados  en este lugar.  Es allí  donde Alberto Luis vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos menores, que dependen de su sustento  proporcionado justamente por un negocio de fritangueria, en la línea como empanadas, arepas, caramañolas, patacones, papas rellenas de carne, pollo o cerdo,  que inicio hace 8 anos  y hoy se encuentra ubicado en un sector de gran movimiento estudiantil, que es su mercado real.
Este es su segundo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo  y  con él comprara  materias primas, como aceite, sal y maíz en mayor volumen. Alberto tiene como meta   activar un segundo negocio: el de jugos de frutas naturales,  como guanábana,  níspero,  melón,  guayaba,  pina  y zapote entre otras deliciosas frutas propias de la región,  para complementar  su actual actividad.  Su mayor desafío es la falta de capital parta desarrollar sus metas, por eso debe trabajar un poco mas y seguir persistiendo en ellas para  lograr alcanzarlas.
texts.en:
Alberto Luis E. lives in Baranoa, a village near Barranquilla renowned for its art and folklore manifestations as well as fried food, particularly the famous pork chops from the Atlantic province. At week-ends and holidays people from nearby villages go to Baranoa to enjoy the delicious, freshly prepared food from the area. That's where Alberto Luis lives with his partner and two young children. They rely on the proceeds from a fried food business he set up 8 years ago that sells pies, cornmeal rolls, yuka pasties, fried green banana rolls and potatoes stuffed with meat, chicken or pork. It is located in an area with a lot of student traffic, which is his target market. This is his second loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and he plans to use it to buy ingredients such as oil, salt and corn in larger quantities. Alberto's goal is to start a second business, selling natural fruit juices such as soursop, medlar, guava, pineapple and sapote among other delicious fruits from the region, to complement his current one. His main challenge is the lack of capital to develop his objetives, so he is working a bit more and persisting to achieve his goals.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials such as oil, salt and corn in larger quantities.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 24-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his family and 2 siblings. Despite his young age, he has been an experienced carpenter for almost 10 years. And in 2005, he has owned his shop in his town. He is requesting his loan of US $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new equipment for his business and additional wood supplies to sell. He will able to make a variety of products and satisfy the demands of his clients, increasing his sales and his profit by a large percentage.  

In the future, he is looking to further expand his merchandise and invest in a new wood-sanding machine. He hopes that the coming year will continue to bring positive growth and increased sales. 

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.About Ameen:

Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese Microfinance sector since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specialized in Microfinance.

At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: purchase new equipment for his work and additional supplies of wood to sell

loans.name: Sope Serigne Ibra Bousso Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOPE SERIGNE IBRA BOUSSO est créé depuis 6 mois. Il est composé de 15 femmes toutes du même village. Elles ont formé leur groupe par voisinage et par affinité. Le groupe de solidarité fait partie du Banc Villageois de BOFFEL
Madame SENEB. S., debout à droite sur la photo est responsable du groupe de solidarité. Elle est âgée de 50 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants en charge. 
Elle fait de l’embouche ovine et de la transformation et vente d’huile d’arachide. Elle fait cette activité depuis bientôt 5 ans. 
Son second prêt avec CAURIE-MICRO FINANCE lui permettra d’acheter 2 moutons qu’elle va emboucher pendant au moins 4 mois avant de les revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires. Elle va acheter également des arachides pour faire de la transformation en huile d’arachide. 
Son objectif est de participer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille et de renforcer le bien-être de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The Sope Serigne Ibra Bousso solidarity group was created six months ago. It is made up of 15 women, who all come from the same village and are either neighbors or good friends. The solidarity group is part of the Banc Villageois in Boffel. Mrs. SeneB. S., who is standing on the right in the photo, is in charge of the solidarity group. She is 50 years old, married and mother to seven children, who are in her care. She has a sheep fattening activity and also makes and sells peanut oil. She has been doing this for almost five years. Her second loan from Caurie-Microfinance will allow her to buy two sheep which she will fatten up for at least four months before reselling them at the weekly markets. She is also going to buy peanuts in order to make peanut oil. Her aim is to contribute to the improvement in her family's living conditions and to strengthen her children's welfare.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase two sheep and peanuts

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
Este grupo del Barrio Los Arrabales surgió por promociones realizadas en la zona, el grupo se encuentra en el 14º ciclo, es un comité antiguo con pagos excelentes, tienen un ahorro que recaudaron mediante las actividades que vienen realizando desde el comienzo del comite.

Todas las integrantes son señoras muy trabajadoras y una de ellas es la Sra. Patricia A. posee un local de expendio de bebidas gaseosas, refrescos, golosinas en general, postres, helados, así como comida rápida.
Desea incrementar sus ingresos con la ampliación del engocio mediante la adquisición de más mercaderías al por mayor para la venta al detalle, tales como más variedad de bebidas, de gaseosas y golosinas. 
Teniendo en cuenta la demanda creciente de la clientela y el punto estratégico en el cual está ubicado su Kiosco.
texts.en:
This group, from the neighborhood Los Arrabales, was formed thanks to promotional activities in the area. The group is now in its 14th loan cycle. It is a longstanding committee with an excellent payment record. They also have savings collected from the activities they have been organizing since the group began. All of the members are very hard-working women. One of them is Patricia A., who has a shop where she sells soft drinks and other beverages, assorted snacks, desserts, ice cream and fast food. She would like to increase her income by expanding her store through the acquisition of more merchandise on a wholesale basis. She will purchase items such as a greater variety of beverages, soft drinks and snacks, taking into account the growing demand among customers and the strategically favorable place in which her kiosk is located.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying snacks, desserts such as ice cream and fruit, canned and packaged foods, and beverages

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 33 years old and is married with three children. She has been running Happy Daycare school for four years. The school has 134 children with six employees. She was previously employed as a teacher before she opened her own school.

Gladys hopes to be financially stable so as to improve her standard of living. She has benefited from the New Jerusalem group in Faulu Kenya because she has previously been guaranteed two loans. She is requesting another loan of 60,000 KES which she will use to start another school.

Gladys’s dream is to grow her school into a secondary school in the future.

loans.use: To start another school

loans.name: Gloria Maruja

texts.es:
Gloria es socia del Banco Comunal Chaska Lucero.
Gloria es soltera y tiene 3 hijos, Gloria tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende lencería, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Gloria necesita un préstamo de1000 soles para la compra de ropas interiores.
Los sueños de Gloria es tener capital propio y tener una tienda.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the Communal Bank “Chaska Lucero”. She is single and has three children. Gloria has a stand at the April 12th Market where she sells lingerie. She acquires her products in the city of Lima and engages in her business every day.

Gloria needs a loan of 1000 PEN to buy undergarments. She dreams of having her own capital and opening a store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase undergarments

loans.name: Levi

texts.en:
Levi D., from the village of Poblacion 3 Clarin Misamis Occidental, is 39 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Levi owns and operates a business venture offering motor transport services. Engaged in her business for over three years, she earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Levi joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC, she is now requesting a new loan, her fifth, of 10000 PHP to repair her existing vehicle for better service. Levi plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla D., from the village of Sta Rosa, is 40 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Perla owns and operates a business venture raising pigs for fattening and sale. Engaged in her business for over 10 years, she earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Perla joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 13000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future, she is now requesting her eighth loan for 15000 PHP to be used for the same purpose. Perla plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more gallons of red oil

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is 35 years old and married with four children. He has been in business for fourteen years. He sells charcoal in a busy middle-class residential area. He employs two people in his business and has been a Faulu client for a long time. He is requesting a loan of Kes. 80,000 to add to his stock of charcoal. Nicholas also owns a telephone bureau shop where he stocks telephone accessories, He also has a little restaurant. 

Nicholas wakes up at 4am to distribute charcoal to his customers; he is determined and persevering. He hopes to build his own business premises and a home for his family so as to stop renting. Faulu has taught Nicholas diversification and business management.

loans.use: To add to his stock of charcoal

loans.name: Alicia Yisenia

texts.es:
Alicia Yisenia F. M. tiene 34 años. Vive en Unión Libre, vive con el compañero y los hijos viven  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS SOMO MAS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Marañon, por la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol. 

Alicia  se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 8 años. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener casa propia y comprar terreno.
Le gusta cocinar toda clase de comidas y lavar la ropa.
texts.en:
Alicia Yisenia F. M. is 34 years old. She has a common-law marriage and lives with her partner and children in the canton of Ventanas, located in the Los Ríos province. She has three children.

The members of the Unidos Somos Más solidarity group are located in the Marañon area, in the Puerto Pechiche parish which is part of the canton of Pueblo Viejo. This rural cooperative works in short cycle farming planting corn, rice, and beans.

Alicia has worked growing corn, rice and beans especially for the past eight years. She buys her products in Comercial López in Ventanas and sells them in the Ventanas market and in the same area.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of farming supplies and fertilizers for her crops. The loan support will help her financially to meet her needs. She faces challenges such as pests, diseases, and the change in climate. Her dream is to have her own house and to purchase land.

She likes to cook all kinds of food and wash clothes.

loans.use: Agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a 41-year-old married man with five children and owns a house in Kasese. He has been retailing clothes and cosmetics for the last ten years. He increased the capital of the business by initially selling coffee. The challenge he faces is that of buying expired cosmetics. His vision is to expand his business. David needs the loan to buy clothes and cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: Buying clothes and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Tukolelewamu Group

texts.en: A. Musa, on the right, is the leader of Tukolerewamu group in Mubende. He is 32 years old and married with three children in school. He has a business selling produce from Bangi and grateful that his customers are so loyal and dedicated. He is able to make 100,000/= as weekly profit and these help him in reinvesting in his business as well as caring for his family. Musa is also a farmer who sells some of his plantains. He is very experienced since this has always been a family business — one that he took over from his parents. He needs a loan to be able buy more produce for resale.

loans.use: Buying more produce for resale.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean D. is from the village of Pigsaan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 41 years old. Jean is widowed and has six adult children. To make a living, Jean runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, snack foods and toothpaste. Jean has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2008, Jean joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jean has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Jean is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods and snack foods. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Jean from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods and snack foods

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Rosa Lina

texts.es:
Doña Rosa, tiene 48 años de edad, reside en Nueva Guadalupe departamento de San Miguel, vive con sus dos hijos de 22 y 20 años de edad, ella se dedica a destazar cerdos, venta de frutas y venta de pupusas, estos negocios los inicio hace 10 años, atendiéndolos de lunes a sábado.
Ella está necesitando de dinero para invertir al negocio, por lo que se ve en la situación de solicitar un préstamo para comprar mercadería como maíz, chicharrón, quesillo, tomates, también frutas como sandias, papaya, mangos además de cerdos para seguir comercializando su carne.
Este préstamo le será de mucha utilidad para el negocio ya que aumentara su inventario de productos que tendrá a disponibilidad para los clientes, atendiendo de una mejor manera. Su propósito es mantener en el mercado competente y fortaleciéndose cada día de lo mejor en mercadería, ayudando así a sus hijos para que puedan vivir de una mejor forma y se preparen para el futuro.
texts.en:
Rosa is 48 years old.  She lives in Nueva Guadalupe, in San Miguel department, with her two children aged 22 and 20.  Rosa's business is slaughtering pigs, selling fruit and selling pupusas (thick tortillas stuffed with a savory filling).  She has been in these businesses for 10 years and works from Monday to Saturday.

Rosa needs money to invest in her business.  She is requesting a loan so that she can buy merchandise such as corn, cooked pork paste, soft cheese, tomatoes; fruit such as watermelons, papaya, mangos, and also pigs so that she can continue selling their meat.  This loan will be very useful to Rosa since she will be able to increase her inventory and have more products available for her customers.  This will allow her to provide them with a better service.  Her goal is to remain competent in the market and to strengthen her business every day with the best merchandise, thereby helping her children to live better lives and prepare themselves for the future.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for preparing pupusas.  To buy fruit.

loans.name: Sokhna Bintou

texts.fr: Madame Sokhna Binetou G. habite dans un quartier voisin de la localité de Yoff. Elle est âgée de 34 ans. Elle est mariée et pratique la coiffure depuis 1999. En même temps elle exerce le commerce de greffage, de chaussures et de produits cosmétiques. Elle a choisi le métier de coiffure par passion. L’activité de commerce  l’intéresse  beaucoup  aussi à cause de son aspect lucratif. Elle est membre du guichet de yoff depuis 2003. Elle a déjà remboursé 2 prêts antérieurs.  Elle sollicite un crédit de 250 000 frs prévu pour régler sa commande de greffage et de chaussures qu’elle va placer a ses clients. Avec ce financement elle envisage augmenter ses gains et améliorer les conditions sociales de sa famille.
texts.en: Mrs Sokhna Binetou G. lives not far away from the city of Yoff. She is 34 years old and married. She has been a hairdresser since 1999. At the same time, she sells hair extensions, footwear and cosmetics. She chose this activity because she has a passion for it. Another interesting factor in this activity is the income. She has been a member of our branch in Yoff since 2003. She has already repaid two previous loans. She applies for a loan of 250,000 CFA francs to buy hair extensions and shoes for resale to her customers. Thanks to this loan, she expects to increase her income and improve the social condition of her family.

loans.use: To buy hair extensions and shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more fabric, beads, and bags.

loans.name: Hilda Luciana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de San Jerónimo,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Hilda Luciana; la socia tiene 31 años de edad, casada y tiene 4 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de comida ella vende de forma ambulatoria por la plaza de Chimpahuaylla, lleva años en este negocio ella cuenta con el apoyo y la ayuda de su esposo cuando ella lo necesita,  la socia desea aperturar su propio restaurante y mediante este préstamo ella podrá realizar su sueño.

La socia solicita el préstamo para terminar de pagar el local que alquilo para aperturar su negocio y comprar insumos para la preparación de la comida que preparara en su restaurante. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla.” The bank is located in the district of San Jerónimo, which belongs to the province of Cusco, in the department of Cusco. 

The member is Hilda Luciana. She is 31 years old, married, and has 4 children. She alternates her daily activities with her business of selling food. She sells as a street vendor in the plaza of Chimpahuaylla. She has been in this business for years and can count on the support and help of her husband when she needs it. Hilda Luciana would like to open her own restaurant, and with this loan she will be able to achieve her dream.

Hilda Luciana is requesting the loan to finish paying the rent for the space that she rented to open her business, and also to buy ingredients for the preparation of the food for her restaurant. 

She is happy about the loan and she promises to make the repayments.

loans.use: to finish paying the rent for the space that she rented to open her restaurant, and also to buy ingredients for the preparation of the food

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida N. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. She also cares for her father. Farida lives in a home that she rents; she does not have access to electricity or to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

Farida sells sugar cane. She has been in business for six years, and she works seven days out of every week. The main business challenge for Farida is the seasonal aspect of sugar cane.

Farida has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to purchase more bundles of sugar cane to sell. Her goal is to boost her business and make more in profits.

loans.use: To buy more bundles of sugar cane

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is 49 years old and married.  To earn a living, he sells cameras.  He has engaged in the business for nine years.  He runs his business in a very competitive environment; hence, he puts extra effort to attract more customers.  He hopes to expand his business within five years.  He wants 20,000 KES to buy cameras.

loans.use: To buy cameras

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Mario tiene 34  años, vive con su esposa  y sus 3 hijos en una casa que es alquilada. Hace más de 2 años se dedica a la venta de cerdos ahumados que es un plato típico en su zona y se le llama “lechón”, de esta manera trabaja todos los días en compañía de su esposa y de algunos familiares, pues son socios en este negocio, ya que intervienen en el proceso de su elaboración, desde la compra de los cerdos, la preparación, horneado y venta de este platillo a los distintos puntos de la ciudad donde reside. Su esposa la ayuda principalmente en el comercio  pero en un horario que no perjudique en la crianza de sus hijos. Durante este tiempo, ha visto que es rentable este negocio, porque el lechón que produce tiene buena sazón y tiene mucha demanda en su zona, ya que le permite proyectarse para el futuro y ver las mejores opciones para su negocio. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP y esta muy entusiasmado de ver que se integra a un grupo de personas en el banco comunal que son solidarias y responsable en sus pagos la cual le da confianza y se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más cerdos al por mayor.
texts.en:
Mario is 34 years old and lives with his wife and 3 children in a house that is rented.  For 2 years, he has dedicated himself to selling smoked pork, a food called “lechón” that is traditional of the area.  He works every day along with his wife and some relatives who are partners in the enterprise.  They all contribute to the business’ process, from buying the pigs to preparing and selling the food throughout the city where they live.  His wife helps him primarily with sales, but on a schedule that is not detrimental to raising their children.  
  
Over time, he has seen that the business is profitable because his dish is very tasty and in high demand.  This allows him to plan for the future and see better options for his business.  This is his first loan with MFP; he is very enthusiastic to see that he has joined a group of people who are united and financially responsible with their loans.  This gives him confidence, and he commits to making his repayments on time.  He will invest his loan into buying more pigs at wholesale.

loans.use: buy more pigs at wholesale.

loans.name: Betys Adela

texts.es: Betys Adela se dedica a la venta de refrescos y repostería. La Señora Betys tiene 40 años, tiene 2 hijos de 10 y 22 años a su cargo, inicio este negocio con mucho sacrificio pues Betys no tenía un trabajo estable que le proporcionara ingresos diariamente. Este crédito es para la compra de frutas para la elaboración de sus refrescos y además para la compra de una gran variedad de pan como picos, semitas, empanadas, cachitos, pan simple, donas, entre otros.  Ella trabaja desde hace 4 años, labora todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche.
texts.en: Betys Adela, age 40, has two children who are 10 and 22 years old. She makes her living by selling pastries and refreshments -- a business she started four years ago because she did not have a stable job and needed a source of daily income. It took a lot of effort to start the business and now  Betys works every day, from 7am  to 9pm. Betys will use the loan to purchase fruit for preparing her refreshments as well as a variety of baked goods such as empanadas, plain bread, breadsticks and others.

loans.use: to purchase fruit for preparing refreshments; to purchase baked goods

loans.name: Sissigbe Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SISSIGBE est composé de trois  personnes qui sont des amies et qui mènent leur activité au même lieu. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Chantal Ablanvi est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Chantal Ablanvi est né le 27 Avril 1971 dans une ville du Bénin. Chantal Ablanvi est mariée à un Transitaire du nom de Albert. Le couple a quatre enfants dont trois sont à leur charges. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents et certains ne sont pas scolarisés. Chantal Ablanvi vend des vêtements tous cousus depuis trois ans, de façon ambulante. Chantal Ablanvi s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Chantal Ablanvi sollicite, ensemble avec son groupe, un premier crédit.
texts.en:
The SISSIGBE group is composed of three women who are friends and who run their businesses in the same place. The group representative, Chantal Ablanvi, is the one raising her hand in the photo. 

Chantal Ablanvi was born on April 27, 1971 in a town in Bénin. She is married to to a shipping clerk named Albert. The couple have four children; they are still responsible for three of them. The children live together with their parents and some are not enrolled in school. 

Chantal Ablanvi has been selling ready-to-wear clothing for three years, as an itinerant salesperson. She buys her merchandise in Bénin. Wishing to satisfy her clientele and grow her sales and thus her income, she is asking, together with her group, for a first-time loan.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Cornelio

texts.en:
Cornelio Y. is 63 years old and widowed with four adult children. He is from the city of Pantaon Ozamis City. To make a living, Cornelio owns and operates a business raising crops. His main source of income comes from planting and harvesting root crops and banana to sell. Cornelio has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. 

Cornelio joined GDMPC in 2008 to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. Cornelio is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This will be the third loan taken out by Cornelio from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated with his loan to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for a sewing business.

loans.name: Vukuzenzele Group

texts.en:
Tholakele is 50 years-old and single with 6 children between the ages of 16 and 36. She takes care of one relative. She runs an agricultural business in Kwa Zulu Natal in Mandini in South Africa. In the photo she is rasing her hand.

She has been in this business for two years.  She sells live chickens from her home and wants to start selling red meat. She also receives income from the goverments child support grant. She requested this loan throgh WDB and Kiva to buy livestock chickens and red meat. Tholakele says that the extra income form this loan will help her generate more profit and take care of her and her family's needs. She faces a challenge of customers who buy on credit and fail to pay. In the future, she would like to own a supermarket.

She commented that she is exited about Kiva and that they will show her business on the internet.

loans.use: to buy chickens and red meat.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is 39 years old and married to Charles. She has four school-going children. She has farmed and run a clothing shop for the past thirteen years in Ndunyu Njeru.

Serah was introduced to KADET by an existing KADET customer. This is her third loan. She paid the other loans well and in good time. She intends to use this loan to buy a dairy cow, seed, fertilizer, pesticides and pay school fees.

In the future she aspires to practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: to buy buy a dairy cow, seed, fertilizer, pesticides and pay school fees.

loans.name: Mujeres Cumplidas X Group

texts.es: ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA "MUJERES CUMPLIDAS X" PORQUE SON UN GRUPO D. PERSONAS MUY CUMPLIDAS QUE EN BASE A LOS PRESTAMOS HAN PODIDO CRECER Y SALIR ADELANTE, UNA D. LA FORMA D. HACERLO ES TRABAJANDO Y SIENDO RESPONSABLES CON TODA LA COMUNIDAD Y SUS FAMILIAS, Y SIENDO CUMPLIDAS EN SU PRESTAMO. EL GRUPO SE LOCALIZA EN EL ESTADO D. PUEBLA EN MÉXICO. LA SEÑORA CLAUDIA ES LA PRESIDENTA DEL GRUPO, ELLA TIENE 38 AÑOS D. EDAD, ES CASADA Y TIENE UNA HIJA D. 15 AÑOS. ELLA CUENTA CON UN TALLER D. COSTURA EN SU DOMICILIO,  COMENTA QUE CON MUCHO ESFUERZO Y DEDICACION HA PODIDO SACAR ADELANTE A SU HIJA PARA QUE SIGA CON SUS ESTUDIOS. ELLA SOLICITA SU PRESTAMO PARA INVERTIR EN SU NEGOCIO AL APROXIMO REGRESO A CLASES YA QUE LE SOLICITAN UNIFORMES ESCOLARES, Y ASÍ COMPRAR TELA E HILOS. CON LAS GANANCIAS SEGUIRA INVIRTIENDO EN SU NEGOCIO, ADEMÁS D. CONTRIBUIR PARA COMPRAR EL MATERIAL ESCOLAR D. SU HIJA.
texts.en:
This group is called "Mujeres Cumplidas X" (Accomplished Women X) because they are a group of very accomplished people who, based on their loans, have been able to grow and advance. One form of doing this is by working and being responsible and accountable to the entire community and to their families and fulfilling their loan obligations. The group is located in the state of Puebla, in Mexico. 

Señora Claudia is the president of the group. She is 38 years old, is married, and has a daughter who is 15. She has a sewing workshop in her home. She  comments that with much effort and dedication she has been able to bring up her daughter so that she can continue with her studies. She is applying for the loan to invest in her business for the beginning of the next school year, since she has orders for school uniforms, and so she will buy fabric and thread. With her earnings, she will continue investing in her business and in addition contribute something towards her daughter's school supplies.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread to make school uniforms.

loans.name: Las Palomitas Group

texts.es:
La Alcancía Comunal “Las Palomitas” es un grupo conformada por  07 personas responsables y dispuestas a seguir trabajando.
Norma es natural de   Cerro de Pasco pero con la idea de surgir llego a Lima desde muy joven, actualmente tiene 38 años de edad y su familia está conformada por ella su esposo y 4 hijos.
