Norma se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza la cual lleva más de 01 año dedicándose a dicho rubro, ella se inicio en ese negocio gracias a que una amiga la animara a emprender su propio negocio, también nos cuenta que vende artefactos la cual trabajo sobre pedidos que le hacen sus conocidos y familiares, este trabajo le ha ayudado a tener una estabilidad económica para su hogar, es por ello que sigue apoyando a sus dos menores hijos en su educación. El anhelo de Norma es de comprar su propia vivienda ya que por momento vive en casa de su suegra. Con el crédito que solicito va invertir comprando productos de belleza como talco, perfumes, cremas, colonias. La Alcancía Comunal “Las Palomitas” agradece y están comprometidos a seguir trabajando bien. La señora Paulina no pudo estar presente por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en:
The "Little Doves" community bank is comprised by seven individuals who are very responsible and willing to continue working. Norma is originally from Cerro de Pasco but she arrived in Lima at a young age to get ahead. She is currently 38 years old. In her family there's herself, her husband and their 4 children. 

Norma sells beauty products. She has been in this line of business for over a year. She started when a friend encouraged her to start her own business. She also explains that she sells items on demand, based on the orders placed by friends and family. The business has helped her achieve financial stability for her home and enabled her to continue to support the education of her two youngest children. 

Norma's goal is to buy her own home, as she's living under her mother-in-law's roof at the moment. With the requested loan she invest in the purchase of beauty products such as talcum powder, perfumes, lotions and colognes. The "Little Doves" community bank is grateful for the loan an is committed to keeping up the hard work. Paulina wasn't able to attend due to work reasons.

loans.use: to buy talc, perfumes, lotions and colognes.

loans.name: Sut

texts.en: Sut is 33-year-old woman. She is living in Baray District, Kompong Thom Province. Now, she is a farmer. From this business she gets low income per month. Due to the lack of money and it is the time for farming, Sut has decided to request some funds from Kiva Partner, HKL. With these funds she would like to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other materials. She hopes that this loan will increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other materials.

loans.name: Carmen Julia

texts.es:
Carmen es una madre de familia de 31 años de edad, vive con sus hijos en su casa propia,  cuenta con servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona rural del departamento de Lambayeque.  Toda esta zona sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

Carmen se dedica a la venta de cerveza, esta actividad los realiza desde hace 5 años, su negocio lo tiene en su misma casa. Últimamente se ha incrementado las ventas de cerveza en la zona donde vive, lo que le ha favorecido para poder incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Teniendo la oportunidad de crecer Carmen ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de cerveza y realizar algunas mejoras en su vivienda, con la finalidad de obtener mayores ganancias y así sus clientes aumenten, para solventar el crédito otorgado y para que su familia se supere poco a poco.
texts.en:
Carmen is a thirty-one year old mother who lives with her children in her own home, which has light and water service and is located in the rural region of the Lambayeque department. Throughout the region, people work in agriculture, ranching, and tourism.

Carmen sells beer, and has been doing so for the past five years. Her business is based in her home. Lately, beer sales have increased in the region where she lives, which has allowed her to be able to increase her profits and improve her family’s quality of life.

Carmen has requested a loan of 1000 PEN ($375) from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase a larger quantity of beer and to make some improvements in her home. Her goal is to earn greater profits, and, in that way, increase her clientele so that she may repay the loan awarded, and so that her family situation improves little by little.

loans.use: To purchase a larger quantity of beer so that she can commercialize her business.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en: Jessie is a 53-year-old married man with three children. He is a farmer working in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. He grows rice and sells his harvest in his community. Aside from rice farming, Jessie also raises pigs and runs an ice-cream business. Jessie works hard to improve his income and support his family. He requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, piglets and feed and ingredients for ice-cream. Jessie hopes to succeed in all his ventures.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, piglets and feed and ingredients for ice-cream.

loans.name: Cristobal

texts.es: Cristóbal tiene 30 años, convive con Valentina de 24 años, con quien tiene 03 hijas. Juntos habitan en la localidad de natividad, Pichari. Ella nunca tuvo la oportunidad de asistir a un centro de estudios, pero eso no le impidió a lograr su objetivo, de crecer económicamente y lograr lo que en la vida mas anhela, que es el de tener su propio campo agrícola, y una casa propia. Recuerda que en un inicio se esforzó constantemente para establecerse en una  actividad agrícola, cultivando café y cacao. Pero gracias a su dedicación sus frutos se desarrollan de la manera mas adecuada, además que utiliza materiales orgánicos que no dañan  el medio ambiente para mantener saludables dichos frutos. Y esto es gracias a que utiliza técnicas que utilizaba sus abuelos, para que sus productos estén libre de cualquier sustancia química, y es así que hasta el día de hoy mantiene esa técnica. Usualmente trabaja con su pareja, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos y en temporada de siembra y cosecha necesita contratar peones para que faciliten su trabajo. En un futuro cercano anhela incrementar su campo agrícola, con el único fin de producir mayor volumen. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en pagar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 3,000 soles, contratará peones para que lo ayuden e cuidar, limpiar y fertilizar sus plantas de cacao y café.
texts.en:
Cristóbal, 30, lives with Valentina, 24.  They have three daughters.  They live together in the community of Natividad, Pichari.  He never had the chance to go to school but that did not stop him from reaching his goal: to grow economically and attain the life he’d always wanted which is to have his own farming business growing coffee and cocoa beans.  

Thanks to his dedication his fruit develops very well.  Besides, he uses organic supplies that do not damage the environment to have healthy fruit.  This is thanks to his using techniques that his grandparents used so that the products will be free of chemicals; to date, he still uses these same techniques.  He usually works together with his partner but sometimes his children also help and during planting and harvesting he needs to hire day workers to facilitate the work.  In the near future he’d like to enlarge his growing fields to produce larger volume.

This will be his first MFP loan that he commits to repay punctually.   He will use the 3000 soles to hire day workers to help him care for, weed and fertilize his cocoa bean and coffee plants.

loans.use: to hire day workers.

loans.name: Huaramaya Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “HUARAMAYA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Cascada, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Rogelia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: crianza de ganado vacuno, venta de leche, confección de polleras y mantas.

La señora Rogelia,  indica que es primera ves que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de leche que viene trabajando hace diez y seis año atrás, ya que es un negocio familiar.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital mediante la compra de una vaca lechera, que comprara de la feria de Villa Remedios y posteriormente lo procesado lo venderá a las empresas lecheras. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.
texts.en:
The Huramaya Communal Bank will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Cascada.  It is made up of six members and it is managed by a board of directors headed by Rogelia.  The communal bank's members have different businesses, among which we have the following: raising cattle, selling milk, and making skirts and blankets.

Rogelia tells that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer, having joined on the invitation of a promoter.  Currently, she has a business selling milk that she has had for 16 years now since it's a family business.

The loan she is now taking out is to increase her capital through the purchase of a milk cow.  She will buy it at the Villa Remedios market and after processing it she will sell it to a dairy company.  This kind of work allows her to generate the resources to support her family as much as possible, as she is married and has four children.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCION - ANTA”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Anta en la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Felicitas;  La socia tiene 37 años de edad, la socia es casada, la socia tiene un hijo de 18 años de edad, la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de granos, la socia compra habas, maíz amarillo, blanco, papa seca, frejoles, porotos, pallares, cereales; La socia trabaja vendiendo productos en el mercado , ella desea invertir el crédito en la compra de productos secos al por mayor de su proveedora y para ella requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos secos, la socia con lo que ingresa de sus ventas lo invierte en los estudios de su hijo. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos secos.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Felicitas belongs to the communal bank "Virgen Inmaculada Concepción - Anta," which is located the Anta district of Cusco, Peru.

She is 37 years old, married and has an 18 year old son.  She works buying and selling grain. She buys lima beans, yellow and white corn, dried potatoes, kidney beans and pallar beans.  Felicitas sells her products in the market and plans to invest the loan in dried goods which she gets at a wholesale price from her supplier.  Money earned from her investment will go towards her son's education.  

Felicitas is grateful for the loan and is committed to repaying it in accordance with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: invest in dried goods.

loans.name: Carmen Monica

texts.es: La familia de la señora Carmen Monica, es una familia que emigro de Cochabamba desde hace un año y medio; ella tiene tres hijas las cuales estudian, hoy viven el barrio villa  Paraiso y se encuentra  a 45 minutos de la ciudad, el esposo se dedica al trabajo de taxista pero este trabajo solo alcanza para conciliar algunos gastos de alimentación y a duras penas los estudios de sus hijas, la esposa, la señora Carmen Monica se dedica al comercio de venta de comida en la calle, vendiendo sanduwich de chancho para ayudarse pero la cantidad que vende aun no les alcanza para poder subsistir bien, por este motivo necesitan el préstamo para poder aumentar su producción de sanduwich y así poder ayudar a su esposo y a sus hijas mejorando la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carmen Monica's family moved from Cochabamba a year and a half ago. She has three daughters who are studying. Today, they live in the Villa Paraíso neighborhood, 45 minutes away from the city. 

Her husband works as a taxi driver but that only covers some food expenses and barely their daughters' education. His wife, Carmen Monica, works as a street vendor selling food -pork sandwiches- to help, but her sales are not enough to subsist. For this reason, they are requesting a loan to increase her sandwich production in order to help her husband and daughters improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to increase her sandwich sales.

loans.name: Bienvinida

texts.en:
Bienvinida is married and has eight children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Bienvinida is 45 years old.

Bienvinida has a fishing/fish-vending business in the Philippines. Bienvinida requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

Bienvinida has been in this business for 35 years. In the future, Bienvinida would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Hakim Mai's Group

texts.en:
Hakim Mai is 55 years old. She is married and lives with her family, including her two children who are 20 and 22. Her son is a driver by profession while her daughter is studying in 12th standard. 

Hakim Mai's husband is a farmer by profession and is involved in the agriculture business. Besides growing seasonal crops in the field, he also operates an animal-sales business. He keeps goats and buffalo, and sells their milk to generate additional revenue. 
 
With this loan, her husband will purchase a buffalo so he can sell its milk to more clients and generate a good income. She is hopeful that the loan investment will help expand her husband’s business and improve her family’s well-being.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called "Asasah Passbook") is Hakim Mai.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo to sell its milk.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a married woman with three children. She is 48 years old and resides in the Philippines. 

Patricia owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She's been in this business for four years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 from her business. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional stock to sell. 

Patricia has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Patricia wants to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchased stock to sell in her general store.

location.town: Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Chinbat

texts.en:
Chinbat, 51, is a teacher at a driving school. He has been doing his job for 16 years and he lives with his family in the common which is located in the boundary district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

His living apartment was built in early of 1970. Lately it has became old and difficult to live in because no renovations have been made since it was built. Therefore he is planning to make the renovations to his apartment before the coming spring. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to purchase the necessary building materials to make a renovation to his rooms.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary building materials to make a renovation to his rooms.

loans.name: Gantumur

texts.en:
Mr. Gantumur, 34, runs a taxi service around the districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been in this business for six years and already has had many customers in the past years. He lives with his wife and his two children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. 

Since last summer Gantumur has been building a new house in his backyard. But he has been faced with the lack of money to purchase the building materials. This happened because of his faulty projection of building costs. Now he needs over MNT 1,800,000 to finish building his new house. Therefore, he is requesting a loan to purchase the necessary building materials to complete his house.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary building materials to finish building his house.

loans.name: Isaaf

texts.en:
Isaaf is a 43-year-old single lady who started working in 2002 as a tailor at a tailoring shop for three months then decided to start her own business on her own. 

In 2002, Isaaf bought a sewing machine and started sewing and tailoring clothes for people at her home. Little by little, she was able to expand and open her own tailoring shop.

Now Isaaf has applied for a loan to buy a new sewing machine and work on expanding more.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Yaira Yulieth

texts.es:
La  Señora Yaira, tiene 35 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos a su cargo vive con su esposo, Su actividad principal es la venta de verduras frutas, carnes y lácteos desde hace más de 4 Años, Doña Yaira, esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de compra de verduras, frutas, carnes y lácteos  ya que su clientela ha crecido y necesita satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes los que prefieren de sus producto por la buena calidad y precios y atención brindada a sus clientes ya que Doña Yaira Junto a su esposo salen a visitar y ofrecerles los productos a sus clientes a las aldeas donde ellos viven, con el apoyo del préstamo que reciba Doña Yaira, le contribuirá a tener un mejor surtido en su negocio, y así obtener mejores ingresos para cubrir los gastos en el hogar y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Doña Yaira ha hecho mejoras a su casa después de que esta se incendiara y perdiera todo, Doña yaira es una persona con deseos de superación y al apoyo brindado y la buena administración de los créditos la Señora Yaira se ha levantado nuevamente, uno de sus sueños es ver sus hijos profesionales universitarios y con sus trabajos para sentirse orgullosa de que ha valido la pena esforzarse por el bien de la familia.
Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - Abril 2012

loans.use: Para la compra de verduras, frutas, carnes y lácteos  para su negocio

loans.name: Khlood

texts.en:
Khlood is a 28 year old married woman who has 4 family members from Al Russeifeh Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 700 JD to buy clothes from Aqaba to sell in her area,she hopes to increase her income. In the future she would like to open a shop.
Since Khlood is under a 30 year old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for clothes to sell

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi, 35 years old and a married lady, lives in a small village of Koraput district in Odisha, earning a livelihood by tailoring. She has been in this trade for the past seven years. 

She now needs a loan of 35,000 INR to buy cloth and thread to make dresses. Laxmi buys cloth and thread from the market and then she makes dresses for children. Once the dresses are made, they will be sold in the market at a profit. Her brother helps her in this business. This loan will help her to improve her business and add income to her family, consisting of her father, mother, and brother.

She hopes to do well in her business. She is thankful to Kiva for this support.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and thread to make dresses

loans.name: Wapanka Raya Group

texts.es:
Es un grupo solidario mixto, está conformado por una mujer y 3 hombres emprendedores, pertenecen a la etnia miskita, viven en el municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Se unieron recientemente con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para acceder a préstamos en Pana Pana, para tener la oportunidad de mejorar sus pequeños negocios de venta de mariscos, incrementar sus ingresos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. Decidieron nombrar al grupo solidario WAPANKA RAYA, porque en vocablo miskito significa “Abriendo nuevas Puertas”

Jefferson Miguel: Es el coordinador del grupo solidario, tiene 27 años de edad, casado con 2 hijos menores de edad. Con el propósito de sacar adelante a su familia trabaja como pescador y su esposa le ayuda a vender los pescados y mariscos. Esta solicitando financiamiento para comprar herramientas para pescar. Sueña con tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en:
This is a mixed loan group. It is made up of one woman and three enterprising men. They belong to the Miskito ethnicity and live in the town of Puerto Cabezas. They recently got to together with the purpose of working integrally to access loans with Pana Pana. They want to have the opportunity to improve their small businesses selling seafood, increase their income, and improve their families' quality of life. They decided to name the loan group "Wapanka Raya" because in Miskito vocabulary that means, "Abriendo nuevas puertas (Opening New Doors)" .

Jefferson Miguel is the coordinator of the loan group. He is 27 years old and married with two younger children. With the purpose of supporting his family, he works as a fisherman and his wife helps him sell the fish and seafood. He is asking for funding to buy fishing tools. He dreams of having a prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy fishing tools.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel C., 31 years old, a native of the City of Maputo, father of 2 children, is responsible for 4 (four) people. He studied until 9th grade, and had to interrupt his schooling due to financial difficulties. The son of a fisherman, he has longstanding experience in the area of fishing.

He began his fishing activity, using a small boat with oars and a sail, renting, employing two helpers. With loans of (20,000 meticais, 40,000 meticais, 30,000 meticais and 50,000 meticais respectively) at HLUVUKU-ADSEMA, he was able to acquire his own boat and outboard engine, sophisticated nets, and to increase the number of workers to 8 (eight).

He currently has a boat with an operational inboard engine, however it has problems due to the constant breakdown of the engine that began when an accident occurred one day while fishing, which created a crack at the bottom of the boat and caused it to sink, damaging the engine.

With a loan of 50,000 meticais, he plans to buy a new boat engine with 25 HP in order to resume the pace of his activity, which is extremely important for the community, given that it provides jobs for 8 people, as well as for resellers of the fishing product, as well as ensuring a continuous supply in quantity and quality of seafood for the population of Catembe and its surroundings.

The original business description in Portuguese is below:

Localização: Catembe, Maputo, Moçambique Cliente: Manuel C. Sector de actividade: Pesca (compra de motor) Valor de empréstimo: 52.000,00 MTN (2,000 US$) Início: 20/11/2006 Fim: 19/11/2007 Manuel C., jovem de 31 anos de idade, natural da Cidade de Maputo, pai de 2 filhos , tendo 4 (quatro) pessoas na sua responsabilidade. Estudou até 9ª classe e viu-se obrigado a interromper devido a dificuldades financeiras. Filho de um pescador, daí a larga experiência na área de pesca.

Iniciou a sua actividade de pesca, usando uma pequena embarcação a remo e vela, em regime de aluguer, empregando dois ajudantes. Recorrendo aos empréstimos de (20.000,00MTN, 40.000,00MTN 30.000,00MTN e 50.000,00MTN respectivamente) na HLUVUKU-ADSEMA, conseguiu adquirir um barco próprio e um motor fora de bordo, redes sofisticadas e aumentar o numero de trabalhadores para 8(oito).

Actualmente conta com um barco com motor a bordo operacional, embora com dificuldades devido ás constantes avarias do motor que tiveram como origem, o acidente ocorrido numa das jornadas de pesca, o qual criou uma fissura no fundo do barco e que culminou com o afogamento do mesmo e causando danos ao motor.

Com um empréstimo de 50.000,00MTN pretende comprar um novo motor de barco com 25 HP de modo a retomar ao ritmo da sua actividade que é extremamente importante para a comunidade visto garantir emprego para os 8 pessoas, assim como para os revendedores do produto da pesca, para além de garantir o abastecimento contínuo em quantidade e qualidade de mariscos a população de Catembe e arredores.

loans.use: To buy motor boat

loans.name: Kokoe Hortense

texts.en:
Ms. Kokoe Hortense M. was born January 10, 1975 in Lomé in the Golfe prefecture. She is married to a teacher, has one child and also takes care of another individual. She has an elementary-school level education and is a hairdresser by trade. She opened her first beauty salon in her neighborhood in Nukafu. Her husband does not earn much money and so is not able to meet the family's needs. He thus counts on Ms. Kokoe M. to take care of the household expenses. She is very energetic, kind and devoted and does everything she can to keep her family together. Thanks to her work experience, she has the ability to manage a loan and to repay it on time. She is requesting a loan of $800 to buy hair dryers and hairpieces in order to better satisfy her customers and earn a maximum profit. This loan will help her to improve her family's economic and social conditions.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 10 janvier 1975 à Lomé dans la préfecture du Golfe, Madame M. Kokoe Hortense est mariée à un enseignant, et est mère d’un enfant. Elle a aussi une personne à charge. De niveau primaire, elle est coiffeuse de profession et a ouvert un salon dans son quartier à Nukafu. Le mari avec son salaire insignifiant, n’arrive pas à satisfaire les besoins de la famille. Il revient à Madame M. Kokoe de prendre en charge le foyer. Très dynamique, sympathique et dévouée, elle met tout en œuvre pour garder l’harmonie dans la famille. Par ses expériences dans le métier, elle a la capacité de gérer un crédit et à le rembourser au moment opportun. Pour ce faire, elle sollicite un crédit de $800 pour l’achat de séchoirs et mèches pour mieux satisfaire ses clients et réaliser un profit maximum. Ce crédit contribuera à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille, sur le plan économique et social.

loans.use: To buy two hair dryers and hairpieces to satisfy her customers

loans.name: Mark

texts.en: Mark is married but as yet has no children. His business includes selling herbal medicines which he gets from all over the country. He has been in the business for three years and says the business is booming. With a loan from PEMCI, Mark wishes to increase his stock.

loans.use: Mark would like to boost his stock of herbal medicines.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos lives in Santa Catarina and has been a carpenter for more than 20 years. When he was very young he started to work in a workshop where he learnt the trade and thanks to his desire to do well he saved in order to open his own workshop. It is here that he earns money to sustain his family. He is married and has a young son and they have been his motivation to improve and grow this business.

The good service and the quality products that he offers have lead him to earn a lot of clients however his production has been interrupted as one of the machines he uses has broken down. In order to repair this machine he is asking for a loan of $275 which he will repay over a period of 3 months. You can help this family as with your contribution Carlos can continue to work. He and his family thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

En la localidad de Santa Catarina vive Carlos, tiene más de 20 años que se dedica a la carpintería, desde muy joven comenzó a trabajar en un taller donde aprendió el oficio, gracias a sus deseos de superación fue ahorrando para lograr abrir su propio taller de carpintería, de donde ahora obtiene los recursos que necesita para el sostén de su familia, él es casado y tiene un pequeño hijo, ellos han sido su motivo para mejorar y continuar creciendo con su negocio.

El buen servicio y la calidad de los productos que ofrece lo ha llevado a ganar muchos clientes, ahora su producción se ha visto interrumpida porque una de las máquinas que emplea se ha descompuesto y para su reparación está solicitando un préstamo de $ 275 dólares, mismos que se compromete a regresar en 3 meses. Tú puedes ayudar a esta familia, con tu contribución Carlos podrá seguir trabajando, él y su familia agradecen mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use: To repair machinery/Reparación de maquinaria

loans.name: Severo

texts.es:
Severo is a dairy operator who contracts with Pil Andina (Industrial milk production plant). He also serves his community preaching Christian religion. He lives with his wive and two small children, ages 9 and 4. They live two and a half hours from La Paz, in the community of Chahuira-Pampa. Severo will use this loan to purchase an improved breed of milk cow to increase his milk production. This is necessary, as the PIL plant has raised the demand of milk in the area in such a way that the producers must meet their needs at once. This is his first loan with Impro and he has been qualified through a credit evaluation.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Severo es productor de leche de vaca mismo que comercializa a Pil Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche), también se dedica a predicar la religión Cristiana en su comunidad, vive junto a su esposa y sus dos pequeños hijos de 9 y 4 años. Vive en la Comunidad de Chahuira-Pampa ubicado a dos horas y media de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca lechera de raza mejorada para incrementar la producción de leche, pues la Planta PIL ha incrementado su demanda en todo el sector de tal manera que los productores de leche de la región necesitan cubrirla inmediatamente. Es el primer crédito con Impro y la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo

loans.use: Purchase of a milk cow

loans.name: Yawovi Francis

texts.en:
Mr. A. Yawovi Francis was born January 4, 1970 in Gati-Akpafo. He currently lives in Lome in the neighborhood Wuiti. He is a single father of one child of his own and one child of his sister's, who was left under his care. He is a photographer and would like to open a photo/video studio, however, his limited income hinders his endeavors to complete this desire. To make this idea a reality, he needs a loan of $1,000 to purchase the land for his studio and the necessary fitting-out. This would allow him to attract more clients with the goal of increasing his profits.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mr A. Yawovi Francis est né le 4 Janvier 1970 à Gati – Akpafo. Il est actuellement à Lomé et plus précisément dans le quartier de Wuiti. Il est célibataire avec un enfant et un enfant autre de sa sœur est à sa charge. Il est photographe et veut ouvrir son studio de photo et vidéo mais ses maigres économies ne lui permet pas la réalisation de ce projet. Pour ce faire, il sollicite un crédit d’un montant de 1000$ pour la location d'un local, et acheter des nécessaires pour l'aménagement de son studio. Ceci lui permettra d'attirer plus de clientèle en vue d'accroître ses revenus.

loans.use: Opening a Photo and Video Studio

loans.name: Mujuba

texts.ru:
Mujuba, 50, is married and has 5 children. She is selling chicken eggs on the central market. Because stable jobs are lacking, Mujuba’s business provides an important stream of income for her family. Mujuba earned a reputation of responsible MicroInvest client. She plans to use the new loan to expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Мучубе 50 лет, замужем имеет 5 детей. она занимается куплей продажей куриных яиц на центральном продуктовом рынке. Так как постоянной работы нет доход от бизнеса является одной из статей ее семейного бюджета. В Микроинвест она показала себя как ответственная и пунктуальная клиентка. Новый займ собирается потратить на расширение своего бизнеса.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Maximiliana's Group

texts.es:
Marleni, Maximiliana and Alejandra have belonged to the Bonanza Comunal Bank since they were 2, 5, and 1 years old respectively. In their Comunal Bank they learned how to avoid sickness, manage their business, attend to their children and save. Marleni is a single woman of 28 years old, and she sells cosmetics from a catalogue, products she offers to her friends and relatives. Furthermore, she sells clothes in the Market of Vinchos, Huamanguilla and her desire is to open a clothing store. On the other hand, Maximiliana is 60 years old and has 3 children, and sells potato with egg in the Santa Clara market; she has maD. her sales by traveling for the last 30 years. While, Alejandra is widowed, 52, and sells fruits, coca and vegetables in the regional fairs and at the fairs she buys cereals that are sold in the Nery Garcia market. Previously, Alejandra was selling food in the jungle but she had to leave the business to be with her children in Ayacucho. Marleni, Maximiliana and Alejandra need loans of 1000 soles, 400 soles, 600 soles respectively, that will be invested in the purchase of shirts, pants, children’s sets, sweaters, jackets, potatoes, eggs, bananas, oranges, apples, onions, and carrots. The savings of Marleni, Maximiliana and Alejandra will be used to start a new business and for the expenses of their children. The dreams of Marleni, Maximiliana and Alejandra are to buy land, construct a house and to become more capable.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Marleni, Maximiliana y Alejandra pertenecen al Banco Comunal Bonanza desD. hace 2, 5 y 1 año respectivamente. En su Banco Comunal aprendieron a evitar las enfermedades, cómo manejar su negocio, a atender a los hijos y a ahorrar. Marleni es soltera y tiene 28 años, y venD. cosméticos por catálogo, productos que ofrece a amigos y familiares. Además venD. ropa en las ferias D. Vinchos, Huamanguilla u su deseo es abrir una tienda D. ropa. Por otro lado Maximiliana tiene 60 años y 3 hijos, y venD. papa con huevo en el mercado Santa Clara; sus ventas los hace ambulatoriamente desD. hace 30 años. Mientras que Alejandra es viuda, tiene 52 años y 5 hijos, y venD. frutas, coca y verduras en las ferias D. la región y D. las ferias compra cereales que son vendidos en el mercado Nery García. Anteriormente Alejandra vendía comida en la selva pero tuvo que dejar su negocio para estar junto a sus hijos en Ayacucho. Marleni, Maximiliana y Alejandra necesitan préstamos D. 1000 soles, 400 soles, 600 soles respectivamente, que serán invertidos en la compra D. polos, pantalones, conjuntos D. niños, chompas, casacas, papa, huevo, plátano, naranja, manzana, cebolla, zanahoria. Los ahorros D. Marleni, Maximiliana y Alejandra son para iniciar un nuevo negocio y para los gastos D. sus hijos. Los sueños D. Marleni, Maximiliana y Alejandra son comprar un terreno, construir su casa y capacitarse más.

loans.use: Marleni, Maximiliana and Alejandra need loans of 1000 soles, 400 soles, 600 soles respectively, that will be invested in the purchase of shirts, pants, children’s sets, sweaters, jackets, potatoes, eggs, bananas, oranges, apples, onions, and carrots.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbozi, Tanzania! This is 21 year old Rehema M.. She is married with two children, aged 5 and 8. In 1999, Rehema established a general store, and now requires a loan in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed ‘un-creditworthy’ by financial institutions due to a lack of tangible collateral assets. Poor financial support results in poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the said client, extends a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment – a process called a ‘sale and leaseback arrangement’.

loans.use: To purchase additional  stock in bulk.

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.fr:
Residing in Cotonou for more than twenty years, Mrs. Madeleine K. is originally from the town of Ketou in the Plateau Department, where she was born around 1964. She is a married mother of four children, whose schooling and support she is responsible for. A retailer of food products for over 20 years, she currently sells corn and akassa (fermented corn dough). For a little over a year now she hasn’t been able to maintain supply necessary to meet the needs of her customers considering strong demand. As an example, in January of 2008, demand was for 103 sacks while she had only 50 in stock. She is therefore seeking a loan which she needs to increase her stock in order to meet customer demand.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Installée à COTONOU depuis plus d'une vingtaine d'année, Dame K. Madeleine est originaire de KETOU dans le département du PLATEAU où elle a vu le jour vers les années 1964. Mariée, elle est mère de 4 enfants dont elle assure la scolarité et le suivi. Revendeuse de produits vivriers depuis plus de 20ans, elle vend actuellement du maïs et de l’AKASSA (pâte de maïs bouillie). Depuis un peu plus d’un an, elle n’arrive plus à disposer du stock nécessaire pour satisfaire sa clientèle compte tenu de la forte demande. A titre d’exemple, en janvier 2008 la demande était de 103 sacs alors qu’elle n’en avait que 50 dans comme stock. Pour cela elle sollicite ce prêt dont elle a tant besoin pour augmenter son stock afin de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase of 53 sacks of corn.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Doña Juana is a very responsible mother of two children. Since she was young she has had to face many adversities in her life, and until now, with great diligence she has overcome them with the help of her beloved family. Since she separated from the father of her two children she has had to assume the sole responsibility of the home and her children. Thanks to the support of some friends she was able to open a space to sell sweets inside an educational center. This business has helped her finance the studies of her children and the household expenses, but it is still insufficient to cover all of the basic necessities. Her and her children’s desire is to run her business and increase the variety and stock of merchandise that she offers with the intention of elevating her standard of living and offering a good and complete service to their customers. With this objective in mind she comes to you asking for a loan. Whoever has the will has the power and Doña Juana will rapidly realize her project with both of those qualities.

Translated from Spanish by Helen C.Smith, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Juana, es una madre muy responsable, tiene dos hijos y desde muy joven tuvo que atravesar muchas adversidades en la vida y hasta ahora con mucha diligencia las viene sobrellevando con la ayuda de su querida familia. Desde que se separó del padre de sus hijos tuvo que asumir sola la gran responsabilidad de su hogar y de sus retoños, gracias al apoyo de algunas amistades pudo abrir al interior de un centro educativo un espacio de ventas de dulces, este negocio le ha ayudado a solventar los estudios de sus hijos y los gastos de su hogar, pero aun es insuficiente para cubrir todas sus necesidades.Su deseo y el de sus queridos hijos es implementar y aumentar mucho más la variedad y stock de la mercadería que oferta con el propósito de elevar su nivel de vida y brindarles un buen y completo servicio a sus clientes, con este objetivo en mente recurre a ti para hacerte la petición de un préstamo. Quien tiene la voluntad tiene la fuerza y doña Juana con esas dos cualidades podrá concretar rápidamente su proyecto.

loans.use: An increase in capital to offer a greater quantity of cookies, soft drinks, candies and others

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela Bibi, wife of Mr. S. J., has been married for 15 years. She is a graduate, and her husband has a master’s degree. Shakeela has three children--two daughters and one son--all of whom are enrolled in school. S. works in a bank in Sargodha, a small city of Pakistan. Shakeela imports bridal dresses from a few of her family members who are well settled abroad. She rents these dresses at a nominal price. Shakeela also makes jewelry, flower bouquets, and crowns for babies. Her children help her in her work.

Shakeela requires a loan to buy more bridal dresses for her inventory, thereby expanding her business.

loans.use: Expand the inventory of a  bridal dress rental business

loans.name: Comite Renacer Group

texts.es:
The committee, "Rebirth," of the company, Villa Madrid de Limpio, was formed so that members of the company living in the same area could regroup with other members, primarily their neighbors.

There have been four previous meetings regarding loans, in which the interested members became more involved with the program, Commitee of Women Entrepreneurs. In the meetings, these women shared many of their business experiences. At the inception of these meetings, 20 women attended, 19 of which were in agreement with the decisions of the committee.

Now they are in their 4th cycle of the program, and each member is asking for a loan ranging in amount from 300 guaranies to 800 guaranies (average $120), according each member's correspondance since the last loan cycle.

Each member is asking for a loan which will be used to buy the tools of their trade, or to buy merchandise or provisions for the creation of the final product which they sell. The majority of committee members are working independently in selling prepared food, fresh fruits and vegetables, perfumes, flowers, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

El comité denominado "Renacer” de la compañía Villa Madrid de Limpio, se formó a partir de que las integrantes de un comité de la misma zona que decidió desintegrarse ya que quisieron formar un grupo cuyas integrantes vivan más cerca, principalmente vecinas del barrio.

Se realizaron cuatro reuniones previas al crédito en donde las interesadas se interiorizaron más a cerca del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. En las reuniones compartimos muchas experiencias de las señoras con sus negocios. Al comenzar las reuniones asistieron 20 señoras de las cuales 19 estuvieron de acuerdo con los compromisos del comité.

Actualmente se encuentran en el 4º ciclo del programa, la línea de crédito que manejan es de a partir de 300.000 guaraníes hasta 800.000 guaraníes por cada integrante, según lo que le corresponde de acuerdo con el ciclo en el que se encuentran.

Lo solicitado en el crédito cada una de las integrantes utiliza para la compra de herramientas de trabajo o para la compra de mercaderías y/o materias primas para la elaboración del producto que finalmente llevarán a la venta. La mayoría de las integrantes del comité se dedican al trabajo independiente como por ejemplo: venta de comidas, de verduras y frutas, de perfumes, venta de flores, venta de comestibles, etc.

loans.use: Buy materials and merchandise such as linens, meat, fruits and vegetables, soda, perfume, cosmetics, flowers, flour, eggs, bread, etc.

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en:
Mr. Oeun P., 75, and his wife, Mrs. Ren Phoung, 66, who live about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1956 and have four children, one son and three daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home. Another is a fisherman and the fourth a farmer.

Mr. Oeun and his wife have been farming for 28 years. They grow various kinds of vegetables such as spinach, cucumbers, and tomatoes on his farm to sell at the market. Now Oeun is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase seeds and fertilizers for growing vegetables, as well as fishing nets for his son's fishing. The couple is strong enough to work even though they are advancing in years.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for growing vegetables, as well as fishing nets for his son's fishing.

loans.name: Jancy Del Rosario

texts.es:
Jancy is requesting her sixth loan; this time she will invest it in installing floor tile in her home. Jancy has been a school teacher for 12 years, and she is also enrolled at URACCAN University. Jancy has proven to be responsible, honest, and eager to improve herself. She has a 6-year-old daughter who is in first grade of elementary school. Jancy's husband works as a driver and they both contribute to the household expenses. Jancy's dream is to have a stable job, a good home, and to see her daughter receive a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva volunteer

La clienta Jancy está solicitando su sexto refinanciamiento para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda como es poner ceramica al piso de su casa, esta cliente labora como docente de Educación Primaria desde hace 12 años, actualmente esta estudiando su quinto año en la Universidad URACCAN, Jancy se caracteriza por ser responsable, honesta y con mucho deseo de superación personal, tiene una niña de 6 añitos de edad, estudia su primer grado de educación primaria, su esposo labora como ayudante de un camión el cual ambos comparten con los gastos familiares, su sueño es tener estabilidad laboral, una vivienda digna y que su hija estudie para que llegue hacer alguien en la vida.

loans.use: Install floor tile in home

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy O. sells secondhand clothes in Iyano community, where she lives. She started selling secondhand clothes in 2006. Mercy is 34 years old and married with two children. She is a LAPO client. Mercy needs the loan amount of $425 to buy more secondhand clothes to sell. The demand for her secondhand clothes is high.

loans.use: To buy more secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
Doña Modesta cumplió 44 años de edad, estudió hasta tercero de primaria, es casada y tiene siete hijos (cinco varones y dos mujeres) solteros. Vive en la avenida Tacna s/n, distrito de Mazocruz, provincia El Collao, Puno.

Modesta es una nueva integrante del Banco Comunal “Generación 2000” en Mazocruz. Decidió integrarse por falta de capital y por las facilidades para obtener un crédito. Con este préstamo de S/.500 Nuevos Soles, el cual será cancelado en 04 cuotas, comprará 01 saco de arroz con S/.140, 01 bolsa de azúcar con S/.75, 01 bolsa de fideos con S/.30, 01 paquete de gaseosa con S/.17, etc.

Modesta nos relata que no conoció a sus padres, la dejaron cuando tenía 03 años de edad. Su madre la regaló a una familia que no tenía hijos porque ella era madre soltera. Allí creció hasta cumplir los 18 años de edad, dedicándose a tareas como cocinar, lavar, pastar ganados, etc., cuando tuvo su pareja empezaron con el negocio de compra y venta de carne de alpaca, vendía en Mazocruz al por menor. Desde hace 03 años instaló una tienda de abarrotes, y a partir del 2006 también se dedica a la preparación de comida los días de feria (viernes y sábado).
 
Su sueño es comprar un camión con el que piensa transportar verduras y productos de abarrotes a las diferentes ferias, de esa manera podrá obtener mayores ingresos para educar a sus hijos y que puedan ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Modesta is 44 years old, has a third-grade education and is married with seven children — five boys, two girls, all unmarried. She lives on Tacna Avenue in Mazocrux, Peru. Modesta is a new member of the Generation 2000 Community Bank. She decided to join because she lacked capital and for the ability to receive a loan. With the loan she is requesting, which she plans to repay within four months, she will purchase one sack of rice, one sack of sugar, one sack of noodles, one package of soft drinks, among other items. Modesta tells us that she does not know her parents, who left her when she was three years. Her mother left her with a childless single mother. There she grew up, dedicating herself to kitchen chores, washing, grazing cattle, etc., until she and her partner started a business buying and selling alpaca meat in Mazocruz at retail. Three years ago she set up a convenience store and from 2006 she also has prepared meals on market days (Fridays and Saturday). Her dream is to purchase a truck so she can transport vegetables and grocery products to the different outdoor markets, and in this way she'll be able to obtain more income for her children's education so they can grow up to be successful.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, noodles, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Rahmonjon

texts.en: Rahmonjon O. is married and has eight children.  He lives with his entire family, as well as his parents, on a one-hectare property where he grows wheat and hay for his cattle.  Since he was very young, Rahmonjon has loved livestock and worked as a herder.  In order to expand his business he is requesting a loan of $1200, which will be used to purchase more forage and hay for his cattle.

loans.use: To purchase forage and hay for cattle.

loans.name: Mahmuda

texts.ru: Додоходжаева Махмуда проживает в городе Курган-тюбе. Возраст 44 года. Замужем и имеет троих детей. Образование среднее. Занимается торговлей. Имет диллерский центр , где продает сим карты и пластиковые карты денежных переводов за  телефонную связь. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот, а так же сделать небольшой ремонт в помещении. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mahmuda D. lives in the city of Kurgan-tube. She is 44 years old, married, and has three children. She has a secondary education. Mahmuda works in sales. She has a business that sells SIM cards and telephone cards. She decided to take out a loan to increase sales and make some repairs to the store. The loan will be repaid over six months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta always lives with the guidance of the Lord. She is not only a servant of God but a servant of her community. She is actually one of the councilors in their barangay. She manages a hog raising business. Now, she plans to get a loan of at least Php4,000 to buy two additional pigs to raise to increase their income. Some of the money will be used to buy feeds supply. When her hog raising business becomes stable, Julieta wants to expand to other types of business such as putting up a small store to help their financial needs. Her word of honor made Julieta a determined woman to pursue what she has planned and started. This principle motivates her towards the success of everything she is taking.

loans.use: Julieta would like to purchase two pigs and feed supply.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en: Mary M. is 37 years old and married with 7 children, but she also cares for 5 orphans. She is a farmer, but also sells second hand clothes from the daily markets around Lugazi and Jinja. She descends to her farm very early in the morning, and in the afternoons she goes to the markets to sell her clothes; leaving her children and other helpers to finish with the farm work. She now has four cows and five goats plus other commodities that she has attained through her work. Even her clothes are now of higher qualities and are easier to be sold.

loans.use: More clothing for her stock plus paying labor on her farm using the loan.

loans.name: Fikake

texts.en:
E. is married to Fanka Gabriel and they have 4 children all below 15 years of age. E. is living with her entire family in a house of 3 sleeping rooms and one sitting room. E. has faced so many challenges in life such as the death of her parents, school dropout and family problems. These problems made life unpleasant to E. until the year 2006 in which she came to the knowledge of GHAPE and became a member. E. obtained her first loan from GHAPE in the year 2006, which was 20,000 FRS, and received 150,000 FRS in the year 2008; the repayments were made promptly.

With a loan of 250,000 FRS, E. plans to buy more yams for 100,000 FRS, plantain and cocoyam for 100,000 FRS, and fruits and vegetables like pineapples, carrots, and bananas for 50,000 FRS.

E. greatly believes the business will progress because of the experience she has had in the business and the high demand for her goods. With this business, E. helps her community by supplying food to them, reducing their need to travel to the market and even increasing the economic status of her community. She plans to use the profit from the loan to pay for her children's school fees and to feed and clothe her children. Her repayments will commence in the fourth month from the day of disbursement.

She prefers to receive loans from GHAPE because of the training GHAPE offers before disbursing loans, the proper follow up that is done when the loan is repaid, and the comfortable method of repayments.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Buying and selling of yams, plantain, cocoyam, and fruits.

loans.name: Ferida

texts.en:
Ferida G. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and bread and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Ferida is 30 years old and is married with a husband who is a policeman. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Prodan

texts.en: Prodan D. repairs agricultural machinery.  His is a mechanic. In his district, D. is known as a professional engineer.  He is required to repair equipment in local household.  Prodan is borrowing from Microinvest to purchase spare parts for agricultural machinery to repair his own tractor so he can process the land.  The business is located in Cioropcani village, Ungheni district.  D. plans to open a workshop about repair techniques.

loans.use: purchase spare parts for agricultural machinery repair

loans.name: Mas Que Vencedores Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario mas que vencedores esta integrado por tres personas de las cuales dos son caballero y una dama. este grupo se integra de la siguiente forma:
La Sra. Santos G. tiene 68 años de edad, esta casada y tuvo 3 hijos de los cuales uno le ayuda economicamente ya que trabaja en un taller de mecanica, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa usada desde hace 4 años, para vender su producto ella se traslada a las dintintas casas de la aldea.
las personas de su comunidad la conocen bien y dicen que es una persona responsable y muy luchadora, su mayor deseo es tener una tienda de ropa.
El Sr. Angel Fabricio C. tiene 22 años de edad, el vive en union libre con la Sra. Mirna Gonzales con la cual no han procreado ningun hijo.
el se dedica a la venta de camarones y pescado, desde hace 16 meses, para vender su producto el se traslada a los dintintos comedores de la cominidad donde tiene bastantes clientes ya que financia ssu producto, el vende producto de muy buena calidad.
su mayor sueño es tener una bodega en la cual el pueda vender su producto al por mayor.
Yunior R. tiene 27 años de edad, el vive en union libre con la Sra. Francis ordonez, tienen 1 hijo, el se dedica a la venta de tomates, papas, yuca, repollo, chiles, zanahorias, pastes, pepinos, bananos, naranjas, el tiene 2 años de hacer esta actividad, para vender su producto lo pone en su carro y lo lleva  a los distintos municipios del departamento de Valle.
su mayor sueño es tener un camion para vender mucho producto.
todos ellos necesitan el credito para salir adelante con sus familias.
texts.en:
The Más Que Vencedores (More Than Conquerors) Solidarity Group is made up of three people, two of whom are male and one female, as follows: Santos García is 68 years old and married with 3 children, one of whom works in a vehicle repair shop and helps her financially. She has been selling second-hand clothes door-to-door in the village for 2 years now. Those in her community know her well and consider her a responsible and very strong-willed individual. Her greatest wish is to own a clothing store. Angel Fabricio C. is 22 years old and lives with his partner, Mirna Gonzáles, with whom he has no children. He has been selling fish and shrimp for 16 months now, visiting the different eateries in the community, among which he has quite a number of customers on account of the excellent quality of his produce. His greatest wish is to sell his produce wholesale in his own store. Yunior R. is 27 years old and lives with his partner Francis Ordonez and their son. He has been selling tomatoes, potatoes, cassava, cabbages, chili peppers, carrots, pastes (small pastries stuffed with potatoes, meat and fruit etc.), cucumbers, bananas and oranges for 2 years now. He drives around the different municipalities in the Valle department selling his produce. His greatest wish is to own a truck with which to sell a larger amount of goods. All of them need the loan to maintain their families.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pants, shirts, shorts, socks, shrimp, fish, tomatoes, potatoes, cassava, cabbages, carrots, bananas, chili peppers, cucumbers and avocadoes

loans.name: Ma. Evangeline

texts.en: Mrs. Ma. Evangeline S. is fifty-eight years old and married with two children. She lives at Punta, Dipolog City. She and her husband work hard for a living and for their children's education. Her husband has no regular job; that is why she is eager to help him. She has already received several loans and pays it back consistently. Recently, she asked for $125 to purchase materials for making and selling nipa (leaves used to make thatch for a roof). They have faithful customers, and that is a big help for making an income. Evangeline's wish is to send her children all the way through school.

loans.use: To buy materials for nipa-making

location.town: Dipolog-Punta, Dipolog City Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Aura Maria

texts.es:
La señora Aura Maria , pertenece al Banco Comunal “Huicungo ”, vive en la Calle Colina  s/n, Distrito de Huicungo, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Juanjui, Departamento de San Martín. Es Viuda, tiene 56 años, 05 hijos, todos ellos ya independientes, pero una de sus hijas que vive con ella es quien le ayuda en el negocio. 

Su espíritu  luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes en muy pequeña cantidad poco a poco fue ganando experiencia en este tipo de actividad, y haciéndose muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.  
En la actualidad tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acude a su tienda a comprar donde cuenta con todo lo necesario que el ama de casa necesita y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con el préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, utensilios de aseo para el hogar y de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Aura Maria  se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando y seguir adelante y asegurarse una  vejez tranquita y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aura Maria belongs to the Comunal Bank, “Huicungo ”, she lives on Colina Street s/n, Huicungo District, in the Mariscal Cáceres Province, Juanjui, in the San Martín State. She is a widow, 56 years old, 5 children; all independent now, but one of her daughters lives with her and helps her with the business. Her fighting spirit which has always characterized her desire to move forward with her own means, has made her start her own business selling groceries in small quantities, gaining experience little by little in this kind of activity and making her well known and loved among her clients. At the present time she has loyal clients that come daily to her shop where she buys everything necessary for the housewife’s needs. She personally waits on them with the charisma that characterizes her service. With the loan of 1,000 S/ she hope to invest it in buying rice and sacks of sugar, bags of beans, milk and preserved canned fish, and in a variety of brands cleaning utensils for the home, personal hygiene products to give her clients her best attention. Aura Maria feels very strong continuing to work and move forward ensuring a tranquil later years in life. She thanks the Manuela Ramos Movement for contributing to her ability to achieve her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Will buy basic necessity articles

loans.name: Con Esfuerzo Triunfaremos - Group 2

texts.en:
Danilza P. lives in La Mina, a small batey (a company town where sugar workers live) in the municipality of Consuelo, outside San Pedro de Macoris in the Dominican Republic. She and her husband, Cristobal Montero, have three children. Danilza went to middle school, but did not complete it, so providing a good education for her children is extremely important to her.

Danilza sells clothing, both in her neighborhood and on the nearby streets. She sells on credit to some of her clients, and then they pay her back on their pay days. This represents a challenge for her, because not everyone pays her on time and she spends a considerable amount of time doing collections.

Danilza wants to see her business grow. She wants to set up a boutique with more varied clothing items. She hopes her children have a better future and can continue studying for the careers of their choices. On behalf of Danilza and the rest of this Bank of Hope, we thank you for your support

loans.use: To buy clothing to resell

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
For more than a year, “Balot” vending has been the primary business of Mrs. Elsa S..  (Balot is a fertilized duck egg with a nearly-developed embryo inside that is boiled and eaten in the shell). She earns a weekly net income of PHP300. She works patiently in order to generate income for her family. She seeks financial assistance from KIVA to further develop her business and expand into other kinds of business to increase her income. Elsa is hoping to borrow PHP18,000 as additional working capital.

Elsa is 47 years old. She is married to Ariel S., 36 years old. Her husband works as a tricycle operator. They help each other for the progress of their family. Unfortunately, the couple doesn’t have children yet. They are happily living at Barangay Minante 2 of Cauayan City.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Encuentro Con Jesus 3 And 4 Group

texts.en:
Luz N. (second from right) is a thirty-year-old businesswoman who lives about an hour outside of the capital, Santo Domingo, in a city called Los Alcarrizos. She is a coordinator for the Bank of Hope “Encuentro con Jesus” (Encounter with Jesus). While this is the third loan that Luz has taken out with Esperanza International, it is the first loan for many of the other women in her group.

Luz took out her first group loan in February 2008 and has consistently and persistently made her payments. However, the previous members of her group struggled to accept the responsibilities associated with microfinance and thus the group suffered from solidarity and cooperation problems. Esperanza International utilizes group lending, which means that the other members of the group are held responsible if one member defaults. Luz is excited because she has great hope for the responsibility and solidarity of this new group. She shared that it is directly evident that these women are ready to flourish with the opportunity that microfinance provides and are simultaneously ready to be dependable group members.

In February 2008, Luz ran a colmado, a small store that sells primarily durable goods and foods such as rice and potatoes. Almost a year and a half later, Luz now runs a cafeteria where she sells a variety of lunch foods including fresh juices, fried chicken, empanadas (a pastry turnover filled with savory ingredients and baked or fried), and tostados (a tortilla fried in deep fat with various fillings piled on it). Currently, Luz is unable to satisfy the demands of her customers (certainly a good problem to have); thus, she will use her loan to purchase more primary materials so she can expand the amount of food she produces with her mother.

Luz hopes to use her increased profits to not only expand her business but also to save up to replace her tin roof with a more stable cement block roof since it rains frequently in Los Alcarrizos. This new roof will truly be a manifestation of the stability and improvement that microfinance can foster.

Luz lives with her husband, who sells construction materials, and her two children (4 and 6). She is excited for her children’s future and wants them to grow up studying hard, attending church, and making good friends. The children are not the only ones studying in this family. In fact, Luz has been taking night classes in the capital. While she is currently between sessions, she plans to resume classes in August. 

On behalf of Luz N., the Bank of Hope Encuento con Dios, and the microfinance institute Esperanza International, thank you for providing opportunities to those who need it most!

loans.use: To buy more primary materials for cooking

loans.name: Enyonam

texts.fr: Enyonam G. est une jeune femme de 27 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de pagnes au marché de Kpalimé, une ville située à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. elle souhaite avec ce crédit accroître la taille de son commerce en achetant de nouveaux produits afin de satisfaire la demande de la clientèle
texts.en:
Enyonam G. is a young woman, 27 years old, married, and the mother of two. She is a retailer of pagnes (colorful West African cloth) at the marketplace in Kpalimé, a city located about 120 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. She wishes to use this loan to expand her business by buying new products to satisfy customer demands.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 32-year-old mother of three who owns a beauty shop in the Embakasi area of Nairobi.  She has requested her second loan of Ksh. 30,000 after successfully repaying her first loan of Ksh. 20,000 in order to diversify and open a fruit shop. 

Margaret hopes to one day grow her business into selling wholesale and buy plots of land and develop houses for rental units. On a personal level, she would like to one day own her own home and educate her children to the highest level. Margaret describes herself as diligent and social.



Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Start a fruit shop

loans.name: Juana Luz

texts.es: Juana Luz G. G. reside en el departamento de La Libertad. Juana tiene 24 años de edad, vive con su esposo que trabaja como empleado y aporta a la familia $200.00 US mensuales, y su pequeño hijo Miguel de tan solo dos años de edad. Juana posee una tienda en su casa, la cual tiene  solamente dos años de existir , siendo esta la razón por la cual la tienda se encuentra con poco inventario y es por eso que ahora Juana solicita un crédito, para surtir su tienda con granos básicos y boquitas que le ayudaran a incrementar sus ventas.

loans.use: Surtir su negocio

loans.name: Ndèye Sophie

texts.fr: Ndèye Sophie M. est une femme de 45 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont un est à l'école. Elle est  membre du Banc Villageois de BOUCOTTE PLACE GAO depuis 6 ans et demi et y a bénéficié de 13 prêts qu'elle rembourse toujours avec succès. Avec son prêt elle envisage de renforcer son activité de teinture afin d'accroître ses bénéfices qui lui permettront de participer aux charges et bien être familiale.
texts.en:
Ndèye Sophie M. is a 45-year-old married woman who is the mother of five children, one of whom is in school. She has been a member of Banc Villageois BOUCOTTE PLACE GAO for six and a half years and has received from it 13 loans, which she always repaid successfully.  With this loan, she envisions bolstering her business involving dyed cloth to grow her profits.  This will allow her to help with expenses and her family's welfare.  

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering and advancing her work

loans.name: Macaria

texts.es: Macaria E. de 40 años reside en Ciudad Delgado, junto a sus dos hijos y una nieta. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa interior femenina, faldas y blusas, las cuales las comercializa de manera ambulante. Macaria es una mujer muy trabajadora la cual sale a las calle desde muy temprano para tratar de vender lo más posible y de esta manera obtener mayores ganancias. Ella solicita un préstamo para poder obtener el capital necesario y de esta manera comprar más mercadería y así poder brindarles mayor variedad a sus clientas.

loans.use: Compra de ropa.

location.town: Ciudad Delgado en el departamento de San  Salvador

loans.name: Leatitia

texts.en:
Leatitia K. is a 30-year-old widow with two children aged 10 and 12 years old. She lives in Kicukiro district in Kigali, the capital of Rwanda.

Leatitia owns a restaurant serving the local community and has owned this successful establishment since 2004. The business employs seven persons from her community. The profits from her business allow her to pay school fees for her two children. As she owns a restaurant, providing food is not too difficult!

Leatitia is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company in order to increase her profit through purchasing more equipment such as a larger fridge, a new blender and other equipment.

loans.use: To buy more equipment for her restaurant

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes, de 36 años, es una madre muy alegre y amorosa, vive con su hijo (Paolo) de 16 años. La casa donde vive se la dieron a cuidar, y por el momento es su vivienda.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de segundo uso en un puesto ubicado en la avenida “Costanera” de la ciudad de Puno (lugar donde se hacen ferias de ropa de segunda mano en esta ciudad), ella vende todo tipo de ropa, ya que compra por fardos cerrados la vestimenta americana que llega a nuestro país.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de venta, lo cual hace menos fastidiosas sus largas jornadas de trabajo. Lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta sin poderlo descuidar. Con el tiempo, anhela tener una tienda de ropa donde pueda vender con más tranquilidad sus prendas de vestir.

Este es el primer préstamo de Mercedes con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo para no meter en problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida. Con los mil soles solicitados, comprará más fardos de ropa para aumentar la cantidad de mercadería que tiene en su puesto.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 36-years-old and is a very happy and loving mother who lives with her son, Paolo, who is 16. They live in a house that they take care of.

Mercedes sells secondhand clothing in a stall located on "Costanera" Avenue in the city of Puno. She sells all kinds of clothing and buys a variety of clothes sent from the US to be sold in Peru. What she likes most about her work is chatting with her fellow salespeople, which makes her long days of work less tiresome. She has been doing this work for three years and believes the hardest part is having to stay all day in her sales stall without being able to leave. In the future, she longs to have a clothing store where she can sell her garments with greater ease.

This is Mercedes' first loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner), and she knows she has to pay on time in order to not have problems with the members of her communal bank, where she is appreciated. With the 1000 Peruvian soles she has requested, she will buy more bundles of clothing in order to increase the quantity of merchandise she has in her stall.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy used clothing

loans.name: C2255 Ubumwe Group

texts.en:
Sylivestre is 37 years old and is married with three children. He lives in Kabuga where he is the president of a group called “Ubumwe”. This is the fourth successful year in their business of selling small fish commonly known as “indagara”. The group works from 6 a.m. to 5 p.m. every day.

The group is requesting its first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their business through purchasing a greater volume of indagara fish. With this loan, the group hopes to get better pricing for their product and improve their business and hopefully earn more profit in the process. This, in turn, will allow the members and their devoted spouses to build a secure future for themselves.

loans.use: To purchase a greater volume of indagara fish

loans.name: Bina

texts.en:
Bina K. lives in a Bhakapati Village, located in Kathmandu district. It is one of the developing villages of Kathmandu and most of the people in this region are engaged in farming.

Mrs. K. is a grocery shopkeeper in her village. She sells different types of grocery items in her shop such as rice, maize, noodles, snacks and cold drinks. Her husband also helps her in the shop.

Now Mrs. K. is requesting an Rs 25,000 loan to expand her business by purchasing different varieties of grocery items for her shop.

loans.use: To buy different varieties of grocery items for her shop

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane runs a a tailoring and dressmaking shop in the neighborhood of Likoni in Momabasa, Kenya. She is a single lady with no children. She makes both ladies' and children's dresses. This is Jane’s first loan application (Kshs 30,000) and she plans to use it to expand her stock of dressmaking materials and keep part of it as savings for emergency use. She says the business is doing well; with her profits, she has also managed to start a business dealing in plastics.

loans.use: Buy stock of materials

loans.name: Waheed

texts.en: Waheed is 51 years old and married with 4 children who are all doing well in school. He sells medicine. "I love my business because I love seeing people healthy", says Waheed. He lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. His wife is a nurse and they both contribute to supporting the family. He is requesting a loan amount of NGN 70,000 to purchase more medicine to sell. He believes that having an assortment of medicine that is of good quality will increase his sales. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn R. is from the village of Kauswagan, Dangcagan, Bukidnon. Evelyn is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells both food & daily use products in the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Evelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Evelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new inventory

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua E. makes and sells a local delicacy called Fante kenkey at Elmina (Fante kenkey is a variety of kenkey associated wth the Fante people of Ghana. It is fermented corn and cassava dough wrapped in plaintain or banana leaf).

Ekua has received no formal education. She is single and has two children. She is responsible for paying school fees and utility bills.

Ekua has been selling Fante kenkey for some time now. Her loan will be used to buy more maize to make kenkey for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more maize to make kenkey to sell

loans.name: Idowu

texts.en: Idowu sells articles like cards, clock to make a living. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes to grow her business. She hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more articles to sell. She is 41 years old and a widow with three children. Her children  attend school. Life as a widow has not been easy. She sells for long hours to enable her put food on her table to feed her children. She hopes to lift her business and family above poverty. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more articles to sell

loans.name: Antonia Patricia

texts.es: La señora L. N., es de oficio domésticos, trabaja como conserje (limpieza) en una empresa, tiene un hijo en edad escolar. El préstamo lo necesita para compra de unas hojas de zinc, para cambiarlas en el techo de la casa, ya que se encuentran dañadas y el invierno esta pronto a venir, por lo que necesita proteger de la lluvia a su familia. Con los préstamos que ha tenido en CEPRODEL viene mejorando sus condiciones de vida. Es una joven madre responsable y dedicada a su hogar.
