texts.en:
Sra. L. N. provides housekeeping services. She works as a janitor for a business and has a son who is in school. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase sheets of zinc so that she can replace the roof of her house. It is currently in disrepair, and with winter approaching, she needs to protect her family from the rain. With her loans from CEPRODEL, she has been able to improve her living conditions. This young mother is responsible and dedicated to her household.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheets of zinc to replace her roof

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret has a grinding machine that she uses to grind foodstuffs like tomatoes, pepper, onions and beans. She also makes local soap to sell. She is a lovely and hard working mother. She hopes to lift her business above poverty. She lives in Edo State, Nigeria. She is married and blessed with 6 children. Her children attend school and this makes her happy. 

Margret needs a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase a grinding machine. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a grinding machine

loans.name: Priyangani

texts.en:
Priyangani Vithanage is a 39-year-old married woman living in Nimalawa Akurassa with her two children and husband.  

She has a bicycle repair garage, a business she has been doing for 15 years now, running it independently. In her shop, she fixes and rebuilds bicycles for her local customers.  She devotes her full effort towards her business, growing it step by step, and uses the income to help support herself and her family.  

Priyangani has asked for a 20,000-LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka in order to expand her bicycle garage.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To develop her bicycle repair business

loans.name: Chanthoeun's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthoeun C. is a 28-year-old married woman. She is the village bank president selected by 14 members, located in Kaoh P. village in Kandal province. Each member of this village loan group will use the loan for a different purpose. Mrs. Chanthoeun C. is a fruit and vegetable seller who earns a small income to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Kunthea Nheom, is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he cultivates vegetables.
 
Mrs. Chanthoeun C. now is requesting a loan to buy more fruits to enlarge her business and to purchase fertilizer and pesticide to support her husband's farming. Mrs. Chanthoeun C. is a mother of two children; one is attending the local school and the other one is four years old.

loans.use: To buy more fruit, fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower from Lebanon is a 46-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and child. Both he and his wife work to support the family. He has owned his own mini-market since 1997. These small stores are common throughout Lebanon and can be found in almost every neighborhood. 

He has requested a loan of $1000 from the Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to increase his store’s inventory. This will be his first loan from Ameen. He estimates that the loan will help him increase his profit by 15%.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his picture, not indicating his name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loan from Kiva to offer lower interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling US $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit: http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: to increase his store’s inventory

loans.name: Benoît

texts.fr: E. Benoît est né en 1969 à Dogbo au Bénin. Marié à BOKONON Emilienne, une revendeuse, Benoît est père de cinq enfants qui sont tous scolarisés et encore à sa charge. Benoît s'est installé depuis vingt deux ans environs au quartier Dodji Dangban à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique, avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la famille. Benoît a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire, puis a commencé à vendre des pièces de rechange à Békon, à Allada. C'est à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, que Benoît s'approvisionne. Benoît exerce cette activité depuis vingt deux ans, et a déjà bénéficié d'un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qu'il a bien remboursé. Benoît voudrait élever le niveau de son activité et mieux assurer la demande de sa clientèle, sans connaître de rupture de stock. C'est ce qui l'a conduit à solliciter un nouveau concours financier auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
E. Benoît was born in 1969 in Dogbo in Bénin. Married to BOKONON Emilienne, a petty trader, Benoît is the father of five children who are all enrolled in school and still being supported by him. About 22 years ago, Benoît came to live in the Dodji Dangban district of Allada, in the Atlantique province, with his wife and children. The couple share in supporting their family. Benoît stopped going to school at the secondary level, then began to sell spare parts at Békon, in Allada. He buys his inventory in Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. Benoît has been in this business for 22 years and has already received one loan from ALIDé, which he has correctly reimbursed. He would like to expand his business and better satisfy his clientele by not experiencing shortages of this or that part. This has led him to request a new loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of spare parts

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en:
Zahra is a 46-year-old woman from Lebanon. She is living with her husband and their four children. Zahra has owned a grocery store since 2008. She decided on opening her store because she wanted to have an independent job which would allow her to supplement her husband's income and provide the best to her children. She sells canned food, groceries, candies, beverages, biscuits and lots more. 

Today, for the first time, she has requested a loan to purchase merchandise for her store. She hopes to continue improving her work in the coming year, as well as her financial situation.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Jose Dolores

texts.es:
José de 46 años, vive en el Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución), Hace 14 años el compro un solar para construir su casa y tener su negocio de comidas.

Después de haber comprado el solar con una mesita y cocineta el empezó a vender “caldo de salchicha” (plato típico del Ecuador que se lo prepara con las viseras de la vaca rellenas de plátanos),  poco a poco con esfuerzo a podido tener su propio negocio ahora también vende “fritada” (es un plato con carne de chancho y granos), trabaja todos los días desde las 05:30am hasta el anochecer. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar una cocina y mesas para su negocio de comidas, en el futuro quiere arreglar mejor su negocio de comidas rápidas.
texts.en:
José is 46 years old and lives in Paraíso de Guayaquil - an area now on the outskirts of the city, whose natural ecology is fast disappearing. 14 years ago, he bought a plot of land to build his house and set up his catering business. After he bought the land, a table and a little kitchen, he began selling “caldo de salchicha” (an Ecuadorean speciality made with beef and plantains). Little by little and with a lot of work, he was able to build up the business, which now also sells "fritada" (a dish made with pork and corn). He works every day from 5.30am till nightfall. With this loan, José wants to buy a better kitchen and tables for his business. In the future he wants to improve his fast food business further.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Kitchen, tables

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen C. is from the village of  Magsaysay Misamis  Oriental. She is 20 years old. Karen is single. To make a living, Karen owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Karen has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Karen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Karen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Karen is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Karen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
N. Margret is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala East region of Uganda. She is married and has no children. Margret has a business selling charcoal: an endeavor she has pursued for three years.         

To help expand her business, Margret is requesting a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more charcoal. Margret plans to use the loan to expand her business and generate a better profit in order to help her family. 

In the future, Margret hopes to own a house and build a bigger business.

Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills. Afterward, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses. These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance. Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal

loans.name: Santos Joel

texts.es:
Santos tiene 28 años de edad y vive junto a su familia en el sector Muy finca del distrito de Mochumí, una zona agrícola conformada por varios caseríos cuyos pobladores viven de actividades como la agricultura y el comercio. Pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace un año a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para brindar servicio de transporte). El brinda este servicio en los diversos caseríos que conforman la zona en donde vive y en el pueblo central (Mochumí), los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza en colaborar con el sostenimiento de su familia.

El continuo uso brindado a su mototaxi y el mal estado de los caminos de la zona han hecho que su unidad movil sufra algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento, para realizar esta acción el ha creído pertinente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Santos es una persona honrada y entregada a su trabajo, diariamente el da lo mejor de si para mantenerse en esta actividad y asegurarle a los suyos el sustento diario. Sus vecinos y amigos le consideran un joven tranquilo y responsable.
texts.en:
Santos is 28 years old and lives with his family in the sector of Muy Finca in the District of Mochumí, an agricultural area that consists of several villages where the inhabitants make their living through farming and trade. This district is part of Lambayeque Province, which is located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

For the past year, Santos has been providing cargo and passenger transport services using a motorcycle taxi (a vehicle that consists of a motorcycle taxi with an attached cabin for providing transportation services). He provides his services in different villages within the area he lives and in the town of Mochumí. The income he receives from this business is used to support his family.

Due to continued use and the poor condition of the local roads, his vehicle has developed some problems that require urgent repairs to ensure that it operates properly. In order to take corrective action, he is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN.

Santos is an honest person who is dedicated to his work. He does his best every day so that he can maintain his business and provide for his daily needs. His neighbors and friends consider him to be a peaceful and responsible young man.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for repairs & maintenance of his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Juntas Podemos Group

texts.es:
GRUPO  JUNTAS PODEMOS
 El grupo está conformado  por  tres  hermanas que se dedican a la venta de verduras en el mercado local  de San Juan Sacatepéquez ,   ANGELICA  R. G. se dedica a la venta de condimentos para  comida( venta de especies),  inicio con su negocio hace 20 años vendiendo  como  ambulante  en  los diferentes pueblos que eran más cercanas  a la aldea  y los días domingos vendía fuera del mercado  durante 15 años  luego  tuvo la oportunidad  de poder comprar un puesto  dentro del mercado  desde hace  5 años  donde  ya tiene clientes fijos  que  le compran   su mercadería, tiene  3  hijos uno de ellos estudia y trabaja  los otros estudian   la señora no vive con su esposo ella ha sacado a sus hijos adelante con la ayuda de su negocio   su mayor deseo  es agrandar su puesto para poder tener más variedad en  ingredientes  para comida ( especies ), MARIA R. G.   se dedica a   la venta de verdura  en el mercado local de San Juan, tiene 3 hijos  uno de ellos ya es  mayor de edad, su esposo le ayuda   a vender cuando esta de descanso su mayor deseo es tener un segundo puesto donde pueda ofrecer sus verduras . ANA ALICIA R. G. se dedica a la venta de verdura   y de algunos granos básicos  para el consumo diario  su puesto se encuentra también en el mercado local, tiene una hija  menor de edad y  su deseó para su negocio es tener más variedad de verduras  como también poder darle un mejor futuro con lo necesario para su hija.
texts.en:
Group name: Together We Can The group is made up of three sisters. They sell vegetables in the local market of San Juan Sacatepequez. Angelica R. G. sells condiments (spices). She started her business 20 years ago, selling door to door in the villages closest to their town and on Sundays she sold outside the market for the past 15 years. She found the opportunity to purchase a stand inside the market five years ago and now she has a steady client base to purchase her merchandise. She has 3 children, one is working and the others are in school. She is no longer together with her husband; she raised the kids herself with the help of her business. Her greatest dream is to have a larger stand from where to display a greater variety of ingredients and spices for sale. Maria R. G. sells vegetables in the local market of San Juan. She has 3 children, one is independent. Her husband helps her with her business in his spare time. Her greatest dream is to have a second stand from where to sell vegetables. Ana Alicia R. G. sells vegetables and basic grains of every day use. Her stand is also located in the local market. She has a young daughter. Her dream is to have more variety in the products she sells and to provide a better future for her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase food items.

loans.name: Señorcito Del Cautivo (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Señorcito del Cautivo esta formado por un grupo de 9 señoras que en su mayoría se dedican al comercio y buscan la mejor manera de seguir incrementando sus negocios, están seguras que los créditos les van a ayudar a crecer en sus negocios ya que se caracterizan por ser mujeres luchadoras. Viven por diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la tercera ciudad con más importante del Ecuador  por su belleza arquitectónica, sus artesanías, su cultura y su gente.

La Señora. Carmen V. vive por la parroquia de Baños, este es el primer crédito que realiza en la banca comunal y fue invitada por una amiga.  Nuestra socia tiene 38 años,   es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 17, 16, 10 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan y ayudan  económicamente en los gastos del hogar, su último hijo  estudia en una escuela de la ciudad, su esposo trabaja como jornalero, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña Carmen se dedica a la venta de frutas,  realiza esta actividad hace 17 años  en el mercado de la feria libre desde las 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. todos los días, vende todo tipo de frutas y cuenta con un puesto propio. El crédito que recibe lo va a invertir en la compra de más frutas como naranjas, sandias, melones, mandarinas, etc. Su meta es realizar el segundo piso de su casa para más comodidad de su familia.

La Señora. Elisa Victoria N. vive por el sector del Crea en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiende 48 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos que son mayores de edad, dos de sus hijos son casados y viven  independientemente, sus tres hijos solteros trabajan y su sueldo lo utilizan para sus gastos personales, su esposo trabaja como bodeguero en una fabrica de la ciudad, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Doña Elisa se dedica a la venta de frutas en el mercado de la feria libre en la ciudad de Cuenca, actividad que le realiza hace 22 años, cuenta con un puesto propio, trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 7 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. y vende todo tipo de frutas. Este es su primer crédito que realiza en la fundación y fue invitada por una amiga a formar parte de la banca comunal, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más frutas como piñas, papayas, naranjas etc.  Su sueño es  algún día tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The Banco Comunal Señorcito del Cautivo (Imprisoned Lord Communal Bank) is composed of 9 women, the majority of whom engage in trade, always looking for the best way to keep on improving their activities. Being determined women, they are sure the loans will help them making their activities grow. They live in different areas of the town of Cuenca, the third most important city in Ecuador for its architectural beauty, its craftsmanship, its culture and its people. Ms. Carmen V. lives in the Baños parish. This is the first loan she is requesting through the Communal Bank, to which she was invited by a friend. She is 38 years old, she is married and has 3 children aged 17, 16 and 10. The two older children have a job and economically help facing family expenses, the youngest is a student attending a school in the city; her husband is a laborer. Thanks to hers and her husband’s jobs they have succeed in building themselves a house. Carmen sells fruits every day in the open market from 8 am to 6 pm, and she has been engaging in this activity for 17 years. She sells every variety of fruit and has her own stall. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more fruits such as oranges, watermelons, melons, tangerines and so on. Her goal is to complete the second floor of her house to offer better living conditions to her family. Ms. Elisa Vitoria N. lives in the Crea sector of the town of Cuenca. She is 48 years old, she is married and has 5 adult children: two of them are married and live independently, the other three are single, they have a job and they use their wages for their personal expense. Her husband is a winemaker in a company of the city. They are currently renting as they do not have a house of their own. Elisa sells fruits in the open market of the town of Cuenca, something she has been doing for 22 years. She has her own stall and she works Sunday to Sunday form 7 am to 6 pm, selling every kind of fruit. This is the first loan she is requesting through this institution, and she was invited by a friend to form part of the Communal Bank. The loans she is requesting will be used to buy more fruits such as pineapples, papayas, oranges and so on. Her dream is to have a house of her own one day.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela V., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy different kinds of fruits.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es: El señor Juan T. trabaja arduamente para llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación. Actualmente requiere mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda que ha estado en malas condiciones y para ello ha solicitado un crédito para ser invertido en la compra de los materiales de construcción y de esta manera brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su amada familia.Espera que su crédito sea otorgado y así llevar a cabo su sueño de reconstrucción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Juan Pablo Tujillo O. is a security guard working for COMMEMA* at the Wholesale Market of Mangua. He has been granted five loans by Ceprodel, and they have all been used to make improvements to his house.
The loan he is requesting will be used to buy materials for the rebuilding of his house and to whitewash the walls, as well as to solve a few family problems.

* COMMEMEA is the acronym for “Corporación Municipal de Mercados de Managua” (Managua Municipal Markets Corporation)

loans.use: To make improvements to his house.

loans.name: Gina Helen

texts.en:
Gina Helen E. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 43 years old. Gina Helen is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Gina Helen owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector selling home products. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling personal home products to tourists and local community members. Gina Helen has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Gina Helen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Gina Helen is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Gina Helen from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Gloria Eufemia

texts.es: La señora Gloria Eufemia V. es comerciante del mercado central, desde hace 50 años  su negocio es venta de mariscos y está ubicado en el sector marisco su financiamiento lo solicito para comprar pescados de dos tipos de variedad,  tiene seis años de trabajar con Ceprodel y con estos financiamientos ha superado su calidad de vida trabaja todos los días de la semana no descansa es luchadora y se esfuerza bastante.
texts.en: Gloria is a merchant in the central market. For the past 50 years her business has sold seafood and in the seafood area of the market. She is requesting the loan to purchase two kinds of fish. She has worked with Kiva partner Ceprodel for the past six years, and the loans have helped her improve her quality of life. She works every day of the week without rest. She is a fighter and works very hard.

loans.use: Purchase seafood

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith sells new clothes and cosmetics and repairs clothes in Nairobi. The area that Faith operates from is competitive and she has a reliable clientele. She is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to buy another sewing machine and add clothing display units. Faith, 34 years old, is married and is a mother of two. She describes herself as hardworking and reliable.

loans.use: buying another sewing machine and adding clothing display units

loans.name: Angela Domitila

texts.es:
Angela Domitila M. M. tiene 55 años. Es casada, vive con el esposo y los hijos viven  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS SOMO MAS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Marañon, por la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol. 

Angela se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 15 años. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar terreno.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Angela Domitila M. M. is 55 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  She has two children.

The 'Unidos Somos Más' (Together We Are More) community bank is located in Marañon district, in Puerto Pechiche parish, in Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this community bank work in short cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and beans.

Angela has been growing corn, rice and beans for 15 years. She is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for her crops.  The support of this loan would help her financially to cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as insect infestations, crop diseases and changes in the climate.  Her dream is to buy her own plot of land.  She likes taking part in sports.

loans.use: Farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married. He is a farmer from Kamenka. Alexander grows early spring vegetables and sells them wholesale and retail in the markets of his region. Alexander owns 3 big arch greenhouses. He started this business 5 years ago. Alexander has invested 40,000 Grivnyas in the venture. Currently, he spends about 5,000 – 7,000 Grivnyas on seeds and polyethylene film.  

Alexander is seeking a loan of 8,000 Grivnyas to construct a new greenhouse to be able to grow more tomatoes in spring. Alexander started working on it, however, he didn’t have the finances to finish it. Therefore, he is planning to use financial assistance to buy polyethylene film and complete the construction process. One of Alexander’s other short-term plans is to build another two greenhouses on his property, thus expanding his farming enterprise and boosting his sales. Alexander is very ambitious. He wants to grow and further develop his business.

loans.use: to construct a greenhouse

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es: Trinidad del Carmen Vermudez es una mujer trabajadora y esforzada quien desde hace 25 años se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras. Este negocio lo inicio con el apoyo de su suegra  quien le enseño este trabajo y luego se independizo. Con este trabajo ha sacado adelante a sus cuatros hijos de los cuales solo el menor de 19 años está a su cargo.
texts.en: Trinidad del Carmen Vermudez is a hard-working woman who has been selling fruit and vegetables for 25 years.  She started her business with the support of her mother-in-law who taught her the trade and then she set up on her own.  Through her work, Trinidad has managed to get her four children ahead in life.  Only her youngest, who is 19, is still in her care.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Oyungerel

texts.en: Mrs. Oyungerel is 46 years old widow, lives with her three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her eldest daughter just graduated a University and works in small company and her youngest daughter is student in local University. Her son is currently unemployed and temporary lives with her grandmother and looks after her. Mrs.Oyungerel rents a space inside the small grocery store and sells a fruits and vegetables. She is running this business since 2005 and has had steady growth over the years. Her store is located close to her house and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She is working hard to be able pay her daughters education fees and other necessary expenses and she also believes that a University diploma is the best legacy parents can give to their children. This time she is requesting a loan to increase her working capital and stock up more products to sell before the Mongolian Lunar new years celebration.

loans.use: to increase working capital and stock up more products to sell

loans.name: Las Vecinas Group

texts.es:
Las Vecinas es un grupo solidario de Credituyo en su primer ciclo formado por 7 mujeres. Ellas pusieron ese nombre al grupo porque todas viven en la misma colonia, muy cerca unas de otras. 
Martha es una de las mujeres del grupo. Ella vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en la colonia Nuevo Escobedo. Ella tiene una hija de 13 años y un hijo de 4. Ella tiene un puesto de tacos en el cual trabaja junto con su esposo para poder mantener a la familia. Los tacos se llaman “Los Sureños”,  y comenzaron hace 8 años en un puesto cerca de su casa. Los tacos que vende son de carne asada, puerco, quesadillas con carne, y además también venden hamburguesas. Ella pidió el préstamo para poder invertir en el negocio y seguir vendiendo continuamente y así que sus clientes sigan contentos . Martha quiere con sus ganancias seguir apoyando a la educación de su hija que estudia la secundaria y nos comento que es el primer lugar de su clase.
texts.en:
'Las Vecinas' (The Neighbors) is a Credituyo community bank which has seven female members and is entering its first loan cycle.  The women gave the group this name because they all live in the same neighborhood, very close to each other.

Martha is one of the group's members.  She lives with her husband and two children in Nuevo Escobedo neighborhood.  She has a 13 year-old daughter and a 4 year-old son.  Martha has a taco stall where she works together with her husband in order to support her family.  The tacos are called “Los Sureños”.  She started selling 8 years ago in a location near her home.  She sells roasted meat and pork tacos, quesadillas with meat and burgers.  

Martha requested this loan to invest in her business so that she could continue selling her products and keep her customers happy.  She would like to use her profits to continue supporting her daughter's education.  Her daughter is currently in high school and she tells us that she is top of her class.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her taco stall

loans.name: Oscar William

texts.es:
Oscar de 27 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, vive con su esposa y sus hijos, Oscar administra un ciber cofee, donde ofrece los servicios computarizados, tiene dos años de dedicarse al negocio, él estudio computación es por eso que decidió emprender esta actividad, hoy día tiene muchos clientes y es reconocido por muchos pobladores de la zona.
El actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de más equipo de computo, materiales como CD, USB, y compra de muebles, con esta inversión Oscar recibirá mejor a los clientes, tendrá disponibles maquinas nuevas que en algunos casos cuando hay mucha clientela dará abastó con el servicio.
Las aspiraciones son mejorar el servicio a los clientes, ampliar el local, mantener el equipo en las mejores condiciones, estas actividades le darán mayor fortaleza al ciber y por consiguiente mejoran sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Oscar is 27 years old, and he lives with his wife and children in the Jiquilisco department of Usultan.  Oscar manages a cyber cafe, where he offers computerized services; he has been doing this work for two years since he finished his studies in computing.  He now has many clients, and he is recognized for his work by many members of the community.

Oscar is applying for this loan to purchase more computer equipment, materials such as CDs, USB cables, and also furnitre.  With this investment, Oscar will be able to better receive his clients, and he will have new machines available so that during times when he has a lot of clients he will be able to keep up with the work.  His goals are to improve his service to his clients, expand the physical space where his cafe is located, and maintain the equipment in the best possible condition. These improvements will strengthen his business and in turn will increase his family's income.

loans.use: Purchase of equipment, CD, USB cables, and furniture.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase merchandise to resell

loans.name: Circuncision   Livia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” SILKINCHANY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de San Jerónimo,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Livia; la socia tiene 38 años de edad, casada y tiene 3 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales (pollos), ella lleva años en esta actividad trabajando conjuntamente con su esposo, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes como restaurantes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona alegre y con muchos motivos para salir adelante  como son sus hijos.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar de alimentos para sus animalitos como maíz, purina entre otros más.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank named "Silkinchany". It is located in the district of San Jeronimo, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

Her name is Livia: She is 38 years old, married, and she has 3 children. She alternates her daily activities with her business raising livestock (poultry). She has many years in the business, working together with her husband. She raises these livestock for later resale to her clients, including restuarants that place orders. She is a very happy person and she has many reasons to come out ahead, especially her children.

She requests a loan to purchase feed for her livestock, such as corn, purina and others.

She is happy to have this loan and she is committed to making the payments.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her livestock, including corn, purina, and others.

loans.name: Charily

texts.en:
Charily is 44 years old and married with 10 children, three of them in school. Charily works very hard to provide for them.

Charily runs a business buying & selling rice grains in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more rice grains.

Charily has been in this business for six years and has sustained her business with the help of her loans from NWTF. 

In the future, Charily would like to expand her business.

loans.use: To pay for the purchase of rice grains

loans.name: Saigo Enole

texts.en:
Saigo is 29 years old, married, and the mother of two children who are schooling. She has been in the agriculture industry for the last five years with a monthly income of about $63. 

She has been a good client who repaid her first loan without any impediment. This will be her second loan from KADET. She plans to use the loan to purchase farm supplies. 

She hopes to generate profits from the loan which she will use to expand her farm from small scale to commercial. She hopes in future she will live a better life and hopes to see her children live in opulence.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Maritza Monserrate

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Luz De América.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Maritza, tiene 44 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tuvo cuatro hijos pero uno de ellos falleció hace varios años, tiene tres de 18, 16 y 15 años los mismos que estudian en colegio. El marido es ebanista.
 
Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo. Además de productos de Esika (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días en sus ratos libres, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Sus productos los recibe en su casa y lo que es ropa compra en una distribuidora. Nos cuenta que con el crédito anterior empezó con este tipo de ventas ya que antes se dedicaba a la venta de artículos para el hogar.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa de todo tipo. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 5 años  y le gusta porque los créditos son fáciles de hacer. 

Su sueño es tener una boutique.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for some years as the of the royal tamarinds, the members of the Luz De América [Light of America] community bank meet every two weeks. 

Here we meet Maritza. She is 44 years old and in a common law marriage, which has produced four children, one of whom died several years ago. Her other children are aged 18, 19 and 15 years old. They are high school students. Her husband is a furniture maker.    
 
She is a housewife who sells clothing via catalogue to be able to have her own resources. She also sells Esika products (beauty products such as cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories). She works every day in her free time, selling her products on credit, collecting every week. She receives the beauty products at her house and buys the clothing from a distributor. She tells us that with the previous loan she started doing these sales, since before she sold household items.

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and all types of clothing. She has been in the community bank for 5 years and she likes it because it is easy to take out the loans.   

Her dream is to have a boutique.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: Rosa Verónica

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Divino Niño se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Rosa, tiene 25 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 9 y 2 años de edad, el mayor estudia en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella es una muy buena madre y ama de casa que para ayudar de alguna forma a su esposo con los gastos del hogar realiza el crédito para que él invierta en su negocio. Su  marido se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo en forma ambulante y también a través de pedidos. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00, nos cuenta nuestra amiga que él a veces se va a otros cantones con su mercadería ya que tiene varios clientes. Compra sus productos en Santo Domingo y también en Portoviejo en una distribuidora. Nos cuenta que su esposo lleva más de 10 años que se dedica a  esta actividad.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas, y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres ciclos, es la fiscal de pagos  y le gusta los créditos ya que estos son muy importantes para el negocio del marido.
 
Su sueño es tener una casa bien construida.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Divino Niño" meets every two weeks in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo.  It is a place known for its busy commercial activity, the San Pedro and San Pablo festivities, and the cheerfulness of its people.

Here we meet Mrs. Rosa, age 25, who is married and has two children, 9 and 2 years old,  the eldest of which is in school.  Her husband is a merchant.

She is a very good mother and homemaker who tries to help her husband with the household expenses by taking out the loan for him to invest in his business.  He sells all kinds of clothing by taking orders on a door-to-door basis.  His work day is from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., according to our friend, and sometimes he takes his merchandise to other cantons where he has several customers.  He buys his products in Santo Domingo and Portoviejo at a distribution company.  Rosa's husband has been in this business for over 10 years.

This loan will be used to buy merchandise such as trousers, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing.  Rosa has been in the communal bank for three terms and is the payment supervisor.  She believes the loans are very important for her husband's business.

Her dream is to build her own house someday.

loans.use: To buy trousers, t-shirts, blouses and children's clothing.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es: María Isabel de treinta y seis años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus hijos en casa propia. Ella tiene una tortillería y  una venta de gas propano en el lugar donde reside; María es una mujer muy activa y muy dedicada a su trabajo, para ella  su motivación y ganas de salir adelante es lo que va a determinar su destino por eso se esfuerza cada día por servir al cliente como se lo merece. María vende las mejores tortillas del lugar a muy buen precio y últimamente ha tenido más clientela, es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz y gas propano, de esta forma María no decepcionara a sus clientes y tendrá seguridad económica en su hogar para una mejor vida en su familia
texts.en: María Isabel is 36 years old, and lives with her partner and children in their own house. She has a tortilla store and sells propane gas in her home. María is a very active woman and is dedicated to her work. Her motivation and desire to go forward is going to determine her destiny because she works everyday to serve her clients like they deserve. María sells the best tortillas in the area at a very good price, and has earned more clients. Because of this, she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will permit her to buy corn and propane gas. In this way, María won’t disappoint her client and will have financial security and a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy corn and propane gas

loans.name: Limpopo Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 64-year-old Christine (holding the yellow folder) from Masvingo. She is married with no children.  Christine runs a retail business selling clothing and is also a preschool teacher. The business has been in operation for five years. She says the main challenges her business faces are competition and defaults from debtors. 

Christine has requested a loan of $300 to increase her stock of clothes such as t-shirts, blouses and warm clothing for the winter. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the general welfare of her family. In the future Christine plans to operate an outlet.

loans.use: to increase her stock of clothes such as t-shirts, blouses and warm clothing for the winter

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 33 years old, married, and has one child. She has been running a clothes-trading business for 3 months. Rose intends to use her loan to purchase more clothes that will be sold to customers. 

Rose hopes to open a larger apparel shop in the future. In doing so, she hopes to employ 2 to 3 more employees.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes that will be sold to customers

loans.name: Feleciana

texts.en: Feleciana is married with no children. Feleciana is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. Feleciana is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. She has requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to purchase more pigs to sell. Feleciana has been a member of PMPC for five years.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en: Jacob is 37 years old. He is a determined and focused businessman. He is married and blessed with four children aged 12, 8, 6 and 4. To make ends meet for the last 12 years, he has been repairing automobiles in his shop where he has employed 7 employess. His dream is to one day open up a company dealing with automobiles. He is requesting a loan of 20000 Kenya shillings to buy needed auto repair equipment. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for empowering him financially.

loans.use: to buy needed auto repair equipment

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 55 years old and has seven children. Four of them are attending school, and the others have settled into marriage and live separately from him. Martin still works hard to sustain his family through farming. He has worked as a farmer for the past 30 years and is determined to do the best to improve his yield with every harvest. He earns an average income of 30,000 PHP during each harvest season, usually between April and November of each year. 

Martin is requesting a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer for his farming production. With the help of this loan, he hopes to grow his farming operations and continue to support the complete education of his children.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: El sr. Pedro vive en la zona del plan 3000 en su casa propia es casado y tiene cuatro hijos que asisten a  la escuela, el y su esposa se dedican a la venta de comida, su venta esta en la parada de la línea de micros de la zona,  El crédito que esta solicitando es para comprar otro frízer ya que el que tiene no le abastece ya que también vende refrescos y soda. Venden desayuno y almuerzo, cuentan con el apoyo de una de sus hijas. El sr. Pedro es una persona responsable, trabajadora se sacrifica mucho  para darles una buena educación a sus hijos, su deseo del Sr. Pedro es el ver a sus hijos profesionales.
texts.en:
Pedro lives in his own house in the Plan 3000 zone.  He is married and has four children who go to school.  

He and his wife sell food.  Their place is located at the bus stop for the line of micro busses in the zone. 

The loan he is requesting is to buy another freezer.  The one he has does not suffice because he also sells refreshments and soda.  They sell breakfast and lunch, and one of their daughters helps them.

Pedro is a responsible and hard-working man who sacrifices a lot to give his children a good education.

Pedro’s dream is to see his children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Sat

texts.en:
Mr. Sat, 57, is a married man and has five children who live under his income. He now intends to use the loan to buy feed concentrate to fatten up pigs. He has several pigs in his possession and he intends to feed them concentrate to fatten them up more quickly. He wants his animals to reach ideal weight so he can sell them in the local and nearby markets. He would like to earn higher profits for his family and his parents’ well-being and to grow with this pig raising project. 

This is the sixth cycle that Mr. Sat is borrowing from HKL and the fourth cycle of his loan with Kiva partner. He’s had no previous loans in state banks or other institutes but he is only borrowing from Hattha Kaksekar limited which offered the best terms and a much lower interest rate. So, he would like to requests some funds in order to purchase pig feed.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed.

loans.name: Kanha

texts.en:
Kanha is a rice farmer and her husband has full-time employment in Phnom Penh. They live in a village about 17 kilometers south of Phnom Penh City. They have two sons and one daughter. Two are in school and one is still young.

Kanha hopes to supplement their income with a new business raising chickens, so she is asking for another loan of $1,000 to buy baby chickens to raise. She will also use a part of the loan to build a kitchen where she cooks.

Kanha and her husband are pictured.

loans.use: To buy chickens to raise and to build a kitchen

loans.name: Mark Kristoffer

texts.en:
Mark Kristoffer is now 26 years old and married but has no children yet. He already earned a degree but, due to a lack of job opportunities, he is engaged in a hog-raising business to generate income. He has been in this business for almost 4 years and usually earns a net income of 8,000 PHP a month which he uses to satisfy their basic necessities. 

He aimed to improve this business by raising more pigs but, due to inadequate capital, he is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy piglets, feed, vaccines and vitamins for his hog-raising business. He believes that, through this loan, he will be able to acquire additional piglets to raise. He mentioned that, through patience and strong determination, he will improve the business and make it a viable source of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feeds, vaccines and vitamins for hog raising

loans.name: Rossel

texts.en:
Rossel is 31 years-old. She is married with five children. 

Rossel has a food shop or carenderia that sells snacks and viands like chicken and pork adobo, and pancit bihon. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of PHP 16,000 in order to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks and viands.

Rossel has been a member of  Kiva partner HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rossel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks and viands.

loans.name: Amistad Group

texts.es:
La Sr. MARTHA, de 43 años de edad casada, tiene 1 hijo menor de edad  de 8 años  en etapa escolar, mujer luchadora  por salir adelante  frente a los obstáculos  que se les presenta en  la vida, socia de la alcancía comunal “Amistad”, se le renovó el préstamo ya que  en el ciclo anterior demostró puntualidad y responsabilidad en  sus pagos.
Ella se dedica en la actualidad a la confección bordados de fustanes  de vestimentas  típicas de la región. El Préstamo solicitó  para la  compra de materiales como hilos, telas, etc. En el futuro desea exportar los  fustanes al exterior del  país donde,  así  incrementar más sus ingresos y poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida  a su familia.
La clienta está ubicada  parte superior de la fotografía vestida con ropa color celeste.
texts.en:
Martha is 43 year old.  She is married and has an 8 year old child who attends school. She is a woman who struggles to get ahead in the face of life’s obstacles.  She is a member of the Amistad Communal Bank.  She is renewing her loan as she demonstrated punctuality and responsibility in her last loan cycle.

Currently, she embroiders petticoats for the traditional clothing worn in the  region.  She is requesting the loan to purchase thread, fabric, and other materials.  In the future, she wishes to export the petticoats out of the country. This will enable her to increase her income and provide a better quality of life for her family.

The client is located in the upper part of the photograph, dressed in sky blue clothing.

loans.use: purchase thread and fabric for the embroidery of petticaots.

loans.name: Rachael Kalunda

texts.en: Rachael is a widowed woman. She has six children with ages ranging from 25 years to 35 years old. She describes herself as quiet. She operates a retail store where she sells general items like sugar, flour, cooking oil etc. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a shopping centre. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add to her stock of general items. Her business goal is to grow into wholesale within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a supplier of groceries in the area.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking oil, flour, beverages and detergents

loans.name: Mercedita Group

texts.en:
Mercedita is 50 years old and lives in Del Pilar, Baliangao. She is married and has three children. 

To earn a living, Mercedita has a business selling grocery items. She earns about 3200 Philippine Pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. Mercedita's group has requested a loan of 14,500 PHP; she will use her portion to purchase more stock for her general store. 

Mercedita has been a member of PMPC for seven years. 

Mercedita is the leader of a two person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks for her general store

loans.name: 030704-Đông Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Phượng works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise to sell in the future.

Phượng is 40 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the leader of a 3-member group, the 030704-Đông Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents.

In 2010, Phượng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Phượng has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Phượng has been involved in this business for 5 years. The main harship that Phượng faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Phượng hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy a new motobike.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Sleiman

texts.en:
Sleiman is a 45-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two school-age children. He’s working really hard to be able to cover his family needs as he is their main source of income.

Sleiman decided to start his own business in 1993, so he opened a bakery shop in his town where he’s well known for his delicious food and good atmosphere.

Today he’s asking to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to expand and renovate his bakery in order to attract more customers and earn more money. In the future, he plans to open a small playground for kids.

loans.use: to expand and renovate his bakery.

loans.name: Theoun

texts.en:
Theoun, 59, is widowed and resides with two children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia. She is a masseuse. Her daughter is employed as a garment worker. Her son is a chef and motor taxi driver.  

Theoun requests a loan of 600 USD to buy a new motorbike for her son to use as a motor taxi. In the future, she would like to expand her business and refurbish her house.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike for her son to use to provide taxi services.

loans.name: Juhudi Group

texts.en:
Macho, is in his late thirties, is married and has five children. He has been selling eggs and poultry for seven years now. He works from 6am to 6pm and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Macho’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to increase the number of chickens in his poultry business and has paid back his loan successfully. He hopes for a loan to buy chicks. Macho’s dream is to one day be an international businessman.

Macho will share this loan with his loan group, "Juhudi," which has a total of 16 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more chicks

loans.name: Malek

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 22 years old, single, and lives with five family members.

Malek is a blacksmith; in 2003 he opened his own workshop. He produces gates, grilles, railings, light fixtures, furniture, sculptures, tools, agricultural implements, decorative and religious items, cooking utensils, and weapons. He has sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation. He is well-known in the surrounding areas.

He decided to apply for a $3000 loan in order to expand his workshop and to add more inventory. He aims to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to expand his workshop and to add more inventory.

loans.name: Hillary

texts.en:
Hillary is 21 years old, single, and has two dependents. He has been selling second-hand clothes for the last two years with an average monthly income from the business of KES 9,000.

He is borrowing his first loan with KADET Ltd of KES 20,000, which he plans to use to purchase bales of second-hand clothes. With the anticipated profits he will open another branch.

His hopes and dreams are to become a successful businessman and a responsible parent and also to be useful in his county (administrative unit for local government) economic-wise.

loans.use: to purchase bales of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Filipenses 4:13 Group

texts.en:
Jeannette is the coordinator of her group, which is called Filipenses 4:13 (Philippians).  The group is made up of five women who run their own businesses in the town of Puerto Plata, a tourist center in the north of the country.  She makes her home here in a simple structure with her two children and her long term partner. 

Jeannette runs a little cafeteria, where she sells "empanadas and pastelitos", both are dough made of flour and filled with meat or vegetables, then fried to be sold as a snack.   Empanada are made in the shape of a half moon and pastelitos are round.  She will use this loan to buy goods like flour, cooking oil, meat, butter, eggs and vegetables. 

This is Jeannete’s first loan with Esperanza International.  She has been running her business for the past two years, when she started making pastelitos and selling them from her house to all her neighbors and around the school.  Now she has a cafeteria, and she sells other products.  She is planning to reinvest her business profits.

Her most difficult challenge is to give credit to her clients. Jeannette dreams to have a prosperous and successful business.  Thank you for lending to Jeannette and the Mujeres con Propositos group!

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, meat, butter, eggs and vegetables.

loans.name: Pélagie

texts.fr: Âgée de 31 ans, Pélagie vit au Bénin et n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Pélagie est mariée à un certain Madjidi. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Pélagie vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges du ménage. Pélagie vend des savons, des plats, des pâtes alimentaires et du lait par la méthode de distribution depuis quatre ans ; ce qui lui permet de contribuer à l'éducation et à l'entretien des enfants. Pélagie s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. La clientèle de Pélagie devient de plus en plus grandissante. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Pélagie sollicite une troisième fois l’appui financier de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des savons, des plats, des pâtes alimentaires et du lait.

loans.name: Abdullahi

texts.en:
Mohammadu is maize farmer from Baure village. As a member of Babban Gona, Mohammadu is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Mohammadu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet his immediate cash needs for things such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Mohammadu can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Mohammadu is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.en:
Mr Francisco is the owner of a printing business, and his experience is in the area of 30 years \\\"A lifetime,\\\"says Mr Rodriquez.

He principally prints advertisement copies, business cards, calendars and at this time of year, Christmas cards. His business enables him to support his wife and 3 children. But he his currently faced with a difficult situation. One of his machines is broken and he cannot afford to stop production at this time. Because of this, he needs a loan for $2,000 dollars in order to buy another offset printer. This wil allow him to not delay his orders, to make higher earnings, and to maintain happy clients. But above all, to support his family.

Loan Use:To purchase another offset printer.

El Sr. Francisco es dueño de una imprenta su experiencia en esta área es de 30 años “Toda una vida” comenta el Sr. R.. Principalmente realiza impresiones publicitarias, tarjetas de presentación, calendarios y en esta época lo mas usual las tarjetas navideñas Esta fuente de trabajo le a proporcionado mantener a su esposa y 3 hijos El Esta pasando por una situación difícil. Una de sus maquinas se averió y no podrá sacar su producción en esta temporada. Por lo cual el necesita un préstamo de 2,000 dlls. Para comprar otra máquina impresora offset. Esto le permitirá no quedar mal con sus pedidos, obtener mejores ingresos y tener a sus clientes contentos. Pero sobre todo mantener a su familia.

loans.use: Para comprar otra máquina impresora offset

loans.name: Aluoch

texts.en: G. Aluoch is 40 year-old entrepreneur who lives with her husband and six children in Rongo, Kenya. She has also trained as a community health worker to provide home-based care to people living with HIV/AIDS in her area. G., called mama mdogo by her co-wives children, runs a fish selling business at a market in Rongo town. She is the sole income earner in her household and depends on her business to feed and clothe her children and pay their school fees. Her hard work, determination, and excellent people skills have led to her success.  She manages her stall during the day and provides home based care services to people living with HIV/AIDS in the evenings.  Her profits pay the household expenses as well as secondary school fees for three of her children.  G. plans to use the funds from her  loan of Kshs 40,000 (approximately US $575) to incorporate the sale of cereal into her business.

loans.use: To increase stock for dry fish and other basic commodities

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Monica will use the money to diversify and expand her business.

loans.name: David

texts.es:
Business Description

David has helped serving his mother’s business since he was quite young. From his father he learned the baker’s occupation. He got married one year ago and along with his wife managed to establish his own bakery. His sister helped him with merchandise. Little by little and being responsible he has managed to obtain loans so his business is the source to support his family. David has a shop and a bakery where he has put into practice the knowledge that his parents taught him. He works every day from 5:30 a.m. to 9:30 p.m. His wife helps him serving the clients. He also sells gas cylinders for domestic use.

Loan Use

The credit will be use to buy merchandise in order to have other products that have a lot of demand. He will refit his premises to provide a better service.

Personal information

David is 23 years old. Currently he has no children. His wife besides helping him in the business, she sells cosmetics. His wish is to be able to buy the small house where they live now and have the shop. The house belongs to his sister and she will allow them to pay her in installments to be able to buy it. He hopes that with the loan he will be able to fulfill his dream.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

David desde muy joven le ayudaba a su mama en la atención del negocio. Con su papa aprendió el oficio de elaborar panes. Hace un año se caso y junto a su esposa logro montar su propio local. Su hermana le ayudo con mercadería. El poco a poco siendo responsable ha logrado obtener créditos con los que su negocio ha podido mantenerlo. Tiene una tienda y panadería donde ha puesto en práctica sus conocimientos. Gracias a la ayuda de sus padres que le enseñaron. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 5:30 a.m. hasta las 9:30 p.m. Su esposa le ayuda en la atención del local. También tiene venta de cilindros de gas de uso domésticos.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de mercadería para surtir su local. Además exhibir otros productos que tiene demanda. Adecua un poco su local para dar mejor servicio.

Información Personal

David tiene 23 años. Al momento no tiene hijos. Su esposa a más de ayudarle en el local se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. Su deseo es poder comprar la casita donde viven y tienen el local. La casa es de su hermana y ella les va ha dar facilidad para poder obtenerla. Espera con la inversión que realizara poder cumplir su sueño.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela tailors blouses, purses, serviettes, and table cloths which she knits and sells in the city of San Cristobal, Chiapas to the people who already have an established store selling handcrafts.

She is 34 years old, has 7 children and belongs to group "Espinola 4" together with Doña María Díaz Díaz (artisan) and doña Petrona Hernández Díaz (breeding of sheep and chicken). With the loan, Manuela and María will buy string and fabrics for their handicrafts and Doña Petrona will invest purchasing animals to breed.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


MANUELA, se dedica a la confección de blusas , monederos , servilletas , manteles los cuales borda y vende en la ciudad de San Cristóbal a las personas que ya tienen locales establecidos de artesanías...Ella tiene 34 años, siete hijos y pertenece al grupo Espina 4 junto con doña María Díaz Díaz (artesana) y doña Petrona Hernández Díaz (crianza de borregos y gallinas).Con el préstamo Manuela y María compraran hilos y telas para sus artesanías y doña Petrona invertirá comprando animales para su crianza.

loans.use: Artisan

loans.name: Niminou

texts.fr:
Mr. O. Niminou is a traditional furnace maker in Gbadago.  He was born in Lome on June 3rd 1979.  He is married and has one child and has primary education.  His wife runs a small business of materials (cloth), but it is hard to meet all the demands of the family.  Having a good sense of entrepreneurship, he has decided to open his own business and needs a credit of $400 to get the stock for his trade.  This money will allow him to improve his family situation and ensure that his child can go to school. 

Fabriquant de fourneaux traditionnels à Gbadago, Mr O. Niminou est né à Lomé le 03 juin 1979. Marié et père d’un (01) enfant, il a vite quitté les bancs après ses études primaires. Sa femme exerce le petit commerce de tissus pagne mais difficilement il arrive  à répondre aux besoins familiaux. Ayant un bon esprit d’entreprise et de gestion, il s’efforce à rentabiliser un crédit de 400$ pouvant lui permettre de faire  le stock de tôles qui est son premier outil de travail . Cet argent lui procurera un revenu lui permettant d’améliorer le bien-être de la famille et assurer la scolarisation de ses enfants.

loans.use: Purchase work material

loans.name: Latifat

texts.en: Latifat O. is 25 years old, married with 2 children. She hails from Mushin in Lagos State, Nigeria. Latifat sells provisions and has been in business since 2002. She needs the loan to buy more provision for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sale

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es:
Jenny Luz, aged 36, belongs to the Community Bank ‘Women progressing towards the future’ in the settlement of La Fortaleza. She is mother of five children who study in a modest educational centre in their town. Her husband Germán helps her in all her decisions and both are determined to provide their children with a good education so that they can become professionals.

Jenny has a small grocery store and she is dedicated to the sale of groceries and other essential items. She wishes to expand and improve the business’s facilities. Jenny Luz dedicates herself to this activity in order to help her husband with the maintenance of their home and the full satisfaction of their children’s needs. With your help, this hard-working mother will be able to realise her goal in a short time.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Jenny Luz de 36 años de edad, pertenece al Banco comunal “Mujeres rumbo al futuro” del asentamiento humano la Fortaleza, es madre de cinco hijos los cuales estudian en un modesto centro educativo de su ciudad, su esposo, Germán, lo apoya en todo lo que decide y ambos se han propuesto brindar a sus hijos una buena educación para que lleguen a ser profesionales.

Ella tiene una pequeña bodega y se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad, tiene el propósito de acrecentar y mejorar las instalaciones de su negocio, Jenny Luz se dedica a esta actividad para apoyar a su esposo con la manutención de su hogar y la plana satisfacción de las necesidades de sus hijos. Con tu ayuda esta trabajadora madre logrará su propósito en corto tiempo.

loans.use: Expansion/Renovation of her business

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 39 year old Neema K.. She is married with three children, aged 18, 22 and 12. In 2006, Neema established a phone credit business and now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional phone vouchers. She thanks you for your support.

Mobile phones have become the most common form of phone communication, as a result of numerous factors including the limited availability of landlines and the relative low cost of mobile phones. Not only professionals, but also grandmas in villages, school kids, and street sellers carry mobile phones.

loans.use: To purchase additional phone vouchers in bulk.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: Fatmata is 35 years old and married with 3 children.  Although her husband is employed, his salary is insufficient to meet the family’s expenses.  With four loans from SMT, Fatmata was able to increase her stock of palm and nut oil.  She is now requesting a loan of $700 to purchase 120 gallons of palm and nut oil.  She would like to sell them on wholesale.

loans.use: Fatmata has a goal of selling her oil on wholesale.   Her loan from SMT would start her on the path to achieving that goal.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty, who belongs to the community bank, Señor de los Milagros de Chiquian, works in cheese sales in the Chiquian district, Bolognesi province, in the area of Ancash. She also sells at the Huaraz market and works in housekeeping.

With this loan of S/.1,800.00 ($675), she will be able to take care of six dues, and buy 180 cheese molds to sell to clients in Huaraz.

She is 40 years old, is married, and has 6 children. Her husband works in livestock farming and is a musician. The two of them work to support the education of their children.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Betty, pertenece al Banco Comunal Señor de los Milagros de Chiquian, se dedica ala venta de quesos, en el distrito de Chiquian, provincia de Bolognesi departamento de Ancash. También vende en el mercado de Huaraz y atiende pedidos a domicilio.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,800.00, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará 180 moldes de queso, para venderlos en Huaraz a sus clientes.

Ella tiene 40 años de edad, es casada, tiene 6 hijos, su esposo se dedica a la ganadería y es músico, ambos trabajan para educar a sus hijos.

loans.use: Cheese molds to sell

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina, age 29, is married with 3 children (ages 15, 10, and 4). She sells used clothing, a business she started in 2002. She works from 6 A.M. to 10 P.M. daily and makes a monthly profit of about $45.

Christina hopes for a loan to purchase more clothing to sell. She is a member of the Umoja Ni Nguyu loan group whose members guarantee one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing to sell

loans.name: Emilia Jonas

texts.en:
Emilia is 36 years old and originally from Incassane in Catembe, a fishing village that is a 10-minute ferry boat ride away from the capital city of Maputo. Emilia is married and has two children: a 14-year-old daughter, and a 12-year-old boy, both of whom are in 7th grade.

Emilia grew up with her parents and when she was 11 years old she moved to Chamanculo, where she studied when she was not working at home. Her formal education ended at 6th grade.

Emilia lived a few years in South Africa, where her husband still lives. She decided to start selling products acquired there to her compatriots in Mozambique. Emilia sells curtains and clothes to her neighbors and has been quite successful. Curtains are the most successful product and are sold for amounts between MTn 250 and MTn 2,500, depending on the size and quality. Emilia is currently earning about MTn 5,000 per month and has a profit of up to MTn 1,000. Her husband sends her a monthly 2,000 Rands (approximately MTn 6,000) to help with the household expenses.

Emilia has received three previous loans from Hluvuku. The first two were used to start new a business, but the results were not satisfactory. Emilia decided to use the third loan to help speed up the construction of her house. She built a ditch at her house and improved the quality of sanitation of her family. With this fourth loan of MTn 15,000, Emilia plans on buying cement, sand, windows and doors to keep building her house.

In the future Emilia would like to be able to pay for her children’s schooling and see them graduate from university.

loans.use: Buy construction material

loans.name: Thi So

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thi So (ID number: 070044), is 46 years old. She would like to borrow 2,006,000 VND (125 USD) to purchase seeds and fertiliser for farming. She has 3 school-going children. Her husband is a manual worker moving wood blocks to earn a stable income for their family. Her family's average income is 80,000 VND (about 5 USD). Mrs. So has never borrowed from any other Fund. She likes to join this Fund because the procedure is simple.

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Nguyễn Thị Sổ (MS: 070044), năm nay 46 tuổi. vay 2.006.000 VND về mua lân đạm, giống phục vụ nông nghiệp. Cô có 3 con còn đang đi học. Chồng cô đi bốc vác gỗ giúp cho gia đình có thu nhập thường xuyên. Mức thu nhập của gia đình là 80.000 VND. Gia đình cô chưa vay vốn ở đâu. Cô thích tham gia vì thủ tục đơn giản.

loans.use: Farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase goods to restock a small grocery store

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en:
Bridget is married and has eight children, four of whom are under 15 years of age. The recent death of her father has made life very difficult and sad for her. But Bridget saw GHAPE as a source of hope, and quickly enrolled to become a member. Since that time she has received and repaid five loans, and has been able to feed her family, pay her children's school fees and clothe them. 

If Brigit receives a new loan, she will use it to rent a palm tree plantation and produce palm oil as well as buy and raise fowl for sale. She has promised to start repayment on the fourth month after disbursement, and will to use the profit generated by the loan to pay school fees and expand her business. 

Brigit is a big fan of loans from GHAPE because of the training it offers and its good repayment terms.

loans.use: To rent a palm tree plantation for oil production and to buy chickens to raise and sell.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es:
La señora Herminia Espínola de Aguero, es casada, el cónyuge tomo la decisión de viajar al exterior (España) por razones económicas, y gracias a esto la Sra. cuenta con otro ingreso pues el envía dinero mensualmente desde el exterior.

Los mismos tienen dos hijos, quienes son menores de edad. Herminia posee un copetín, la misma esta muy bien ubicada en una zona altamente comercial. Se inició con un capital de apenas Gs. 500.000. (alrededor de 110 dólares), que fue ampliando con el correr de los años, pues actualmente cuenta con una amplia cartera de clientes.

La señora retira el préstamo para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de comestibles, como: empanadas, chipa guazu, milanesas, otros.

Una de sus aspiraciones es poder este negocio, en lo que se refiere al equipamiento o mobiliario para poder ofrecer un ambiente más cómodo y ameno a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Herminia E. de Augero is married. Her husband took the decision to travel abroad (Spain) due to financial reasons, and thanks to this, Mrs. Herminia has an extra income since he sends money on a monthly basis from abroad.

They have two children, who are both minors. Herminia owns a drink stand. It is well located in a busy commercial zone. She started with a budget of just $110 USD and has been expanding as the years pass by. Today she has ample amounts of customers.

Mrs. Herminia would like this loan to purchase materials necessary to make edible items such as empanadas, chipa guazu, milanesas, and others.

One of her aspirations is to equip her business with furniture to create a more comfortable environment that is inviting to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase edible products such as meat, flour, vegetables and others.

loans.name: Saida

texts.en:
Saida, a 44-year-old mother of two children aged 14 and 18, has been selling food and drinks in Zanzibar since 2002. Her most popular items are juice, maize, and maandazi, which are small snacks composed of fried, semi-sweet dough, similar to plain donuts. She currently works in her shop from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. everyday, earning a monthly profit of approximately $45.
