Saida is now requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can purchase more ingredients to increase her maandazi output as well as additional stocks of juices and maize.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for the maandazi that she cooks and sells.

loans.name: Saidali

texts.ru: Бобиев Сайдали проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст 34 года. Женат , но детей не имеет. Имеет свой магазин , по продаже продуктов питания. Этим бизнесом занимается уже 15 лет. Хочет развернуть свой бизнес , путем вливания дополнительных финансовых средств. Это возможно только при получении кредита. Получив кредит завезет новый ассортимент товара. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Saidali B. lives in the Khuroson regions. He is 34 years old, is married, but does not have children. Saidali owns a food store. He has been in this business for 15 years. He would like to expand his business by investing additional financial resources. This is only possible if he takes out a loan. After taking out a loan Saidali will purchase new products for sale. He can pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is a 29-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their child. He has been working as a tailor for five years. Mohamed sews all kind of clothes and fabrics. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase new sewing machines.

Mohamed is special in his work because of his good reputation. When he first started his business, he wasn’t able to rent sewing machines in order to work. He decided to start his own business because he has enough experience and also his willingness to continue. In the future, he plans to own a sewing factory.

This is the first time that Mohamed has requested a loan.

loans.use: Mohamed needs the loan to purchase new sewing machines.

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en: Sarah B. is the leader of Kisimba group in Lugazi. She is a business woman with a bar and a restaurant that she has been managing from her home for a long time. In all her businesses, she employs 2 people that help her out and so far, business is not bad; and as a result, she has been able to buy her self a plot of land, build a house, buy house hold items as well as pay school fees for her children each term. Sarah needs another loan to help with buying necessary food and supplies for her restaurant and wines, beer, and local brews for her bar.

loans.use: Buying food supplies like matooke, rice, beans, cassava and more for her restaurant plus buying wines, beers and local brew for her bar.

loans.name: Josehina

texts.en:
Josephina T. runs a café and sells traditional clothing at Mbagala ward in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. She purchases the traditional clothes (vitenge and kanga) at the Mnazi Mmoja shopping center and sells them to customers at Mbagala.

Her business plan is to run a whole shop of traditional clothes. She requests a loan of $625 (800,000 TZS) to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.use: Purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Semetiya Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe SEMETIYA sont toutes mariées et ont une moyenne d’âge de 26 ans et  4 enfants. Elles vivent en majorité dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, frères, sœurs et époux. Ces femmes résident dans le village de WEREKELA, sous préfecture de Fana relevant de la préfecture de DIOÏLA région de Koulikoro république du Mali. Par des relations commerciales, elles se sont connues et font essentiellement l’achat vente de condiments alimentaires. 
Pour mieux développer leur activité elles ont intégré  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur sixième prêt de groupe. Les précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles comptent utiliser le prêt pour acheter,   600 kg de feuilles de baobab séchées, 150 kg d’oignon et 80 kg d’aubergines. Elles s’approvisionnent  auprès des maraîchers de WEREKELA et environs et revendre sur le marché de FANA en détail et au comptant à une clientèle composée de femmes.
Elles espèrent  réaliser un bénéfice de 10 000 FCFA  chacune à la fin du cycle qui sera utilisé dans la prise en charge des frais scolaires des enfants.
texts.en:
The ten women of the SEMETIYA group are all married and on average 26 years old with 4 children. Most of them live in traditional extended families with their children, brothers, sisters, and husbands. These women live in the village of Werekela, Fana sub-prefecture, Dioila prefecture, in the region of Koulikoro in the Republic of Mali. Through their businesses, these women met each other, and are all engaged to a large extent in the buying and selling of condiments. To better develop their business, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, and are currently seeking their sixth group loan. All their previous loans were repaid without problems. They plan to use this loan to buy 600 kg of dried baobab leaves, 150 kg of onions and 80 kg of eggplants. They supply themselves from the market gardeners in Werekela and the surrounding area, and sell their goods at the market in Fana at retail and in cash to a clientele composed of women. They hope to realize a profit of 10,000 FCFA each at the end of the loan cycle, which will be used to take care of and pay for the education of their children.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments

loans.name: Nuevo Milenio Group

texts.es: El grupo "Nuevo Milenio" esta representado por el señor Walter Santos y conformado por 12 miembros D. los cuales su principal actividad es el comercio D. productos como accesorios D. celular, material D. escritorio, cosméticos, abarrotes, dulces y al servicio público D. pasajeros. Este grupo sabe que existe L. competencia pero no le da importancia ya que saben como trabajar con sus productos. El destino del crédito es para L. ampliación D. sus negocios y a L. compra D. insumos y materiales que mejoren L. calida D. sus productos para incrementar sus ingresos y mejora más aun L. calida D. vida D. sus familias. Los socios(as) Van cursando su tercer ciclo dentro D. L. institución por lo que tienen experiencia en grupos solidarios y saben como cumplir con sus obligaciones con responsabilidad, honestidad y muchas ganas D. salir adelante
texts.en:
The group 'Nuevo Milenio' is represented by Walter Santos and is comprised of 12 members, for whom the principal activity is the sale of products such as mobile phone accessories, stationery, cosmetics, groceries, sweets, and transport tickets. This group knows that competition exists, but this doesn't worry them as they now know how to work with their products. This loan is destined to increase their businesses and buy items of necessity and materials that improve the quality of their products, to increase their earnings and further improve the quality of life of their families. The members are in their third season in the institution, which is why they have experience as a supportive group and know how to meet their obligations with responsibility, honesty and a lot of enthusiasm to move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for operations

loans.name: Maria Otilia

texts.es: la sra. Maria S. de 65 años de edad, viuda, ella se dedica al lavado de ropa en diferentes casas desde hace 3 años, de esta actividad se sostiene, lo hace 3 veces por semana y cobra $8.00 por dia, asi mismo recibe una pension del Instituto Hodureño de Seguridad Social por la muerte de su esposo de $16.00 mensuales, la cliente necesita un credito para hacerle una mejora a su casa, cambiar tres puertas, repellar una pared y cambiar dos cajas de aguas negras que estan derramando agua, ella es una persona responsable y sociable, es muy querida por sus vecinas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria S. is a 65 year old widow. She has been washing clothes in houses for the past 3 years. She does this 3 times a week, charging $8.00 per day, to support herself. She receives a $16.00 monthly Social Security pension from the Instituto Hodureño for the death of her husband. She needs a loan to make home improvements, change three doors, repair the walls, and change two sewer connections that are leaking water. She is a responsible and friendly person who is much loved by her neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy cement, sand, lime, water, stones, bricks

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria es socia del Bancomunal  La Fortaleza.
Gloria  es casada tiene 58 años, cinco hijos mayores que están casados.
Gloria era ambulante en el mercado vendía medias en una carreta, lo dejo por que le salio una hernia, y tuvo que dejar de trabajar, por un tiempo, hasta que decidió trabajar en su casa, puso una bodega  se llama Bodega Gloria, ya tiene dos años.
Gloria necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para invertidos en la compra de gaseosas, cervezas, leche, saco de azúcar.  
Desde que esta en Finca ella invierte el todo el préstamo en mercadería, ha aprendido a invertir, le gusta la unión  que hay entre las socias y la solidaridad en el Bancomunal.   
El sueño de Gloria  es estar tranquila en su casa, y dedicarse a su bodeguita.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the La Fortaleza community bank. She is married, 58 years old, and has five married children. Gloria used to be a street vendor, selling stockings from a cart in the market, but she had to stop working for a time when she suffered a slipped disk. Later, she decided to work at home, setting up a small grocery called Bodega Gloria which she has operated for two years. Gloria needs a 1000-soles loan to buy cold drinks, beer, milk and bags of sugar. Since starting at Finca, she's learned how to invest and she now invests all her borrowings in merchandise for the business. She likes the camaraderie of the group and the sense of solidarity that the community bank provides. Gloria's greatest hope is to be happy both at home and at her bodeguita.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
L. Nguyễn Thị owns and operates a business raising livestock, mainly cattle, for sale. She is a 41-year-old woman living in the town of Nghi Lộc.  She is married and has three school-age children.  L. has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month.
In 2004, L. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living conditions and ability to engage in business activities.  L. has successfully repaid a previous L. of 7,000,000 VND from TYM Fund.  This previous L. was used to purchase livestock.  L. is now requesting a L. of 10,000,000 VND to purchase breeding livestock.  This will be her fifth L. from TYM Fund.  L. plans to use the revenue to expand her business.
No. 1037061088.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is fifty-four years of age. She is married and has given birth to seven children – three sons and four daughters. She says they are in the senior high, junior high and primary schools. She lives with the children and her husband in a family house in a very busy commercial town called Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana.

Mary’s husband is a farmer while she is a trader. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She trades in ladies’ secondhand clothes such as dresses, underwear, etc. She also sells bed sheets. Mary buys from Kumasi and hawks (sells door-to-door) to sell in her community. She says she also treks to other towns to sell on their market days.

Mary has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure bales of textiles. She is hopeful to expand her business and increase her profit margin. Mary desires to sponsor her children in school to high levels.

loans.use: To buy secondhand clothes in bulk

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: Celia tiene 44 años de edad , ella es soltera, tiene 2 hijos que le ayudan en el negocio que tiene, ellos viven en una vivienda que le han dado como caseros, desde hace varios años, ella tiene un lote propio , en el que todavía no ha construido, ella tiene su puesto propio de venta de frutas y carbón en el mercado de la localidad, tiene 13 años de experiencia en este negocio, hay competencia en la zona pero pese a ello existe bastante demanda, el crédito fue para invertir en su negocio de venta de frutas y yuca, carbón. Ella ya ha obtenido dos créditos anteriores en agrocapital , que lo ha cancelado puntual, actualmente tiene también crédito en otras entidades financieras, pero que se encuentra canceladas con puntualidad.
texts.en:
Celia, 44, is single, and she has two children who help her in her business. They live in a house she was given to take care of years ago. She has her own lot, but she has not yet constructed anything on it. She has her own place for selling fruit and charcoal in the local market. She has 13 years of experience in this business. There is competition in the zone, but there is also sufficient demand. The loan was to invest in her business of selling fruit, yucca, and charcoal. She has had two previous loans with Agrocapital, which she paid punctually. She currently also has loans in other financial entities, but they are repaid with punctuality.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to sell fruit and charcoal

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
La señora Consuelo, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 42 años, 04 hijos que aun dependen de ella.

Se dedica a la Venta de Aguajes y diferentes preparados a base de maní, desde hace muchos años atrás, se inició con un capital de S/. 100.00, hoy en día continúa con el mismo negocio en horas de la mañana y tardes, en un esquina, frente a la Botica “Central” de la Ciudad de Moyobamba, donde hay mucho movimiento y sus ventas le salen a pedir de boca. Nos cuenta que le va muy bien en sus ventas y esta muy  contenta con lo que hace.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará 50 sacos de aguajes (fruta silvestre de esta parte del país). Como complemento también comprara sacos de maní, para preparar sus manís salados, dulces y confitados.

Se siente muy contenta, ya que pese a las dificultades supo salir adelante junto a su familia, por lo que reconoce el gran apoyo que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos le viene brindando a ella y otras mujeres de la región San Martín.
texts.en:
Consuelo belongs to the Community Bank “Mujeres Emprendedoras” in the Moyobabma District, Moyobamba Province, Department of San Martin. She lives with her partner, is 42 years old and has 4 dependent children.

She sells aguajes and different items made from peanuts. Many years ago she started out with 100 soles and now continues the same business in the mornings and the afternoons, on a corner opposite the “Central” pharmacy in the town of Moyobamba where it is very busy and her sales come from word of mouth. She tells us that her sales are very good and that she is very happy in what she does.

With this loan of 3,000 soles she will buy 50 bags of aguajes (a wild fruit from this part of the country). She will also buy bags of peanuts with which to prepare her salted and sweet peanut snacks.

She is very happy that despite her difficulties she has moved forward together with her family and recognises the huge help that the Manuela Ramos Movement has given to her and to other women in the San Martin region.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of aguajes (local wild fruit) and peanuts

loans.name: Marvin Jose

texts.es: El señor Marvin José tiene la edad de 44 años, reside en el barrio Hialeah en la capital de Managua, su negocio es una pequeña pulpería y tiene doce años de administrarla, inicio solo vendiendo golosinas y gaseosa pero con los prestamos que Afodenic a otorgado ha podido ir incrementado sus ventas. Con este préstamo espera comprar granos básicos, lácteos, frutas y verduras para ofrecer a sus cliente una variedad de productos y poder obtener mejores ganancias para lograr solides en su. Negocio. Da las gracias a la institución por el crecimiento que ha logrado.
texts.en:
Sr. Marvin José is 44 years old and lives in the Hialeah neighborhood in the capital of Managua. He has been operating a small grocery store for 12 years. He started selling only candy and sodas, and with the loans from AFODENIC, was able to increase his sales.

With this loan, Sr. Marvin hopes to purchase basic grains, dairy products, fruits and vegetables to offer his customers a variety of products and generate more revenue. He thanks the institution for the growth of his success.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, dairy products, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buying sewing machines

loans.name: Komivi

texts.fr: Cet homme est marié et a 02 enfants à sa charge. Pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, il a décidé en 2007 d’exercer le commerce très rentable du charbon de bois. Beaucoup de gens viennent acheter du charbon chez lui en gros et en détail. Ses charbons sont faits avec des bois de bonne qualité, ce qui fait qu’il a beaucoup de clients. Il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 25 sacs de charbon de bois. Ce prêt lui permettra aussi de couvrir ses frais de transport vers Kpalimé où il s’approvisionne.

loans.use: Achat des sacs de charbon de bois

loans.name: Deisy

texts.es:
Deisy es comerciante de productos de Herba libe, es su fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de sus dos hijos que depende de ella; los menores todavía se encuentran estudiando. Ella es divorciada y no cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo, vive en anticretico ubicado en la Zona Ciudad Satelite de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de mercadería (productos balanceados dietéticos) y así poder vender más y mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Daisy is a salesperson for Herbalife products. This is her source of income to cover the expenses of her two sons who are dependent on her, as they are minor children who are still in school. She is divorced, and does not receive help from her ex-husband. She lives in a leased home located in the Ciudad Satelite area of the City of El Alto. The loan will be used to purchase merchandise (nutritionally balanced diet products) with which she can increase her sales and improve her income. This is her second loan with IMPRO, which has conducted an evaluation that has qualified her for the approval of the requested loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase nutritionally balanced diet products from the firm Herbalife, for which she is an authorized vendor

loans.name: Douglas Ernesto

texts.es: El señor Douglas Ernesto Gutiérrez M., el tiene  45 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos menores de edad. El se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y calzado, los cuales distribuye en su casa de habitación. Douglas dio inicio a su negocio hace 10 años, cabe señalarse que antes de poner el negocio en su casa el viajaba al Río San Juan a distribuir sus productos de forma ambulante, además que allá tenia personas conocidas, a los cuales el les entregaba sus productos para luego regresar a los 15 días que ya habían vendido la mercancía. Pero esto le resultaba muy cansado y poco a poco fue estableciéndose hasta que logro poner el negocio en su casa, que es donde está actualmente establecido. El crédito será invertido en la compra de ropa variada y calzado las cuales piensa distribuir desde su casa de habitación, ya que posee una buena clientela establecida. Su sueño es llegar a establecer otra tienda en el mercado, en el cual sus ingresos puedan ser mayores que los que posee actualmente
texts.en:
Douglas Ernesto Gutiérrez M., 45, is married and has three minor children. He sells used clothing and shoes from his home. Douglas started the business ten years ago. Before he started the business in his house, he traveled to Río San Juan to distribute his products as a street vendor. Also, he had people there that he knew. He would leave the products with them and return in 15 days after they had sold the merchandise. But, this made him very tired. Little by little he was establishing himself, and he was able to set up the business in his house. That is where it currently is. The loan is to buy various clothing and footwear, which he plans to sell from his home. He has a well established client base. His dream is to establish another store in the market, which can lead to greater income than he currently has.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Faridah's Group

texts.en: K. Faridah is a hard working and devoted 42-year-old lady. She is married and has four children ages 8-18 years old. For the past eight years, she has been raising poultry and running a small retail shop in Lugazi. Faridah is good businesswoman who knows how to take good care of her customers so they return and bring their friends. She is requesting a loan to expand what she offers for sale in her retail shop. She wishes to improve her income so she can educate her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for retail shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cola nuts.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie E. is from Barangay Tumpagon, a village within Cagayan de Oro City on Mindanao. She is 35 years old, married and has five school-aged children. Rosie runs her own sari-sari (variety) store from which she sells a variety of different products to the local community. Rosie has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Rosie joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. Rosie is requesting a loan of 14,000 PHP, her fourth from HSPFI (her third, successfully repaid, was a loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI). She will use her loan to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use all revenue from her business to supplement her family’s income.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy additional products to sell in her "sari-sari."

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 39 years old and married with two children, who are both attending school. She has a hardware business in the Kayole area of Nairobi and sells cement, mabati (iron sheets), and household fixtures. She has been in business for five years and employs one person. She also operates another retail shop. She requested this loan of Kes. 50,000 from Faulu to add more items to her hardware store.

Jane describes herself as hardworking and creative. In the future, she hopes to be a multi-supplier of hardware items.

loans.use: Add stock to her hardware store

loans.name: Sussy

texts.es:
La señora Sussy es socia del Banco Comunal “Gran Poder” desde hace 2 años atrás, del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 26 años de edad, es casada y tiene 1 hijo. Estudió superior completa y se dedica a la venta de alimentos balanceados.
Sussy nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 700.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar alimentos balanceados.
Su sueño para el futuro es ser empresaria.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad de las socias en las reuniones.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sussy is a partner in the Community Bank of “Gran Poder” for the past two years. She is from the district of Ilave, province of El Collao in the area of Puno. She is 26 years old, is married and has one child. She finished her high school studies and is dedicated to the sale of grains. Sussy tells us that her first loan from Manuela Ramos Movment was for S/500 Peruvian nuevos soles which allowed her to increase her capital. She is requesting a loan of S/700 Peruvian nuevos soles with which she will be able to buy grains. Her dream for the future is to be an entrepreneur. What she likes most about the Community Bank is the punctuality of the partners and the meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase feed grains

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 52 años de edad, casada y cuya familia esta conformada por esposo, sus dos hijos, y 04 nietos que aún estudian, y todos ellos conviven con Carmen en su casa es propia. Es así que para ganarse la vida, se dedica a vender golosinas como galletas, chocolates, cigarros, y caramelos, en un pequeño espacio que ella mismo creo en el exterior de su casa y sobre un tablero de madera en donde ha colocado su mercadería. Es entonces y durante 10 años que se dedica a vender sus productos de golosinas por las tardes, y durante las mañanas vende de manera ambulatoria, habas, maní, canchitas (productos confitados).  Gran parte de su trabajo la mantiene activa y eso es lo que más le agrada hacer y sobre todo atender a sus clientes. Para Carmen su negocio le resulta rentable, debido a que se encuentra ubicada en una zona donde hay muy transito de personas y eso le permite vender todos los días. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a pagar con sus cuotas a tiempo, además manifiesta que le gusta mucho trabajar con su grupo comunal ya que todos son muy solidarios y honestos cuando trabajan. Con el préstamo que solicita, lo invertirá para construir un kiosko y comprar más productos para abastecer su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Carmen is 52 years old, is married and has two children and four grandchildren. All of them live with Carmen in the home she owns. To earn a living, she sells sweets such as cookies, chocolates and candies as well as cigarrettes in a small space that she created outside the house with a table to display her merchandise. She has been selling her goods from home in the afternoon for the last 10 years. In the mornings, she is a street vendor and sells fava beans, peanuts and other products. Her work keeps her active and she enjoys the activity and serving her customers. Carmen's business is profitable since there is a lot of foot traffic in her area which allows her to sell every day. This is her third loan with MFP and she is committed to paying the loan back on time. She tells us she enjoys working with her Village Bank as all of the members are very supportive and honest in their work. She will use the loan to build a kiosk and to buy more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To construct a kiosk and to purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of three people who are led by Mrs. Sokhom S.. She is 53 years old and lives in Crouy ChR. village, Kandal province. 

She and her husband, Mr. Samark Port, are farmers who own a 2-hectare field where they cultivate rice. They face some problems because the field is infertile and doesn't have enough the water to support it. So Mrs. Sokhom S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and gasoline to support the rice field. She is the mother of four children, one of whom repairs cell phones, and the other three are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and gasoline

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.fr: Madeleine SAMB est une femme de 54 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 8 ans et a une bonne expérience en matière de crédit. Elle fait de l'élevage et embouche porcine. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Madeleine Samb is a 54 year old woman. She is married and the mother of 4 children. She's been a member of "Banc Villageois" for 8 years and has good experience in terms of loans. She does livestock farming and fattens pigs. She contributes to improving the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her self-financing capacity

loans.name: Bola

texts.en:
Bola sells drinks and juice at retail prices to her customers to make a living. She is a widow with four children. Life as a widow has not been easy for her. She works for long hours to enable her to meet the basic needs of her children. 
Bola has been in this business for a very long time. She is happy with her business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to expand her business. 
Bola hopes for a loan amount of  70,000 Nigerian Naira (NGN) to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha tiene 51 años, está casada y tiene 4 hijos, la mayor se casó y hace poco se mudó, los 3 menores siguen a su cuidado. Su casa está ubicada al sur de la ciudad de Lima.

Anteriormente tenía una tienda de ropa, en un local céntrico de su localidad, pero no le resultó rentable porque no podía juntar para pagar el alquiler mensual. Entonces optó por mudar toda su mercadería a su casa y vender desde allí. Ahora, cada vez que tiene la oportunidad, carga su bolso de ropa y visita a sus amistades para ofrecer sus prendas. Esta metodología le ha resultado mucho mejor y es una actividad que le gusta mucho, y junto a las ganancias de su esposo como albañil, pueden suplir las necesidades de sus hijos. Para más adelante está pensado en comprar vitrinas donde pueda exhibir sus prendas en su casa.

Este es su quinto crédito con MFP y una vez más reitera su compromiso de seguir siendo muy responsable en sus pagos, ya que desea seguir contando con posteriores préstamos. A su vez, está contenta de ser parte de su grupo, pues no tiene quejas de sus compañeras de crédito. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de uniformes, por ser campaña escolar y de ese modo pueda captar mayores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Martha, 51, is married and has 4 children. The oldest is married and recently moved away. The 3 younger children still live with her. Her house is in the south part of Lima. Martha used to have a clothing store in a commercial zone of her neighborhood but it wasn't viable because she couldn't cover the store's monthly rent. She subsequently decided to move the business to her house and sell from there. Whenever she has the chance now, she loads up her clothing bag and calls on friends and acquaintances to buy whatever she has on offer. This approach has worked much better and it's work that she very much likes doing. With her husband's income from his construction work, they are able to provide the things their children need. Martha is considering buying display cases so that she can better show her merchandise at home. This is Martha's fifth MPF loan. She has promised to go on being responsible about repaying her loans because she wants to ensure that she can get new loans in the future. At the same time, she is happy to be part of her group and she has no complaints about any of the other members. She will use the loan to buy uniforms that she can sell during the coming school year and, in turn, increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Hang's Group

texts.en:
Hằng Thị T. Đỗ is 41 years old. She lives in Duc Tu village, Dong Anh, Ha Noi, with her husband and two children. She breeds pigs and breeds poultry. Her husband is a driver. They have a monthly income of about 4.000.000 Vietnamese dong. 

Ms Hang has taken part in SEDA for four years. She is the group leader of a seven–member group loan with Kiva partner SEDA and repays on time. In the next loan cycle, she would like to borrow 5.014.000 VND (or about $265) to breed pigs and poultry in the hope that it will make a profit so that her family may afford to buy more good furniture.

 About the other borrowers in her group:

 Hien T. P. is 50 years old. She breeds poultry and cooks wine. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to buy rice for cooking wine.

 Oanh T. N. is 28 years old. She breeds chickens and wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to buy chicken feed.

 Thuan T. N. is 51 years old. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to breed poultry.

 Vui T. Hoang is 53 years old. She wants to borrow 6.322.000 to buy chicken feed.

 Loan T. N. is 52 years old. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND for a small business.

 Ngu T. H. P. is 30 years old. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to invest in her business.

loans.use: For pig breeding and poultry breeding

loans.name: Jayaseeli

texts.en:
Jayaseeli is a 55-year-old married woman living in Hikkaduwa along the southern coast of Sri Lanka with her husband and son.  The 2004 tsunami in this region devastated the Hikkaduwa area, and Jayaseeli lost two daughters in the tsunami.  She lost all her possessions as well, including her house.  

Jayaseeli has a spice-making business, which she is very enthusiastic about. Jayaseeli has been managing her business by herself, and she devotes her full efforts to improve it, step by step.  

Jayaseeli has asked for a 50,000-LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka in order to expand her business.  This will be her second loan from BRAC to supply capital for the spice business and she hopes to continue to see success.  She is grateful for BRAC because of the financial support it provides to her.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To develop her spice-making business

loans.name: Samrith

texts.en: Samrith P., 42, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for clay and ceramic products. She sells groceries for a gross income of about USD 20 per day, while her husband sells ice, earning a gross income of USD 26 per day to help cover the family expenses.  Samrith is now requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more groceries to stock the store, and in the future she would like to use any additional profit to expand her business.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Benigno

texts.es:
El señor Benigno R. vive en casa propia en la zona de Llojeta, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz.
El señor Benigno es albañil, realizando trabajos de construcción en viviendas particulares de esta ciudad, ingresos con los que se mantiene.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción del muro frontal de su vivienda, para darle seguridad a la misma.
Esta es la segunda ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Benigno R. lives in his own home in the Llojeta area on the east side of the city of La Paz. He is a construction worker and generally works on individuals' homes in the city and uses that income to support himself. This loan will be used to build the front wall of his home to improve his home security. This is the second loan he has requested and the socioeconomic analysis performed after his first loan has qualified him to receive another.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a frontal wall for his home to provide better security

loans.name: Faithful Friends Group

texts.en:
Esther T., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Faithful Friends. She is 44 years old and widowed, with three children who range from 5 to 24 years old. She was only able to attend school through 9th grade due to poverty. All of her children are attending school.

For 6 years, she has been selling rice, oil, pepper, and charcoal in Gardnersville, outside of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 7,000-Liberian-dollar portion of this 35,000-Liberian-dollar group loan to buy more rice, oil, pepper, and charcoal.

Her goal is to grow her business, build a shop, and continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Jackson is inset at the lower right because he was absent during the interview.

loans.use: To buy more rice, oil, pepper, and charcoal

loans.name: Wofunira Women's Group 2, Kampala

texts.en:
For a period stretching to three years now, hardworking and self-motivated Ruth K. has been plying her salon business in Zana-Kampala. She also ekes out supplementary profits from her poultry business.

Though she is only three years down the road, this married mother of three children has made lots of headway in terms of consolidating her gains. In a week, she makes profits to the tune of 200,000 shillings. This has lent her enormous countenance in her drive to elevate the welfare of her family. All her three children are happily in good schools around Kampala.

Ruth’s startup business story can be traced to her erstwhile shop business. This gave her that sense of self-esteem that she could not fail in any business endeavor. With this loan, she is hoping she will be able to purchase new dryers. At length, she wants to expand her salon so that she is in a position to take on bridal services, too.

loans.use: To purchase hairdryers and other salon equipment

loans.name: Jehova Es Mi Pastor  2 Group

texts.en:
Juana is the coordinator of her group, Jehova es mi Pastor 2 (God is my pastor), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Juana’s group is located in Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production, and the second biggest city in Dominican Republic, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure with her two children.

Juana is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in cosmetics, laundry and beauty products like shampoo, conditioner, body cream, soaps, detergents, etc.

Juana will use the profits to reinvest in her business and, through the loan's benefits, give her family a better life, like getting her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics, laundry and beauty products

loans.name: Rwakahurwa Tukore, Rukungiri Group

texts.en: Hardworking widowed B. Peninah from Nyaruharo, Rukungiri started up her poultry farming business over five years ago. She was a lucky beneficiary of national agricultural programs here in Uganda that help people start up different projects. With her determination, she developed her business and sells eggs and broilers for chicken meat to hotels and other local consumers with shops that provide ready market. Her main drawback is having a small stock of birds. With this loan, she is very optimistic of increasing her stock of poultry birds and having more production in terms of eggs and broiler supplies. This will definitely improve her sales revenue and family income to enable her to provide for her 5 children’s welfare.

loans.use: restocking the poultry farm with more birds

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites C. is a 43-year-old, married woman who supports her family by operating a Ready-to-Wear clothes business. She and her family live in Prk kaisdaan, Brgy Daga, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her Ready to Wear business, she is gradually making her family more stable economically. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 2,000. Marites is now borrowing PHP 10,000 to increase the working capital for her Ready to Wear business. This will be her 6th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 8,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Marites aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and to ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to provide additional working capital

loans.name: Luz Ernestina

texts.en:
Luz Ernestina G. M. is 31 years old and lives in common-law marriage in Chillanes in the Bolivar Province of Ecuador. She has 5 children aged 17, 11, 9, 7, and 3.

Luz is a member of the rural loan group called San Jacinto. The group consists of fifteen members, the majority of whom work in the agricultural sector.

Luz also works in agriculture and earns on average $150 monthly. She purchases her supplies and sells her products in the nearby town of Matilde.

Luz plans to use this loan to build a house. Her dreams are to finish building the house, to buy a car, and to see her children get a good education.

In her free time Luz likes to spend time with her children and watch television.

loans.use: To build a house

loans.name: Yohana

texts.es: La Sra. Yojana P. es trabajadora activa del Centro de Salud “San Rafael del Sur”   ella  se desempeña  como Secretaria Ejecutiva, tiene  diecisiete años de trabajar para esta institución, es casada actualmente. Ha tenido  nueve créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación y este lo está solicitando para aumentarle un cuartos más  a su casa,  los cuales  los créditos con Ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Yojana P. works at the San Rafael del Sur Health Center as an executive secretary. She has worked there for seventeen years, and is married. She has received nine loans from CEPRODEL, and has used them to purchase construction materials to improve her house. She is asking for this loan to improve another room in her house. The loans from Ceprodel have benefited her very much, and she has used them to improve the quality of life of herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Eileen Gessner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials: Stone, sand, cement, etc

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica M. is a 40-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a fish vending business. She lives in Sitio. Tagasa, Brgy. Bitoon, Daanbantayan, Cebu. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fish vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of about $210. Jessica is now borrowing 15,000 PHP to use as additional working capital. This will be her 5th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 13,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom.  

Jessica  aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Celia

texts.en: Celia R. is from the city of Bacolod, Ozamiz City. She is 49 years old. Celia is single and has an adult child. To make a living, Celia operates a transportation service. Celia has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Celia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Celia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40,000 PHP from GDMPC. Celia is requesting a new loan of 27,813.30 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be the second loan taken out by Celia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda P. is from the village of Brgy. Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 51 years old. Erlinda is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Erlinda owns & operates a motorcycle business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating tricycle (three-wheeled) transport services. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Erlinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase tires and other accessories. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Erlinda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 34 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es: El Sr. Manuel de Jesús G. él es trabajador activo del colegio público “Instituto Nacional San Rafael del Sur” desempeñándose como director del colegio tiene  veinte y tres año de trabajar como docente. Ha tenido  nueve créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: Manuel de Jesús G. is a hard-working man.  He is the principal of the “Instituto Nacional San Rafael del Sur” school.  He has been a teacher for twenty-three years.  He has had nine loans from CEPRODEL and each one has been used to buy building materials to extend and improve his house.  The CEPRODEL loans have benefited him greatly since they have enabled him to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: Sand, cement, stone and gravel

loans.name: Freddy Gilbert

texts.es:
Freddy Gilbert G. M. tiene 40 años. Vive en Unión Libre,  vive con la compañera y con el hijos, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos.  Tiene 1 hijo. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. El Recreo este grupo se dedica exclusivamente a labores agrícolas especialmente a la siembra de cultivo de ciclo corto como es el maíz, arroz, soya y fréjol. Todos los socios son del mismo sector recinto San Vicente Las lomas Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos a esta ventanillas pertenecen 12 socios.

Freddy se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de maíz desde hace 3 años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y los vende en la feria de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño comprar terrenos para trabajar.

Le gusta jugar volly
texts.en:
Freddy Gilbert G. M. is 40 years old. He lives with her common-law wife and their son. They live in Canton de Ventanas in the Los Rios Province.

The members of V.R.C., El Recreo, are dedicated exclusively to farming mostly growing products with short cycles like corn, rice, soy and beans. Twelve members are from the same sector; San Vicente, Las Lomas, Canton de Ventanas in the Los Rios Province. 

Freddy has been dedicated to farming for the last three years, planting mostly corn. He buys his supplies in Ventanas and sells his products in the open market in Ventanas.

He is requesting the loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers to cultivate corn. This loan will provide economic assistance to make the purchases. The members encounter challenges with diseases, pests and climate changes. 

He enjoys volleyball and his dream is to buy land to farm.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Robinson

texts.es:
Robinson tiene su negocio desde hace quince años, inicialmente comercializaba con vestidos femeninos maculinos e infantil, mientras simultaneamente se dedicaba al oficiol de albañilerìa y en oportunidades a la venta de verduras en el mercado`pùblico de Barranquilla. Asi fue que cuando se casò de 21 años y tuvo 2 niños y una niña, asumiò su gran responsabilidad con experiencia y aun lo hace con sus hijos que ahora tienen 15,27 y 28 años de edad y con sus nietos. Robinson es una persona dinàmica que participa en todas las actividades de la Fundaciòn, es asì como està vinculado al equipo de futbol microempresarial que organizò esta empresa, con la que en la actualidad ha realizado 2 financiamientos; con estè ùltimo, su CrediKiva,  planea comprar juguetes, porque está cercana la època de fin de año para que los padres de familia   compren juguetes y sea el "niño Dios" de los infantes quien se los traiga en la noche del 24 de Diciembre,  y los pequeños creen que los trajo Dios niño desde el cielo; asì que el dia 25 de Diciembre usted puede encontrar niños alegres jugando por las calles de Barranquilla, con los juguetes que Robinson vendiò a sus padres, como patinetas, muñecas, carros y los juguetes que esten de moda. Como Robinsos está pendiente a lo que se mueve en cada época, tambien vende ropa, calzado, fantasia, etc por eso le va muy bien porque es conciente de la oportunidad comercial. El negocio de Robinson  muestra los siguientes  indicadores financieros : una rotación de cuentas por cobrar de 14 dias, su rentabilidad sobre las ventas de 40%, un endeudamiento actual del 1% y una capacidad de pago actual de 99%  y 94% con el nuevo financiamiento.
Desde su primer financiamiento Robinsòn sintiò que su negocio se moviò con un nuevo capital y pudo ahorrar un poco y aumentar ligeramente su utilidad, asì que espera que algun dia se convierta en un almacen y sueña con tener un vehiculo para el transporte, lo cual le facilitaria la vida.
texts.en:
Robinson has been in business for 15 years.  He started off selling women's, men's and children's clothes whilst also working as a construction worker and selling vegetables in Barranquilla public market.

When he married at 21 and had 3 children, 2 boys and a girl, he took on responsibility for his children with experience and he still assumes responsibility  for his children, who are now aged 15, 27 and 28, and his grandchildren.

Robinson is a dynamic person who takes part in all the activities Fundación Mario Santo Domingo offers.  He is a member of the football team which the firm organized and has had 2 loans.  With this latest Kiva loan, he plans to buy toys because the end-of-year period is approaching which is when parents buy toys and let their children know that it is “the Christ child” who brings the toys on the evening of 24th December.  The little ones think that “the Christ child” brought them from heaven.  On 25th December you can find happy children playing in the streets of Barranquilla with the toys that Robinson sold to their parents such as scooters, dolls, toy cars and whatever toys are popular that year.

As Robinson is always aware of what sells each season, he also sells clothes, footwear, costume jewelry, etc. His business does well because he is aware of sales opportunities.  Robinson's business has the following economic indicators: his accounts receivable turnover is 14 days, his current debt is 1% and his capacity to fulfil payment obligations is 99%, 94% with this new loan.

From the time of his first loan, Robinson felt that his business got moving with new capital.  He was able to save a little and increase his profits slightly.  He hopes that some day he will be able to have a store and he dreams of having a vehicle to transport his goods as this would make his life easier.

loans.use: To buy toys to sell as children's Christmas presents

loans.name: Kamene

texts.en: Kamene is 29 year old single mother of two school-going children. She has a retail shop, which she has been running for three years, that has a profit of Kshs 2,000 per month. This is her third loan with Kadet; she repaid her previous loans successfully. Kamene hopes to own a big shop and become a wholesaler in the future. She also hopes to give her children a quality education and improve their living standards.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, maize and flour for her shop.

loans.name: Etchrivi

texts.fr: Monsieur Etchrivi est âgé de 30. Il  fait comme activité l’Electricité et la Plomberie où il tire ses revenus.   A travers cette activité, il a remboursé  déjà plusieurs crédits. IL achète les matériels d’électricité  au grand marché de Lomé et travaille dans les zones environnantes  de Lomé. IL  a commencé en 2006 cette activité. Il demande un prêt  pour acheter  10 tubes orange, 15 câbles TH et 2 rouleaux de fil.
texts.en:
Mr. Etchrivi is 30 years old. He makes a living working as an electrician and a plumber. These activities, started in 2006, have already allowed him to repay several loans. 

He gets his electrical equipment at the big market of Lomé and works in the surrounding areas. 

He is seeking a loan to buy 10 orange tubes, 15 TH cables, and 2 rolls of wire.

loans.use: To purchase electrical and plumbing equipment

loans.name: Tiaulel Ene Lloitei

texts.en:
Tiaulel Ene Loitei K. is 42 Years old, married and a mother of eight children. Tiaulel is a farmer and she does the farming on her own piece of land which she has been doing for the last nine years.

She learned about KADET LTD from other women in a group already registered with KADET in her area of residence. This will be her second loan after she successfuly paid the first loan well and in time. She is planning to buy fertilizer, wheat and maize seeds for planting season.  

Tiaulel Ene  hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to build a permanent house. She hopes to be a prominent farmer of wheat and better living of the family. She is an industrious woman who is determined to achieve her set objectives.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and wheat and maize seeds.

loans.name: Lucia Ramona

texts.es: Lucia Ramona su negocio es la compra y venta de ropa.  Esta no es la primera vez que realiza créditos, pues han sido satisfactorios para ella. Desde hace más de 21 años que se dedica a este negocio. Lucia dio inicio a este medio de vida por la necesidad de sufragar los gastos de su hogar. Ella siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer muy responsable y disfruta de interactuar con sus clientes. Ella solicita este crédito que será destinado para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, shorts y trajes.
texts.en:
Lucia Ramona has a business that involves buying and selling clothes. This is not the first time she has received loans and she has been satisfied with them. Lucia started this business more than 21 years ago because she needed to cover her household expenses. She has always been known for being a responsible woman and enjoys interacting with her customers.

Lucia is requesting this loan to purchase trousers, shirts, skirts, shorts, and suits.

loans.use: Purchase trousers, shirts, skirts, shorts, and suits

loans.name: Rosa Melida

texts.es:
Rosa, se dedica a vender ropa, tiene 30 años de edad, vive con su familia: su abuela y 2 hijos de 11 y 5 años de edad, es madre soltera  y la casa donde viven es propiedad de su abuela, está ubicada en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán.
El negocio de Rosa existe desde hace 7 años, vendiendo ropa, perfumes y cremas, estas ventas las realiza de forma ambulantes, recorriendo las colonias y cantones cercanos. Por el momento solicita un préstamo para comprar ropa (blusas, faldas, camisas y ropa interior), con esta inversión espera mejorar su inventario y ofreciendo variedad de prendas de vestir espera también que sus ventas aumenten.
Rosa cada día desempeña su trabajo con la esperanza de algún día contar con los fondos necesarios para comprar su propia casa donde vivir con sus hijos y que estos estudien para tener mejores oportunidades en el futuro.
texts.en:
Rosa, 30, sells clothes.  She lives with her family: her grandmother and two children who are 11 and 5 years of age.  She is a single mother and the house where she lives is owned by her grandmother.  It is located in San Francisco Gotera, Morazán department.

Rosa’s business has been in operation for 7 years.  She sells clothes, perfumes and creams.  She sells in an ambulatory manner visiting nearby neighborhoods and cantons.  For the moment she is asking for a loan to buy clothes (blouses, skirts, shirts and underwear).  She hopes this investment will improve her inventory offering a wider selection of clothing; she hopes that her sales will increase too.

Rosa works every day with the hope of someday having enough funds to buy her own house to live in with her children and that they may study to have better opportunities in the future.

loans.use: To buy blouses, skirts, shirs and underwear.

loans.name: Muhsinjon

texts.en:
Muhsinjon is married and has two little children. He runs a business selling clothing and headdresses. Muhsinjon boasts a nice selection of items he offers for sale. He has many loyal customers who trust him and always come back for good quality, durable clothes when they shop at the market. Muhsinjon has been in the trade for three years. He is requesting a loan of $1,300 USD to increase his assortment of merchandise for the coming spring season. He is a hardworker and a determined businessman with clear vision and sober thinking. We believe Muhsinjon’s business will benefit from the current loan and will continue to grow, bringing him a stable income in the future.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new goods for resale

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl A., a CCT* community partner, aims to go against the common notion of mediocrity with regard to her business. She is happily married to Leonardo, her business partner, and they are blessed with a child who is currently studying. The family lives on Edang Street, Pasay City.

Cheryl has operated a sari-sari (variety) store for four years. She adapts well to the trends in her neighborhood, knowing which popular brands of food, shampoo, drinks and other products people want. Because of her expertise in this field, she is able to earn PHP 10,000 monthly.

But Cheryl knows she can do more to produce more. She is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to help her develop her business. She intends to use this loan to buy more quantities of quality merchandise. She knows that having a lot of stock will attract more customers to her store. Cheryl is doing everything possible to see her business grow and stabilize because she wants to become successful in life, be it on a personal or business level.

As a CCT community partner, Cheryl faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to restock her inventory

loans.name: Nortjie

texts.en:
Nortjie, 62, is a widow and the mother of six children. Her children, Leo, 41, Marcel, 39, Andre, 37, Yanti, 34, Reni, 32 and Yance,30, are all married. Nortjie lives with Yanti and her family in Oesapa Village. To make a living, Nortjie runs a photocopy business, which she's done since her husband passed away in 2009. This business helps her to generate an income. Nortjie is known as a strong woman for her age, as she still likes to work to earn her living despite her children being willing to support her. She enjoys spending her days running her business.

While Nortjie is happy with the business, she also dreams of running another business: a motorcycle wash service. She feels this business will improve her income as currently most people don't have time to wash their motorcycles and thus will require such a service. Nortjie is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 IDR to buy a diesel engine and other equipment to commence her new business. She hopes that TLM is willing to assist her in making her dream come true.

loans.use: to purchase a diesel engine and other equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bails of shoes to add her stock

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Meeting life’s challenges head-on is a habit that could be developed only by the brave. Evelyn B., 38, does just that. Evelyn is only a high school graduate, but right now she manages her own micro-business. She is married to a construction worker, Joevil, and mother to her three children, who are all studying at a public high school nearby.  Together, they live in Barangay Commonwealth, Quezon City, Philippines.

Evelyn runs her own sari-sari (variety) store, located in an extension of their house. Every day, she observes the buying patterns of her customers and notes their preferences in terms of the type of item they buy, the price and the brand. She sees to it that her customers get what they desire. She also operates a food stall where she offers food items among her local community. Monthly, Evelyn earns an estimated net income of around 11,000 PHP.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a 16,000 PHP loan.  She intends to meet the demands of her customers.  As needed, she will buy more stocks of rice, soft drinks and other grocery items.  She also will use part of this loan to buy more raw ingredients needed for her food stall.

Evelyn acknowledges that no challenge is too hard to deal with. She knows that the Lord will enable her to overcome and uphold the future of both her children and her business. She dreams of making her sari-sari store grow. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay  microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional grocery items for her variety store and more raw ingredients needed for her food stall

loans.name: Ronald Alberto

texts.es:
Ronald  tiene 24 años de edad, él es soltero y vive con sus padres no tiene carga familia. Reside en zona rural, en una comunidad pequeña llamada  Cazalan en el distrito de Monsefú.

Ronald se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte público en una mototaxi que es de su propiedad. Dicha labor la desempeña en los alrededores de su localidad  Esta actividad la viene realizando hace 4 años, en los que ha ido adquiriendo experiencia en el rubro y clientela fija.

Ronald tiene la necesidad de darle mantenimiento a su mototaxi por lo que ha recurrido Edpyme Alternativa para solicitar un préstamo de 3000 nuevos soles,  con los que el podrá realizar los cambios y arreglos necesarios para que pueda brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. 

Servicio que presta ronald es muy solicitado en su localidad por tal motivo, él  constantemente se capacita en temas de atención al usuario.

Ronald es un cliente conocido por Edpyme Alternativa, el cual cuenta con buenas referencias por personas de su comunidad, pues lo consideran una persona trabajadora y responsable.
texts.en:
Ronald, age 24, is single and lives with his parents.  He does not have the responsibilities of having a family.  He lives in a rural zone in a small community called Cazalan in the Monsefú district.

Ronald provides public transportation service with his own “mototaxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle).  He does this work in the area surrounding where he lives.  He has been doing this for four years.  During that time he has been acquiring experience in the field and acquiring established customers.

Ronald needs to perform maintenance on his taxi.  That is why he has come to Edpyme Alternativa to request a loan for 3,000 soles.  With the loan he will be able to make changes and needed repairs in order to be able to offer his customers better service.

Ronald’s taxi service is much requested in the area.  Therefore, he is always focusing on customer care.

Ronald is a well-known client of Edpyme Alternativa.  He has good references from people in his community.  They consider him to be a hard-working and responsible person.

loans.use: to provide needed maintenance on his mototaxi.

loans.name: Canal De Bendicion 6 & 8 Group

texts.en:
Eliana is the coordinator of her group Canal de Bendicion 6 & 8 (Channel of Blessing).  Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the economy is dominated by the sugarcane harvest. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her two children, taking care of them as a single mom.

Eliana is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and expanding her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling fried food, by buying chicken, beef, flour, oil, and plantains. She operates a fried food stand where she cooks dinners for sale. She is saving her profits to improve her home by building her future house out of concrete block, which will provide more security. 

She enjoys being part of her group and sharing with them in different activities. Also her favorite thing to do is spend time with her two children.

loans.use: to buy chicken, beef, flour, oil, plantains, etc. for her fried food stand.

loans.name: Edmund0

texts.en:
Edmundo is 43 years old and married with two school-aged children. He earns about Php 30,000 per crop season as a farmer working in the Philippines.

Edmundo grows corn and has been doing that for 30 years. Edmundo is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase fertilizers and seeds to grow.

In the future, Edmundo hopes that his farming business will improve to support the needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds to grow.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, aged 37, is married to Helen. They are blessed with one child, aged 1 year. David sells curios, which he has been doing for 21 years. The business earns him a monthly income of 25,500 Kenyan shillings.

This is his first loan term with KADET LTD. He will use the loan funds to buy more curios for sale.

David hopes to be one of the international curio exporters in the future.

loans.use: to buy curios.

loans.name: Rwamashengyero Tweyambe Group

texts.en:
26 year old Amos is full of energy, agility and dynamism. These traits have served him well the last 5 years as he goes about his day to day trivial round in his hotel business in Mubende town. The father of 2 began this business with capital from his farming business and he says he has been making headway ever since. 

He has struke quite a chord with his clients with his good human relationship skills.  This, to a big extent, explains why his hotel appeals to quite a big clientele.  On the side too, Amos has a cattle sales business which he says is like his second string to a bow.  Weekly Amos' businesses make profits totaling up to 100,000 shillings.

Amos says he will use this Kiva loan to purchase more food like bananas, cassava, maize flour, rice, beans, cabbage, meat, cow peas, etc. for use at the hotel.

loans.use: to purchase food such as bananas, maize flour, rice, cassava,etc fo use at the hotel

loans.name: Etibar

texts.ru:
Etibar 33 qoda. On jenat i uje imeyet 3 detey. Etibar yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Kalbadjar region, seychas projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Etibar 6 let kak zanimayetsya prodajey stroitelnix materialov. Eto uje 3aya ssuda Etibara. Vse suddu kotoriye bral Etibar bili oplacheni vovremya. 
Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti dlya pochinki svoyey gruzovoy mashini dlya razvitiya svoyego biznessa.

http://partners.kiva.org/lend/3396

http://partners.kiva.org/lend/93852
texts.en:
Etibar is 33 years old.  He is married and has three children.  Etibar is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from the Kalbadjar region who now lives in the Absheron region with his family.  Etibar has been selling building materials for six years.  This is his third loan.  All of his loans were repaid on time.  Now he needs 2000 AZN to buy parts to repair his truck in order to develop his business.  

http://partners.kiva.org/lend/3396

http://partners.kiva.org/lend/93852

loans.use: to buy parts to repair his truck

loans.name: Serafina

texts.en:
Serafina is a hard-working mother who is now 47 years old with five school-aged children. She is a farmer working in the Philippines who earns 9,000 PHP a month. Despite hardships in life, she is strongly determined to improve her family’s living standard and to give her children a better future.

Serafina is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to be used to pay for labor to prepare her land for planting and purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her crops. She is hoping to have a plentiful harvest in order to earn more income to satisfy her family’s daily basic needs and to finance the education of her children.

Serafina believes that with patience and strong determination and the continuous assistance of ASKI and Kiva lenders she will be able to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to pay for labor to prepare her land and purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her crops.

location.town: Brgy. Munguia, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Marianita De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora. Marianita es socia del banco comunal Señoras De Taguan, vive por la parroquia de San Bartolo, este lugar es de clima frió, su gente se dedica a la ganadería y agricultura, muchos laboran diariamente en la ciudad de Cuenca regresando a sus hogares en la noche, son personas muy amables y mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

Doña Marianita tiene 50 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos, cuatro de sus hijos son casados e independientes, uno trabaja y ayuda le económicamente, otro está estudiando en el colegio y su ultimo hijo está estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad.
 
La Señora Marianita se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar,  también cría ganado, borregos, cerdos, cuyes y gallinas a los que los vende en su comunidad.

En el banco comunal se encuentra hace un año y medio, el nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos para crecer en la actividad de cría de animales.
 
Su meta es tener muchos más animales.
texts.en:
Marianita is a member of the “Señoras de Taguan” (Taguan Ladies).  She lives in San Bartolo Parish, a cold climate location.  Its residents raise livestock and farm.  Many work daily in the city of Cuenca returning home at night.  They are very kind people who maintain their culture and traditions.

Marianita is 50 years old, married and had 7 children.  Four of her children are married and independent.  One works and helps her out economically.  Another is in high school and the youngest goes to the little local  school.

Marianita does her household chores but also raises cattle, sheep, pigs, guinea pigs and chickens that she sells in her community.

She’s been in the communal bank for a year and a half.  She will use the new loan to buy pigs to expand her animal raising business.  Her goal is to have many more animals.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Levon

texts.en:
Levon was born in 1956 in Ijevan city. He is married and has three children: two sons and a daughter. Levon's children are married. One son and daughter live separately from their parents and another son and his family live with Levon. 
 
Levon worked as a mechanic for a long time, but since 1994, he has been engaged in bee keeping. Now Levon has 10 beehives and he intends to add to his beehives, which will help him to increase his family's income in the future. Levon sells derived honey to his regular customers.
 
Recently Levon has laid out a garden where he grows nuts and fruits. He says when his trees grow enough he will be able to sell nuts and fruits and to gain additional means for his family. 

Levon is seeking a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy 10 beehives and to fence his garden. 

This is Levon's fifth loan from Nor Horizon and he has never delayed his repayments.

loans.use: To buy 10 beehives and to fence his garden

loans.name: Ma.aracelli

texts.en: Ma. Aracelli is 36 years old and married with 2 children who are in school. She is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Ma. Aracelli requested a loan of PHP 11,000 from Kiva's partner, NWTF, to purchase fertilizers for her vegetable garden. She has been farming vegetables for 5 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. Ma. Aracelli would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Avec Dieu Plus Group

texts.en:
Mélanie is the leader of the group named “Avec Dieu Plus” made up of 13 members firmly united to receive loans from the micro-finance institution HOPE RDC in order to develop their businesses.

Mélanie, 45, is married and has six children of whom two go to school. Mélanie’s main business is selling fresh food in her area. Each day, her business brings in a profit of $20. She has been a micro entrepreneur since 2006. She likes her business and she is working hard to achieve her goal of one day opening a general store. 

She is a loyal client of the MFI HOPE RDC who has already received ten loans and has repaid them properly. She intends to use the next loan to purchase additional goods to resell with the aim of increasing her profits.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods for her business for resale at a profit.

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children.
