Vergie has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Vergie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future,Vergie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Arcelia

texts.es: La señora Arcelia y su esposo son una pareja estable que ya tienen varios años de casados, que con ahorros formaron su propio patrimonio. La casa donde viven ya tiene 20 años a la cual le han ido haciendo mejoras para que permanezca en buenas condiciones. En este momento Arcelia no cuenta con el capital necesario para reparar las paredes y pintar de un color a su gusto para dar mejor aspecto. Para que Arcelia realice su proyecto necesita comprar pintura, cemento y arena.
texts.en: Arcelia and her husband are a stable couple that have been married for several years. They used their own savings to build their assets. The house where they live is 20 years old and they have been making improvements to it so that it will remain in good condition. At this moment, Arcelia doesn’t have the capital necessary to repair the walls and paint them a color she likes to make them look better. In order for Arcelia to finish her project, she needs paint, cement, and sand.

loans.use: to buy paint, cement, and sand

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es: Emiliana tiene 49 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Segundo de 66 años y sus 4 venerados hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Emiliana, junto a su esposo trabaja todos los días en sus cultivos. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas, ya que sabe que sus productos que obtenga en sus tierras serán de calidad. Ella principalmente siembra cacao, café y hojas de coca, ya que estos son los productos que mejor se venden en el mercado. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es estar permanente junto a sus cultivos. Emiliana lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos hasta la ciudad de San Francisco, ya que es ahí donde vende sus productos. Para el futuro de su negocio, espera juntar el dinero necesario para comprar nuevas tierras. Este será el crédito número 04 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá el apoyo  de ustedes, así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su trabajo; por otro lado  se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos son muy responsables. Los 3,000 nuevos soles solicitados, los invertirá en mejorar sus cultivos, para ello comprará sacos de abono para obtener mejores productos.
texts.en:
Emiliana, 49, is a very hardworking woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband, Segundo, 66, and their beloved four children that she wants to provide a better quality of life for.  Emiliana works alongside her husband in the fields every day. With much effort she’s managed to make her farmland more productive and she knows that the products she’ll obtain from her soil will be of quality.  She mainly farms cocoa beans, coffee and coca leaf since they are the products that sell the best at market.  

What she most enjoys about her work is permanently being near her crops.  Emiliana has been in this line of work for 20 years and considers the most difficult part of it transporting the crops all the way to the city of San Francisco which is where she sells them.  For her business’ future she hopes to gather enough money to buy new land.

This will be loan #4 with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she’ll have your support because she’ll feel sure about making progress with her work.  She also commits to continue making her installment payments like she did with previous loans she got.  

It pleases her to be part of a communal bank because everyone is very responsible.  She will use the requested 3000 new soles to improve her crops.  To do so, she’ll buy sacks of manure to obtain better products.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Lorilane

texts.en:
Lorilane is 36 years old, and married with two adult aged children. She has a retail shop located in her village where she can sell a variety of products. Her spouse works as a farmer. Lorilane is well known as a very responsible mother in her village.

Lorilane is asking a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase can goods, noodles, spices and snack foods for her store. Lorilane wishes that someday she can achieve her dreams for her family to have a better life.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, spices and snack foods for her store.

loans.name: Shabana's Group

texts.en:
Shabana has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her sewing business. With the loan she will buy a new sewing machine, because her current machine is causing problems for her and she is unable to fulfill the client orders on time. She is well experienced in her business and hopeful that by purchasing a new sewing machine she will be able to run her business better and increase her profits.

She is 37 years old and has no child yet. Her husband is a factory worker and works for a low income. Due to her husband's low income, Shabana started her business to financially assist him. She is confident about her business success after the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Phallin

texts.en:
Phallin (in the photo) runs a grocery store at home in the village and also rents a space in her house to garment-factory workers. Her husband, Sokhom, is now a security guard. They live in a village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three sons and one daughter: two are in school and the other two are still young. 

Phallin hopes to continue her business selling groceries, so she is applying for another loan in the amount of $300 to purchase additional grocery items for sale.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items for sale

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Imelda has a shop that sells food products like adobo, afritada, and barbecued chicken. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of  7,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients needed for making food.

Imelda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Imelda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making food.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is a 35-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She has had a business selling tea in Yei, South Sudan, for two years. Betty is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar, milk, and coffee. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, milk, and coffee to sell

loans.name: Kosay

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 22 years old, married and has two children. He lives with ten family members and three of them work.

Kosay has been an owner of a restaurant since 2005, where he offers a variety of delicious food. He has more than four years experience in this field and a good reputation. His restaurant is situated in a crowded area where there are a lot of customers passing by.

He is requesting a $2,700 loan in order to repair and fix his restaurant’s walls. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to repair and fix his restaurant’s walls

loans.name: Akuch

texts.en:
Akuch is a 32-year-old married woman with two children, both of them in school. She has had a business selling food out of a stall in Bor, South Sudan for five years.

Akuch is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and beans for sale.

loans.name: Speed Way Organisation Group

texts.en:
The Speed Way Organization group is based in Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone.  With their first loan from SMT/Kiva, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more profit, and improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Lamin.  Lamin is 35 years old.  He was born in Bo district, in southern Sierra Leone, but is currently residing in Koidu with his wife and 4 children.  His wife is a businesswoman and his children are attending primary schools.  Lamin is a tailor and has been in this profession for 10 years now.  He has requested for this loan in order to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana de 33 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de Cartagena con su cónyuge y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 3 a 15 años. Hace 3 años Ana decidió emprender un negocio de venta de congelados y otro de venta de calzado y bolsos. La primera actividad la aprendió después de haber trabajado con su tía en se oficio y decidió implementarla pues es muy amante de la buena cocina. Inicialmente trabajo mediante pedidos y cuando tuvo una clientela concentrada adicionó otra actividad comercial como la venta de bolsos y calzado. Ella hace la lista de clientes interesados, compra y distribuye sus productos, después de comunicarse telefónicamente con los solicitantes. Su meta es formalizar su microempresa y conseguir un local, que le permita posicionarse, ganar dinero aun mas y en un futuro generar la posibilidad de que sus hijos tengan estudios de calidad. Ella también tiene como propósito mejorar las condiciones locativas de su negocio y hacer adecuaciones a su vivienda, lo cual es su sueño de prosperidad. Su mayor desafío es hacer más eficiente la producción de más, pues no tiene la maquinaria requerida para ello y el espacio donde funciona resulta muy pequeño. Aun así afrontará estas situaciones y con su gran creatividad y por ahora se enfoca en incrementar su capacidad productiva y en la organización de sus negocios. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer finanaciamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará harina de trigo, bandejas plásticas, queso, bocadillo y también invertirá en calzado sobre pedidos de su clientela. Con esta inversión Ana aumentará sus utilidades y con ello sus ingresos familiares, haciendo de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en: Ana, 33 years old, lives in the city of Cartagena with her spouse and their 4 children, ages 3 to 15. Three years ago, Ana decided to undertake a business selling frozen goods and another selling footwear and bags. She learned the first business after having worked with her aunt in that area and decided to undertake it because she is a lover of good food. Initially she worked to order and once she had a dedicated clientele, she expanded to include the other business—selling bags and footwear. She makes a list of interested customers, and buys and distributes the products after talking with the customers by phone. Her goal is to formally establish her micro-business and get a retail location. This would allow her to establish herself and earn even more money. Additionally, in the future it would allow the possibility of her children having a quality education. She also has as a goal improving the location of her business and making improvements to her home; this is her dream of prosperity. Her biggest challenge is making a bigger production line more efficient, because she doesn’t have the machinery required to do so and the space where she works is very small. Even so, she will face this situation with her great creativity. For now she is focusing on increasing the production capacity and organization of her businesses. This is exactly why she is turning to a Kiva loan, her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With this loan she will buy wheat flour, plastic trays, cheese, guava paste, and will also invest in footwear for her customers' orders. With this investment Ana will increase her profits and with those her family income, making her Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, plastic trays, cheese, guava paste and also will invest in footwear.

loans.name: Djumagul

texts.ru: Джумагул благодаря поддержки Фонда Кива и всех инвесторов, которым она очень благодарна, смогла развить свое дело, вложив средства по назначению. Она торгует продуктами питания в магазине около дома. Ее прибыль на сегодня составляет от 30,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Джумагул обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS). На полученный кредит она увеличит ассортимент товаров в магазине. Джумагул планирует открыть дополнительную торговую точку.
texts.en: Djumagul is thankful for the support that she received from Kiva and its lenders, and she wishes to express her gratefulness to all.  She was able to grow her business, having used her loan as she had intended.  She now sells household goods and construction supplies.  She currently has 400,000 som (KGS) worth of merchandise in her inventory and she makes an income of 24,700 som (KGS).  She has turned to Bai Tushum and requested a loan of 120,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to increase her assortment of goods in her shop.  She is planning to renovate her house.

loans.use: to increase her selection of food products in her shop.

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.en:
Rosalba started her first store over ten years ago selling all types of clothing. It was a stable source of income but had to be closed down after five years due to a very unfortunate circumstance. Rosalba’s son was diagnosed with a heart condition that required an operation that cost over $8,000. Rosalba and her husband had to sell their business and their home in order to save their son’s life. She, her husband and her three kids had to move into Rosalba’s mother’s home and they had to restart their business with only $200 in capital.

This has been a very tough experience for Rosalba but she hopes that she can improve her business in order to purchase a new home for her family. Her husband is a factory worker but hopes to one day also run the store with Rosalba. She needs the loan in order to invest in new clothing and improve the appearance of her store.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in new clothes to sell for the holiday season

loans.name: Piah

texts.en:
Piah, 40 year old, is a farm laborer. She works on land owned by other people with 3:1 revenue sharing system, where Piah gets 75% and the landlord gets 25% of the product revenue. She requested a $50 loan to buy farming supplies. But she hopes to obtain a larger loan to enable her to work on larger land area. She hopes to get her own land someday.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for her farm.

loans.name: Sevil

texts.en:
You can see in the picture a very kind woman, who lives in the Salyan region, in Yenikand village. Sevil is married and has 4 children.
This 57-year-old woman breeds cattle to meet the demands of her family.  It is very difficult to bring up 4 children. 
She needs a loan of $600 to buy a pregnant cow, so she will be able to increase the number of her cattle and provide a better living for her children.
Sevil has been in this business for 3 years.

loans.use: To buy a pregnant cow

loans.name: Rute Alberto

texts.pt:
Client: Rute Alberto L.
Location: Bairro Chamissava- Catembe- Maputo- Mozambique
Business Name: Retail
Loan Amount: 600.00US$
Loan Use: To increase stocks in her shop
Start: 07/10/2007
End: 07/31/2008

Rute Alberto L., 29, is civilly married with 4 children. She lived in Catembe with her parents, and her father died when she was 12 years old and in the 4th grade.

She then lived with her aunt and went to school until 8th grade, and then left school due to financial difficulties.

She took a typewriting course (without much success) at Lewis Petrus [school] and later emigrated in 1996 to South Africa in search of better living conditions in order to help her mother and younger siblings. In Rand, she met her husband with whom she currently lives.

In 2005, she decided to return to Mozambique to live in her house, and built a small shop where she sells various kinds of basic necessity products. She heard of Hluvuku [MFI] from her brother-in-law and decided to ask for aid to order to develop her business.

With the US$600 loan, she intends to increase her business by buying bagged/packaged goods, chickens and chicken-related products, which will allow her to increase her monthly income.

The location of her business has been a significant help, as it reduces the distance she has to go to purchase various products, and she also has an employee.

Her goal is to increase the number of customers, to save some money, and to make improvements to her shop.

Translated from Portuguese by Dan Foster, Kiva Volunteer.

Cliente: Rute Alberto L.
Localização: Bairro Chamissava- Catembe
Actividade: Comércio
Valor financiado: 15.000,00MT (600.00US$)
Aplicação empréstimo: Compra de produtos de 1ª necessidade
Início: 10/07/2007
Fim: 31/07/2008

Rute Alberto L., tem 29 anos de idade, casada maritalmente, tem 4 filhos, viveu com os pais na Catembe e que anos mais tarde este veio a falecer quando tinha 12 anos e nessa altura frequentava a 4ª classe.

Passou a viver com a tia onde estudou até 8ª classe e depóis deixou de estudar por dificuldades financeiras.

Frequentou sem sucessos o curso de dactilografia na Lewis Petrus e mais tarde emigrou para África de Sul a procura de melhores condições de vida isto em 1996 por forma ajudar a mãe e seus irmãos mais novos, na terra do Rand conheceu o marido com quem vive actualmente.

Em 2005 decide voltar a Moçambique para viver definitivamente em sua casa, constrói uma pequena mercearia onde vende diversa gama de produtos de 1ª necessidade.

Soube da existência da Hluvuku atravéis da cunhada e decide pedir auxílio para incrementar seu negócio.

Com o crédito de 15.000,00 MTn pretende aumentar o volume de negócio comprando produtos em sacos, frangos e derivados deste, o que lhe permitira aumentar sua renda mensal.

Pela localização deste empreendimento veio ajudar de forma significativa póis reduz a distânicas que percorriam para compra de diversos produtos e também emprega um trabalhador.

A perspectiva futura é ter cada vez mais clientes , poupar algum dinheiro, melhorar a mercearia.

loans.use: To increase stocks in her shop

loans.name: Verail

texts.es:
Mrs. Verail was born in Muchamaca, a small village in the province of Otuzco, but from a very young age she has lived in the Otuzco district, Otuzco province, department of La Libertad. She is 42 years old and has two young daughters who depend on her. She attended school just up to the third year of high school.

Mrs. Verail says that she learned to work from a very young age, because she helped her mother sell things on the streets of Otuzco. She became pregnant at age 19 and, because her husband was a student, she had to look for some form of work to help cover the expenses. She started processing dried potatoes and wheat in small quantities to sell in the market, but when she became ill she was prohibited from spending much time in water, so she could no longer process grains. She thought then she could buy grains in bulk and sell them wholesale. Because she needed capital for this, she accepted an invitation from a neighbor to join the Communal Bank called "The Olive". With her first loan of approximately $96, she purchased a large quantity of wheat and potatoes, and sold it wholesale. In this way she worked for about two years, saving her resources to start a warehouse, which she did successfully. At present, she does various activities: she and her children take turns working in the warehouse, she buys and sells grains wholesale, and and on Wednesdays and Sundays she sells cheeses in the plaza to pilgrims visiting the Virgen a la Puerta.

The loan that was recently approved by Manuela Ramos for approximately $636 will be used to buy grains such as wheat and corn, as well as dried vegetables, in bulk. Mrs. Verail hopes to buy a car and two motorcycle taxis to rent out, and in that way she can generate more income.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

La señora Verail nació en Muchamaca un caserío de la provincia de Otuzco pero desde muy pequeña vive en el distrito de Otuzco, Provincia de Otuzco del Departamento de La Libertad; tiene 42 años de edad y dos hijas menores que dependen de ella. Estudió solo hasta tercer año de secundaria.

La señora Verail dice que aprendió a trabajar desde muy pequeña porque ayudaba a vender a su mamá por las calles de Otuzco (cancha y marcianos). Se embarazó a los 19 años de edad y como su esposo era estudiante tuvo que buscar la forma de trabajar para ayudar a cubrir los gastos; empezó a pelar papa seca, trigo, y mote en pequeñas cantidades para vender en el mercado pero como enfermó le prohibieron estar mucho tiempo en el agua por lo que ya no podía pelar granos, pensó entonces en comprar granos en mayor cantidad y venderlos al por mayor, como necesitaba mayor capital para ello acepta la invitación de una vecina para formar parte del Banco Comunal “El Olivo” con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 (aproximadamente $ 96) que recibió compró mayor cantidad de trigo y papa y lo vendió al por mayor, así trabajó aproximadamente dos años, guardando sus utilidades para poner una bodega lo cual hizo con éxito. Actualmente realiza varias actividades: ella con sus hijas se turnan para atender la bodega, compra y vende granos al por mayor y además los días miércoles y domingos vende quesos y quesillos en la plaza de armas a los visitantes de la Virgen a la Puerta.

El reciente préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/.2000 ($ 636 aprox.) será utilizado para comprar granos como trigo, maíz y menestras al por mayor. La señora Verail sueña con comprar un auto y dos mototaxis para ponerlos en alquiler y así poder generarse otros ingresos.

loans.use: To buy grains (wheat, corn) and dried vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Brigitte

texts.fr:
At 47 years of age, Mrs. Brigitte A. lives in Lomé. She is married and has two children. Her husband, a primary school teacher, does not earn enough to meet the needs of the family. To help him out, Mrs. Brigitte A. entered the general food business, which has done well, since she is the sole seller in the area. Given her meager finances, she is unable to meet the demands of her customers and risks losing them. She would like to open a large store where one can find all sorts of goods, but sadly, she lacks the means to do so. She is asking for a loan of $1000.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 47 ans, Madame A. Brigitte résident Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Son mari un Instituteur n’a pas de grand revenu pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Pour l’aider, Mme A. Brigitte s’est lancé dans le commerce d’alimentation générale, un commerce qui lui réussi bien car elle est la seule dans le quartier. Devant ses maigres économies, elle n’arrive pas à être à la hauteur de sa clientèle et risque de les perdre. Elle veut ouvrir une grande boutique où on peut trouver toutes sortes de choses mais les moyens lui manquent cruellement. Elle sollicite un crédit de $1000.

loans.use: To open a general food store

loans.name: Ida

texts.en: Ida is 29 years old, married with one child, aged 6. She started farming after becoming a member of MBK. She needs a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farm. Her husband, Agus, does not have regular income. Ida usually earns US $10 per week and she hopes that the loan will help her increase her income for her family. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Mérida

texts.es:
Merida is very hard-working woman. It's amazing the strength that she has to do hard tasks and simultaneously work in her business. The love to her little ones, age 4 and 1 give her all that strength. For the past two years during the weekends, she has been selling a drink made with the Maca plant, baked custard, bread with cheese among other food in the streets. She used to sell this products at the school coffe shop when she was a teenager, and then she became independent to start her own business. Now she is very happy because with this activity she is able to cover her family’s needs. He has found a very profitable opportunity where her loved husband works. There are a lot of people who goes around this area. Her desire of progress and well-being has lead her to request the help of your noble heart in order to obtain the quantity that she needs to invest it to buy the materials necessary for the distribution of her desserts and sandwiches.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Mérida, es muy trabajadora y empeñosa, es increíble las fuerzas que tiene para realizar tareas duras y a la vez dedicarse a su negocio. El amor a sus pequeños de cuatro y un año son toda su fuerza. Ella tiene dos años dedicándose a la venta de agua de maca, leche asada, pan con queso entre otras viandas por las calles de la ciudad, los fines de semana, ésta idea surgió porque ella en sus años de adolescencia ayudaba en la venta de estos productos en un cafetín escolar; se independizó para crear su propio negocio, ahora está muy contenta con su desempeño porque esta actividad le otorga la capacidad de satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar. Ha encontrado una oportunidad muy provechosa en el lugar en el que se desempeña su querido esposo para ofertar sus deliciosas viandas ya que hay mucha gente que transita por este lugar. Sus deseos de mejora y bienestar la llevan a solicitar la ayuda de vuestro noble corazón a fin de obtener la cantidad que necesita para invertirlos en la compra de materiales necesarios para la distribución de sus postres y sándwiches.

loans.use: Buy the necessary utensil for the distribution of her prepared food.

loans.name: Sri Iswati

texts.id:
Sri Iswati, a mother of one child, supports her family's economy by opening a motorcycle spare parts shop. Located in Kepayaon street, the shop can generate 400,000 IDR ($43 USD) per week. Her husband helps her collecting the parts from recyclers. Typically the items are paid after they are sold. Sri Iswati runs the shop from the morning until dawn. Through the business they could send their child to school and cover basic needs.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Sri Iswati adalah ibu dari satu orang anak, menopang perekonomian keluarga dengan membuka warung yang khusus menjual spre part motor. Warung yang terleta di jalan kepaon ini mampu meraup keuntungan 400.000 rupiah/minggu. Usaha ini tentunya didukung oleh suaminya yang menyuplay kebutuhan warung dengan mengambil barang-barang dari para pengepul, biasanya oleh suaminya barang-barang tersebut diambil terlebih dahulu kemudian transaksi pembayaran dilakukan apabila barang tersebut sudah laku. Sri Iswati menjaga warung tersebut dari pagi sampai malam dan lewat usaha tersebut mereka dapat menyekolahkan anak serta mampu mencukupi kebutuhan setiaphari.

loans.use: To purchase goods

loans.name: Adama

texts.en: Adama sells her food items in Makeni town of Sierra Leone.  She uses her friend's veranda to place her goods.  With 4 children and an unemployed husband, she needs to increase her stock to generate more income.  She is, therefore, requesting a loan of $700 for this purpose.  Adama is 36 years old.

loans.use: Adama needs additional money to help her purchase enough stock to sell and generate sufficient profits.

loans.name: Maisa

texts.es:
Maisa is a very pleasant and persevering 23 year old woman. Originally from the town of Cuzco, she has lived in the city of Juliaca for the last two years. She finished secondary school and immediately sought to work to earn her own income and to pay for her higher qualifications. After saving enough money, she decided to open a small soft drinks outlet as the space available for this purpose was located in a very strategic and commercial city of Juliaca.

The desire of this young woman is to increase the stock of her merchandise, with the aim of substantially increasing her sales and to continue her current business.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Maisa, es una muchacha muy alegre y perseverante de 23 años de edad, natural del departamento de Cuzco, hace 2 años radica en al ciudad de Juliaca, terminó sus estudios secundarios e inmediatamente buscó trabajar para generar sus propios ingresos y así lograr cubrir sus estudios superiores, luego de reunir una buena cantidad de dinero decidió abrir una pequeña tiende de bebidas gaseosas y refrescos, ya que el espacio que disponía para este fin se encontraba ubicada en un lugar estratégico y muy comercial de la ciudad de Juliaca. El deseo de esta empeñosa muchacha es aumentar el stock de su mercadería, con el fin de incrementar sustancialmente sus ventas y poder mantener activo su negocio.

loans.use: Additional capital to purchase stock and to offer a greater variety of soft drinks

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma is a 45 year old widow with five children, ages 2 to 18 years old. She and her husband also take care of two other children, ages 2 and 5. In 2006, Mwajuma began selling charcoal seller, and everyday she works from 9am to 7pm at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Mayngul

texts.en: M. Mayngul is 39-years old. She is married and has 4 children. For 8 years, Mayngul has been selling rice in the local market of the city. and she is an expert in rice. Rice is very popular staple food in Tajikistan. One of the most widely spread meals made of rice is called “plov”. “Plov” is cooked very often, moreover you can hardly find any family occasion which can be conducted without that delicious meal. There are various types of “plov”, and each depends upon the meat and the rice that are used for cooking. Mayngul is not only rice, but her clients seek her advice in which rice to choose for which recipe. She is requesting a loan of $600 for the term of 9 months. She will spend the loan to upgrade and replenish her stock. Mayngul thanks everyone for their support and she assures she will repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase more rice for selling

loans.name: Block C North 2003-2 Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Rose F.. She currently sells beer and is requesting a loan to open up a bar. Rose is 30 years old and is married to a peasant. She has three children, ranging from age 7 to 15, all of whom go to school. Each week, Rose makes approximately 80 Sudanese pounds in profit. With the extra capital from her loan, she hopes to open up a bar.

Rose is joined in her small group by Poni S., Juru L., Ruth K., and Jane A.. Poni sells vegetables at the market (like okra and cabbages) and wants to expand her business. Juru sells charcoal at home and wants a loan to pay school fees for her children. Ruth sells bread at the market and wants to build an oven. Jane sells beans and posho at the market and is requesting a loan to open up a bar.

loans.use: To open up a bar.

loans.name: Brigther's Upendo B Group

texts.en:
Brigther is a married woman with 4 children who are 11, 9, 6, and 3 years old. She owns and operates a small food vending store, which she started in 2007. Every day, she works extremely hard from 8 am to 5 pm at her business and, in doing so, she can earn a monthly profit of approximately $250 from her sales.

Brigther now requests a loan in order to buy more food items, such as rice, maize, flour, meat, vegetables, and bananas for her business. Importantly, she will share the loan proceeds with her subgroup members, Hamida and Scola, who have their own businesses in clothing sales and food sales.

loans.use: To improve and expand her business by purchasing additional food

loans.name: Mwajuma's Tujiamini Group

texts.en:
Mwajuma is 26 years old. She is married with 4 children aged 9, 6, 4 and 1. She has been a phone voucher, beans and charcoal seller since 2008. Every day, she works from 8am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Mwajuma is now looking for a loan to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Mwanausi.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La señora Sonia es una persona sacrificada y muy trabajadora, soltera tiene 2 hijos menores. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropas y cosméticos de forma ambulante y bajo pedido. Su venta mas fuerte lo hace dentro del mercado general de abastos y zonas cercanas de su vivienda.

Los primeros días de la semana levanta pedidos y a partir del miércoles hace la entrega y cobranzas de su mercaderías, tiene clientelas formadas, con este trabajo lo cría a sus pequeños y lo hace estudiar.
texts.en:
Sonia is a self sacrificing and hardworking woman. She is single and has two young children. She dedicates herself to the sale of clothing and costmetics as a traveling salesperson and by order. She gets the most sales at the general market and in areas close to her home.

During the first days of the week she takes orders and starting on Wednesdays she delivers and collects payments for her merchandise. She has established clients and with this work she is able to raise her children and provide an education for them.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise like clothing, general merchandise and cosmetics.

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.es:
Bernarda inicio hace 3 años con el negocio porque en el habitacional donde vive sus vecinas y amigas se dedicaban a la venta de algún producto así que ella decidió vender perfumes con eso ayudaría a su marido con los gastos y tendría tiempo de cuidar a su hijo ya que cuando nació tuvo que dejar su empleo para atenderlo.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses para poder instalar un local de perfumería en los mercados y vender no solo de catalogo, sino de marcas reconocidas las cuales solo maneja sobre pedido ya que son caras.
texts.en:
Three years ago Bernarda began her business because in the neighborhood where her neighbors and friends live, they sell one product or another, so she decided to sell perfume and in this way she would be able to help her husband with the expenses and have time to take care of her son because when he was born she had to leave her job to take care of him. She needs a loan for US$400, which will be repaid in 6 months, to be able to install a perfume locale in the markets and sell not only by catalog sales but also well known brands which she sells only by special order because they are expensive.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: open a locale in the market for her perfume business

loans.name: Mukadam

texts.en: Mukadam A. is married and lives with her husband and three children.  While her husband works as a labourer in their village, Mukadam manages the shop she opened three years ago selling kitchen supplies.  Having started this business to help contribute to her family's income and standard of living, Mukadam now sees the potential for a significant expansion by purchasing additional inventories of kitchen supplies.  This will increase her profits and allow her to start saving money for her children's education.  Therefore, Mukadem is requesting a loan of $750, which she will use to increase her shop's inventory.

loans.use: To purchase a greater quantity of kitchen supplies for resale.

loans.name: Chhae

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhae N., 25, is married and lives with her husband and young child in the Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a true entrepreneur who has a business grinding rice crops. She has a big mill and is able to make $10 a day. Her father ran the machine before he retired.  

Mrs. Chhae N. would like to take out a loan of $1000 to purchase a big grinding mill to rent to the farmers in the village.

loans.use: To purchase a big grinding mill.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Berta es socia del Banco Comunal Suni.
Berta es madre soltera, tiene 30 años y 1 hijo, Berta tiene una tienda en su casa ubicada en la selva de Palmapampa que se ubica a 7 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde vende pantalones, polos, ropa de bebe, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Berta necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa de bebe.
Los sueños de Berta son construir el segundo piso de su casa, surtir con mas productos su tienda.
texts.en:
Berta is a member of the Community Bank “Suni”. Berta is a single mother. She is 30 years old and she has a son. She lives in the Palmapampa forest, 7 hours away from the city of Ayacucho, where she sells pants, sweaters, baby clothes, and others. She purchases all her products in the city of Lima. Berta needs a loan of 1000 soles ($325), which she will use to purchase baby clothes. Berta’s dream is to build a second floor in her house and to diversify her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase baby clothes

loans.name: Unice

texts.en:
Unice is married to Bernard S. and they are blessed with three children. She has been a very hard-working woman during her whole life just to sustain her family .She was forced by her parents to get married early because they were unable to pay her school fees and so she dropped out of school. This has made Unice very worried when she sees her friends doing well. In the cause of hard work, she encountered some challenges in life such as the death of her father and poor health. These challenges made life miserable for her until the year 2007 when she discovered GHAPE as a source of relief and became a member.

In that same year of 2007, she received her pioneer loan of 40,000 FRS CFA and the repayment was made promptly. She is now asking for a loan of 100,080 FRS which she will use to buy red palm oil. She is convinced the business will progress because of the experience she has in the business and because she is considered trustworthy by the members in her community. Operating this business in her community will shorten the distance her neighbors have to go to purchase palm oil which is a big expense for them. Unice plans to use the profit from her loan to pay her children's school fees, feed them, and to take care of their medical expenses if they are sick and taken to the hospital. She prefers to received a loan from GHAPE because of the trust she has in GHAPE; the method of repayment is comfortable and convenient.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Buying and selling of red palm oil

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.ru: Назарова Шарифа проживает в городе Вахдат.Возраст 46 лет, замужем и имеет семерых детей. Образование среднее. Уже 10 лет обеспечивает семью , тем , что работает На рынке. Торгует детской одеждой. К весне планирует завезти весенний товар и поэтому обратилась к нам за кредитом . Погасить кредит сможет в течение 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sharifa N. lives in Vakhdat. She is 46 years old and is married with seven children. She has a high school diploma. For the past 10 years she has been making a living by selling children's clothes at the local market. She is applying for a loan that would allow her to supply goods ahead of the spring season. She would be able to repay the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to supply goods ahead of the spring season

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa A. is 63 years old. She is married and has given birth to seven children: three girls and four boys. All of them are out of school and living independently.

Her husband is a farmer. However, he doesn’t go the farm any longer because he has lost his eyesight. His predicament forces Adwoa to work very hard in order to provide daily bread for the household and pay all the hospital bills. She lives with her husband and some grandchildren in a family house in a small farming community called Hweakwae in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the dwellers of this community is farming.

Adwoa sells vegetables such as tomatoes, onions and garden eggs (similar to eggplant) and tilapia on a table top in the market square. She procures her products in Nkawkaw, a nearby city in the region.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Somos Catrachos Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario somos catrachos esta integrado por tres clientes, todos tienen negocios en barrios muy cerca del mercado, se conocen muy bien, la sra. Etelvina M. tiene un puesto de abarroteria en el mercado de nacaome , de ella dependen 5 hijos, ella tiene 57 años de edad y radica en la aldea el chorro, goscoran, valle. ella necesita el credito apra comprar mas productos que vende, ella necesita surtir su negocio ya que las exigencias de los clientes son muchas y rapido se queda sin unos productos que tienen mucha demanda.
la sra. Bernarda R. tiene 48 año de edad ella radica en el barrio brisas del sur, tiene 3 dependientes, su esposo don concepcion villalobos es zapatero y el repara zapatos en el mercado, los dos juntos se ayudan para salir adelante con su hogar, ella realiza la venta de refrescos y leña, esta la vende en la colonia donde vive, ella necesita el credito para comprar mas refrescos, el sueño de los dos es tener una zapateria en su casa de habitacion.
la sra. Maria Villalobos tiene 20 años de edad y vive en el barrio suyapa desde hace 10 años, es soltera y se dedica a la satreria y venta de ropa, ella necesita el credito para comprar telas, hilos, broches, zipers,, su deso es ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
The supportive group "We are Hondureños" consists of three clients who have businesses in neighborhoods very close to the market and are well known there. Etelvina M. has a job in a grocery store in the Nacaome market. She is 57 with five dependent children. She is settled in the small village of El Chorro in the Goascoran Valley. She needs this loan in order to buy more products to sell. She needs to stock her business well, given that her clients' demands are many and she quickly runs out of in-demand products. Bernarda R. is 48 and is settled in the Brisas del Sur neighborhood with three dependents. Her husband, Don Concepcion Villalobos, is a cobbler who repairs shoes in the market. The two together help each other with household responsibilities. Bernarda sells soft drinks and firewood in the colony where she lives. She needs this loan to buy more soft drink inventory. The couple's shared dream is to have a shoe repair shop in the house where they live. Maria Villalobos is 20 years old and has lived in the Suyapa neighborhood for 10 years. She is single and works as a tailor and also sells clothes. She needs this loan to buy materials, thread, snap fasteners, zippers, etc. She hopes to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of groceries and soft drinks, firewood, sewing supplies and clothing.

loans.name: Manuel Genaro

texts.en:
Manuel is a member of the Virgen Asunta Village Bank in the town of Urco, just outside the city of Calca and about one hour from the city of Cusco. Manuel is 48 years old and married with one young daughter (pictured below—her head was shaved to get rid of head lice).

Manuel has a small dairy farm with 36 cows, which he has had for the past four years. Prior to that, he worked with his mother, Yoni, on her dairy farm. Manuel sells milk to PRONA, a government program that provides free milk to poor schoolchildren. The program buys his milk for 1.70 soles per liter (US 55 cents). Manuel produces about 300 liters of milk per day.

Manuel is requesting a loan of 2000 soles to buy cornhusks to store in his grain silo to feed his cows. He expects this amount to fill an entire silo of 200 cubic meters. Each silo will last him for about six months. Manuel wants to continue to buy more cows and expand his farm. His goal is to eventually produce 1000 liters of milk per day.

Manuel has pledged to repay his loan in full and on time.

loans.use: Buy cornhusks to feed cows

loans.name: Ulfat Nisah M.iqbal Group

texts.en:
My name is Ulfat nisah and I have been residing in a city named Vehari, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Vehari city is famous for its shrines. My husband has a business selling garments. He sells both ladies & gentlemen’s garments to different cloth shops. He buys garments from a city named “Multan” at cheap rates and sells to the cloth shops and earns a good profit. He has been doing this work for the past 6 years. I prepare embroidered clothes on order and earn income. I invest all the income from my husband’s garment business. I am applying for a loan to buy garments to increase the profit of my husband. 

I’m leading this group for another lady who is also a citizen of Vehari, and her name is Nasreen mai. She runs a food selling business and she requires supplies (lentils, spices and cooking oil) to expand the food business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy garments to sell.

loans.name: Dominga Anastacia

texts.es: Dominga Anastacia Pérez M. tiene 55 años de edad. Es madre soltera. La actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio. Dominga inicio este negocio por que tenia que sufragar los gastos de su familia. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la elaboración de repostería, pero este negocio no fue tan rentable como ella pensaba porque tenia que invertir una gran cantidad en materia prima. Por lo que decide incursionar en la venta de mercadería en general ya que este negocio le gusto más. Le financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de bolsos, ropa interior, cosméticos entre otros.  El sueño de Dominga es poseer una mini tienda.
texts.en:
Dominga Anastacia Pérez M. is 55, and she is a single mother. She sells general merchandise. She has been doing this for four years. Dominga started this business because she had to pay the family expenses. Previously she made pastry. But, this business was not as profitable as she thought because she had to invest in large amounts of raw materials. That is why she decided to start selling general merchandise. She likes this business more. The loan she is asking for is for working capital to buy handbags, underwear, and cosmetics, among other things. Dominga’s dream is to have a mini store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn A. is married and has two children. She has a junior high school education. Evelyn is a seamstress and also sells fabrics in Abotoase, near Hohoe. Her husband is a teacher in the Ghana Education Service, who lives on a low income.

Evelyn uses her income to help her husband take care of home and parenting expenses. Evelyn will use the loan to buy fabrics to sell and sew for her customers. With the profits Evelyn plans to save.

loans.use: Buy variety of fabrics to sell and sew.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La señora Nancy, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Abejitas”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 38 años y 03 hijas que dependen de ella y son la razón por la cual se esfuerza día a día. 

Teniendo la profesión de Técnica en Industrias Textilas, no dudo en implementar su propio taller de costura, en un local muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en su misma casa, lleva varios años dedicándose a la Confección de Vestidos, tanto de damas, caballeros y niños. Con el trabajo que realiza esta muy contenta, por que le gusta y así genera sus propios ingresos para aportar en su hogar.
Nos cuenta que le va muy bien en sus ventas, trabaja con pedidos de sus clientes anticipadamente.

Uno de sus sueños y meta por lograr, es implementar su propio taller de confección de vestidos, con maquinas industriales modernas.

En la actualidad continua con sus confecciones de vestidos y tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuden a su casa para realizar sus trabajos y pedidos, es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con la amabilidad que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, comprará telas en metros, de diferentes géneros, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones. 

Nancy, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nancy is a member of the “Las Abejitas (The Little Bees)” Communal Bank in the District of Moyobamba, Province of Moyobamba, Region of San Martin. She is married, 38 years old, and has three daughters who depend on her and are the reason for which she works day to day.

Being a technician in the textiles industry, there are no doubts in her opening her own seamstress shop in a well equipped location in her own home. She has several years of experience in the sale of fine clothes for ladies, gentlemen, and children. She is very happy with the work she is doing because she likes it and is earning her own income to contribute to her household. She tells us that her sales are going very well, and she works with advance orders from her customers. One of her dreams and goals to achieve is to open her own seamstress shop for the sale of fine clothes with modern, industrial machines. At the moment she continues with her sale of clothes and has a faithful clientele who come to her home daily to see her work and orders. It is she who personally attends to them with the friendliness that characterizes her.

With this loan of 1000 PEN she will purchase fabrics by the yard of different types, instruments she uses such as scissors, sewing needles for hand and machine, pins, and buttons.

Today Nancy feels like a very fulfilled woman with more goals to reach and dreams to realize. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos movement for helping her to start her business and to the many growing enterprising women.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabrics by the yard and different colors of threads

loans.name: Esiaonam

texts.en: Esiaonam S. is married and has 4 dependents. She has received no formal education. Esiaonam has been selling processed fish in Bantoma since 1994. Her husband is a trader. Esiaonam uses her income to pay school fees and other bills. Esiaonam will use the loan to purchase more fish for processing and sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esiaonam plans to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: Esiaonam will use the loan to purchase more fish for processing and sale.

loans.name: Blanca Azucena

texts.es:
Blanca vive en el barrio Chiquinquirá en el sector la playa en Azogues, tiene 47 años de edad,  es divorciada y tienes 2 hijos de 21 y 18 años, aún viven con ella son solteros y estudian en la universidad,  viven en casa propia.

Trabaja en el comercio de funeraria desde  hace 20 años en sociedad con su madre,  en la calle sucre en el centro de Azogues, su servicio es las  24 horas del día y el negocio les deja una buena utilidad, las dificultades de este negocio es tener que levantarse las madrugadas para atender a sus clientes.

El préstamo que solicita los utilizara para ampliar el negocio comprando cajas, a saber que el precio de cada una de ellas es de 300 hasta 1200 dólares, incluida la capilla ardiente individual.

Blanca es socia hace 3 o 4 años aproximadamente  y le gusta los beneficios que aquí le brindan, sus metas son viajar por el país incrementando su negocio.
texts.en:
Blanca lives in the Chiquinquirá neighborhood in the La Playa sector in Azogues. She is 47 years old, is divorced, and has 3 children who are 21 and 18 years old. They still live with her; they are not yet married and are studying in the university. The family lives in their own house. Blanca has been in business with her mother in funerary services for 20 years. Their business is located on Sucre Street in the center of Azogues. The service is 24 hours per day and the business provides them a good living. The problem with this business is having to get up very early in the morning to tend to their clients. The loan she is requesting will be used to expand the business by buying coffins because the price of each one is between $300.00 and $1,200.00, including individual funeral chapel services. Blanca has been a member for 3 or 4 years approximately. She likes the services provided here. Her goals are to travel the country and to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy coffins

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos G. is a 30 year old, newly married man who operates his pool business in Mukuru, Nairobi. He describes himself as social, friendly and God fearing.

Amos has been running his business for the last six months though he also works as a driver for public service vehicles. 

He has requested a first loan of KES 20000 in order to clear payment of the pool table. He desires to develop rental houses in Nairobi and give his family a good life.

Faulu Kenya

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Clear pool table payment.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is twenty years old. She is single and has no children. She lives alone in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Wiawso, in the Western Region. She works hard to make a living. Esther trades in all kinds of food items and vegetables. She sells on a table top at the market square. She buys her goods from Kumasi at affordable prices. Esther has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy food items to resell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen V. is from the village of Bunawan. He is 38 years old. Helen is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Helen owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Helen has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 1,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Helen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Helen is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Helen from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is into tailoring and the sale of sarongs. She has been in this business for a long time. She is 53 years old and married with five children.

Roseline hopes for the loan of N50,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Carmelito

texts.en: Mrs. Carmelita E. is from the village of Punta Sulong, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is married and blessed with four adult children. Carmelita owns and operates a business selling fish and shrimps from her fish pond. She has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns PHP 5,000 net from her business. In 2007, Carmelita joined PMPC to access their programs and services. Currently, she's obtaining her 5th loan of PHP 12,500 which will be used as additional capital for her fish pond business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her fishpond business

loans.name: Chuluun

texts.en:
Chuluun M. is 40 years old and lives with his wife, five daughters and son in Uvs province in western Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. His oldest five children, all daughters, attend a local secondary school and his youngest son will soon start kindergarten. M. operates a coal and firewood trading business in his town. In Mongolia, coal and firewood are two common fuel sources used to heat homes and gers. His business is especially profitable during the frigid Mongolian winter months. M. also grows vegetables in the spring and summer months and plans to begin selling them after next years harvest to supplement his income. He is a very hardworking businessman and says, "I am working hard to better my family and give my children every opportunity to live happy lives." He is requesting a 250,000 tugrug (~175 USD) loan to purchase coal for his business. About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase coal for his business

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La señora Hilda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres con Éxito II”, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es casada, tiene 43 años y es madre de 03 hijos, los 03 que aun dependen de ella.

Hilda, es una mujer muy dedicada a su familia, alegre y carismática, cualidad que le ayuda bastante en el negocio que maneja. Se dedica a la venta de Nutrientes (Omnilife).

 Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00, comprará productos de Omnilife como: Magnus, Optimus, Aloe Beta, Omniplus. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de otra vitrina, para exhibir sus productos.

Hilda, es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Ms. Hilda T. is a member of the Mujeres con Éxito II Communal Bank in the Banda de Shilcayo district of the San Martin province and department. She is a 43-year-old married mother with 3 dependent children.

Hilda is a woman who is cheerful, charming, and very devoted to her family. These characteristics help her out a lot with the business that she manages. She sells Omnilife health products for a living.

With this 800.00 PEN loan, she will purchase Omnilife products like Magnus, Optimus, Aloe Beta, and Omniplus. She will invest part of the money in purchasing another display case for her products.

Hilda is an example for many female small business owners; with perseverance, they shall realize their dreams. She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her launch her own business and for helping other women grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase health products

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
La señora Nieves es socia del Banco Comunal “Lupakas” desde hace 1 año atrás, del distrito de Pilcuyo, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 35 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Estudió secundaria completa y se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado.
Nieves nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital y comprar ovejas.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 1,700.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar una vaca.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa en Ilave y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y la puntualidad que hay con las socias.
texts.en:
Nieves, 35, has been a member of the "Lupakas" communal bank in Pilcuyo district, El Collao province, Puno department, for a year. She is married and has two children. She completed secondary school and she raises cattle. Nieves tells us that she used her first, 500 new sol, loan from Manuela Ramos Movement to buy sheep. She now needs 1700 new soles to buy a cow. Her future dream is to have her home in Ilave and that her children become professionals. What she likes best about her communal bank is the savings and the punctuality of her fellow members.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: Karina tiene 32 años de edad, y cuya familia esta integrada por su esposo y sus dos preciosos hijos y juntos viven en su propia casa. Es así que hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de comida, en una pequeña instalación que acondiciono dentro de su vivienda, en donde ofrece por las mañanas desayuno y por las tarde almuerzo, complementando parte de su servicio en la venta de bebidas gasificadas. El encanta mucho el trabajo que realiza, ya que le hacen sentirse útil, además cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos. De esta manera su negocio le ha dado muchas rentas ya que por ubicarse en una zona céntrica en donde los trabajadores de moto taxi se estacionan frente a su establecimiento, motivo suficiente para aumentar la demanda de su comida. Para Karina espera que su negocio le sea prospero y pueda con el tiempo construir un restaurante. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP por lo que espera ser muy cumplida con sus cuotas, asimismo considera que es bueno trabajar con su grupo comunal ya que todos ellos son muy responsables. Ella invertirá con el crédito que solicita en la compra de insumos para preparar comida además de abastecerse de bebidas, así mismo derivará parte del préstamo en los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Karina is 32 years old and her family consists of her husband and two beautiful children who all live together in their own home. For the past two years she has been selling prepared food from a small area within her home. She offers breakfast in the morning and lunch in the afternoon. She also sells soft drinks. She likes her work very much. It makes her feel useful and she also gets help from her children. Her business has provided a good income, and the moto-taxi drivers often park in front of her establishment, thereby increasing demand for her food. Katrina hopes that her business will continue to thrive and that she will eventually be able to build a restaurant. This will be her third loan through MFP and she intends to be on time with her payments. She thinks that it’s great to work with communal banks. She will use the money from this loan to buy food supplies and drinks. She will also use a portion of the money to pay for her children’s schooling.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buys food supplies and drinks

loans.name: Atom

texts.en:
Atom R. is 39 years old and married to a peasant. She has eight school-aged children. Atom is currently in the business of selling charcoal and beer from her home, and is requesting a loan to purchase more crates of beer to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay her children's school fees and build them a house to settle in.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Alfa Omega Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento ALFA Y OMEGA ya trabajo un ciclo en nuestra Institución, es un Banco que ya esta en su segundo ciclo esta conformado por 11 integrandes 9 Mujeres.y 2 Varones, las socias se dedican al comercio y venta D. verturas, cosmeticos, equipos D. computación y otros

La Sra.BERTHA es la presidenta del banco y tiene 3 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar ella se dedica a la venta D. material plásticos y es una persona bastante dinámica, responasble y el dinero del prestamoutilizara para la compra D. mercaderia y  aumentara su capital D. trabajo.

La Sra. TANIA Ella es la secretaria en el Banco y tiene 1 hijo pequeño, es madre soltera y sola mantiene su hogar uno D. sus deseos es ver a su hijo profesional, se dedica a venta D. computadoras y con el prestamo ha logrado aumentar su capital D. trabajo y así para poder mejorar su negocio y su calidad D. vida.

La Sra. ROCIO Es la tesorera en el Banco y es una persona joven, ella estudia y tabaja  se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza por catalogo, con el prestamo ha logrado comprar en cantidad sus productos que estaban en oferta como ser perfumes, desodorantes, talcos y otros, lo que permitirá mejorar sus ingresos económicos y es estudiante en la Universidad Escuela Hotelera administración turistica.

Todas las socias son personas responsables dinamicas trabajadoras que en muchos casos mantienen solas el hogar y estan muy agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The communal Bank of Emprendimiento ALFA and OMEGA is in its second cycle with 9 women and 2 men, all of the members work selling cosmetics, computer supplies and other products.

Bertha is the president of the communal bank and has 3 children who attend school. She works selling plastic products, and is a very dynamic and responsible person. Her portion of the loan will help her purchase merchandise and grow her business.

Tania is the secretary of the communal bank and is the single mother of one young child. One of her dreams is to see her son get a good education and have a profession. Tania works selling computer supplies and her portion of the loan will help her build her business and improve the quality of life for her and her son.

Rocio is the treasurer of the bank and is still quite young. She is studying still and working selling cosmetics. Her portion of the loan will be used to purchase beauty products she can sell such as perfumes, powders and cosmetics. This will help her generate income to pay for her studies towards a hospitality degree at the University.

All of the members are responsible and hardworking people. In many cases, they have to maintain their families on their own, and they are very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the support and the confidence they receive through the loans.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to help grow their respective businesses

loans.name: Ndèye

texts.en: Ndèye N. is 37 years old, married and the mother of three children. She has been a member of the Village Bank "MBarry Gouytane" for two and a half years. With the loan she will buy more vegetables to sell at the market. The income generated from this activity will allow her to improve the living conditions and health of her family.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta E. is from the village of Magsaysay Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Julieta is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Julieta operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, candies, a coconut wine called "tuba," etc., in the local community. Julieta has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Julieta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julieta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This will be the second loan taken out by Julieta from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Salma's Group

texts.en:
Parveen wants a loan to buy construction supplies (cement, bricks) for her construction supply-selling business. Khursheed wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business. Tahira wants a loan to buy clothes for her clothes-selling business. Abida wants a loan to buy materials (lentils, cooking oil and rice) for her food stand. 

Salma is the group leader of the above-mentioned ladies. They all live in a city called Lahore, famous in Pakistan for its historical places and its Punjabi foods. She is a mother of five kids: three daughters and two sons. All of them are enrolled in school and are getting an education. She is an uneducated lady but She wants to raise her kids with an education because it's necessary for their future. Her husband supports him in her dream by getting up early to bring the children in to school. 

She operates a sewing business and her husband operates her dairy business. They both earn well from their businesses. They save a part of their income in a "committee" for their children and will utilize this money for their higher education. Currently, they need a loan to buy another dairy cow to expand their dairy business.

loans.use: To buy another dairy cow for dairy business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cooking gas to sell

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene started to be an active entrepreneur in 2008. She invested in a rice farm and a 'sari-sari' (variety) store. Today, she has a hectare of rice field and continues to run her store. She says that by God’s grace she was able to manage the store and farm and keep it running until now. She is also thankful that her businesses have been able to sustain her family. 

Arlene is married and has three children who go to school. She hopes for her businesses to grow so she has a stable income. She applied for a loan of Php 15,000, which she will use to purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers and also supplies for her 'sari-sari' store.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Rabbi Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
M. is a 31-year-old woman who describes herself as hard-working.  She is married to a farmer and has 3 children between the ages of 4 and 12 years old.    M. would like to provide her children with quality education up to university level.

For the past 8 years, M. has operated a 'cold store' selling items such as frozen fish and chicken.  She will use the loan to buy more fish and chicken for her store.  M. hopes to eventually expand her business by buying more goods to sell to customers. 
 
M. is the leader of the group called 'Rabbi', which means 'father'.  There are 12 members in this group.  The other members of the group operate retail businesses offering items such smoked fish, bananas and plantains.  All of the members know each other well and live in the same area. They hope to expand their businesses with this loan.

loans.use: Purchase cartons of frozen fish and chicken

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more slippers

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es: Rosaura, de 21 años, vive en la casa de sus padres.Desde hace 4 años, vende  ropa y zapatos  que comercializa  a su clientela fija, y que  atiende llevando  la mercadería  a las casas de sus clientes. Vende muy bien los modelos nuevos que adquiere, además comercializa en su centro de estudios, a sus  compañeras de clase, que le hacen regulares pedidos. Ella ofrece al crédito y acuerda con sus clientes  para cancelar en cómodas cuotas. De esta manera  tiene la libertad de generarse mayores ganancias, por lo que ha visto que su negocio es muy rentable, y a futuro quiere incrementar la cantidad de clientes.Es la tercera vez  que tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete ser  muy responsable con el pago de sus cuotas, además  agradece  a todas las personas que hicieron posible el  préstamo, pues le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Rosaura tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de cantidad de prendas de vestir y zapatos para damas, pues tiene varios pedidos por cumplir.
texts.en:
Rosaura, 21, lives in her parents’ house. For four years she has been selling clothes and shoes, which she markets to her steady clientele, and she brings merchandise to her customers’ homes. She does a good job of selling the new styles that she buys, selling to classmates at her school, who make regular orders. She extends credit to customers and lets them pay in easy installments. This gives her the freedom to generate greater earnings. From what she has seen, her business is very profitable and in the future she wants to increase the amount of customers. This is the third time that Rosaura has a loan from Microfinanzas Prisma and she commits to being very responsible with her payments. In addition, she thanks all of the people that made the loan possible. It will be very helpful to her in the progress of her business. Rosaura has planned to invest the capital requested in the quantity purchase of women’s clothing and shoes since has several orders to fulfill.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Mujeres Esforzadas 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Damiana is the coordinator of her group 'Mujeres Esforzadas' (Forceful Women), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally--many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the slums north of Santo Domingo, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and six children.

Damiana is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling cakes by buying the necessary ingredients. She will use the profits to build a second room for her children as well as to save for their education. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: A sack of sugar, a sack of flour, flavoring, and eggs

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson D. is from the village of Alibago, Enrile, Cagayan. He is 47 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Nelson raises livestock. His main source of income comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Nelson has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Nelson joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelson has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. Nelson is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional animals. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Nelson from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay his children's tuition fees. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
