Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional animals to raise and sell.

loans.name: Sixto Aguado

texts.es: Sixto tiene 23 años de edad el es soltero vive en la casa de sus padres, casa de  material noble ubicado en el distrito de La Tinguiña. El se dedica a prestar servicio de transporte en vehiculo alquilado, el viene realizando esta actividad hace 2 años, cuenta con licencia de conducir a dos.  Sixto es un joven emprendedor y muy activo tiene muchos sueños y objativos uno de ellos es poder adquirir su propio vehiculo, con el dinero que solicita realizara algunos gastos personales.
texts.en:
Sixto is 23 and single. He lives in his parents' home, a well-built home located in the La Tinguiña district. He offers a transport service in a rented vehicle. He has been doing this for 2 years, and he has a class 2 driver's license. Sixto is a young and very active entrepreneur. He has many dreams and goals, one of which is to be able to acquire his own vehicle. With the requested loan he will cover some personal costs.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: personal costs

loans.name: Israel Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Israel lo integran Liseth María Z. de 38 años, Hellen Haideé F. C. de 25 años y Juana Verónica D. de 40 años. Liseth, su coordinadora, se dedica a la venta de ropas y calzados de segunda mano desde hace 2 años en el mercado Israel Levites de Managua, sin embargo en sus inicios hace 8 años ella vendía únicamente ropa de manera ambulante en los barrios de Managua. Hellen, tiene una sala de belleza en el mismo mercado, anteriormente ella trabajaba a domicilio pero recogió dinero y con la oportunidad que encontró en los créditos logró hacerse de un tramo en el mercado donde actualmente trabaja. Juana al igual que sus socias tiene un tramo en el mercado, el local de ella era anteriormente un comedor donde vendía también licores y por el motivo que parecía más una cantina que un comedor decidió suspender la venta de estos productos y ahora sólo vende comida.

Estas mujeres utilizarán el crédito para la compra de productos e insumos para sus respectivos negocios.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Israel" has 3 members: Liseth María Z., 38, Hellen Haideé F. C., 25, and Juana Verónica D., 40. Lisbeth, the coordinator, has sold used clothing and footwear for 2 years in the Israel Levites market in Managua. When she started out 8 years ago she worked as a street vendor selling only clothing in the neighborhoods of Managua. Hellen has a beauty salon in the same market. Previously she worked as a domestic, but she gathered together some money and with the opportunity that she encountered with these loans she managed to get herself a stall in the market where she currently works. Juana, along with the other members, has a stall in the market, which was previously a restaurant that used to also sell liquor, but since it seemed more like a bar than a restaurant she decided to suspend the sale of those products and now sells only food. These women will use the loan to buy products and supplies for their respective businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy products and supplies for their respective businesses.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: La Sra. Luz Marina A. S.   ella  es Trabajadora activo  del colegio público “CERMA” de San Rafael Del Sur  desempeñándose como Maestra de Educación Primaria, tiene  treinta y un años de trabajar para esta empresa,. Ha tenido  doce créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación los cuales le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Luz Marina A. S. is an active worker at the “CERMA” public school in San Rafael Del Sur, in the position of elementary school teacher. She has worked for this organization for thirty-one years. She has had twelve loans with CEPRODEL, which she has used to buy construction materials to improve the home where she lives. The loans have benefited her greatly, because they have allowed her to improve her living conditions and those of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying stones, sand and cement

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
This is Perla J., 54, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Reynaldo J., an Overseas Filipino Worker, and mother of two young adults who are currently working and helping out with the family’s finances. At this time, she is working hard to continue provision of their family’s everyday expenses.

Perla maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php300 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php25,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Perla dreams of being able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy orders for her customers.

loans.name: Haydie

texts.en:
Haydie S. is from the village of San Isidro, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 23 years old. Haydie is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Haydie owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Haydie has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2300 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Haydie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Haydie is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Haydie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is 31 years old. She is married and has five children between the ages of 13 and 5 months. Two of her children are enrolled in school. Her husband is a driver. Claudine sells various items in her shop. She has had this business for four months. With this loan she will buy more soap, sugar, and salt to sell. With the profit from the business she will pay school fees for her children. In the future she would like to own a big shop selling a variety of consumable goods.

loans.use: To buy more soap, sugar, and salt to sell

loans.name: Celia Ibeth

texts.es: La Sra. Celia Ibeth G. E. es trabajadora Activa del colegio público “Los E.” San Pablo desempeñándose como Maestra de Educación Primaria tiene Veinte y tres  años de trabajar para esta institución. Ha tenido  ocho  créditos con CEPRODEL y cada  uno los ha  realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción para  ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación y este lo está solicitando para ampliarle un cuarto más a su casa de habitación, de cuales  los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Celia Ibeth G. E. is an employee at the “Los E.” public school in San Pablo, working as a primary school teacher.  She has worked at this school for twenty-three years.  She has had eight credits with CEPRODEL, and used each one to buy construction materials to expand and improve her home.  She is requesting this loan to add another room.  The loans with CEPRODEL have greatly benefited her, as they have allowed her to improve her and her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase sand, cement, stone, cinder blocks.

loans.name: Jared

texts.en: Jared is a 30-year-old businessman. He operates a cereal shop where he sells beans, rice, mung beans and other grains. He has operated this business, in a densely-populated residential area, for two years and hopes to become a supplier of grain for more profits in the future. Jared is married and the father of two. He describes himself as hardworking and focused. Since joining Faulu, his economic status has improved and life has become better. He is requesting a loan of Kes. 50,000 to buy beans, rice, ndengu (mung beans) and other grains for sale. This loan is guaranteed by his group.

loans.use: To buy beans, rice, ndengu (mung beans) and other grains

loans.name: Mi Amigo Jesus Group

texts.es:
ARSENIA ES INTEGRANTE DE LA ALCANCÍA COMUNAL  “MI AMIGO JESÚS”. TODOS SON DEVOTOS DE JESÚS  ES POR ELLO LA DENOMINACIÓN DEL GRUPO DE COMERCIANTES QUE DIARIAMENTE SE ESFUERZAN PARA LOGRAR TENER GANANCIAS DE SUS NEGOCIOS, ESTA COMPUESTO POR 8 INTEGRANTES  Y DESDE EL 2007 PARTICIPAN EN EL PROGRAMA .ARSENIA EJERCE EL CARGO DE SECRETARIA DEL GRUPO. 
CASADA Y CON 6 HIJOS DE LOS CUALES 02 ESTÁN DEPENDIENDO DE ELLOS. ARSENIA A LOGRADA VENCER LA ADVERSIDAD NOS CUENTA, PUES CUANDO SU ESPOSO DEJO DE TRABAJAR PARA UNA EMPRESA MINERA POR RECORTE DE PERSONAL, ELLA CON SUS MENORES HIJOS SE INICIARON EN  EL NEGOCIO DE LA PREPARACIÓN Y VENTA DE TAMALES, PUES SU SAZÓN LA HACÍAN MAS RECOMENDABLE Y EMPEZÓ COMO AMBULANTE Y AHORA COLOCA SUS PRODUCTOS SOBRE PEDIDOS EN DIVERSAS ZONAS ALEDAÑAS A SU VIVIENDA HASTA CHOSICA.  SUS HIJOS MAYORES LOGRARON ESTUDIAR CARRERAS TÉCNICAS Y UNA DE SUS HIJAS LOGRO VIAJAR AL EXTRANJERO Y ENVÍA REMESAS PARA SU APOYO PUES ARSENIA TIENE A SU ÚLTIMO NIÑO CON EL SÍNDROME DE DOWN.
ARSENIA  SOLICITO EL PRÉSTAMO PARA INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE LOS INSUMOS PARA LA PREPARACIÓN DE LOS TAMALES  A ELLA LE ES CONVENIENTE COMPRAR EN CANTIDAD  MAÍZ PARA MOLER Y ACEITE EN LATA, HUEVOS, ACEITUNAS Y OTROS.
ARSENIA SUEÑA Y DESEARÍA  UNA MOLEDORA PARA  GRANOS DE MAIZ PUES LO HACE ARTESANALMENTE, UN SOPLETE QUE USA PARA AGILIZAR LA COCCIÓN DE LOS TAMALES PARA QUE LE DESCARGUE EL ESFUERZO YA QUE TIENE QUE LEVANTARSE VARIOS DÍAS A LA SEMANA A LAS 5.00AM PARA LA PREPARACIÓN DE SUS TAMALES.  MI AMIGO JESUS ES UNA ORGANIZACIÓN QUE PARTICIPAN ACTIVAMENTE Y ESTÁN CONTENTOS DE SER PARTICIPES DEL PROGRAMA PROSPERIDAD COMO PUEDEN APRECIAR EN LA FOTOGRAFÍA. AGRADECEN EL APOYO Y ESTÁN COMPROMETIDOS EN SER BUENOS SOCIOS.
texts.en:
Arsenia is a member of the “Mi Amigo Jesús” (My Friend Jesus) communal bank.  They are all devoted to Jesus, thus the group name.  They are a group of merchants who daily struggle to obtain profits from their businesses.  There are 8 members that have been participating in the program since 2007.  Arsenia is the group’s Secretary.

She is married and has 6 children, two of whom are still dependent on them.  Arsenia has managed to overcome adversity.  She tells us:  when her husband stopped working for a mining firm due to staff reductions, she and her minor children started making and selling tamales because her tasty way of making them made it advisable.  She started out as a street vendor and now she sells based on prior orders in various villages near her home; she goes as far as Chosica.  Her older children managed to study technical careers and one of her daughters managed to travel abroad and sends monthly stipends to help Arsenia because Arsenia’s youngest child has Down’s syndrome.

Arsenia requested the loan to buy ingredients to make tamales because it’s useful for her to be able to buy the corn in bulk to grind, the oil in cans, eggs, olives and others.

Arsenia dreams with having and wants to have a mill to grind the grains of maize because she currently does it by hand.  She also would like to have a stove to cook the tamales that will make things easier for her since she has to get up at 5am several days a week to prepare the tamales.

Mi Amigo Jesús is an organization whose members participate actively and are happy to be part of Prosperidad as can be seen in the photo.  They are grateful for the support and are committed to being good associates.

loans.use: To buy a corn mill.

loans.name: Janiffer

texts.en:
Janiffer is 33 years old, married with two children.  She has been running a health clinic so as to earn a living.  It is ten years since she started the business and she has been able to grow the business through Faulu Kenya.  

Janiffer gained experience for running a clinic because she was previously employed in a hospital.  She has requested 50,000 Kes to stock more medicine.

loans.use: To stock more medicine

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, es una madre de familia muy emprendedora, vive en casa de sus familiares, en compañía de su esposo y su hijo. Todos los días de la semana, Ana trabaja brindando el servicio de transporte público en su motocarro. En un inicio su esposo fue quien se dedicaba a esta actividad, pero tuvo una propuesta de empleo y para no dejar de percibir ganancias, así que ella tomó la posta de este trabajo. Han transcurrido un año dedicándose a esta labor, ha aprendido a tener destreza y habilidad en el manejo de éste vehículo. Se siente muy feliz por desarrollarse en esta actividad, asimismo le es muy rentable, con lo cual puede ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. En adelante anhela comprar su propio moto carro, de ese modo podrá alquilar la moto que tienen y así generarse ingresos adicionales. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar a tiempo sus cuotas; para así  acceder a posteriores ayudas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará llantas para su moto carro, para tener en buenas condiciones su motocarro.
texts.en: Ana is a mother and a very enterprising person. She lives in a house belonging to her family, in the company of her husband and their son. Every day of the week Ana provides public transport with the help of her motorcycle rickshaw. In the beginning it was her husband's business but he got a job offer and for the sake of keeping this source of income she took it up.  It has been one year since she started in the business, and she has learned the skills and abilities to drive such a vehicle. She is very happy to have started in the business especially because it is so profitable. She is able to contribute with her husband towards the household expenses. In the future she endeavors to purchase her own rickshaw, to be able to rent out the motorcycle they already have as an additional source of income. This is her second loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she knows she needs to make her payments on time to be eligible for any future loans. The loan she requests will be used to purchase tires for her rickshaw, to have a dependable vehicle.

loans.use: To purchase new tires.

loans.name: Allen

texts.en: Allen is a thirty-eight-year-old married female with two children who rents a house in Kasese. She has been dealing in secondhand clothes for the last seven years. She started her business with a capital of 100,000 UGX and later increased it to 1,500,000 UGX. Her hardship is the lack of customers during the rainy season. Her vision is to start a boutique and educate her children. Allen needs the loan to buy more clothes to resell.

loans.use: To buy secondhand clothes to resell.

loans.name: Desiderio Rolando

texts.es:
El señor Desiderio Rolando G. F. tiene 37 años de edad y vive en la casa de sus padres  en la comunidad de San Andres de esta ciudad de Tarija. Desiderio no es casado pero tiene un hijo. Desiderio se dedica desde hace mas de 20 años a la producción agrícola sacando al mercado productos como ser: papa, zanahoria, arveja, etc. Productos que saca a vender en el mercado campesino de esta ciudad. Desiderio quiere tener mejores ingresos para salir adelante , pero el nos cuenta que tiene la necesidad de comprar semillas de papa, abonos, remedios, etc. Es por eso que el crédito será destinado para la compra de dichos productos, para de ese modo poder incrementar sus ingresos.   
                                                                                                                                                                                                     
Desiderio nos cuenta que quiere mejorar las condiciones de vida que tiene, por eso nos dice que el próximo crédito que solicite sera para mejorar las condiciones de su casa donde vive.
texts.en: Desiderio Rolando G. F. is 37 years old and lives in his parents' house in the community of San Andres in the city of Tarija. Desiderio isn't married but he has a son. He has made a living for the past 20 years in agriculture, taking products such as potatoes, carrots, peas, etc., to sell at the city's country market. Desiderio wants to increase his income so he can keep making headway, but he tells us that he needs to purchase potato seeds, fertilizers and other items. He plans to use the loan he is requesting to purchase these products and in this way he can increase his income. Desiderio tells us that he wants to improve his living conditions, so the next loan that he requests will be to make improvements to his home.

loans.use: Purchase agricultural supplies

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha, de 55 años, natural del distrito de Ayna San Francisco; es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Alejandro de 55 años y sus 02 queridas hijas Mónica de 25 años y Zulema de 20 años; las cuales todavía dependen económicamente de elL. y lo que más desea es brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Desde muy joven a Martha le nació el gusto por las ventas de las prendas de vestir, es por ello que con el tiempo decidió dedicarse a L. venta de ropa. Actualmente tiene un pequeño puesto en un centro comercial llamado “Gamarrita” es aquí donde ofrece L. variedad de ropas nacionales e importadas; los fines de semana acude a distintas ferias que se realizan en diferentes pueblos de L. zona del Valle Río Apurimac ya que según manifiesta es allí donde mejores pagos obtiene por sus ventas. Viene trabajando 10 años en este negocio y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien le apoya en las ventas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre las prendas que están de moda en L. capital que es L. ciudad de lima, ya que así siente que se gana L. confianza de sus compradores, considera que lo más difícil es tener que transportar los pesados fardos de ropa a las distintas ferias, pero aún así no se da por vencida, ya que sabe que de esta actividad depende el bienestar de su familia. Con el tiempo, desea poner otra tienda en L. ciudad de Pichari distrito que viene desarrollándose y cuenta con mayor masa poblacional. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea acceder a otro crédito más adelante. En su banco comunal es una socia muy solidaria y siempre esta pendiente del bienestar de sus compañeros. Con los 3,000  nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ropa en L. ciudad de Lima, sobre todo prendas de verano; por que el calor es perenne en L. selva peruana.
texts.en:
Martha, age 55, is originally from the District of Ayna San Francisco. She is a cheerful hardworking woman who lives in her own home with her husband Alejandro, age 55, and their two beloved daughters, Mónica (age 25) and Zulema (age 20). Both of her children are still financially dependent on her. What she wants most is to provide her family with a better quality of life. As a young woman, Martha discovered her taste for fashion by selling clothes. Eventually she decided to open a clothing shop and now has a small booth at a shopping center called “Gamarrita” where she offers a variety of domestic and imported clothing. On the weekends, she travels to various fairs held in different towns in the Apurimac River Valley where she is able to sell her goods at better prices. Martha has been working in this business for ten years and has the support of her husband who helps with making sales. What she enjoys most about her work is advising her customers about which clothes are fashionable in the city of Lima and earning their trust. She considers the most difficult part to be transporting the heavy bundles of clothing to different fairs. However, she refuses to give up since the welfare of her family depends on her business. Eventually she hopes to open another shop in the city of Pichari, an area that is still developing and has a large population.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. Martha is willing to submit all of her payments on time because she wants to access another loan very soon. In her Communal Bank, she is a supportive member who is always concerned about the welfare of the rest of her group. The loan of 3000 PEN that she requested will be used to buy more clothes in Lima, mostly summer fashions since the heat is ever present in the Peruvian jungle.

loans.use: Purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy fish wholesale to add to current stock

loans.name: Azucenas Group

texts.es: El banco de Emprendimiento "AZUCENAS " es un Banco que se encuentra en su segundo  ciclo,  todas las socias  han  demostraron ser  personas responsables y trabajadoras, este grupo esta representada por las siguientes socias: como Presidenta esta la Sra. Ysabel quien es la líder y fundadora del grupo, tiene el negocio de venta de bisutería( Joyas para niñas, trabas para el cabello, sujetadores de cabello y  adornos)  ambulando por la Zona de  Valle Hermoso. Esta Casada  y tiene 2 hijos pequeños, y el crédito que solicitó es para la compra de Sujetadores de pelo y trabas para niñas en cantidad. Como Tesorera esta la  Sra. Emiliana  quien  esta Separada y tiene 3 hijas pequeñas y tiene como negocio Venta de Salchipapas y refrescos en la zona de la laguna  y solicitó el crédito para compra de papa y aceite para la elaboracion de las salchipapas es socia nueva pero las señoras del grupo la consideran como  una persona muy responsable y puntual y la secretaria es la Sra. Rielmy quien es casada y  tiene 2  hijos y  su negocio es  tienda de Barrio que se e en su domicilio    es una persona  activa y respetada por el grupo, solicito el crédito para compra de abarrotes como fideos, arroz y azucar para surtir su tienda. Todas las socias son personas responsables que se dedican al comercio minorista y están agradecidos con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The Emprendimiento Azucenas Bank is in its second loan cycle. All the members have demonstrated themselves to be responsible and hard workers. Mrs. Ysabel is the president, leader and founder of the group. She sells custom jewelry going from place to place through Valle Hermoso. She is married and has two small children. She is requesting a loan to purchase hair clips and barrettes for little girls. 
Mrs. Emiliana is the treasurer; she is separated and has three small daughters. Her business is to sell ‘salchipapas’ (sausage rolled in potatoes) and soft drinks in the Laguna Alalay zone. She is requesting the loan to increase her working capital. She is a new member but is considered by the other members to be a very responsible and punctual person.
Mrs. Rielmy is the secretary; she is married and has two children. Her business is a local store which she has in her house. She is an active person and is respected by the rest of the group. She is requesting the loan to increase her working capital. 
The above three members represent the group.
All the members are very responsible people who run small businesses. They are very grateful for the loan and support.

loans.use: to purchase hair clips and barrettes

loans.name: United Youth Group-Bushenyi

texts.en:
M. Laban is a 49-year-old, level-headed stickler for hard work. This has in many ways played to his strength, especially as he oversees the running of his now 20-year-old liquor store business at his home in Bushenyi.

Laban is a happily married father of seven who says he took over this business after his father passed on. On the side, he also does some farming. 

He says this business generates 100,000 shillings weekly. He says with this loan, he is going to purchase more sweet bananas that he uses in the brewing of his liquor. 

Laban belongs to United Youth Group-Bushenyi.

loans.use: to purchase more sweet bananas that are used in making the liquor he sells

loans.name: Kebah

texts.en:
Kebah is 39 years old and is married with four children between the ages of five and 18. All of her children live at home with her. Her husband has his own business. For the past eight years, Kebah has been making soap. She has been working to improve her product and her business is growing.

Kebha is requesting a loan to purchase soap-making materials. In the future, she hopes to save money for her children.

loans.use: to purchase soap-making materials

loans.name: El

texts.en: El S., 55, resides in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products.  S. sells traditional cakes, earning an income of USD 1.25 per day.  Each month, the family has to spend USD 66 on food and USD 30 on the other necessary expenses.  S. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase a motorbike to transport the cakes to sell. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to transport cakes to sell

loans.name: Maria Valentina

texts.es:
María de 43 años es soltera, tiene casa propia con los servicios de agua,  luz y desagüe, ubicada en el distrito de Monsefú y a unos 15 minutos de distancia de la provincia de Chiclayo.  En la cual los pobladores desarrollan la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesanía.

María tiene algunas tierras de cultivo que su padre le dio en herencia, en las cuales siembra tuberculos (papas y   camotes) y hortalizas (espinaca, coliflor, culantro,etc), las mismas que una vez cosecha vende ambulatoriamente en el mercado de su zona como de la ciudad de Chiclayo, como son productos que se venden rápido porque los pobladores lo consumen diariamente, lo quel e permite tener ingresos diarios para poder solventar sus necesidades.

Al observar María que su negocio va incrementando su clientela a solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 800 nuevos soles para  comprar fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras de cultivo y así pueda tener productos de mejor calidad, permitiéndole pagar su préstamo y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Maríaes una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora, siempre con la intensión de mejorar ella y su negocio.
texts.en:
María is 43 years old, single and has her own home with running water, electricity and plumbing located in the district of Monsefú located some 15 minutes from the Chiclayo province. Most of the inhabitants in the area are farmers, cattle breeders and in handicrafts.

María has some plots of land that she inherited from her father where she grows tubers (potatoes and sweet potatoes) and vegetables (spinach, cauliflower, cilantro, etc.) those that she harvests she sells as a street vendor in the market in the area like the city of Chiclayo since they are sold quickly because the residents consume them daily. This allows María to have daily income to be able to meet her needs.

As María saw that her business keeps growing as do her customers, she went to get a loan of 800 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy some fertilizers to improve her plots of land so that she can have more quality products that will allow her to payback the loan and improve her quality of life. María is a responsible and hardworking woman with the intention of improving herself and the business.

loans.use: buy fertilizers to improve her plots of land.

loans.name: Elvia Maria

texts.es:
Elvia de 38 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene su negocio hace varios años atrás, ya que su esposo es chofer y ella le quiere ayudar con los gastos de su familia. Poco a poco ha incrementado los víveres de la tienda. 

En la actualidad trabaja de lunes a domingo desde las 07h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días. Vende la libra de arroz a $ 0.33, la libra de azúcar a $ 0.35. Tiene muchas aspiraciones en su tienda por eso quiere continuar trabajando y surtiéndola con mercadería y víveres variados.  Por eso quiere el préstamo para poder comprar arroz, azúcar y harina. En el futuro quiere incrementar la mercadería del local.
texts.en:
Elvia is 38 years old and she is a very hard working woman who has had a business for the past several years. Her husband is a driver and she wants to help with the family's expenses. Gradually she increased the grocery products in her store.

She works from Monday to Sunday from 7:00 am to 9:00 pm every day. She sells rice for $0.33 per found, and sugar for $0.35 per pound. She has many aspirations for her store which is why she wants to keep working and adding variety with merchandise and various products. She wants this loan to purchase rice, sugar, and flour. In the future she wants to increase the merchandise in her store.

loans.use: to purchaser rice, sugar, and flour.

loans.name: Jean Batiste

texts.en: Jean Batiste is 30 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom attends school. His wife owns a shop where she sells different items. Jean Batiste sells food stuffs such as matooke (green bananas). This business has enabled him build his own house. He is requesting a loan to buy more matooke in order to increase his profits. He plans to buy animals with the profits he hopes to earn.

loans.use: To purchase matooke(green bananas) for sale.

loans.name: Ruqaya

texts.en:
Ruqaya, her husband and two sons built a new house. They managed to build it after eight years of marriage and saving money.  Ruqaya needs $3,000 to finish the kitchen, and she wants to pay for tiles and window installation.

Ruqaya took out a loan from FATEN to pay for the tiles and window expenses as they can't move in without having the kitchen ready for use.

Ruqaya is a conservative woman from Ramallah, hence her husband Jad is photographed instead.

loans.use: to pay for Installing tiles and kitchen windows.

loans.name: Kadide

texts.en:
Kadide is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a poultry business, selling as wholesale to her neighbours and passersby. She faces major challenges of poultry disease outbreak and the high cost of transportation. Kadide dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Rushuma Twimukye Group B

texts.en:
Retailing has been 35-year-old Annet's business for 6 years now. The warmhearted mother of 4 operates from Kihihi in Western Uganda. Retailing is quite a highly favored trade in Western Uganda. Most people have been able to keep their heads above the water with earnings from this trade.

Annet's retail shop is teeming with a variety of general merchandise commodities such as soap, sugar, maize flour, paraffin, etc. These commodities sell well and at length, Annet has been able to reinvest most of the profits she makes. This has ensured continuity in her transactions.

Notwithstanding that, Annet has also had her fair share of business adversity that she says has not in any way dampened her spirits but rather emboldened her to work assiduously hard to succeed. She has learned to take most of the adversity within her stride. This has been her calling card in many ways.

On the side, Annet also does some banana farming. With this side business she is able to eke out additional profits. Weekly her retail sales gross profits are to the tune of 140,000 shillings.
 
Annet says she is requesting this Kiva loan to purchase more retail commodities such as beans, rice, salt, maize flour, cooking oil, etc. to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities such as beans, rice, salt, maize flour, cooking oil, etc. to resell

loans.name: Muzaffar

texts.ru: Музаффар проживает в районе Дангара. Ему 50 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Старший сын находится в России на заработках. Сам Музаффар занимается торговлей. В селе Гичовак у него имеется магазин, где он продает продукты питания. Этим видом деятельности он занимается четыре года. В продвижение его деятельности ему помогают его дочь и сын. Он берет кредит для покупки муки, молочных продуктов и приобретения холодильника.
texts.en: Muzaffar lives in the region of Dangara. He is 50 years old. He is married and has three children. His wife is a homemaker. His oldest son is now working in Russia. Muzaffar is in sales. In the village of Gichovak he has own store where he sells food and groceries. He has been in this business for four years. His daughter and son help in the growth of his business. He is taking out the loan to buy flour, milk products and a refrigerator.

loans.use: to buy flour, milk products and a refrigerator

loans.name: Rocio Del Pilar

texts.es:
La Sra. Rocío del Pilar pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos”, del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Está Casada, tiene 38 años, y tiene 01 hijo de 8 años, estudiante de nivel primario. Desde los 16 años empezó a estudiar y trabajar en alta costura junto a su mamá, pasó el tiempo y  decidió independizarse logrando establecer su negocio en su propio domicilio, empezó con un capital de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, comenzó a confeccionar ropa interior para damas, caballeros y niños y poco a poco fue adquiriendo e incrementando sus materiales y su trabajo. Actualmente cuenta con el apoyo de su hermana, ellas elaboran vestidos, pantalones, blusas y camisas para trabajadores de entidades públicas y privadas, cuenta con clientes fijos, haciéndose muy conocida y de esta forma brinda un trabajo de calidad.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,300.00, comprará  telas en fardos de diferentes colores y diseños, carretas de hilos de cocer de colores, alfileres, agujas, tijeras sesgos, blondas y otros adornos para dar un buen acabado a sus productos.La Sra. Rocío del Pilar se considera una mujer exitosa, anhela formar una sociedad e incrementar la venta de polos deportivos.  Está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Sra. Rocío del Pilar is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Eucaliptos” (The Eucalypti) which is located in the District of Tarapoto, Province and Department of San Martín. She is 38 years old and has an eight-year-old son who is an elementary school student. Sixteen years ago, Rocío began studying and working in high fashion along with her mother. After some time had passed, she decided to become independent and establish her own business at home. She started out with capital of 500 PEN and began producing undergarments for women, men, and children. Rocío gradually acquired more materials for her work. She currently receives assistance from her sister. They produce dresses, trousers, blouses, and shirts for employees of public and private entities. Rocío has established customers who know that what she produces is of quality.

With this loan of 1300 PEN, she will buy bundles of fabric in different colors and designs, colored thread, pins, needles, scissors, lace, and other embellishments that provide a good finish to her products. Sra. Rocío del Pilar considers herself to be a successful woman. She hopes to form a partnership and increase her sales of sports shirts. Rocío is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping women like her to have opportunities to develop and move forward.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Ledesma

texts.en:
Ledesma is a responsible housewife who aims to become successful in the future. She is 43 years old and has four school-age children. They want them to finish their studies so that they will find a good job someday. Rice farming is their main source of income. They have been in this business for almost 28 years now and usually earn a profit of only PHP 20,000 per cropping. 

She aims to increase their production so that they will increase their income for their basic necessities and for the schooling of their children. She wants to ask for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay expenses incurred in transplanting the rice seedlings. She mentioned that she needs to work hard and strive harder to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides and to pay expenses incurred in transplanting the rice

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 41 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family.  Judith buys and sells rice in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 22000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

Judith has previously borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF.  She has been running her rice business for 18 years and she also earns an income from raising pigs.

Judith aspires to save money and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a married woman who lives in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She is a rice farmer and also raises pigs.. Josephine's husband, who is also a farmer, mainly manages their rice farm. Josephine focuses on raising hogs and taking care of their children. She works hard to help augment their family income. She has applied for a loan to purchase feeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Josephine hopes to continue earning from their farm and small piggery.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Medie

texts.en:
Medie works hard every single day, because she wants to give her family a good quality of life.

She is 45 years old and lives with her family in the village of Villa Concepcion, Cauayan city, Isabela.  She hopes to maintain her business for the future of her family.

At this time, Medie aims to improve her retail store business but she doesn't have enough capital.  Therefore, she is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy grocery items such as coffee, sugar, canned goods and noodles to sell.  Medie hopes to maintain her business for the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries items to sell.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is 51 years old and lives in Malintuboan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with seven children.

Luzminda works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for five years. She has requested loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase three boxes of fish to sell.

Luzminda has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Luzminda hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase three boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Nyamwanga

texts.en: NyaM. is a single man. He describes himself to be honest, persuasive, and attentive. He operates a soft drinks sales business where he sells water, sodas and other energy drinks. He has been involved in this business for 3 years and employs 1 staff member. His business is located in a shopping centre. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of business premises. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of soft drinks. His business goal is to grow it and become a supplier of soft drinks to local hotels and restaurants within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will construct a premises from which he will be running his business.

loans.use: To add to his stock of water, soda and energy drinks.

loans.name: Sokhea

texts.en:
Sokhea is from a rural area of Tbaung Khmum district, about 150 kilometers from Phnom Penh city. She is 27 years old, married and has three children. They are not in school yet. She is a farmer and she has been farming for 5 years. To better support her living, she also plants cassava. 

Sokhea has been with VisionFund since 2008. The loan from VisionFund has made a positive impact for her family. Now she is requesting her fourth loan. She will use this loan to rent a plot of land for a cassava plantation. With this loan, she hopes to make more cassava (starchy tuberous root) which will enable her to earn more income to better feed her children and build some savings for future needs and her children's studies.

loans.use: to rent a plot of land for a cassava plantation

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel used his previous loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy spare parts for his van. Now, he is able to run his business more efficiently, thanks to Faulu Kenya giving him financial support. He hopes to buy another van for his transport business. He has requested another loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to service his van.

loans.use: To service his van.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is a 40-year-old married man with three school-going children. He owns a house with electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his children. 

Alfred has operated a bar for more than four years; his potential clients are the local area's residents. He faces the major challenge of rising beverage prices in the market. He dreams of expanding his business.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, he wants to purchase more crates of beer for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve his living standards.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of beer for resale.

loans.name: Bol

texts.en:
Bol is a 32 year old a married woman with three children. All of them are in school. She has had a food stall business in Bor, South Sudan for three years.

Bol requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice for sale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 40-year-old a married woman with four children; one of them is in school. She's had a business of selling food in a stall in Yei, South Sudan for two years.

Rose is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase onions and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase onions and beans for sale.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is 60 years old, married, and has three adult children who are already married. Anahit worked at Ijevan High School as a teacher until she retired on a pension. In 2001 she and her husband organized their own business in a rented space. This business consists of food and mixed product sales. During these years, they built up their shop and bought furniture for their house. Anahit’s shop has a reputation in Ijevan for having the cheapest products for retail and wholesale purchasing.

Thanks to her first and second Kiva loans, Anahit increased her shop assortment, which has provided her with a good income. This permitted her and her husband to complete construction on their house and to add a story to their shop, which is situated in the yard of their house. Anahit and her husband are also managing a gift shop in the new addition.

Now Anahit is requesting a loan of 200,000 Armenian drams to buy New Year’s candy sets to resell. With future income, she intends to do interior repair on her house.

loans.use: to buy New Year’s candy sets to resell.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is 56 years old and lives in San Vicente Alto,Oroquieta City. She is married with three children. 

Jessie has a general store and earns approximately PHP 1,000 each month from it. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase more stock for her general store. 

Jessie has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, Jessie hopes to earn money for her and her family's future. Jessie owns a van and she is a good mother and a loving wife.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is 35 years old; he lives in Gaza with his wife and four children.
He opened small workshop “blacksmith” in 2008 he specializes in manufacturing doors and windows; this business is the only source of income for his small family, and he has one labor to help him because his customers increasing constantly.
Rami is satisfied with the income of his business, but he needs this loan to buy welding machine and equipment for his workshop which will allow him to expand it Rami is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy welding machine and equipment for his workshop which will allow him to expand it Rami is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Start a food kiosk business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a weighing machine

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
Mark A. is 30 years old, single, and lives with two dependants, a boy and a girl, who are members of his extended family. One of the dependant’s parents died due to HIVAIDS and the other was abandoned during the 1992 land clashes in the Transmara region of Kenya. He lives with them within Kayole, Kenya.

In 2004 Mark ventured into the business sector by doing tailoring and dressmaking, which he did for 3 years. The business capital was provided by Kenya Agency of Development and Entrepreneurial Technology (KADET), a World Vision micro-finance wing. A loan of Ksh 56,000.00 (USD 800) enabled him to buy sewing machines and clothing materials and he was later able to settle the loan. A golden opportunity from the World Vision emerged and got him a tender to make school uniforms for four schools within Kayole. 

In 2005, as a form of business expansion, Mark started a mobile phone repair shop and sale of mobile phone accessories. He employed 3 orphans who had gone through technical skills training sponsored by World Vision. Besides offering mobile phone charging services, the number of clients seeking phone repairs has greatly increased. He is currently not able to serve his customers effectively since he lacks computers and power flashers that enable detection of a problem in the phone software hence he incurs extra costs in having to seek that kind of service in the city centre, 20 kilometers from his business location. 

Mark is requesting for a loan of (USD 650) to enable him purchase a computer and power flashers. This will enable him to detect the problem in the phone software and to do repairs. This will help improve the profit margins by cutting down on costs of transportation and consultation services from other dealers and also bring flashing services closer to other technicians operating within Kayole. The business will also create employment for the people of Kayole. The loan is repayable within 12 – 18 months.

loans.use: Purchase of power flashers and a computer

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan C. is married with only one child, but he also takes care of his sisters and brothers and pays for their school expenses. At thirty-five years of age, he runs a small store selling bicycle and motorbike spare parts and lubricant in Kabala town in Sierra Leone. His aim is to increase his stock by purchasing parts wholesale from the Republic of Guinea.

C. used a previous loan from SMT to diversify his business by including the sale of lubricant. He is now requesting a loan of $200 to purchase more lubricant so that he can earn more income for the family.

loans.use: Purchase lubricant wholesale for resale in his bicycle shop

loans.name: Farhad

texts.en: Farhad I. lives in Gahramanli Village. It is a small city in the Beylagan Region, which sits in southwest Azerbaijan. He is 26 years old and he is single. His business is cattle-breeding. He just started this business, and therefore faces some obstacles. He would like to buy more cows and expand his business. He needs $600 to buy a cow, and so he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Abbass Al Hajj

texts.en: Abbass owns a grocery store and all the neighboring clients visit him. Abbass lives in Nabatieh, south of Lebanon with his wife and 3 children. He needs to purchase enough merchandise for his business in order to get enough income to support his family, especially since he was the victim of a work accident while working on his second job in the construction sector. He therefore needs to compensate the loss of income from his construction job, which he is no longer able to hold.

loans.use: To buy products for his grocery store

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
In 2000 Vivian Y. opened a shop selling men’s and women’s clothing. She now requires a loan of $275 to expand her line of clothing (ball gowns, clown costumes?). She hopes to increase her profits so that with her husband, Sijao, and she can continue to support her son Kelvin, 12 and her younger sister Maria, 18.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus termed not creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipments from the said client, extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called sale and leaseback.

loans.use: To purchase new stock to expand the line of clothing.

loans.name: Phin

texts.en:
Mr. Phin Ruos, age 36, has been married since 1994 and has two children, one son and one daughter. He is currently in the business of contracting with villagers to build and repair houses. He began his construction contracting business in 1998. His wife, Mrs. Sokhon Yi, age 38, is a housewife. She is looking after her two children at home and sending them to study at school in the village.

Phin is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the second time, in the amount of $800. He will use this money to purchase a motorbike to use in his construction business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Namugongo D Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Jane S..  She is currently in the business of education, running a nursery schoool and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to construct another classroom.  Jane is a 46 year old widow.    She has onechild aged 22 who goes to school.  Each week, Jane makes approximately UGX 80,000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build more classrooms.  Jane has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 500,000 in order to invest in the education business and the loan was paid back on time.  Jane is joined in her small group by Faridah N., Juliet N., Margret N., and Betty N..  Faridah N. is currently in the business of raw foods and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to increase her stock.  Juliet N. runs a retail shop and is requesting a loan of UGX 10,00,000 to increase her stock.  Margret N. also runs a retail shop and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to buy another fridge.  Betty N. also runs a retail shop and is requesting a loan of UGX 900,000 to start a restaurant business.

loans.use: To construct a new classroom and expand her nursery school

loans.name: San Juana

texts.es:
Since she was very young, San Juana has been dedicated to sales, to start with she sold shoes from a catalogue and other goods. Nevertheless, once a friend invited her to a demonstration of kitchen utensils, she fell in love with the products and decided to start selling them. Little by little her products became popular.

Presently she does not have much merchandise and therefore she is requesting a loan of $675 to be repaid in 6 months and with this money, San Juana will buy merchandise to offer more variety to her clients. With your support, San Juana will be able to provide properly for her youngest daughter who is the only child living at home.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Desde que era muy joven San Juana se dedica a las ventas, en un inicio vendía zapatos por catálogo y otros artículos. Sin embargo en una ocasión una amiga de ella la invitó a una demostración de artículos de cocina, quedó encantada con los productos y decidió comenzar a venderlos. Poco a poco se fue dando a conocer por los productos que vende.

Sin embargo actualmente no cuenta con mucha mercancía es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $675 que está dispuesta a pagar en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero San Juana podrá comprar más mercancía para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes y que estos tengan de dónde escoger. Con tu ayuda San Juana podrá sacar adelante a su hija la más chica que es la única que vive en su casa.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to increase sales of kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
Leticia N. is an enterprising woman, married to Alejandro Domínguez Córdoba. They have 2 children, ages 9 and 10. She began her business 5 years ago, selling shoes by catalog to her friends and acquaintances. The motivation behind her business was the need to have additional income to meet her household expenses.

Today she needs a loan of US$250, which will be repaid in 6 months, as she has many orders to fill and with this money she will buy the shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Leticia N. es una mujer emprendedora esta casada con Alejandro Domínguez Córdoba quien trabaja como minero tienen 2 hijos de 9 y 10 años. Su negocio lo empezó hace cinco años vendiendo zapatos por catalogo a sus familiares. Su principal motivación fue la necesidad fue tener ingresos adicionales para los gastos de su casa.

Actualmente requiere un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses tengo muchos pedidos para surtir y con ese dinero comprare los zapatos.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Enissa

texts.en:
Mambo from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 25-year-old Enissa M.. She is not married and has 1 blessed child aged 1. She has 6 dependents who live with her because they are closed relatives. In 2005, Enissa established her clothes-selling business. She is now requires a loan in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

Secondhand clothes journey across the oceans from America and Europe and are then washed, ironed and sold in bulk by wholesalers in Dar es Salaam to retailers who then rewash and re-iron them for sale on the streets of Dar es Salaam and the surrounding towns and villages. These clothes are becoming increasingly popular, especially among the younger generation, because they are so cheap and because of the general appeal of anything Western or modern. Many people argue that the popularity of the West’s cast-offs is damaging the local cloth and garment industry. There are many people who still appreciate the beauty of traditional Tanzanian dress, however, the growing market in used clothing and its importance to many micro-entrepreneurs cannot be denied.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock in bulk.

loans.name: Kewerimidde Women's Group

texts.en: Forty-three-year-old N. Mastula, treasurer of Kewerimidde women’s group, is a businesswoman who owns a retail shop in Katosi. Katosi is a port city, with the main activity being fishing. In Mastula’s shop, she sells fishing materials such as floaters, oars, jerry cans, fishing nets, and hooks. She has had her shop for six years. Her dream is for her shop to grow and become more lucrative with more fishing supplies of different types. She would like a loan to buy more floaters, fishing nets, hooks, jerry cans and oars. She is a widow with seven children to care for, of which four are her own. Mastula also has a tailoring business just outside her shop, through which she buys material for school uniforms and women’s traditional and casual wear, all for sewing. For the uniforms, she gets contracts from schools, and this only booms at the beginning of each school term. She does all this for the sake of her children’s future.

loans.use: To buy more fishing supplies to sell

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is married and has three grown children. Nearly 3 years ago she decided to open a little children’s clothing kiosk, a business she says was her calling. She was able to purchase a kiosk in the very center of the market that is easily accessible to many shoppers. Today, Elvira’s business yields $1000 a month in income with an investment of $2,000 in inventory. 

Elvira sees a great opportunity for business growth this summer season. Her expertise in quality clothing merchandise is greatly appreciated by her customers, and her desire to assist clients and her entrepreneurial spirit are part of what makes her business successful. On a personal level, Elvira desires to invest her earned profits into repair work in her house. She is requesting a loan for 5,000 Grivnas to broaden the assortment of clothing items she offers at her kiosk so she will be ready for the busy season. She has proven to be a strong and reliable client with “Nadiya Ukraine”. We believe that this loan will be a big help to Elvira as she looks for ways to increase her business activity.

loans.use: To open a new vending facility

loans.name: Sada's Tujuane Group

texts.en:
Sada is a 25-year-old, married woman with 2 children. One of her children is 7 years old, while the other child is 1 years old. She has been a trader since in 2006. Every day, she works from 7 am to 6 pm at her business and, in doing so, she can earn a monthly profit of approximately $25 from her sales.

Sada now seeks a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses dealing with soft drinks sales, medical supply sales, and bites sales.

loans.use: To improve and expand her business by purchasing additional items

loans.name: Sadio

texts.fr: Sadio D. est mariée, 43 ans et mère de 08 enfants. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer le capital de son activité qui consiste à acheter de la graine d’arachide, à la transformer en pate afin de la revendre. Elle souhaite ainsi pouvoir améliorer les conditions de vie et de santé de sa famille et assurer une bonne scolarité à ses enfants. <b>Elle compte rembourser en une seule échéance au bout de six mois<b/>.
texts.en:
Sadio D. is 43 years old, married and the mother of eight children. She is requesting this loan to boost the capital of her business, which consists of buying peanut seeds to turn into peanut butter to sell. In this way she wants to be able to improve the living conditions and health of her family and ensure that her children have a good education. She aims to repay the loan in a single installment after six months.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy peanut seeds and turn them into peanut butter for sale

loans.name: Digna

texts.es: Digna, de 35 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y otros productos desde ya hace mucho tiempo. Es madre de 3 hijos, los cuales  son sus ganas de seguir adelante, su esposo Rubén es trabajador independiente, y siempre está de acuerdo con lo que su esposa decide con respecto a la mejora de su negocio.Las aspiraciones que tiene Digna, para sus hijos, son brindarles por el momento sus estudios y lo necesario para que se sientan felices.Quiere seguir creciendo en su negocio, por eso que desea ampliar su tienda y posteriormente quiere tener un minimarket, para ello, necesita de un capital para cumplir con su objetivo.
texts.en:
Digna, who is 35 years old, has been selling groceries and other products for a long time. She is the mother of 3 children, who inspire her to keep going. Her husband Rubén works independently and is always in agreement with what his wife decides to do to improve her business. The ambitions she has are for her children - to provide them with schooling and with whatever is necessary for their happiness. She wants to continue growing her business, which is why she wants to expand her store and later on, to have a mini-market. For this, she needs a loan to reach her objective.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand and make improvements to her store.

loans.name: Teriya (Friendship) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Teriya est un regroupement de quatre femmes du village de kimparana (préfecture de San région de Ségou) qui sont des voisines de quartier. Elles ont en moyenne 30 ans, mariées et mères d’au moins 2 enfants.
Elles mènent une activité centrée autour du poisson qui est soit vendu frais, fumé ou grillé. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis deux ans. Le montant du prêt est passé de 50.000 FCFA au premier prêt à 150.000 FCFA pour le cinquième prêt. Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour payer des cartons de poissons à partir de Mopti (Cinquième région du Mali). En plus de cette activité principale, certaines vendent du bois de chauffe.
Les produits sont vendus aux différentes foires de la zone ainsi qu’à la maison. Les femmes du groupe Teriya contribuent aux dépenses de la famille et injectent une partie des bénéfices dans leurs activités.
texts.en:
The Teriya goup is made up of 4 women from Kimparana village (San Prefecture, Ségou region) who are from the same neighborhood. They are on average 30, married, and have at least 2 children.

Their principal business revolves around fish which is sold either fresh, smoked, or grilled. To expand the size of their businesses, the members of the group decided two years ago to join the credit program of Soro Yiriwaso. The amount of money they were allowed to borrow started off at 50,000 F CFA for their first loan and is now at 150,000 F CFA for their 5th loan. This loan will be used to buy cases of fish from Mopti (fifth region of Mali). Besides this primary business, some of the members of the group sell firewood.

Their products are sold at the various marketdays in the area as well as out of their houses. The women of the Teriya group help to cover family expenses and invest a part of the profit back into their businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fish for re-sale

loans.name: Akil

texts.en: Akil is a 31-year-old married man with two young children, living in Bint Jbeil, Southern Lebanon. A car mechanic for several years, he opened his own workshop in 2000. He took his first micro-loan to buy tools for his shop and introduce additional services. As his business is expanding, Akil wants to borrow US$1,200 to ameliorate the technology he possesses by buying a lifting apparatus for trucks.

loans.use: To buy new machinery

loans.name: Dong Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Đông năm nay 49 tuổi,chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1996. Hiện tại công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị là từ chăn nuôi lợn, gà. Với việc chăn nuôi 20 con lợn nái, 150 con gà đẻ và nuôi cá thu nhập của gia đình chị Đông hàng tháng đạt 3.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thức ăn phục vụ cho việc chăn nuôi
texts.en:
Mrs. Dong Thi N. is a 49 years old woman. She joined the TYM fund in 1996. Now the family’s income comes mainly from their farm. The farm of fish, 20 breeding pigs, and 150 hens brings in the income of about 3,000,000 Vietnamese Dong per month. She plans to make the next loan of 15,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to buy food supply.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food supply

loans.name: Mirtha

texts.es: LA SRA. MIRTHA TIENE 49 AÑOS CUENTA CON UNA VIVIENDA PROPIA EN LA URBANIZACION EL QUIOR,  TIENE DOS DEPENDIENTES UNO DE 12 Y OTRO DE 19 AÑOS. LA SRA. MIRTHA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE CALDOS EN EL MERCADO ALTO SAN PEDRO, ACTIVIDAD EN LA CUAL LLEVA MAS DE 10 AÑOS DE EXPERIENCIA Y ADEMAS CUENTA CON UNA RENTA DE UN VEHICULO EL CUAL TRABAJA COMO TAXI. LA COMPETENCIA EN AMBOS RUBROS ES FUERTE, PERO LA EXPERIENCIA QUE LOS AÑOS DE TRABAJO LE HAN OTORGADO  HACE QUE CUENTE CON CLIENTES FIJOS   PARA LA VENTA DE SUS  CALDOS. LA CLIENTE TIENE UN PROMEDIO DE VENTA DE 250 BS/DIA CON UNA GANANCIA PROMEDIO DE  40% SOBRE LAS VENTAS DEL DIA. LA CLIENTE YA HA TENIDO DOS OPERACIONES ANTERIORES A ESTA EN LAS CUALES  HA DEMOSTRADO LA RESPONSABILIDAD EN EL PAGO DE LAS CUOTAS.
texts.en:
Mirtha is 49 years old. She lives in an urban area called “Quior”. She has two dependent children, a 12 year old and a 19 year old. Mirtha has sold shoes at the Alto San Pedro market for over 10 years. She also rents a car that is used as a taxi. Both businesses have a high market competition, but with her experience after so many years, she managed to acquire fixed clients that regularly purchase her shoes. She has an average daily sales income of 250 bolivianos ($35), with an average earning of 40% over the daily sales. This is Mirtha’s third loan and she has proven to be responsible with her payments before.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Juhudi Iwepo Group

texts.en:
Sakina has been a clothing, soup, and perfume seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 13 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $190. Every day she works at her business for 16 hours. She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes and perfumes for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business, improve her home, and save money.

Sakina is 27 years old, married, and has one child, age 3. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Siti. Siti also has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and perfumes for her business

loans.name: Hikmatullo

texts.ru: Зарипов Хикматулло проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 25 лет, женат и имеет двоих детей. Уже восемь лет занимается торговлей продуктов питания. Имеет свой магазин у себя дома. Сам живет в одном из отдаленных кишлаков города. Поэтому его магазин единственная возможность сделать покупки. Кредит планирует получить для того, чтобы закупить товар долгого хранения. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Hikmatullo Z. lives in the town of Vakhdat. He is 25 years old and is married with two children. For the past eight years he has been selling groceries. He has a store in his house. He lives in one of Vakhdat's remote villages. His store provides a unique opportunity for people to do groceries in their village. Hikmatullo is applying for a loan in order to buy groceries that can be stocked for a long time. He would be able to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow and to purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes A. is 56 years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, two males and one female. She says all of them are out of school and living independently. She lives with her husband and grandchildren in a family house in a small farming community called Hweakwae in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the dwellers in this community is farming. The land is rich in nutrients and as a result, good for farming.
Agnes trades in foodstuffs such as yam, cassava, plantain, and other cereals such as beans, maize, etc. She buys from a town called Afram Plains where the cost is economical and she treks to nearby markets to sell. She sells to retailers and food vendors. Agnes has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to procure goods on a large scale to supply more customers. It is Agnes’ dream to help her grandchildren in school.

loans.use: To buy tubers of yam and cereals

loans.name: Elva Nelly

texts.es:
Elva es socia del Banco Comunal El Roble..
Elva es soltera, tiene 31 años , Elva viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende golosinas al por mayor y menor, además Elva embolsas bocaditos de maíz con juguetes, productos que vende por mayor.
Elva necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de caramelos y galletas.
Elva sueña con tener una tienda mayorista de golosinas.
texts.en:
Elva is a member of the El Roble Communal Bank. She is 31 years old and single. Elva travels to various regional markets where she sells candy both retail and wholesale. She also packages savory corn snacks with toys, which she sells wholesale. Elva needs a loan of 1250 soles which will be invested to buy candy and cookies. Elva dreams of having a wholesale candy store.

Translated from Spanish by Deborah Delzell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy candy and cookies

loans.name: Lesli

texts.es:
La señora Lesli, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Vencedoras de Villa Universitaria”, vive en el Jr. Cajamarca Nº 160, Distrito de Tarapoto, departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 36 años y es madre 02 hijos, 01 que todavía depende de ella.

Con su crédito de S/. 300.00, por iniciativa propia, inició su negocio vendiendo comidas preparadas, nos cuenta que le va muy bien. En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio vendiendo sus alimentos, su negocio está ubicado en la vereda de su casa, donde vende a los moradores de la comunidad, amigos y vecinos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1200.00 que cancelara a plazo de 06 meses, lo invertirá ampliando e implementando su negocio, y comprar más mesas, sillas, vasos y ollas, e insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos.
Ella mayormente toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. Hoy se siente más independiente y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas y en los actos de su vida diaria.

Nos manifiesta su gran agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como Mujer y apoyar a otras mujeres que quieren emprender su negocio y salir adelante solas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Leslie, belongs to the Communal Bank "Las Vencedores Villa Universitaria" and lives in Cajamarca Jr. No. 160, District of Tarapoto, San Martín. She lives with her partner, is 36 years and mother of 2 children, 1 still dependent on her. With her loan of S /. 300.00, taken on her own initiative, she started her business selling prepared foods and she tells us that it is doing very well. At present, she continues her business selling food, located on the pavement in front of her home, where she sells to residents of the community, friends and neighbors. With this loan of S /. 1200.00, she will invest to expand her business and buy more tables and chairs, cups and pots, and ingredients for the preparation of the daily food. She generally decides on how the profits of her business are used. She now feels more independent and responsible, for paying her bills and in other aspects of her daily life. She expressed great gratitude to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a women and support other women who want to start their own business and succeed on their own.

Translated from Spanish by Tim Hassett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for her food service businesss

loans.name: Salomat

texts.ru: Саломат Солибоева 1955 года рождения , замужем имеет 6 детей. высшего образования не имеет. На рынке торгует около 10 лет. Продает муку на оптовом рынке.  В Микроинвест обратилась по совету подруг. Получила  кредит и приобрела партию товара . Муку у нее раскупают оптом. Так выгодней и оборот идет быстрее на сбыт. Планирует расширить свой магазин на будущий кредит.
texts.en:
Born in 1955, Salomat S. is married and has 6 children. She does not have a higher education. She sells flour at a wholesale market and has almost 10 years of experience in this business. Salomat reached out to MicroInvest on an advice from her friends. She obtained a loan and purchased new product inventory. Her customers buy her flour wholesale, which is quicker and more profitable. Salomat plans to expand her store with this new loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Sixta

texts.es: La Señora Sixta Dávila tiene la edad de 52 años, vive en el barrio Laureles Sur, su acompañante de vida le ayuda económicamente es comerciante ambulante, tiene cuatros hijos dos trabajan le ayudan y los otros dos estudian. Unos de sus proyectos son construir su casa y que sus hijos sean hombres de bien. Doña Sixta desde hace seis años trabaja por cuenta propia en su casa de habitación vendiendo tortillas como una de las dificultades muy vista que no tiene construido el techo para protegerse en tiempo de lluvia, lo cual le baja las ventas. Iniciando con fondos propios que tenían, el desarrollo de su trabajo es de mucho esfuerzo el cual agradece  Afodenic por apoyar  con préstamos que fomenta a crecer como pequeños empresarios. Con el préstamo que solicita que es su séptimo ciclo lograra comprar materiales de construcción como : zinc, reglones, clavos, cemento y unos bloques para realizar la construcción de un muro pequeño previniendo la entrada del agua y el techo que falta en su lugar de trabajo, sirviendo a sus clientes con mayor comodidad y seguridad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sixta Dávila is 52 years old, she lives in the neighborhood Laureles Sur. Her life partner, a street vendor, helps her economiccally, she has four children, two are working and supporting her and the other two are students. One of her projects is to build her house and that her children become good human beings. Doña Sixta has worked independently for the last six years selling tortillas from her home. One of the difficulties is that it lacks roofing to protect from rain and therefore sales decrease. She started to develop her work with her own funding and a lot of effort which is appreciated by Afodenic that offers support with loans to help small businessmen and businesswomen grow. With the loan requested, her seventh, she will buy construction material such as zinc, lining, nails, cement, and some blocks to build a small wall to prevent the water from entering as well as the roof covering her working space, thus being able to serve her clients with more comfort and security.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction material to build a wall

loans.name: Mma

texts.en: Mma A. is 54 years old.  She is married and has given birth to seven children, three sons and four daughters.  All attend school.  She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase, in the Western Region.  Her husband works at a local sawmill firm while she is a food vendor. Mma prepares and sells porridge in the mornings.  She wants a loan to buy bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk.  Mma buys her goods from nearby communities. Mma has been in business for over ten years.  Mma aspires to expand her business and sponsor her children in school.

loans.use: Buy maize in bulk.

loans.name: Khum

texts.en:
Mrs. Khum C., 56, and her husband, Mr. Khoeun Phun, 46, live along National Road Number Two about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1987 and have three sons. One son attends school and the other two assist their farther in farming. Besides her children, she also has an elderly mother living with her.

Chum has been selling vegetables for two years. Her husband is a disabled solder and he is a farmer as well. She is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorized hand tiller for her husband’s farming business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorized hand tiller for farming

loans.name: Virgen De La Asunción Group

texts.es:
El banco Comunal Virgen D. L. Asunción, se encuentra ubicado en L. comunidad D. Cuenca, L. cual pertenece al departamento D. Huancavelica. 

Liduvina es viuda y tiene 06 hijos. ElL. se dedica a L. venta D. granos, los cuales en un inicio compraba D. casa en casa. Ahora manda a moler los granos, los cuales venD. en cada feria que pueD. asistir. Poco a poco su negocio esta creciendo, gracias a los prestamos que recibe. ElL. esta ahorrando para L. educación D. sus hijos y llegar a tener su propio molino, donD. elL. pueda moler sus granos.

Martha con el primer préstamo que recibió, compró gaseosas y refrescos, actividad a L. cual se dedica hasta ahora. Pese a L. competencia que existe en su rubro, elL. a podido sacar el negocio adelante, generándole mas ganancias, las cuales se encuentra ahorrando para poder comprar un vehiculo y así poder trasladar su mercadería.

Celsa tiene 05 hijos. ElL. se dedica a L. venta D. granos, los cuales en un inicio compraba D. casa en casa. Ahora manda a moler los granos, los cuales venD. D. feria en feria. Su negocio ha ido incrementándose desD. que inició con sus prestamos, los cuales le han ayudado mucho, incluso a cambiar su calidad D. vida y L. D. sus hijos. Con sus ahorros, esta pensando abrir una bodega donD. ofrecer sus productos.
texts.en:
The Virgen D. L. Asunción Community Bank is located in the Cuenca community, which belongs to the Huancavelica department. Liduvina is a widow with six children. She sells grains. When she started, she bought them going door to door. Now she has the grains ground and sells them at every fair that she can attend. Little by little, her business is growing, thanks to the loans that she receives. She is saving for her children’s education and to be able to have her own mill where she can grind her grains. With her first loan, Martha bought soft drinks and drinks. That is her business up until now.
