In spite of the competition that exists in her field, she has been able to get ahead in her business and generate more earnings. She is saving her earnings to be able to buy a vehicle. That way she can transport her merchandise. Celsa has five children. She sells grains. She started out buying door to door. Now she has the grains ground and sells from fair to fair. Her business has been increasing since she started with her loans. They have helped her a lot; they have changed the quality of her and her children’s lives. With her savings she is thinking of opening a mini market where she can sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in their businesses

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Don Juan Carlos de 45 años de edad, reside en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, casado su esposa trabaja en servicios domésticos, para poder apoyar a sus dos hijos de 8 y 9 años con los estudios, y poder solventar los gastos de la familia. El negocio del señor Juan es soldador eléctrico y la compra de vehículos usados lleva diecinueve años en este negocio, que inicio con ahorros y que poco a poco ha venido desarrollándose y obteniendo clientela, el lleva diez ciclo en Afodenic y se siente sastifecho por la oportunidad que le han dado con los prestamos que ha logrado comprar sus propios equipos. Con este préstamo comprara materiales de construcción para hacer un porche y tener mejores condiciones con su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 45, and he lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood. He is married, and his wife works in domestic services to be able to help support their two children, eight and nine, with their education and to be able to pay the household expenses. Juan’s business is electric soldering and buying used vehicles. He has been in this business for 19 years. He started the business with savings. Little by little it has been developing and gaining customers. He has been with Afodenic for ten loan cycles. He feels satisfied about the opportunity they have given him with the loans and that he has been able to buy his own equipment. He will use this loan to buy construction materials to build a porch and have better living conditions with his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build a porch

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en: Ivan owns a small retail business that sells various construction materials. He has been in this business for 6 years. He chose it because construction materials are in high demand. Offering delivery attracts more clients and helps Ivan to make better sales. Ivan is very responsible; he enjoys his business and has great plans for its growth! Ivan would like to borrow 17,000 UAH to increase the assortment of his inventories.

loans.use: to increase the assortment

loans.name: Lina

texts.es:
Lina es una empeñosa mujer de 39 años, vive con su esposo, José, y sus hijos; José Antonio de 18, Kevin de 14 y Estiven de 6 años de edad, en su casa propia. Desde hace 8 años se viene dedicando a la venta de golosinas en los ómnibus de transporte público, trabajo con el que se siente muy contenta, pues obtiene buenas ganancias. Lina está asociada con un grupo de amigas, quienes en conjunto ponen el capital para comprar golosinas al por mayor. Lina trabaja todos los días y ahora su esposo también ha incursionado en este negocio, entonces juntos obtienen mejores ingresos, lo lamentable es que no pueden pasar mucho tiempo con sus hijos. Lina tiene muchas esperanzas de seguir mejorando, para el futuro quiere tener un negocio en su propia casa, ya que sabe que la juventud no será eterna y debe asegurar su vejez.
Lina es una cliente muy antigua en MFP, anteriormente era parte de un banco comunal, pero ahora ya está trabajando sus créditos en forma individual. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más las golosinas, al igual que sus socias y así aumentará sus ventas.
texts.en:
Lina is an enterprising 39 year old woman. She lives with her husband, José, and their children. José Antonio is 18, Kevin is 14, and Estiven is 6. They live in their own house. For eight years she has been selling sweets on public buses. She is very happy with her work; she gets good earnings. Lina is associated with a group of friends who put their money together to buy sweets wholesale. Lina works every day, and now her husband is also getting into this business. Together they get greater earnings. The sad part is that they cannot spend much time with their children. Lina hopes to continue improving. In the future she wants to have a business in her house. She knows that youth does not last forever, and she needs to provide for her old age. Lina has been a client of MFP for a long time. She was previously a part of a communal bank, but now she is working her loans as an individual. With the money she is asking for she will buy more sweets, like her colleagues, and increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: With the credit he will buy a compressor

loans.name: Poni

texts.en:
Poni E. is currently cultivates and sells green vegetables like okra, cabbages, etc., and is requesting a loan to purchase pesticide to spray her garden. Poni is 20 years old and is married to a peasant. She has three children who attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the length of her garden.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase pesticide for her garden

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia B. is from the village of Bocator Tangub. She is 55 years old. Lydia is widowed and has 8 adult-aged children. To make a living, Lydia owns & operates a business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. Her main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling used products and dried goods product, daily, in the local community. Lydia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lydia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lydia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Abdulaziz

texts.en:
Abdulaziz is married and lives in the town of Isfara in Tajikistan. After getting married, the family's expenses started to accumulate and he started his own business selling foodstuffs. That was two years ago. Little by little he started stocking more products and, based on his customers requests, added items such as soft drinks and sweets. Abdulaziz is requesting a loan of 5000 Somoni to remodel and expand his grocery, allowing him to offer better service to his customers. Abdulaziz and his family thank you for your support.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs for his store

loans.name: Maria Inocenta

texts.es:
La señora María Inocenta, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Victoria”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 46 años y es madre de 04 hijos, 01 que aun depende de ella.

María Inocenta, se dedica a la venta de Refrigerios y se inició con su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 y por iniciativa propia, implemento su pequeño negocio, en el Mercado “La Paradita”, donde atiende a sus clientes día a día. En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio, donde vende sus comidas preparadas como juanes, tamalitos, arroz chaufa, arroz con pollo; dulces y golosinas; chifles, y en bebidas como: gaseosas, refrescos y jugos.

Con este préstamo de S/ 500.00, comprará insumos para sus preparados como: sacos de arroz y azúcar, pollos y huevos en javas, fideos y aceites en docenas, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad.  

Se siente con muchas fuerzas para seguir con sus ventas de refrigerios. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Inocenta, belongs to the Communal Bank “Mujeres de Victoria,” district of Tarapoto, province of San Martín, department of San Martín. María Inocenta lives with her partner and she is 46 years old and has 4 children one who depends on her financially.

María Inocenta sells refreshments and began her job with her first loan of S/. 300.00. By her own initiative, she began her first small business in the “La Paradita” market where she takes care of her customers daily. To this day, she still has the same business and sells prepared food like juanes (a dish made of rice with chicken, olives, and eggs wrapped in a leaf), tamalitos (little tamales), arroz chaufa (rice dish with chicken, bacon and ham), chicken and rice, candy, chifles (fried banana chips), and drinks like refreshments, sodas and juice.

With this loan of S/ 500.00, she will buy products to prepare the food like: sacks of rice and sugar, chickens and eggs in crates, spaghetti, oil in bulk, as well as kitchen utensils to provide better service.

She feels motivated to keep selling refreshments. She is thankful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos (Kiva’s field partner) for contributing to her fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products to prepare food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy American and local rice, Magui soups, tuna, sugar, flour, oil, La Lechera milk, Nido milk, light bulbs.

loans.name: Los Artesanos Group

texts.es:
El grupo los artesanos como su nombre lo indica está conformado por artesanos. De los cuales  Gloria del Carmen M. de 22 años tiene un modesto taller familiar el cual inicio con la fabricación de zapatos y luego lo expandió creando una línea de artesanías en cuero como bolsos, billeteras, fajas, gorras, sombreros y maletines entre otros productos. En el taller trabajan su esposo y dos colaboradores los cuales se distribuyen el trabajo además sus hijos en estas vacaciones están aprendiendo este arte.

José Humberto G. L.   de 29 junto con su hermano se dedican a la fabricación de artesanías en cuero e invertirá el crédito para la compra de cuero. Mientras Gloria Venicia Garcia de 48 años tiene un negocio totalmente distinto ella vende frutas y verduras en el mercado de Masaya.
texts.en:
The Artesanos group is made of craftspeople, as the name indicates. Gloria del Carmen is 22 years old and has a modest family shop which began with shoe making and has expanded to create a line of leather goods such as bags, wallets, belts, caps, hats and briefcases among other products. Her husband and two helpers share the work at the shop. Her children are also learning the craft during their vacation.

José Humberto is 29 years old and makes leather crafts along with his brother. He will invest the loan in the purchas of leather.

Gloria Venicia, on the other hand, is 48 years old and has a completely different business. She sell fruits and vegetables in the Masaya market.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of leather

loans.name: Sakun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sakun C. lives in Ba Khong Khang Kaeut village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns piece of land on which she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Loek Douk is a Khmer noodle seller who sells door-to-door but is able to earn less income than needed to support his family.

In order to improve the family standard of living, Mrs. Sakun C. needs 1,000,000 KHR from AMK to buy a cow for breeding. She would use the rest of the loan to support her husband’s business.

Mrs. Sakun C. is the mother of four children, one of whom is a construction worker while the other three do housework. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow and to support her husband's business

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson Ibrahim O. is a 63 year old married man. He has seven (7) children. He lives in Igara, in a Busia District where he does dairy farming as his business which he started in 2009 as a source of income. 
He sells milk everyday, but it doesn’t end there, Jackson is looking at a brighter future ahead which will see his business expanding. But to achieve this, financial assistance will be needed. It is for this reason he would like to get a loan worth KSH .20000. These funds would be used to buy enough feed for the cattle and pesticides for vaccination.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vaccines for the cattle.

loans.name: Las Cumplidoras Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Las Cumplidoras está conformado por 11 socias de las cuales la presidenta es la señora Epifania, ella es casada, tiene 5 hijos. Epifania se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir para damas, Epifania trabaja de lunes a sábado y cuenta con una experiencia de un año en el rubro. 
El resto del grupo se dedica a diferentes actividades, la mayoría se dedica a la venta de coca, abarrotes  y confesión de prendas de vestir ya sea en sus domicilios o en sus puestos de ventas, una de las socias vende anticuchos de corazón. El grupo en general tiene bastante experiencia en los negocios que desempeñan y es por esta razón son conocidos en la zona donde venden sus productos. Si bien la competencia en general es bastante amplia, el grupo cuenta con experiencia y también con clientes fijos que reconocen su trabajo y demandan sus servicios, por otra parte el grupo tiene bastante entusiasmo con su negocio que hacen. El dinero fue utilizado como capital de operaciones, unos comprarán más abarrotes y telas, A este grupo les esta yendo bien en sus negocios y quieren seguir trabajando y contando sobre todo con financiamiento para poder alcanzar sus metas. El grupo tiene bastante experiencia crediticia con otras instituciones financieras.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Las Cumplidoras" ("The reliable ones") is made up of 11 members, of whom the president is Ms. Epifania. She is married with 5 children. Epifania works at dressmaking for ladies. She works from monday to saturday and has about a year of experience in the area. The rest of the group works in different activities. Most sell coca leaves, groceries, and work as dressmakers, be it at their homes or in their stands. One of the partners sells "anticuchos de corazón" (a typical dish in Peruvian gastronomy made of grilled bits of spicy beef heart). Generally speaking, the group has quite a lot of experience in their businesses and this is why they are well known in the area where they sell their products. While the competition in general is hard, the group has experience and also stable patrons that recognize their good work and demand their services. Besides, the group members are enthusiastic about their jobs. They will use the money as working capital; some will buy more groceries and fabric. This groups is doing well with its businesses and they want to keep working and above all to keep counting with financing to reach their goals. The group has quite a lot of experience with other microfinancing institutions.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Fakhroodin Noori Group

texts.en:
This is Fakhroodin Noori Group. Emamudin, who is the leader of this group, is 46 years old, married, and the father of five children. He lives in district 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan.

Emamudin has a retail shop. When he started this business, he had a small business and it was very weak, but when he got an individual loan he really improved a lot in his business. And still he is furthering his business, attracting a good number of customers, making a good income for his family, and repaying the loan without any difficulty and on time.

Therefore Emamudin has requested his second loan to enlarge his shop and continue his business with even more success. He is sure that he can be a good business dealer in the future.

Emamudin is happy with this loan. He would like to thank both Kiva and AFS and all lenders around the world who help workers and people who would like to be strong in their businesses. Finally, he wants to say that this process is a successful one in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy more food for his shop

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben O., 31, is married and the father of two children. His wife, Lilian, sells clothes in one of the local markets. Reuben runs an office stationery business in the heart of Kisumu town and gets numerous customers from schools and other institutions of learning within Kisumu. He supplies them with writing materials and other office stationery. It is keeping such contacts that has allowed him to excel in his business and he has continued to experience growth for the past four years.

Due to the increasing number of customers, Reuben has had to look for a financier to help him meet his customers' demands. He therefore joined Kadet Ltd., and applied for his first loan, after meeting the requirements. He intends to use the loan to buy more stationery to distribute to his customers, the majority being schools.  

His dream is to become a prime supplier of stationery to different schools within Kisumu City and neighboring towns. He also hopes to boost his wife’s business, which will increase the family's income.

loans.use: To buy stationery and other office supplies for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Pen  R., 50, is widowed and resides with her two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for clay and ceramic products. She produces baskets to sell for an income of about $2 per day. 

R. is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike for the family's use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. R. is pictured with her daughter here at Credit's office in Kampong Chnang.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Alma Iris

texts.es: Alma Iris tiene 26 años, su actividad económica es el servicio de taller de carpintería. Por lo que siempre le ha gustado trabajar de la forma más humilde ella posee un negocio que es un taller de carpintería ubicado en su casa de habitación. Por lo que tiene mucho tiempo de hacerse cargo desde hace 8 años, realiza la compra de contado a diferentes proveedores pues es muy difícil encontrar muy buena madera para la elaboración de sus productos. Por lo que siempre ha invertido sus créditos en su negocio para que pueda salir adelante. Por lo que además ella le ayuda a sus padres ya que ellos no pueden trabajar por su avanzada edad. Solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima. Su deseo es mejorar cada día en la calidad de sus productos.
texts.en:
Alma Iris is 26 years old and runs a carpentry shop. She has always enjoyed working in the most modest surroundings, and runs her carpentry business from the house in which she lives. She has operated this business for a long time, spanning the last eight years. She pays her various providers in cash, but finds it difficult to acquire quality wood to make her products. She has always invested loan proceeds with the goal of succeeding in her business. Additionally, she is helping her parents who can no longer work as they are advanced in age. She is requesting additional financing for the purchase of primary materials. Her goal is to improve the quality of her products on a daily basis.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Vicente German

texts.es:
Vicente German G. M. tiene 24 años.  Es soltero y vive con sus padres en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.
Vicente es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Lotan Bajo, que se encuentra a media hora del pueblo de San Miguel. Son 13 socios en total, y en su mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.
Vicente se dedica a la agricultura desde pequeño. Cultiva maíz, trigo, papas y fréjol. Hace las compras y ventas en el mercado de San Miguel cada 15 días, el día de la feria. 
Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la agricultura e insumos. El crédito le ayudará a tener más dinero y más tiempo libre. Sus sueños para los 5 próximos años es casarse, salir adelante, tener una casa, un carro. Los desafíos que enfrente son la falta de lluvia y las cosechas.
Le gusta hacer deportes los fines de semana, jugar gallos de pelea y también bailar y cocinar.
texts.en:
Vicente German G. M., 24, is single and lives with his parents in San Miguel canton, Bolívar province. He is a member of the Lotan Bajo communal bank which is located half an hour away from the town of San Miguel. The bank has a total of 13 members who are, for the most part, farmers. Vicente has been a farmer since he was a little boy. He grows corn, wheat, potatoes and broad beans. He buys and sells at San Miguel’s market every two weeks on market day. He is asking for funds to invest in farm supplies. The loan will help him have more money and more free time. His dream for the next five years is to get married, to get ahead and have his own house and a car. The challenges he faces are the lack of rain and the crops. He likes to play sports on weekends, to participate in cock fights, and also to dance and cook.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more groceries to fill her warehouse

loans.name: Puthrea

texts.en:
Mr. Puthrea B. is a 24-year-old married man who lives in Chheal Phlouh Village in Takeo Province. He is a battery charger in the local village and is able to earn a small income to support his family. 

His charging machine was broken, so Mr. Puthrea B. decided to ask for a loan to buy a dynamo and to pay for repairs. 

His wife, Mrs. Sreyrem Paem, is a farmer who owns 2-hectares (~ 5 acres) of land on which she grows rice for a living. This couple has a child who is just 3 years old. 

His wife appears in the photo with him.

loans.use: To buy a dynamo and to pay for repairs to his battery charger

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
41-year- old Erlinda D. wants to grow her swine breeding and hog fattening business towards sustainability and profitability.  Hogs she fattened will be sold alive and in volume in the market, while the piglets produced by her swine will be the replacements for the ones sold. Proceeds from this business would enable Erlinda to support the education of her four children, whose ages range from 10 to 16 years old, until they all graduate from college and have earned the degrees they chose. Erlinda believes that this is the best way for them to face their own lives in the future and to have the opportunity to experience it away from the umbrella of poverty. 

Since the income from her hog fattening and swine breeding business can only be earned after four months to one year, Erlinda and her husband have other income to help support their family, especially the educational needs of the children and buying food for the hogs. Her husband earns income as a fish vendor, and Erlinda buys large volumes of herbal medicines, which she sells directly to people in different villages and offices within and outside their own town.

loans.use: To purchase larger volumes of herbal medicines for resale.

loans.name: Arsenio

texts.es:
Arsenio es un padre de familia de 51 años que vive junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en el sector Guaraguaos, una zona rural del distrito de Tambogrando, un distrito agrícola dedicado principalmente al cultivo de frutas, las cuales son exportadas a diversos países, pertene a la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, situada a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Al igual que la mayor parte de hombres de la zona, se dedica desde joven a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura, actualmente cuenta con pequeño terreno de cultivo en donde siembra Mango, cuando cosecha esta fruta, la ofrece en venta a las plantas procesadoras de la zona que preparan este producto para ser vendido al extrajero. Esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingresos por lo que siempre se esfuerza al máximo para sacar adelamte su cultivo.

Arsenio desea adquirir algunos fertilizantes con los cuales planea brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo para poder obtener una buena producción, para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

El es una persona que durante todo este tiempo ha estado trabajando arduamente para sacar adelante a su familia, en la zona donde vive lo conocen como alguien tranquilo y entregado a su familia.
texts.en:
Arsenio is 51 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the Guaraguaos sector, a rural area in the Tambogrande district. This is an agricultural district where they mainly grow fruit that is exported to different countries. He lives in the Piura province, in a region that goes by the same name, three hours from Chiclayo. Like many of the other men in this region he has been working in agriculture since he was young. Currently, he has a small plot of land where he grows mangos. When he harvests the fruit he sells it to the processing plants in the region that prepare it to be sold abroad. This work provides him with his main source of income and he always works hard to get the most out of his crop. Arsenio wants to buy fertilizer that he will use to maintain his crop to obtain a good harvest. To achieve this he has requested a loan, for the first time, from Edpyme Alternativa of 1000 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency). He is a person that has always worked very hard to provide for his family. In the area where he lives he is known a being a peaceful and devoted family man.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to maintain his mango crop

loans.name: Mrs. Siv Ea Lay Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Sixteen people who live in Pou village in Takeo province have selected Mrs. Siv Ea L. as their village bank president. She was born in 1947. All the village bank loan members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their businesses.

Mrs. Siv Ea L. is a clothes washer in the local village, where she is able to earn some money to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Khea Heng, is a construction worker. Her problem is that her washing business does not have enough water to use. So to improve her business, Mrs. Siv Ea L. is applying for a loan to buy a pump machine to use to support her business. She is the mother of two children, both of whom are helping their parents’ businesses.

loans.use: To buy a pump machine

loans.name: Fany Remita

texts.es:
Fany de 46 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil, vende ropa por catalogo a sus conocidos, su esposo es guardia y tienen cuatro hijos. 

Comenzó a vender ropa hace 5 años atrás, cuando tuvo un problema económico por hacer una mala inversión, con sus pocos ahorros compro ropa de una revista y comenzó a venderlas a sus amigas y conocidos, trabaja repartiendo y promocionando la ropa por catalogo en ocasiones con ayuda de su hija. 

Para mejorar sus ventas ella quiere comprar con el préstamo ropa y mejorar su casa comprando pintura. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Fany is 46 years old and she lives in the suburban region of Paraiso de Guayaquil. She sells clothing through a catalogue to her acquaintances. Her husband is a security guard. They have four children together. She started selling clothes 5 years ago when she found herself in financial difficulty, following a failed financial investment. With her small saving she purchased clothing from a catalogue and she started to sell to her friends and her acquaintances. She works distributing and promoting the clothing, sometimes with the help of her daughter. In order to improve her sales she requests a loan to purchase clothing and to improve her home by repainting it. In the future she hopes to finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing.

loans.name: Zenith

texts.en:
Zenith M. is a 27 year old married woman who supports her family by operating 1 business venture: general store business.  She lives in Puso, Buluang, Compostela, Cebu.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP4,800.

Zenith is now borrowing PHP 12,000 as additional working capital. This will be her 4th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP8,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.  Zenith aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: For additional capital for general store.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma L. is from the village of Poblacion, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 38 years old. Gemma is separated from her spouse and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Gemma owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Gemma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Gemma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Otgontuya

texts.en:
Otgontuya P. is a 31-year-old single mother who lives with her mother and two children in Uvs province in Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic dwelling, in a rented yard. Her oldest son, aged ten, attends a local secondary school while her youngest daughter, aged five, goes to kindergarten; her mother is retired.

Otgontuya has been working in a shoe factory for three years after graduating in 2007 from Ulaangom College with a major in shoemaking. She is planning to sew a variety of shoes in her home to sell to her relatives.

Otgontuya is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase materials used in making shoes with white soles. In the future she hopes to make a large quantity of shoes and boots in her home. Otgontuya says, "I want to provide a good education for my children."

loans.use: To purchase shoemaking materials

loans.name: G.s Ovejitas De Jesus Group

texts.es: Paula Romelia y Fidelina conforman el grupo solidario Ovejitas De Jesús. Ellas son personas muy responsables se dedican a la misma actividades económicas. Paubla tiene más de 16 años de tener este negocio, por lo que ha sido muy difícil ya que ha tenido mucha competencia pero ella ha sabido muy bien tratar a sus clientes, pues es muy importante para mantener a su familia. En el caso de Fidelina tiene una pulpería, desde hace mas de 14 años siempre le ha gustado obtener este medio de vida que para ella es muy importante. Juntas han decidido realizar este financiamiento con el fin de invertir en sus negocios.
texts.en: Paula Romelia and Fidelina belong to the communal bank "Ovejitas De Jesús."  They are very responsible people who are both in the same line of work.   Paula has had her business for more than 16 years.  It has been very difficult, since there has been a lot of competition, but she knows how to treat her customers.  Her business is very important in supporting her family.  In the case of Fidelina, she has had a grocery store for more than 14 years.  She has always enjoyed earning a living this way; for her the business is very important.  Together, they have decided to take out this loan with the objective of investing in their businesses.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Arselia Epifania

texts.es:
El señora Arcelia cliente antigua de edad de 46 años vive en la zona de la Guardia barrio villa Fátima hace  5 años, oriunda  del departamento de Cochabamba, se fue a Santa Cruz buscando nueva oportunidad para salir adelante.                                                                                                     Estado civil: concubina con la sr Fernando de edad 48 años cuenta con la actividad de carpintero hace   12 años, al Sr. Le va muy bien, la señora tiene  con 4 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar.                                                                                                                                                                                                             Actividad: es la venta de desayuno y merienda   hace 20 años  en la zona de la guardia mercado de la zona, Destino del crédito  es para la compra de una heladera  para su negocio. 
La cliente están agradecida porque nuevamente confiamos en ellos y agilizamos su préstamo para poder invertir en lo que ellos necesitan.
texts.en:
Arcelia is an old client of Emprender.  She is 46 years old and has lived in La Guardia district, in Villa Fátima neighborhood for 5 years.  She originally comes from the department of Cochabamba but went to Santa Cruz looking for a new opportunity to get ahead.  She lives with Fernando who is 48 years old.  He has been working as a carpenter for 12 years and his business is doing very well.  Arcelia has 4 school-aged children.  She works selling breakfasts and afternoon meals in the district market of La Guardia.  She has been doing this for 20 years.  She will use her loan to buy a fridge for her business.

Arcelia is grateful that we are trusting in her again and are providing her with a loan so that she can invest in what she needs.

loans.use: To buy a fridge

loans.name: Cyprienne Eugénie

texts.fr: A. Cyprienne Eugénie est née le 26 septembre 1965 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Cyprienne Eugénie est mariée à HOUSSOU D. Emmanuel, et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille vit depuis environs sept ans à PK10 Marina dans la commune de Sèmè – Podji. Le couple a un autre enfant  à charge. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Cyprienne Eugénie a très peu fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et assurer les besoins de ses enfants, Cyprienne Eugénie vend divers produits (liqueurs, savons, conserves, lait, mayonnaise, etc.) ainsi que des produits de SOBEBRA dans sa boutique à Cotonou. Cyprienne Eugénie se ravitaille également à Cotonou. Cyprienne Eugénie exerce cette activité depuis dix sept ans et a déjà obtenu deux prêts qui ont été tous bien remboursés. La demande de la clientèle de Cyprienne Eugénie se fait de plus en plus grande et Cyprienne Eugénie désire augmenter le stock de ses produits afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. C’est pour ce faire que Cyprienne Eugénie sollicite un troisième crédit.
texts.en:
Cyprienne Eugénie A. was born on September 26 1965 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Emmanuel Houssou D., and is the mother of three children all attending school. For about seven years the family has been living in PK10 Marina in the commune of Seme- Podji. The couple is also financially responsible for another child. Some of the children are attending school. The couple shares in providing for the various family expenses.

Cyprienne Eugénie did not attend school for long. To provide for her needs and those of her children, she sells various items (liquor, soap, canned goods, milk, mayonnaise etc…) as well as items from SOBEBRA in her Cotonou store. She also gets her supplies in Cotonou. 

She has been practicing this activity for 17 years and has already received two loans that have been fully reimbursed.

Her customers’ demand is always increasing and she would like to augment her stock of items in order to better meet her clientele’s requests. This is the reason why Cyprienne Eugénie is requesting third loan.

loans.use: Purchase of various items (liquor, soap, canned goods, milk, mayonnaise)

loans.name: Augusto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Augusto; el tiene 32 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con la compra y venta de maíz y también se dedica al negocio de transporte de carga, el tiene un pequeño terreno de cultivo donde cultiva maíz y lo vende en las diferentes ferias que existe, el socio quiere mejorar la tierra de cultivo. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para la tierra de cultivo.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Augusto is a member of the 'Virgen Natividad' community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department. 

Augusto is 32 years old and lives with his common-law wife.  They have 4 children.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his business buying and selling corn.  He is also in the freight transportation business.  Augusto has a small plot of land where he grows corn which he then sells in different markets.  He would like to improve the plot of land where he grows his crops.  He is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for his land.  He is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers for the plot of land where he grows his crops

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “12 de Agosto”  del distrito Puno,  provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 30 años, de estado civil conviviente, tiene dos hijos que dependen económicamente de ella, realizó estudios de educación secundaria.

Trabaja hace ocho años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su préstamo inicial fue de  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de artículos de artesanía como chompas, la cual entrega para exportar.

Solicitará un  nuevo crédito por la suma  de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, comprará maquinas para tejer, herramientas auxiliares y lanas, lo trabaja sola.

Su sueño es ser proveedora a exportar.

Le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo, la solidaridad y el compromiso.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the “12 de Agosto” Communal Bank in the Puno district,  province and department. She is 30 years old, is in a common law marriage, and has two children who financially depend on her, she has had high school education.

She has worked for eight years with the Manuela Ramos Movement, her first loan was for  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, money that she invested in her business of selling craftwork such as sweaters, which she delivers for export.

She will request a new loan for the sum of S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, she will buy machinery for weaving, auxilliary tools and wool, she works alone.

Her dream is to be an export provider.

She likes her Communal Bank for the loan facility, the solidarity and the commitment.

loans.use: To buy machinery for weaving, tools and wool to make sweaters

loans.name: Ulugbek Tairov's Group

texts.en:
Jailoo is possibly the most exciting place to visit in Kyrgyzstan. In the Kyrgyz language it means a summer pasture high in the mountains, where shepherds move with their flocks of sheep, horses and cows.
Ulugbek T., 27, is a member of this group. Growing up in Jailoo, he kept the long-cherished family tradition of raising livestock including horses, sheep and cows. But Ulugbek also had ambitions to move to the city and start his own business. It’s been two years since he started driving a city cab in order to make a living. He also understood that selling cattle raised in the perfect conditions of Jailoo would provide a good source of income. Now Ulugbek spends his monthly income from cab driving on purchasing food for livestock that is taken care of by his parents. Ulugbek hopes to obtain a loan for buying additional livestock for resale. He believes his monthly profit will allow him to successfully repay the loan.

Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Jovito Daniel

texts.es:
Don Jovito Daniel S., es trabajador de una empresa de Acueductos y Alcantarillado desde hace 2 años y medio, desempeñando el cargo de Operador de Planta de Tratamiento de Aguas Residuales.

Es acompañado de 39 años de edad, egresado de la universidad, con 4 personas que dependen de él dos de ellas son menores de edad. Vive en la Ciudad de Managua, Municipio de Ciudad Sandino desde hace 8 años.

Este es el primer crédito con CEPRODEL el cual solicita para mejora de vivienda y poder darle a su núcleo familiar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Don Jovito Daniel S. has been employed by a water and sewage company for the past 2½ years. He works as an operator at a wastewater treatment plant.

Jovito is 39 years old and a university graduate. He has four people, including two minors, who are dependent on him. Jovito has lived in the city of Managua, municipality of Ciudad Sandino, for the past eight years.

This is his first loan with CEPRODEL. He has requested the loan to make home improvements so that he can provide his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials for home improvements

loans.name: Yudani Evelin

texts.es: Yudani Evelin S. de 26 años es una joven casada y con un hijo de dos años de edad, que tiene un negocio de venta de mercancias especialmente productos alimenticios y cosmèticos, mediante guias especializadas de productos, a travès de las cuales promociona una variada gama de articulos entre vecinas, familiares y empleados referidos por sus propios clientes.   Yudani iniciò esta actividad buscando generar otros ingresos a su hogar  y gradualmente ha ido adquiriendo su experiencia y con ello ampliando la cobertura de su mercado; hoy està aplicando a un credikiva que es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo para comprar productos alimenticios, que tambien vienen en catalogos y ya tiene un registro de encargos de sus clientes. Su sueño es tener una casa propia y su gran desafio es conseguir el suficiente capital de trabajo para atender la demanda de sus productos, respuesta con la cual ayudarìa a fortalecer su negocio, que en la actualidad presenta una utilidad del 22%, un capital de trabajo por valor de $1.750.000 cop y una rotaciòn de inventarios de 8 dias.
texts.en:
Yudani Evelin S., 26, is a young married woman with a two year old son.  She has a business selling merchandise, especially food items and cosmetics, via specialized catalogues though which she promotes a wide variety of items among her neighbors, family members and employees referred by her customers.

Yudani started this activity seeking ways to generate additional family income and gradually has been acquiring experience leading to an expanded market.  Today she is applying for a Kiva loan, which is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy food items that are also in the catalogues for she already has pending orders from her customers.

Her dream is to have a house of her own and her great challenge is to acquire enough working capital to meet demand for her products which would help her strengthen her business which currently is showing a 22% profit level, working capital valued at $1.750.000 COP and an 8 day inventory turnaround.

loans.use: To buy food items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy maize, beans and cooking fat

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene 37 años de edad, es conviviente y reside con su pareja e hija en el distrito de Reque, una zona bastante comercial que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.

Ella se dedica al comercio de bebidas refrescantes en el Mercado de su localidad desde hace 5 años.  Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad ayuda en sus gastos personales y los de su familia.  Ella en su afán de mejorar la calidad de vida a su familia quiere hacer mejoras en su vivienda, por lo que ha creido conveniente adquirir un préstamo de 1000 soles en Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 37 years old, married common-law, and she lives together with partner and daughter in the district of Reque. It is a highly commercial region belonging to the department of Lambayeque. 

She has been selling refreshing drinks in her neighborhood market for the past 5 years. With the income that she earns from this business she is able to provide for her personal expenses and those of her family. Her goal is to improve her family's quality of life and she wants to make some improvements to their house. For this reason she has requested a loan in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles form Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).

loans.use: to make improvements to her house.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 50 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Tomba, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’articles divers.                                                                                                                        
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter du savon, du riz, des condiments, des céréales et du bétail.                                                                       
AWA C. compte acheter deux sacs de savon avec les revendeurs au marché de Dioïla. Elle effectue ses ventes dans le village au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour couvrir ses propres dépenses et ceux de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The women of the Benkadi group are all married and average 50 years of age and three children. They all live in extended traditional families in Tomba, a village in Fana sub-prefecture, Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They got acquainted through bonds of kinship, neighborhood and friendship. They trade in various products and are seeking their second group loan, to be used to buy soap, rice, food condiments, cereals, and livestock.

AWA C. intends to buy two sacks of soaps from resellers at the market in Dioïla. She sells in the village, for cash and on credit, to a clientele comprising both men and women. She intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 40'000 (ca US$ 80), to be used to provide for herself and her children.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of soaps

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es: La señora Magdalena se dedica  a la venta y confección de zapatos de señora y su esposo ayuda con el trabajo; el crédito lo necesita para la compra  de materia prima como ser cuerina, tela, gamuza, etc.   Así podrá tener mayor cantidad de material y podrá realizar más zapatos. Vive  en casa propia ubicada en la zona Ballivian de la ciudad de El Alto, es casada  tiene tres  hijos. La señora esta satisfecha y muy contenta con los préstamos que se le otorgaron.
texts.en:
Magdalena manufactures ladies shoes to sell; her husband helps her with the work.  She needs the loan to buy raw materials like Naugahyde, fabric, suede, etc. in order to have larger amounts of materials to make more shoes. 

She lives in her own house in El Alto’s Ballivian zone.  She’s married and has three children.  She is satisfied and very happy with the loans she’s been granted.

loans.use: to buy shoe making supplies.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou L. is from the town of p-2, Eastern Pob., Lopez Jaena,  Mis. Occ.  She is 31 years old.  Marilou is single.  Marilou owns & operates a business selling products for daily use, such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community.  Marilou has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Marilou joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marilou from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to buy a motorcycle. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rosemarie works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending.  Rosemarie is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to  purchase fishing gear and equipment for her fishing business.

Rosemarie has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase fishing gear and equipment.

loans.name: Blanca Roxanna

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 20 años de edad, soltera sin hijos a cargo. Vive en casa de sus padres, la cual está ubicada en el Caserío Chacupe bajo, el cual es un caserío pequeño rural que pertenece al distrito de la Victoria.  Cuentan con servicio de luz y el agua que consumen es de un pozo. 

Se dedica a la Agricultura, la crianza de animales de engorde  y venta de los mismos, pero su actividad principal es realizar labores artesanales.Blanca  se dedica a la confección de sombreros de palma, tiene más de 05 años en dicha actividad.  Los sombreros  que ella confecciona son vendidos en la ciudad de Monsefú a comerciantes mayoristas de artesanía y turistas. Para poder realizar esta actividad blanca cuenta con cuenta con 01 maquina de coser donde también  confecciona vestidos y otras prendas de vestir.

Blanca esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para comprar telas para confección de prendas de vestir como vestidos , faldas y otros para comercializar, y tener la oportunidad de poder adquirir más materia prima para sus artesanías.

Blanca es una joven trabajadora, que desea salir a delante, apoyar en los gastos de su hogar y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Blanca is 20 years old, single, and she does not have children in her care. She lives at home with her parents, located in the community of Chacupe Bajo. It is a small rural community belonging to the district of La Victoria. They have electricity and the water they consume is from a well.

She is dedicated to agriculture and raising livestock for resale. But her primary activity is crafting. Blanca makes straw hats and she has more than 5 years in the business. The hats that she makes are sold in the city of Monsefu to the crafts wholesalers and to tourists. In order to carry out her activities Blanca has 1 sewing machine where she also makes dresses and other articles of clothing.

Blanca requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 500 nuevos soles to purchase fabrics to make articles of clothing, such as dresses, skirts, and others products to sell. Her goal is to acquire more materials to make her crafts.

Blanca is a young, hardworking woman who dreams of moving ahead, to cover the expenses of her home and to improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make her crafts.

loans.name: Jeaninne

texts.en: Jeaninne is married and has one child. Her husband is a hard working businessman. Jeaninne sells meat and she has been doing so for three years.  Her business has helped her meet her needs and earn some savings. She is requesting a loan to buy more meat for sale so that she can increase her profits. She plans to save all her profits and buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to puchase meat for sale.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a young man from Hebron, who suffers from cataract. A cataract is a cloudy area in the lens of the eye and causes dizziness and blurry vision.

Muhammad is an employee and can't afford to pay for the surgery but he can pay back, on a monthly basis, the loan he received from FATEN.

Muhammad appears in the picture here.

loans.use: to pay for eye operation expenses (cataract)

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Married to a day laborer, Joice is 35 years old,and she have seven children, none of them is schooling. Joice will use the loan to expand her food -vending business in order to increase her income. and it will be very easy for her for taking care of the children

loans.use: to expand her business.

loans.name: Ikromiddin

texts.en:
Ikromiddin is a cattle farmer, continuing his father's business for the past six years. Ikromiddin buys cattle, feeds them over a certain period of time, and sells them at a reasonable price. He would like to request a loan of 5,000 TJS for the purchase of cattle in order to increase the number of his herd and expand his business. 

Ikromiddin is married and is the responsible father of two children. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road as well as the location of the end of the rule of Alexander the Great. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous, leaving only 7 percent arable land. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent

loans.use: to purchase cattle in order to increase the number of his herd and expand his business

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 49 years old and married to Rael who is a farmer. They are blessed with seven children. He has been a carpenter for four years with a monthly income of KES 5,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD. Samuel will use the loan to buy timber for making furniture and carpentry tools. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hope is concentrated more on his children’s education.

loans.use: To buy timber

loans.name: María Antonieta

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Empresarias Con Futuro se reúne cada 15 días en el Palmar en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual y con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 59 años de edad, en la actualidad está soltera pero de una relación que tuvo hace varios años tiene tres hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad y todos viven en su casa pero en departamentos independientes con sus respectivas familias.
 
Ella tiene un negocio de internet y cabinas telefónicas, allí ofrece el servicio de llamadas tanto nacionales como al extranjero así como el de internet, en este lugar además de prestar estos servicios también vende golosinas, bocadillos de picar, sodas, energizantes, tarjetas y recargas telefónicas. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 22h00 que se va a descansar, son muchos años que tiene su negocio y son muchas las personas que llegan a su local.
 
Este crédito es para comprar golosinas, sodas y pagar la cuenta del servicio telefónico y de internet. Lleva dos ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque estos créditos son un impulso para personas como ella en sus negocios.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Empresarias Con Futuro” (Businesswomen with a Future) meets every 15 days in El Palmar in the city of Manta, which is known for its beautiful beaches that are frequented throughout the year. This city has unequaled beauty and many tourist attractions.

Sra. María lives in this area. She is 59 years old and currently single, but has been in a relationship for several years. María has three children who are all adults and live at home. They reside in separate areas of her house with their respective families.

María has a business consisting of an Internet café and phone booths. She offers national and international calls, as well as Internet service. In addition to providing these services, she also sells candy, snacks, sodas, energy drinks, calling cards, and rechargeable phone credits. María works every day from 8am to 10pm, leaving her fatigued. She has been in business for several years and many people come to her establishment.

This loan will be used to buy candy and sodas, as well as pay her telephone and Internet bills. María has participated in two loan cycles with her Communal Bank. She enjoys being a member because the loans have been a boost to people like her who need the money to run their businesses.

Her dreams include moving forward with her business.

loans.use: to pay her telephone and Internet bills and to buy candy and sodas.

loans.name: Chinigul

texts.ru: Чинигул проживает в районе Дангара. Ей 41 год. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Ее дети маленькие. Чинигул имеет среднее образование. Она у себя в районе открыла магазин. У нее магазин со смешанным ассортиментом. В этой области она уже четыре года. Кредит берет для покупки продуктов питания и хозяйственных товаров.
texts.en: Chinigul lives in the Dangara district.  She is 41 years old, married and has three children, all of whom are small.  Chinigul has a secondary education.  She opened a store in her district and carries various merchandise in her store.  She has been working in this field for four years.  Chinigul is requesting this loan for the purchase of food products and household goods.

loans.use: to purchase food products and household goods

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer wants a loan to buy rice, flour, sugar and salt to sell. The 34-year-old single mother hails from Kyenjojo District and is charged with the responsibility of taking care of her child. For four years, she has been operating a retail shop and with the proceeds, she has been able to educate her child. Her greatest challenge is inadequate capital to meet the increasing desires of her customers and her dream is to set up a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy rice, flour, sugar and salt.

loans.name: Ophelia

texts.en:
Ophelia is 38 years old. She is currently engaged in selling a variety of food, which she cooks and prepares every day. At first, she found it difficult to acquire customers because she was new in the business and people had not tried her foods. But as time passed, she gained loyal customers and made sales.
In order to expand her business, Ophelia is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy bananas (to make bananacue, turon, banana cheaps), eggs (to be coated with flour), breads and juice. She is hoping to make a larger profit in order to be able to meet daily expenses, especially the education of her two children. She also wants to experience a comfortable life so while she is strong she is working hard every day.

loans.use: to buy bananas (to make bananacue, turon, banana cheaps), eggs (to be coated with flour), breads and juice.

loans.name: Reynalda

texts.en:
Reynalda is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.
 
Reynalda has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 26 years. She requested a loan for 15,000 Philippines pesos to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Reynalda has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Reynalda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Sughran is 44 years old.  Her husband sells wheat.  He purchases wheat from the wholesale market and sells to his local area clients for profit. Sughran is a seamstress.  She started this business a few years ago to financially support her husband. She is very good at her work and receives a good number of orders every month. 

Sughran is the mother of 4 children. Her eldest daughter weaves carpet while the others are studying in different classes.  She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s wheat selling business. With this loan, he will buy wheat in bulk quantity to allow him to supply larger quantities of wheat to his client and earn more profit.   He is an experienced person in his business and has been operating it for the past 5 years.  Sughran is confident that an investment will help him improve his business further.

loans.use: to buy wheat

loans.name: Evons

texts.en: Evons is 42 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is married and her husband is a contractor. She has three children between 16 and 20 years old. For the past twenty years she has been selling red oil in the local market. She makes a profit and has a lot of customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more plum oil (red oil) for her business. She plans to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more plum oil (red oil) for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for more rice, onions and coconut milk to make "nasi uduk" (an Indonesian rice dish) to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two sewing machines.

loans.name: Idi

texts.en:
Idi is a 43-year-old married man with two school-going children. His wife, Mwanalima, is a businesswoman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. He owns a house with electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his children. 

Idi has operated a welding business for the past two years; his potential clients are trailer truck owners. He faces the major challenge of insufficient space in which to conduct his business. He dreams of expanding his business and hiring two assistants.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, he wants to purchase a welding machine and hire two assistants to help him run his business. He decided to join Yehu to get funds to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase a welding machine and hire two assistants to help him run his business.

loans.name: Syuzanna

texts.en: Syuzanna is engaged in agriculture, raising cattle and maintaining an orchard. Due to her hard work and enthusiasm Syuzanna has developed her business over the past three years, constructing a barn and expanding the land. Syuzanna needs some financial investment to develop her farming. With the requested loan, she plans to purchase livestock. This increase of livestock will promote agriculture in the community and create opportunities for jobs in the future.

loans.use: to pay for livestock

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: The grocery shop above is owned by Ama. She is married and has four children. Some of the items in the grocery shop are soaps, spaghetti, cooking oil, and tins of milk. Her business is three years old. Ama uses her income to support her partner to take care of the home. Ama will use the loan to purchase more types of groceries to bring variety into the shop. She plans to reinvest the new profits.

loans.use: to purchase other types of groceries to bring more variety to the shop.

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr:
Khady est  une femme mariée de 52 ans qui vit dans une des localités du Sénégal. Elle s’active dans le secteur du commerce plus précisément  dans la vente de tissus tels que thioub, wax. Elle a une expérience d’un an dans son activité qu’elle a choisi par nécessité dans le but de se procurer une source de revenus. L’aspect le plus intéressant   de son activité reste la satisfaction des besoins de sa clientèle qui est très diversifiée. Elle est  membre d’un guichet de l’U-IMCEC  qui est localisée dan sa zone d’habitation depuis quelques années. Elle sollicite un crédit de 400 000 frs prévu pour le financement de son voyage dans un pays limitrophe  du Sénégal.
 Son objectif est d’aller s’approvisionner en tissus, maximiser ses bénéfices et mieux satisfaire ses besoins.
texts.en: Khady is a married woman, 52 years old, who lives in a town in Senegal. She is active in the business sector, more precisely in the selling of fabrics such as thioub (dyed cloth) and wax (colorful West African cloth). She has a year of experience in her business, which she chose out of necessity with the aim of earning a source of revenue. The most interesting aspect of her business is still found in meeting the needs of her very diverse customer base. For a few years, she has been a member of U-IMCEC branch office located in a residential area. She is requesting a loan of 400,000 francs for financing a trip to a country neighboring Senegal. Her goal is to go and stock up on fabrics, to maximize her profits, and to support herself better.

loans.use: to finance a trip to buy fabrics

loans.name: Eman

texts.en: Eman is a 43-year-old woman from Al Hussein, Amman, Jordan. She is a tailor and she is requesting a loan of 500 Jordanian dinars to purchase an additional sewing machine. Eman is looking to license her business and start making sales to companies. She wants to redecorate her home and purchase a car.

loans.use: to purchase an additional sewing machine

loans.name: Thao

texts.en: Mrs. Thao is 42 years old. She is married and has three children, so she works very hard to provide for them .Husbandry is the main income of her family. With this loan, she is able to build a hygienic latrine to improve her family living standard as well as environment protection.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Jeannette Abla

texts.en:
Madam Jeannette Abla A.,a widower remarried to a benevolent teacher without salary for six months, Madam A. is about 40 years old. All the charges of the family are let on her. She is living at Alinka, a village of the canton of Togblé where she has as main activity, the peppers planting. She has at her dependence her two (02) orphans plus the two (02) others children of the new husband and the husband himself. Her senior daughter of the level of form 4 become house girl for lack of support and the second a boy is actually at home with the level of form 2 due also to the lack of support. She does only living from that activity which could bring her back if she has benefited from a more consistent financial support. Very courageous and despite her very misery situation, she has the respect of the other’s property and has succeeded to manage clearly her first credit of $850 without incident. Though she is illiterate, she has always showed the proof of her serious and rigour in her management. She is requesting a credit of $850 to buy a motor-pump in order to be in the safety of the climate ups and downs to enlarge her cultivable surface for a greater production. Backing Madam A., is not only a support to her economic activities, but and especially a humanitarian gesture as the incomes draw from that activity will serve to provide for the needs of those orphans children.

Madame A. Abla Jeannette, veuve remariée à un enseignant volontaire sans salaires depuis six mois, Madame A. a environ 40 ans d’âge. Toute la charge de la famille repose sur elle. Elle vit à Alinka, un village du canton de Togblé où elle a comme activité principale, la culture des piments. Elle a à sa charge ses deux (02) orphelins plus des deux (02) autres du nouveau mari et le mari lui-même. Sa fille aînée de niveau classe de 3ème est devenue domestique faute de soutien et le second, garçon est aujourd’hui à la maison avec le niveau 5ème faute de support également. Elle ne vit que cette activité qui pourrait lui rapporter si elle avait bénéficié d’un appui financier plus consistant. Très courageuse et malgré sa situation de misère très criarde, elle a le respect des biens d’autrui et a su gérer sainement son premier crédit de $350 sans incident. Malgré qu’elle soit analphabète, elle a toujours fait preuve de son sérieux et de sa rigueur dans sa gestion Elle sollicite un crédit de $850 pour s’acheter une moto pompe afin de se mettre à l’abris des aléas climatiques et d’agrandir sa surface cultivable pour une production plus grande. Soutenir Madame A. Abla Jeannette, est non seulement un soutien à ses activités économiques, mais et surtout un geste humanitaire, car les revenus tirés de cette activités serviront à subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants orphelins.

loans.use: To buy a motor-pump and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Silau Kirisiet would like to buy three more steers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, seeds and prepare her farm for her farming business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 37 years old, married, and has 3 children. Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer. She has a grocery store in her house. She belongs to the group “Flor de Tila 1”, together with Mrs. Maria del Carmen Gordillo Aguilar (who makes bread and sells it door-to-door) and Mrs. Amelia L. Guillen (who sells perfumes and cosmetics). They plan to invest the loan in their businesses: Mrs. Rosa plans to buy non-perishable food, Amelia will invest it in the purchase of more perfumes, and Mrs. Maria del Carmen will buy 100 kg (220 lbs) bags of flour to increase the production of bread.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Original description in Spanish:

ROSA TIENE 37 AÑOS , CASADA ,3 HIJOS ,.SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN LA CONSTRUCCION COMO ALBAÑIL. ELLA TIENE UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES EN SU CASA.PERTENECE AL GRUPO FLOR DE TILA 1 JUNTO CON DOÑA MARIA DEL CARMEN GORDILLO AGUILAR ( HACE Y VENDE PAN Y LOS VENDE DE CASA EN CASA ) Y DOÑA AMELIA L. GUILLEN ( VENDE PERFUMES Y COSMETICOS ). CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERAN INVERTIR EN SUS NEGOCIOS ; DOÑA ROSA COMPRANDO MERCADERIA DE ALIMENTOS NO PERECIBLES Y AMELIA INVERTIRA EN COMPRAR MAS PERFUMES , DOÑA MARIA DEL CARMEN COMPRARA QUINTALES DE HARINA PARA PRODUCIR MAYOR CANTIDAD DE PAN .

loans.use: to buy more merchandise

loans.name: Edison

texts.en:
“I don’t know how I can thank Feed The Children Uganda for what they have done for me,” says Edison T., a resident of Kiwatule in Kampala. He joined Tuwoda, a group of women and men who came together in order to get loans from FEED (now Pearl Microfinance Ltd), in 2001. He has borrowed and repaid loans ranging from USD115 to USD900 between 2001 and 2007.

He has managed to buy a banana plantation in his home area, Rukungiri, in southwestern Uganda, and a plot of land in the same area. He sells Bitenge textiles from Congo and works as a tailor. He is completing a residential house where his family will stay. He is 33 years of age and married with five children who are all in primary school. The business is doing very well; however, it can not finance the completion of the house.

loans.use: Edison would like to complete his house and the materials to be used include: 5 bags of cement, glass, window frames, and paint.

loans.name: Matileda

texts.en: Matileda N.'s business is the preparation of meat pies, which she supplies to retailers and schools. She acquired the knowledge on her own and started full time production in 1982. She has been with LAPO for 5 years. She is 60 years old, married with 6 children, and lives in Benin City. She is requesting a loan of $800 to enable her to buy a deep freezer and more supplies.

loans.use: To buy a deep freezer and supplies needed for preparation of meat pies.

loans.name: Enma

texts.es:
Doña Enma, sigue trabajando porque le agrada hacerlo y es su vocación comercializar los artículos que produce. Ella proviene D. una familia netamente artesana, expertos en producir artículos tejidos, cada proceso en su elaboración son conocidos a la perfección por Doña Enma quien ha transmitido a sus siete hijos los conocimientos que adquirió D. sus padres y hermanos. Produce mantos, alfombras, chompas, en fin, todo lo que se pueda tejer y producir en los telares, para luego comercializarlos en la ciudad D. Lima y también en algunas ferias D. su localidad. Siempre ha realizado esta labor y con ayuda D. su esposo ha podido educar a sus hijos con valores y amor al trabajo.
