Sus inmensos deseos D. progreso la llevan a solicitar vuestra ayuda a través D. un préstamo con el objetivo D. adquirir mayor cantidad y variedad D. materia prima para seguir elaborando sus bellos artículos.Posibilitemos su petición para que su negocio se consoliD. y cobije esta navidad a su numerosa familia en el seno D. su humilD. hogar.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Wendy Wise

Enma continues working because she enjoys doing so and her vocation is commercializing the articles she produces. She comes from a mostly artisan family, experts in producing knit articles, and its art of perfection is well known by Enma. As a result she has transmitted that to her seven children. She makes rugs, tapestries and sweaters, and any thing else that can be knit and then sold in the city of Lima and local fairs. She has always done this for a living and with the help of her husband she has been able to proviD. her children with work values and love for their traD.. Her immense desires to progress have taken her to now solicit your help for a loan, with the intention of acquiring larger and more diverse quantities of material to continue manufacturing her beautiful articles. Let’s make her request possible so her business may grow and thus, allow her and her large family a merry Christmas in the warmth of their home.

loans.use: Compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de materia prima para la fabricación de bellos artículos./ Purchase large quantities and varieties of prime material to make beautiful products.

loans.name: Ni Nengah Darik

texts.id:
Currently, chocolate production is very essential support to Ni Nengah Darik’s family. Because the price of chocolate is high at Rp. 12.000,- (USD1.30) per kilogram. Ni Nengah Darik owns a cocoa plantation of 2 hectare. Ni Nengah Darik and her husband converted her farmland to cocoa plantation. However, if the cocoa plants are not well maintained, the production will not be good. Therefore Ni Nengah Darik and her husband borrowed from Dinari Rp. 3.000.000,- (USD320) to buy cocoa seeds. The cost of each cocoa seedling is Rp. 500,- (USD0.50). Ni Nengah Darik buys 400 seedlings at a total cost of Rp. 2.000.000,- (USD200). The balance funding of Rp. 1.000.000,- (USD100) used for medicine because cocoa pest is vicious. The effect of the cocoa pest destroys the fruits turning them black. Ni Nengah Darik spray about Rp. 1.000.000,- (USD100) of medicine on the pest. If sprayed, the cocoa fruits will be good. Every fortnight, Ni Nengah Darik harvest 60 kilogram which can be sold for Rp. 12.000 (USD1.30) per kilogram.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Saat ini hasil coklat sangat menunjang kebutuhan keluarga Ni Nengah Darik. Karena harga coklat sangat mahal bisa mencapai Rp.12.000,- per satu kilogram. Ni Nengah Darik memiliki kebun coklat 2 hektar . Ni Nengah Darik dan suaminya tidak lagi bertani, semua sawahnya ditanami coklat. Tetapi coklat tanpa dipelihara dengan baik hasilnya tidak bagus. Oleh sebab itu Ni Nengah Darik dan suaminya meminjam modal dari Dinari sebesar Rp. 3.000.000,- untuk membeli bibit coklat. Harga satu pohon bibit coklat Rp.500,-. Ni Nengah Darik membeli bibit coklat 400 pohon dengan harga keseluruhan Rp. 2.000.000,-. Sisa modal Rp.1.000.000,- dipakai untuk membeli obat - obatan, karena hama coklat saat ini semakin ganas. Efek sampingan yang ditimbulkan oleh hama coklat , biji coklat membatu dan busuk warnanya hitam ( kangker coklat ). Ni Nengah Darik menghabiskan obat semprot hama coklat hampir Rp.1.000.000,-.Kalau sudah disemprot buah coklat bijinya bagus. Setiap 2 minggu Ni Nengah Darik bisa panen 60 kg dengan harga Rp.12.000,- per kg .

loans.use: Purchase medicine and cocoa seedlings (membeli obat-obatan dan bibit kako)

loans.name: Melvin José

texts.es:
Mr. Melvin L. devotes himself to renting computers with Internet access in the city of León. It’s a very important business since young students use the computers to do their homework assignments, which is why they turn to this center to rent computers.

Today, the business is growing rapidly due to the fact that he has known to invest in the businesss through loans from CEPRODEL that he uses to directly purchase computers as well as maintain and repair these machines.

Currently, he needs to acquire a new computer and to purchase new hardware to replace damaged equipment. For this reason, he confidently turns to CEPRODEL to receive help from these credits that he says will be of great use to him.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

El alquiler de computadoras con acceso a Internet es el negocio que se dedica el señor Melvin L. en la ciudad de León. Es un negocio muy importante debido a que los jóvenes estudiantes hacen uso de computadoras para realizar sus tareas y por tal motivo acuden a este centro para alquilar las computadoras.

Hoy en día el negocio ha venido proliferando por el hecho de que ha sabido invertir en el negocio por medio de los créditos otorgados en Ceprodel utilizados directamente en la compra de las computadoras y además en el mantenimiento y repararon de estos equipos.

Actualmente su necesidad es la adquisición de una nueva computadora y la compra de piezas nuevas para cambiárselas a los equipos dañados y para esta razón es que acude confiadamente a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con estos créditos que asegura le son de mucha utilidad.

loans.use: Invest in new computers and replacement hardware

loans.name: Marinee's Group

texts.en:
Marinee and Nery are members of the community bank “Buena Suerte”. Marinee has been an associate of the community bank for ten years, while Nery has been a member for a little over one year. Through the bank they have learned responsibility and punctuality.

Marinee is 35 years old. She lives with her partner and their one child. Marinee used to be a bank organizer with the community bank, but now concentrates on her business. She has two businesses. Marinee travels to Lima and buys clothing that she later sells to distributors in Ayacucho. Marinee also sells used cars.

Nery is 33 years old. She is separated and has two children. One time per week Nery travels to the city of Tambo, which is two and a half hours outside of Ayacucho, to buy grains. She later sells the grains at the market in Ayacucho.

Marinee and Nery need loans of 1000 and 900 sole (3 soles = $1), which they will use to improve their home, and to buy wheat, corn, barley, and other grains.

loans.use: Marinee and Nery need loans of 1000 and 900 sole (3 soles = $1), which they will use to improve their home, and to buy wheat, corn, barley, and other grains.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en: Jamal is a 36-year-old man. He works and lives with his family in southern Lebanon, in Saida. Jamal is in the food vending business and he also paints furniture. Jamal wants to buy provisions for his little shop. The increased amount generated from his business will help him pay for his wife's childbirth expenses.

loans.use: to buy provisions for his small business

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru is 26 years old, married, with two children, ages 8 and 3. In 2006, Nuru began selling charcoal, working daily from 7am to 8pm at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $320 from her sales.

In the past, Nuru has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary O. sells a hot drink called Ogogoro in the Ilogbo community in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is able to sell her product well because she offers excellent customer service. She is 35 years old and married with three children. She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past two years and has been in this business since 2006. She learned her business over three years.

She needs a loan of $850.00 to buy more hot drinks (Ogogoro) so that she can increase the profitability of her business.

loans.use: To buy more hot drinks (Ogogoro) to sell.

loans.name: Placida

texts.es:
Placida creates "pollera" skirts worn by "cholitas" (indigenous women who wear the traditional costume), working in a variety of fabrics. She is separated and has six children who are grown and independent. She still has one daughter dependent on her. She is the sole provider of income for her family since she cannot count on any other help.

Her home is in the Irpavi II district of La Paz. This is the first time she has requested a loan from Impro. The loan will be used to purchase fabric, lining, thread and other supplies in order to continue her work and ensure the income so necessary for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva volunteer

Placida elabora polleras para cholita y realiza su trabajo en diferentes tipos de tela; ella es separada y tiene seis hijos que son mayores de edad e independientes, solo una esta a su cargo. Es la única que genera ingresos para la subsistencia de su familia ya que no cuenta con otra ayuda. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Irpavi II de la ciudad de La Paz.. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro; el crédito será destinado para realizar para la compra de tela, forro, hilos y otros, de esta manera continuar su trabajo y asegurar sus ingresos tan necesarios para mantener a su familia..

loans.use: Purchase of fabric, lining, thread and other supplies to make traditional skirts

loans.name: Eva Emil's Nguvu Mpya Group

texts.en:
Eva E., age 46, is married with 6 children (ages 24, 22, 18,15, 9, and 6). For the past 4 years, she has had a café, where she sells food and drinks. She works from 6 AM to 6 PM daily, and earns about $60 profit a month.

Eva has had two previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she used to increase her business. She plans to use the new loan to buy a blender and make more juice so she can increase sales. Eva will share this loan with her loan group Nguvu Mpya, which has 16 members. These members will hold each other accountable to pay back their loans.

In the picture, Eva is second from the right, in the middle row.

loans.use: Purchase a blender to increase juice/beverage production and sales

loans.name: Yankadi (Bon Endroit) Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Yankadi sont des femmes mairées monogames avec en moyenne deux (2) enfants. Elles résident dans le quartier Hamdallaye de Sikasso et se sont connues par des liens de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font généralement le petit commerce de divers articles notamment la vente de fruits, de legumes, de céréales et de charbon. 

Dans leurs soucis de renforcer leurs activités, elles ont décidé d’intégrer le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso ou elles sont à leur premier prêt. 

Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter 10 sacs de fruits et de legumes, 20 sacs de céréales et 20 sacs de charbon. Elles s’approvisionnent généralement lors des foires hebdomadaires des villages environnants et au marché de sikasso. 

Les produits sont vendus au marché de sikasso en gros ,en détails ou au comptant. Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000 FCFA .
texts.en:
The members of the Yankadi group are married and monogamous women who have, on average, two children. They live in the Hamdallaye neighborhood in Sikasso and became acquainted through bonds of vicinity and friendship. Their typical business consists in selling various products, in particular fruits, vegetables, cereals and charcoal. Anxious to bolster their businesses, they decided to join the micro-credit program of Soro Yiriwaso for a first loan. With this loan, they intend to buy 10 sacks of fruits and vegetables, 20 sacks of cereals, and 20 sacks of charcoal. They usually do their shopping during weekly fairs in the surrounding villages, and in the Sikasso market. The products are then resold, retail, wholesale or for cash, in the Sikasso market. They hope to make of monthly profit of 20.000 XOF each.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various products (fruits, vegetables, cereals and charcoal) for resale

loans.name: Licenia

texts.es: Licenia es una mujer muy activa y con deseos de superación, a sus 56 años, es viuda desde hace 10 años, tiene 8 hijos quienes significan todo para ella, sin embargo gracias al apoyo de su esposo sacaron adelante a los mismos, siendo en la actualidad, profesionales. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, trabaja para una línea cosmética reconocida a nivel nacional, por su buena atención y amabilidad cuenta con una clientela numerosa, es por eso que optó por implementarse con más de estos productos, así como también quiere comprar una vitrina para su exhibición y seguridad. Para cumplir son su propósito precisa del préstamo que ahora solicita.
texts.en:
Licenia is a very active woman with desires to improve her life. At the age of 56, she is a widow of ten years. She has eight children who mean everything to her. Nevertheless, thanks to the support of her husband, they became professionals. She is dedicated to selling beauty products. She works with a cosmetic line known on the national level, and due to her good service and friendliness, she works with a large clientele. It is for this reason that she wants to increase her number of products and also buy a small glass cabinet for the exhibition and security of her products. To fulfill these objectives, she is requesting this loan today.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a glass cabinet to exhibit and keep safe her beauty products.

loans.name: Marianela

texts.es:
Marianela S. A. es originaria de Cadereyta Nuevo Léon. Ella tiene 33 años y cuenta con un negocio de banquetes, mismo que le fue hereradado por su suegra, ya que desde que se casó trabaja ahi. <

> Actualmente Marianela solicita un préstamo por USD$925 a un plazo de 6 meses, para surtir mercancías y acondicionar su local. En Banquetes Toñita también labora su esposo y cuentan con otro empleado adicional. Los origenes de este negocio se deben a que a los cuñados de Marianela no les interesó hacerse cargo de los banquetes, por tal motivo este fue heredado a su esposo y a ella desde hace 15 años. <

> ¡¡¡¡¡Los invito a que apoyen a Marianela para que puedan pintar su local y así como relizar la compra de utensilios de cocina!!! <

>
texts.en:
Marianela S. A. is a native of Cadereyta Nuevo León. She has a catering business, which she inherited from her mother-in-law. She has worked there since she got married.

Currently Marianela is requesting a loan of $925, which she will repay in 6 months. She will use it to purchase merchandise and to fix up her location. Her husband also works at Banquetes Toñita, so they have another job. They started in this business due to the fact that Marianela's in-laws weren't interested in catering anymore, so she and her husband inherited the business 15 years ago.

I invite you to support Marianela so she can paint her location and purchase cooking utensils!

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and fix up her location.

loans.name: Santusa

texts.es:
Doña Santusa es socia del Banco Comunal “Chojchoni” ubicado en el Distrito de Copani, Provincia de Yunguyo-Puno. Tiene 74 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos mayores vive en el sector Pallcacato, asistió al Programa de Alfabetización, es casada y su esposo le ayuda a vender golosinas, los días de feria. Con el préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compro ganado vacuno y ovino para engorde después de 2 años decidió cambiar de negocio e iniciar con la venta de golosinas. Hace 4 años que trabaja con Manuela Ramos. Actualmente sigue con la actividad económica de venta de golosinas.

Con el préstamo que solicitara de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles el cual será pagado en 4 cuotas comprara una vaca (ganado vacuno) para engorde.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando con el Banco y continuar con su negocio hasta donde pueda.
texts.en:
Dona Santusa is a member of the communal bank "Chojchoni" located in the Copani district of Peru's Yunguyo-Puno province. She is 74 years old and married with 4 grown children. She lives in the Pallcacato area, and has attended a literacy program. Santusa's husband helps her sell candy during street market days.

With a previous loan of 300 Peruvian Soles (US $100), Santusa bought cattle and sheep to fatten. After 2 years, she decided to change businesses and began selling sweets, which she continues to do. She has been working with Manuela Ramos (the microfinance partner) for 4 years.

Dona Santusa is requesting a loan of 800 Peruvian Soles (US $275) to buy a cow to fatten. The loan will be repaid in 4 installments.

Dona Santusa's desire is to continue working with Manuela Ramos and to take her business as far as she can.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a cow to fatten.

loans.name: Umija

texts.en:
Ujima, a single 22-year-old, is currently in the business of selling food at a hotel and is requesting a loan to expand the business. With the extra profits accruing from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a permanent house for rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To build a perminent house for rent

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
La señora Natalia E. tiene ya más de cuatro años dedicándose a la venta de abarrotes este ha sido su fuente de ingresos de su familia ya que es madre soltera y tiene bajo su responsabilidad una hija de 8 años de edad que esta estudiando. 
Desea que su negocio tenga más variedad de productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes pero no cuenta con el capital necesario para poder surtir su negocio y así poder ofrecer más variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Ms. Natalia E. has been selling groceries for over four years and this has been her family’s source of income as she is a single mother with responsibility for her 8 year old daughter who attends school. She would like her business to have a greater variety of products to offer her customers but she doesn’t have the necessary capital to be able to stock her business and therefore be able to offer a greater variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Latifa

texts.en:
Latifa B., 35, is the mother of seven children – one female and six males - four of whom are in junior high and primary school, while the rest are currently working. Latifa lives with her husband, a farmer who cultivates palm nuts, oranges and maize, and some of the children in a rented apartment in Koforidua, a small business and farming community near Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Latifa has traded in maize for the past seven years, purchasing it from farmers in her community and the surrounding towns. She sometimes procures smoked fish as well. Latifa is now requesting a loan to purchase bags of maize in bulk, hoping to save enough to help her husband put up a building of their own and sponsor the rest of their children’s education through to the university level.

loans.use: To procure maize.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana L. is in the business of selling onions, rice and beans and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Diana is 29 years old and is married. Her husband is a soldier. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits earned from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her food selling business

loans.name: Parvina

texts.ru: Парвина работает в собственном свадебном салоне. Ей исполнилось 35 лет, замужем и имеет троих детей. Муж на заработках в России. Работа в салоне интересная, так как каждый день встречаешься с различными людьми, при этом когда наряжаешь невесту – это доставляет особое удовольствие. Парвина не имеет специального образования, но приобрела профессионализм от каждодневной работы. Парвина ранее нигде не кредитовалась, но недавно узнала про Микроинвест и решила получить свой первый займ. Она собирается добавить в свою коллекцию новые свадебные платья.
texts.en:
Parvina works at, and is the owner of, a wedding salon. She's 35, married, and has three children. Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia. She finds her work in the salon interesting, as every day she meets with different people, and working with brides gives her particular pleasure. Parvina does not have a specialized education, but acquired a professional sense from her work. Before, Parvina never took out a loan; however, she recently heard about Microinvest, and decided to take out her first loan. She intends to add new wedding gowns to her collection.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of new wedding gowns

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia es socia del Banco Comunal Anabella.
Alicia es soltera, tiene 69 años y 2 hijos, Alicia vende comida en su casa en donde da pensión, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de su hija, además Alicia brinda servicio de preparación de comida para diferentes compromisos y eventos.
Alicia necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Alicia sueña con prosperar, tener un local estable y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Alicia is a member of the Banco Comunal Anabella. She is 69 years old and is single with 2 children. Alicia prepares and sells food from her home with the help of her daughter. She also offers catering services for different engagements and events.

Alicia is requesting a loan of 1500 soles ($400) to purchase rice and sugar. She dreams of being successful, owning a stable establishment and continuing her work.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice and sugar

loans.name: Ndèye

texts.fr: Ndèye P., 53 ans est membre de banc villageois de Pout Diack depuis 6 ans et demi Son activité est le commerce et l’élevage. Elle vend du bissap, du mil, du niébé et élève des chèvres pour les revendre Elle veut  renforcer ses activités et contribuer à la prise en charge de sa famille. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Ndèye P., age 53, has been a member of the village lending group of Pout Diack for six and a half years. Her work involves commerce and raising livestock. She sells dried hibiscus flowers, millet, and black-eyed peas, and she raises goats to resell. She wants to bolster her businesses and to help support her family. The loan she's requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell hibiscus flowers, millet, beans, and to raise livestock

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha has been selling shoes, handbags and clothes in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for five years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $90. She works at her business for 8 hours every day. Mwanaisha is 22 years old, married, and has two  children: ages 7 and 4.
Mwanaisha is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more shoes, handbags and clothes for resale. She is hoping that through this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money.
She belongs to Mapatano group loan (Group code 2070).

loans.use: To buy shoes, handbags and clothes for resale.

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es:
MARÍA, pertenece al Banco Comunal “CARMEN CABREJOS” su domicilio está ubicado en el Jr. Adolfo morey nº 666, Distrito de Calleria, tiene 64 años, 04 hijos profesionales, y su esposo es operador de maquinaria forestal (jubilado).

	Ella  tiene una pequeña bodega y además vende productos de belleza, el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, que invirtió en compra de golosinas, y desde hace 9 años que está trabajando con Manuela Ramos le ha ido muy bien y sus productos salen cada vez mas.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 Nuevos Soles,  invertirá en la compra de mas productos de belleza, gaseosas y una vitrina para ampliar su negocio y surtir su tienda.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ser una institución que sirve a la comunidad con el servicio que da, y contribuye con las mujeres de esta región.
texts.en:
Maria belongs to the Communal Bank “Carmen Cabrejos”. Her home is located in the District of Calleria, she is 64 years old, has 4 professional children, and her husband is a forestry machinery operator (retired). She has a small grocery store and also sells beauty products. The first loan that she received from the Manuela Ramos program was of 300 PEN, which she invested in purchasing sweets. For the past 9 years that she has been working with the Manuela Ramos program things have gone well for her and her products sell more and more every day. With this loan of 3,000 PEN, she will invest in the purchase of more beauty products, soft drinks, and a display case to expand her business and add variety to her store. Maria thanks the Manuela Ramos program for being an institution that serves the community with the service it provides and for what it contributes to the women of this region.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beauty products, soft drinks, and a display case.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal Hormigas.
Margarita es soltera, tiene 58 años y 1 hijo, Margarita tiene una polleria llamada Margarita, esta ubicada en una avenida concurrida, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de 2 personales. Además Margarita tiene una farmacia en la ciudad de Lima, negocio que esta administrado por su hijo.
Margarita necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de medicinas.
Los sueños de Margarita son mejorar su negocio y ser una empresaria grande.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the communal bank “Hormingas.” She is 58 years old, single, and has a son. Margarita has a poultry store called Margarita that is located on a very busy street. Two people help her in the store. Margarita also has a pharmacy in Lima that her son manages. Margarita needs a loan of 3000 soles to buy medicine with. Margarita’s dream is to improve and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de medicinas.

loans.name: Sarith

texts.en:
Ms. Sarith Y., 37, is single and lives with her parents along National Road Number 6 about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sarith has been growing vegetables and raising pigs for two years. She wants to expand her pigpen; it would be easy for her to raise her pigs. That is why she is asking for a loan of $1,000, to use for that purpose and to grow vegetables as well.

loans.use: To use for growing vegetables and raising pigs.

loans.name: Alvaro Antonio

texts.es: El Señor Álvaro S. tiene 35 años, casado su esposa es ama de casa, con casa propia, vive en la comunidad de Villa del Carmen desde hace más de nueve años. Su esposa es de profesión Ingeniera agrónoma y de especialidad suelos tanto el como ella  tienen un proyecto de sembrar en su finca diferentes productos de granos básicos como maíz, trigo y frijoles. Trabaja en la alcaldía de Villa de Carmen en el cargo de concejal en este nuevo gobierno anteriormente en el departamento de administración en accesoria legal desde hace 8 años. Gracias al préstamo de Afodenic comprara materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, azulejos y tuberílla para la remodelación de la cocina y a su vez ampliarla. Y poder ofrecer a su familia una casa digna.
texts.en:
Sr. Álvaro S. is 35 years old, married, and has lived in his own home in the Villa del Carmen community for more than 9 years. His wife is an agricultural engineer by profession and specializes in studying soils. She currently has a project that involves planting different farm products such as corn, wheat and beans. Sr. Álvaro is an alderman in the newly elected government for the town of the Villa del Carmen. Previously, he worked in the Department of Administration as a paralegal for 8 years.

Thanks to the loan from AFODENIC, he will be able to buy construction materials such as cement, iron, tiles and pipes to remodel and enlarge his kitchen. This will provide his family with a decent home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to remodel his kitchen

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Doña Maria Elena Hernández de 33 años de edad, casada, resida en el barrio Laureles Sur en la capital de Managua, su esposo trabaja en servicios de seguridad, ella tiene una pulpería de seis años el cual comenzó con pequeños prestamos, sus planes es poder agrandar su negocio para obtener mejores ingresos, tiene cuatro hijos de 3,5,9 y 14 años de edad, ellos estudian la primaria, con este préstamo va a comprar productos lácteos, carnes, y granos básicos para poder ofrecer a sus clientes. A futuro es poder hacer mejora a su vivienda, se siente sastifecha por los logros adquirido .
texts.en:
Dona Maria Elena H., 33, is married and lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood of Managua. Her husband works for a security firm. Maria Elena has owned a corner shop for six years, a business that she started with small loans. She wants to grow the business so that she can increase her income. She has four children, 3-, 5-, 9- and 14-years old, respectively, all in school. She will use this loan to buy dairy products, meats and basic cereals to resell to her customers. In the future, she would like to be able to improve her house. She is happy with her progress so far.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen G. is from the town of Baliangao. She is 29 years old. Helen is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Helen owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of food products in the local community. Helen has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,600 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Helen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Helen is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale particularly banana cue vending. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Helen from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for banana cue vending

loans.name: Las Palmas Group

texts.es: Las Socias del grupo “Las Palmas” esta representado por la señora Julia y conformada por 13 miembros jóvenes que comprenden entre los  20 a 40 años de edad, A pesar de ellos son personas alegres, unidas, responsables y honestas como lo han demostrado en sus ciclos anteriores. Dentro de las actividades que realizan las socias esta la venta de de ropa, zapatos, cosméticos, venta de comida, venta de pan, venta de ropa interior de forma ambulante y en puestos fijos. La competencia dentro del rubro de venta de productos es elevada pero las socias saben como salir adelante ya sea diversificando su mercadería o trasladando su puesto de venta a diferentes ferias locales, no les importa trabajas mas horas de las necesarias ya que algunas de ellas son madres solteras y sus hijos valen cualquier sacrificio ya que ellos son su razón de vivir. El destino del crédito es para la adquisición de mercadería, e insumos para hacer crecer sus negocios y mejor sus ingresos que ayudara a brindas a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias ya llevan cursando su tercer ciclo demostrando ganas de salir y responsabilidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
The Group “Las Palmas” (The Palms) is led by Sra. Julia and composed of 13 young members between the ages of 20 and 40. Even though they are a cheerful group, they have demonstrated unity, responsibility, and honesty throughout their previous loan cycles. The members are involved in retail businesses selling products such as clothing, shoes, cosmetics, food, bread, and lingerie. They sell their goods door-to-door and from established locations. Competition in the retail marketplace is high, but the members know how to cope in this environment by diversifying their merchandise or moving their vending locations around the various local fairs. They do not mind working long hours since most of them are single mothers who would make any sacrifice in order to support their children.

Their loan will be used to purchase goods and supplies to grow their businesses and increase their incomes so that they can provide their families with a better quality of life. With regard to their credit experience, the members have started their third loan cycle and have successfully demonstrated responsibility with their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es:
En el mercado El Bisne del departamento de Chinandega, el señor Luis Alfonso D. se dedica a brindar el servicio de reparación de televisores y venta de repuestos de televisores. Es importante destacar que se ha destacado por ser muy conocedor del ramo de la electrónica y por ello ha tenido muchos clientes a los que les ha reparado los televisores. 

La razón por la que el señor Luis ha solicitado el crédito es porque lo va a invertir en la compra de los repuestos para los televisores y así utilizarlos en las reparaciones electrónicas que va realizando con el fin de satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes y brindarles un servicio de alta calidad.
texts.en:
In the El Bisne market in the district of Chinandega, Mr. Luis Alfonso D. works as a television repairman and seller of spare television parts. It is important to point out that he has distinguished himself by being an expert in electronics and because of this, has repaired television sets for many customers. The reason Mr. Luis has requested a loan is to buy spare television parts to be used in electronic repairs. In this way, he will satisfy the needs of his customers and offer them a high quality service.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of spare television parts

loans.name: Qatun Hayta Group

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=102263&_tpos=1&_tpg=1 

El Banco Comunal Qantu Hayta, se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad D. Vischongo, distrito del mismo nombre, provincia D. VilcasH., departamento D. Ayacucho. Esta comunidad esta ubicada a 03 horas D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, la actividad principal D. la comunidad es la agricultura. 

Aydee es soltera, se dedica a la venta D. comida en su propio restaurante, negocio en el cual es apoyada por sus tíos. Aydee requiere D. un préstamo para la compra D. víveres e insumos para su restaurante. Aydee tiene como meta terminar sus estudios D. gastronomía y hacer crecer su negocio. 

Saturnina es casada y tiene 9 hijos. Saturnina se dedica a la venta D. animales, como carneros, cabras y cerdos, negocio que comparte con su esposo. Saturnina requiere D. un préstamo para la compra D. mas animales. A Saturnina le gustaría tener una chacra en el campo, para lograr su meta, ella ya se encuentra ahorrando.
texts.en:
First Loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=102263&_tpos=1&_tpg=1 The communal bank “Qantu Hayta”, is located in the community of Vischongo, in a district of the same name, in the VilcasH. province, in the department of Ayacucho. This community is located three hours from Ayacucho. People mostly farm in this area. Aydee is single and makes a living selling food in her restaurant. Her aunts and uncles help her with the business. Aydee needs a loan to buy food and supplies for her restaurant. Aydee plans to finish her gastronomy studies and grow her business Saturnina is married and has nine children. Saturnina sells animals like rams, goats, and pigs. She and her husband share this business. Saturnina needs a loan to buy more animals and she would also like to have a pond in the countrysiD.. She is already saving so she can meet her goal

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The communal bank "Qantu Hayta" ask for a loan of 6,800 soles for its 12 members to invest in their businesses.

loans.name: Naimullah

texts.en:
Naimullah is the son of S. W.. He is uneducated he is a baker. He has been involved in this business for more than 8 years, but he still lives in a rental house with his family. He can’t support his family and pay the rent of his house. He wants to buy more flour and wood for his bakeshop. Therefore, he has requested an individual loan of 50,000 Afghanis to start his work with more success. This will give him the energy to help his family better than he can now. This will make a bright future for his family.

Note: In this picture of three people, Naimullah is the man on the left side.

loans.use: To buy flour and wood for his bakery.

loans.name: Marième Gorgui

texts.fr: Marième Gorgui D. est une dame de 55 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle souhaite avec ce prêt développer son petit commerce de haricot et oseille et l’élevage ovin qu’elle fait. Cet activité lui permet de subvenir à l’amélioration des conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarité de sa famille.
texts.en:
Marieme Gorgui D. is a 55 year old lady, married and the mother of 6 children. She wants to grow her small business that she is engaged in; beans, sorrel and livestock farming with this loan. This business allows her to provide improved living conditions, health and schooling for her family.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To do petty trading  of micelleneous foodstuffs and livestock.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida O. is from the village of Cabisera 27. She is 48 years old. Aida is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Aida owns and operates a general store where she sells a variety of products in the local community. Aida has been engaged in her business for over  years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

Aida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aida is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will Aida's eighth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell
